title: marble mason
description:
Work Setting

  • Residential
  • Commercial

Specific Skills

  • Set tiles in place and apply pressure to affix them to base
  • Remove and replace cracked or damaged tiles
  • Prepare, measure and mark surfaces to be covered
  • Cut, surface, polish and install marble and granite
  • Align and straighten tiles
  • Mix, apply and spread mortar, cement, mastic, glue or other adhesives using hand trowel
  • Cut and fit tiles around obstacles and openings using hand and power cutting tools
  • Pack grout into joints between tiles and remove excess grout
  • Install tile strips

Work Site Environment

  • Dusty

Work Conditions and Physical Capabilities

  • Physically demanding
  • Attention to detail
  • Hand-eye co-ordination
  • Overtime required

Personal Suitability

  • Accurate
  • Team player
  • Reliability

title: Stone Mason
company: Atlantis Rausch Granite & Marble Installations LTD
description:
We are looking for a stonemason who is experienced in installing custom stone spaces. Experienced in mechanical anchorage systems for Natural Stone Cladding.

Job Duties:

  • Read and Interpret blueprints and layout sketches
  • Shape, trim, face, and cut marble or stone preparatory to setting, using power saws, cutting equipment, and hand tools.
  • Restoring, cleaning existing stone.
  • Construct and install prefabricated stone carvings/masonry units for buildings.
  • Replace defective or missing masonry units on walls or floors.
  • Lay and align stones according to set construction plans and specifications
  • Replace broken or missing masonry units in walls or floors.
  • Smooth, polish, and bevel surfaces, using hand tools and power tools
  • Mix mortar or grout and pour or spread mortar or grout on marble slabs, stones on mud bed floor application.

Requirement

  • Understand mechanical fastening of Granite/Marble/ Limestone.
  • Experience in working safely with hand and power tools.
  • Must be able to multi-task in a fast-paced and extreme quality-focused environment.
  • Great listening and communication skills.
  • Who has strong attention to detail and is focused on working safely.
  • Owns hand tools and has his own transportation.

Salary starting at $32/hour and are based on experience.

Job Types: Full-time, Permanent

COVID-19 considerations:

All employees are expected to follow the protocol set at the jobs by the general contractors.

Job Type: Full-time

Salary: $32.00-$40.00 per hour

Benefits:

  • Dental care
  • Extended health care

Schedule:

  • 8 hour shift
  • Monday to Friday

title: Bricklayers
description:
$40.83/hr +++

Position Overview:

Our team is looking for skilled bricklayers to lay bricks, stone, blocks and precast materials for residential and commercial construction projects for the biggest names in the industry.

We have opportunities in many cities, within and around the Greater Toronto Area:

Bricklayer Duties and responsibilities:

  • Cut and trim bricks and concrete blocks to specification using hand and power tools
  • Lay bricks, concrete blocks, stone and precast materials
  • Experience with natural stone, including limestone, granite, and marble
  • Work independently with a minimum of supervision
  • Ensure tools are in working order, maintained, cleaned and charged
  • Commitment to safety and quality
  • Travel to job sites as required

Required Qualifications (no exceptions):

  • Union Membership or willing to join
  • 3-5 years of experience with a masonry company
  • Safety training certificates (ie. Current - Working at Heights, WHMIS, OHSA Worker Awareness, etc)

Working Conditions and Physical Demands:

  • Physically demanding, handling heavy loads, standing for extended periods, Bending, crouching, kneeling

We offer:

  • Amongst the highest wages in the industry plus plus
  • Competitive Benefits (Medical, Dental, Health)
  • 40 hours per week Monday to Friday (Saturdays optional)

Health and Safety:

  • Personal Protective equipment as prescribed including steel-toed safety boots and a hard hat
  • Comply with industry and company safety rules, policies and procedures

If you are interested in joining our team, please email through this job posting or call Luiza in the Hiring Department at 416-745-0709.

Job Type: Full-time

Salary: $40.83 per hour

Job Type: Full-time

Salary: $37.00-$45.00 per hour

Schedule:

  • Monday to Friday

Experience:

  • Brick Mason: 1 year (Preferred)
  • Masonry: 1 year (Preferred)

Work remotely:

  • No

description: description

title: Tile Setter for Residential and Light Commercial
description:
Handyman Connection is seeking an experienced Tile Setter.  Handyman Connection is a locally owned and operated, well established Home Improvement Company dedicated to excellent customer service and quality work.  Our customers love us!  We have over 50% repeat/referral customer base and our business is growing!

We take care of the things that you don't want to.  We find the jobs, we schedule appointments, we manage the customer, and we take care of the payments.  You can focus on doing the work.  You decide what you want to do, where you want to do it, and when you want to do it.  You can work as little or as much as you like.

What You Will Receive

  • Earn $42-$48/hour, depending on your skills and experience
  • Work as an Independent Contractor
  • Flexibility - you choose the work you do, when you do it, and where you go
  • Professional Office Support - scheduling, customer support, job tracking, billing
  • Free access to custom Mobile App for scheduling and communications
  • Successful marketing campaigns that brings us well qualified customers
  • Branded apparel and signage

Responsibilities

The craftsman/woman will need to have expertise installing a variety of tile materials. You must have basic construction skills, be organized, and effectively communicate with others with a positive attitude.  We are looking for a craftsman or craftswoman who can bid work and produce it.  

  • Working on your own projects installing tiles on floors, backsplashes, walls, custom showers
  • Working as a member of a renovation team for bathrooms, kitchens, basements
  • Commercial installations: Retail, office, condos

Requirements

  • Must have 10 years experience in the remodeling or home repair trades
  • Must pass screening process which includes reference and background checks
  • Must have current Driver's License and Insurance
  • Must have tools and vehicle
  • Must have a smart phone and access to the internet

Ready to Learn More?

Please complete the short application, and we will contact you for a quick conversation to see if this could be the right match for you.  Check us out on the web at: ottawa.handymanconnection.com

title: Tile Setter
description:
For over 12 years, Marble Treasure has served the Greater Toronto Area as a leading marble and granite company. Our attention to detail and ability to translate our client’s décor dreams into a reality has made us a dependable and knowledgeable source for stone décor needs.

 

We are passionate about the quality of our work and the treatment of our customers! We began our business because we truly enjoy helping customers design their projects and our reputation has been built on the unmatched quality of our products and workmanship. We offer clients several options and work with them every step of the way. Whether small or large, we consider all projects to be unique and important.

 

At this time, Marble Treasure is looking to hire 3 professional Tile Setters. The ideal candidate will be hard-working, goal-oriented, and able to work well under pressure.

 

The job duties will include:

  • Prepare, clean, and finalize surfaces to be covered
  • Build underbeds and install anchor bolts, wires and brackets, as needed
  • Mix, apply, and spread mortar, cement, and other adhesives
  • Measure and cut tiles based on available space and approved blueprints
  • Set tiles in position, align and straighten tiles
  • Cut and fit tiles around obstacles and openings
  • Pack grout into joints between tiles and remove excess grout
  • Work with quartz and marble tiles, large porcelain tiles and slabs, and other materials as requested by customers
  • Perform post-installation procedures including applying sealer, polishing, cleaning, and checking for sharp edges
  • Remove and replace cracked or damaged tiles
  • Work with various hand and power cutting tool
  • Verify the quality of work to ensure it meets and exceeds client’s expectations
  • Assist in apprenticeship training and oversee on-site apprentices and helpers, as needed

 

Requirements

 

  • Completion of Secondary School is an asset
  • At least 2 years of experience
  • Ability to problem solve and strong attention to details
  • Good command of the English language
  • Familiarity with workplace safety as well as safe lifting and handling procedures

 

Compensation and Conditions:

 

  • $32.00 per hour for a minimum of 35 hours per week
  • Permanent, full-time position
  • Location of work: 1490 Major Mackenzie Dr., unit D3, Vaughan, L6A 4H6
  • Occasional overtime may be required with applicable overtime pay after 44 hours of work per week

 

How to apply:

 

Please apply by sending your resume to hiring.marbletreasure@gmail.com. PLEASE DO NOT CONTACT THE OFFICE DIRECTLY AS RESUMES MUST BE ASSESSED BY MANAGEMENT BEFORE INTERVIEWS ARE SCHEDULED. Please note that only those who are qualified will be contacted for an interview.

 

Please visit our website at http://marbletreasure.com/ to learn more about our services.

title: Sales Professional, Tile and Stone Installation Systems, Toronto
description:
ARDEX Americas (www.ArdexAmericas.com), is the Global industry leader in the manufacturing and development of high-performance specialty building materials.

We are immediately hiring for a SALES PROFESSIONAL, with experience of TILE AND STONE INSTALLATION SYSTEMS, ONTARIO, with a concentration on GREATER TORONTO AREA (GTA).

The successful individual will have a proven track record of developing and delivering new sales business opportunities with commercial tile contractors, installers, architects and ARDEX distributor partners and retailers. Experience of Tile and Stone Installation industry is essential.

This is a field sales position with a preferred home-office location close to City of TORONTO. Up to 30% territory travel, including overnight on occasions.

Responsibilities:

  • Drive, develop, promote and grow sales of ARDEX products and systems throughout territory
  • Develop and maintain solid working relationships with distributors, contractors, specifiers and other key business influencers
  • Retain current accounts and prospect new business development
  • Successfully launch and promote new products via hands on product demonstrations, presentations & professional product displays
  • Collaborate with Corporate resources such Technical, Customer Service, Marketing, Logistics etc., to deliver exceptional standards of service to ARDEX customers
  • Drive lead generation through jobsite visits, lead generation services, cold calls etc.
  • Develop and successfully execute field sales action plans
  • Achieve and exceed targets, goals and objectives, as established with Sales Manager
  • Represent ARDEX as an industry leader through exceptional professional standards, and a 'customer first' approach.

Keyword: sales, tile, installation, installer, contractor, flooring, ARDEX, manufacturer, building products, concrete, project manager, cement, account manager, manufacturer, representative
Required Experience:
  • Minimum 5 years outside sales experience is essential
  • Demonstrable experience of Tile and Stone Installation Systems is essential (thin sets, sub floor preparation, cement & epoxy grouts, under tile waterproofing, commercial & residential). Tile and stone installation experience is desirable
  • Able to confidently and professionally conduct product presentations and demonstrations
  • Able to operate non power and power tools. Demonstrates good mechanical or hands-on skills to meet the needs of intensive and physically demanding field support and service
  • Technically proficient and familiar with architectural specifications and construction design elements
  • High level of energy and enthusiasm for the business and be customer-driven and professional
  • Self-starter. Able to use initiative, work and adapt to a fast paced and changing market
  • Able to make sound business decisions, influence, be assertive and close a sale
  • Proficient in digital systems: Microsoft Word, Email, Internet, PowerPoint and CRM systems
  • Demonstrates ARDEX Growth Mindset competencies: Innovation, Open Mindedness, Collaboration, Agility, Initiating Action and Execution, Ownership
  • Must possess a valid driver’s license and a clean driving record. Must be able to travel throughout assigned territory as per advertised amounts, including some overnight
  • Must be able to lift to 70 pounds (on occasion) with a carrying capability of 55 pounds

Education

  • College degree preferred or minimum high school diploma /GED and industry related experience

From: ARDEX Americas

title: Tile Setter
description:
Sub-Contract Tile Setter
Mirage Renovations Inc. is a well established renovation firm with over 15 years of experience in the rental unit renovation industry. We pride ourselves on consistently delivering excellent service and always welcome new and talented individuals to our team

We are looking for:
Tile-setting sub contractors to partner with us in order to complete tile installation projects for our many different turn over projects. Experience working in the fast- paced environment of rental unit renovations is an asset.
 
Types of work include but are not limited to:
  • Tub Surrounds
  • Shower Surrounds
  • Kitchen Backsplashes
  • Floor Tiles

A successful candidate must have:
  • 2-5 years experience in tile setting
  • A reliable vehicle
  • Their own tools kept in optimal condition
  • WSIB coverage

***Experience in plumbing and tub installation is a definite asset***
***All work is in the GTA***



About Mirage Renovations:

Mirage renovations Inc. is an interior renovations company that specializes in residential apartment building rental units. We pride ourselves on a quick job, done well and at a reasonable price. Years of experience in the rental apartment sector has allowed us to build a highly dedicated and efficient team that is able to tackle jobs of any size. Capital Projects: - Drop Ceiling installation - Corridor painting - Metal door and frame replacements - Finish work after large scale building updates - Garage Painting - Balcony Repairs - Fences Suite turnovers: We can handle all the components of a complete turnover: - Demolition - Plaster & paint - Electrical - Plumbing - Cabinetry - Tub Surrounds - Flooring - Baseboards - Tiles - Tub surrounds - Doors & Frames - Cleaning In-suite/ Odd jobs: We are well- equipped to provide solutions to all your maintenance needs. - Repairing flood damage - Plaster repairs - Door replacement - Painting - Finish work after plumbing repairs - Leaky faucets - Hardware replacement - Boiler room repairs - Fire- rating updates

title: Labourer
description:

You'll be working with scaffolding, taking it apart, reshaping it, using tools like grinders and screw guns. This is a growing company and there will be opportunity for advancement and more pay. They have trained people on new skills (welding/forklift/truck driving) once you show initiative and interest. If you have fork lift experience handling wide loads, please make sure to note that in your application. If you have any auto-body experience, that will be considered an asset.

Job title: General Labour

Pay rate: $18-19 based on experience

Location: Highway 404 & Herald Road (Newmarket)

Shift time: Start training on the day shift (6 AM - 3 PM or 7 AM - 4 PM)

Ongoing Contract

Advantages
What's great about this opportunity:
-Work for a growing company in Newmarket
-Full time hours
-Flexible start times
-$18-19/hr
-Possibility of permanent placement once the contract is over
-Physical work
-Potential to learn new skills
-Growing company with new roles

Randstad Perks
-Weekly pay with 4% vacation pay added to your cheque
-Benefits from day 1 - Randstad offers immediate benefits for contract workers


Responsibilities
-Assembly of metal frames
-Lifting up to 50 lbs
-Following health and safety procedures
-Using hand and power tools such as grinders, cutting discs, screw guns and hammers
-Other duties as assigned

Qualifications
-experience in assembly/general labour role (landscaping, construction, roofing, etc.)
-Comfortable with hand and power tools
-Able to lift 50 lbs
-Steel toed safety boots

Summary
Apply bellow!

If this General Labour/Assembler role in Newmarket sounds like a position that interests you we want to hear from you right away!

Have questions? Give us a call at (905) 305-2843 and ask for Jordan or send an email to jordan.dewit@randstad.ca

Search all of our open jobs. If you are an expert in a specific role, let’s find a job that’s a perfect match for you. Some of the most in-demand jobs at the moment include machine operators, general laborers, warehouse workers, forklift and counterbalance drivers, and brake press operators.

We look forward to hearing from you!

Randstad Canada is committed to fostering a workforce reflective of all peoples of Canada. Vicinity Motor Corp. (NASDAQ:VEV) (TSXV:VMC) (FRA:6LGA) is a North American supplier of electric vehicles for both public and commercial enterprise use. Poindexter business unit EAVX, the Companyâ€™s strategic partner, for upfitting into next-generation delivery vehicles. For more information, please visit www.vicinitymotorcorp.com.

+ Module yard experience considered an asset


+ Knowledge and tools, materials and equipment used in modular yard


+ Strong attention to detail with the ability to problem solve


+ Vaccinations against COVID 19 are not required on site, however masks (provided by Ledcor) must be worn when social distancing is not possible

title: Construction Labourers
description:
Construction Labourers

In the position of an upcoming job for Construction Labourer, we would ask you to do the following:

  • Handle and distribute construction materials (e.g., load and unload vehicles with supplies, equipment and construction materials
  • Move tools, equipment and construction materials to and from work areas; remove rubble and other debris)
  • Assemble and dismantle scaffolding, ramps, catwalks, shoring and barricades at construction sites
  • Prepare and clean up construction sites
  • Move materials and equipment
  • Perform demolition, excavation and compaction activities Work on a wide variety of buildings, structures and premises including municipal sewer and water mains, roads, dams and bridges, tunnels, railways and canals
  • Use shovels, rakes, or other tools
  • Be able to spot equipment
  • Act as a flagger when needed

Sounds challenging and exciting right? Here are a few of the attributes and experience you need to be successful in this position:

  • You have one to two years of industrial or civil construction experience.
  • You have up-to-date safety tickets (CSTS, WHMIS 2015, and ground disturbance are required)
  • You have experience in using compactors, and trampers (jumping jack)
  • You are able to lift at least 30 lbs
  • You have a safety conscious attitude and able to work with others in a team
  • Valid driver's license - Driver's Abstract is required

Jobs are located in Edmonton, Northern Alberta, and Saskatchewan.

We are an equal opportunity employer. We welcome people of any age, culture, subculture, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, nationality, ethnicity, race, size, mental or physical status, veteran status, religion, language, political opinion, working-style preference, family status, education, and socio-economic status.

title: Labourer
description:
Labourer

Truro, NS

The members of the Inland Group of Companies (Inland Technologies, IDS and Quantem Aviation Services) are highly experienced in environmental management, aircraft de-icing, ground handling and pretty much any other aviation support service you can think of. We operate at over 50 airports in four countries. Inland Technologies core business is the delivery of airport environmental compliance programs. We are continuously innovating the technologies we use to provide our range of services including, spent aircraft de-icing fluid collection and recycling, wastewater management, and aircraft de-icing fluid manufacturing for reuse.

Our business is built on a foundation of excellence in customer service, innovation and continuous improvement and safety is at the forefront of everything we do.  We provide a workplace where respect, integrity and a high degree of ethical behaviour is a minimum expectation.  To learn more about our organization, please visit our website at:  www.inlandgroup.ca

 

We are currently providing an opportunity for a well-rounded safety focused individual to join our team in the position of Labourer at our Brookside Manufacturing Facility.

 

About You:

The ideal candidate will be someone who is passionate about safety, doesnâ€™t shy away from a challenge and is comfortable working in an environment where the noise level can be excessive at times.

 

About the Position:

Aside from the excitement of working in a busy manufacturing facility, the essential duties and responsibilities of this position include:

  • Promoting and adhering to our safety and respectful workplace culture and instilling this culture in the station while ensuring safety and regulatory compliance with all Government Labour, Health and Safety laws, regulations and policies.
  • Follow established Standard Operating Procedures (SOPâ€™s) and HAVE ZERO TOLERANCE FOR UNSAFE ACTS!;
  • Plan and carry out work assignments and handle problems in accordance with instructions, policies, previous training or accepted company practices and procedures;
  • Operate forklift equipment;  
  • As required, assisting in manufacturing functions such as assembly and fabrication;
  • Keep all Inland owned or managed equipment, tools and materials in good working condition, including keeping clean and returning to assigned storage areas when not in use;
  • Maintain facility cleanliness and appearance including garbage removal, washroom cleaning and restocking and other general cleaning requirements;
  • Promptly and accurately complete all associated paperwork as required;
  • Perform/complete other additional projects, duties, and assignments as required and/or by management request.

 

Qualifications:

  • Forklift Operator Certification;
  • High school diploma or equivalent;
  • Read, write, speak and communicate effectively;
  • Basic computer skills with working knowledge of Microsoft programs including Outlook, Word, and Excel;
  • Ability to interpret documents including safety rules, operating, maintenance and procedure manuals;
  • Excellent organizational and time management skills;
  • General mechanical competence and ability to effectively use hand tools;
  • Must possess a strong work ethic, positive attitude, with an ability to motivate and work in a team environment;
  • Willing to learn new skills and adapt to change in order to support the growth of the company and meet needs of customers.

 

About Inland: 

At Inland, we offer the following benefits, some of which are subject to eligibility:

  • A rewarding and safe work environment (company provided PPE);
  • On the job training, mentoring and coaching;
  • Growth and advancement opportunities for high potential employees;
  • Employee and family assistance program;
  • Competitive compensation and benefits package;
  • Pension plan with employer contribution;
  • Access to group rates and discounts.

 

If you are a self-starter who is committed to providing the highest level of customer satisfaction and your experience and ability meet with the above minimum requirements, please forward your cover letter and resume to the Inland HR Team, quoting posting number 22-25.  Full job description available upon request. 

 

Please apply online.

 

Inland is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer.

 

Please note:  All employees working in Canada are required to be fully vaccinated against Covid-19 unless provided by Inland with an approved accommodation under Canada's Human Rights Act.

title: General Labour (Burlington)
description:
JFE Shoji Power Canada Inc. is looking for General Labourers in Burlington, ON!

Formerly Cogent Power Inc., JFE Shoji Power Canada Inc. is under new management.

While we appreciate all applicants, we will only be contacting those selected for an interview.

This position is located in Burlington, Ontario - 845 Laurentian Drive, L7N 3W7 (Conveniently located by bus route) 

This position will be on rotating continental shifts (12-hour shifts) and overtime available as required, there will be a shift premium (80 cents) on all regular hours.

Salary: $18-$23 an hour

 

Why you should join JFE: 

  • $500 signing bonus after your first 4 weeks
  • Travel Subsidy:
    • Starting April to September 2022 we will be providing a subsidy to all employees that incur the costs of travelling to work. These subsidies will be provided at the end of the month in the form of a gas card (i.e April subsidy will be provided by mid-May).
    • For those who take a city bus to work, we will be providing a transit pass.  
  • 100% Health & Benefit Plan 
  • RRSP RPP Pension Plan (Company matching!)
  • Perkopolis Account - get access to 5000 exclusive online discounts to stores & sports events (Hello Fresh, Apple, Indigo, Toronto Marlies, Toronto Raptors, etc.)
  • Boot & Prescription Safety Glasses Reimbursement
  • Employee & Family Assistance (free confidential counselling program)

What youâ€™ll do as General Labour:

  • Set-up machine according to work order and operating procedures
  • Ensure product meets quality requirements as per work order, operating procedures and customersâ€™ specifications
  • Read work orders and understand all measurements
  • Follow priority schedule

About you, simply stated:

  • Strong measuring skills (tape measure & micrometer experience preferred) 
  • Exceptional communication skills
  • Strong attention to detail
  • Mechanically inclined
  • Organized
  • Manufacturing experience is a strong asset

    bout JFE Shoji Power Canada Inc:

    On September 20th, 2019, JFE Shoji Trade Corporation acquired 100% of the shares of Cogent Power Inc, from Tata Steel Europe. Grouped, the Cogent and JFE Shoji Steel America business make it possible for JFE Shoji to capture greater market share in the electrical steel market for both transformer and automotive products. The combination of Cogent and JFE Shoji has become one of the largest processors of electrical steel transformers in the world. JFE Shoji currently has many other production and processing facilities throughout Asia, as well as a facility in Tijuana, Mexico.

    Globally, JFE Shoji enhanced the businessâ€™ competitiveness by sharing and integrating technical skills with deep business experience, which can be strongly applied to the global and North American markets. With this investment, JFE Shoji has one of the worldâ€™s leading processing and distribution functions for core design and manufacturing for transformers.

    Based in Tokyo, JFE is one of the worldâ€™s largest steel producers with over 45,000 employees and operations globally. 

    If you would like to be considered, please apply in confidence. For more information about starting your career with JFE Shoji Power Canada, please visit https://www.jfeshojipower.com/

    Job Type: Full time, benefits, vacation, RRSP and Pension offered!

    Salary: $18 an hour

title: Labourer
description:
You enjoy working with your hands and take pride in hard work. You are motivated by seeing the end product that you helped create. We're looking for labourers to join our crew at our new commercial construction site in Winnipeg.
RESPONSIBILITIES
  • Load and unload vehicles with supplies, equipment and construction materials
  • Move tools, equipment, and construction materials to and from work areas
  • Operate hand and power tools
  • Clean up rubble and debris on a regular basis to ensure a safe and well maintained construction site
  • Move and level earth using shovels and rakes
  • Clean, lubricate, and refill tanks as instructed
  • Practice work place safety at all time
  • Perform other duties as required

REQUIREMENTS

  • Previous experience in a related position
  • Positive can-do attitude
  • Willing and able to easily follow direction
  • Able to lift 50lbs
  • Willing and able to work long hours in a fast-pace, physical environment

 

WHY SEYMOUR PACIFIC?

Seymour Pacific Developments is an industry leader in building multi-family homes with unparalleled speed and efficiency. We develop and build over 1,500 units a year by leveraging effective teamwork and industry expertise. We offer excellent wages and benefits, as well as a variety of training for employees who are motivated to succeed and want to expand their horizons. Seymour Pacific Developments is an equal opportunity employer, and is committed to following safe and inclusive hiring practices.

title: General Labourer
description:
CenterLine (Windsor) Limited is a recognized industry leader in manufacturing standard and custom designed resistance welding, spot welding, arc welding and metal working equipment. We apply state of the art technology to the design and manufacture of robotic weld lines, configurable fastener welders, welding electrodes, welding guns, welding cylinders, and other welding accessories. CenterLineâ€™s vertical integration provides resistance weld gun manufacturing, electrode / weld cap manufacturing, equipment manufacturing, all integrated into our custom machinery. Our people are our key competitive advantage in todayâ€™s global market. Celebrating our 60th Anniversary, CenterLine (Windsor) Limited continues to evolve and diversify to remain a valued partner to its customers and a respected member of industry. Our success is built on the foundation of innovation, efficient design management, excellence and the guarantee of quality service.

 

CenterLine is looking for a self-motivated, reliable individual to fill the position of General Labourer.

 

RESPONSIBILITIES

EDUCATION AND EXPERIENCE

In accordance with the Accessibility for Ontarians Act, 2005 and the Ontario Human Rights Code, Centerline Windsor Limited will provide accommodations throughout the recruitment, Selection, and/or assessment process to applicants with disabilities. title: Construction Labourer
description:
Location:

Ottawa, Ontario

Department:

Employment Type:

Construction - Site, Ottawa

Full-Time

Reports to:

Builder

 

Who We Are

Mattamy Homes is the largest privately owned homebuilder in North America, with 40-plus years of history across the United States and Canada. Every year, Mattamy helps more than 8,000 families realize their dream of home ownership. In Canada, our communities stretch across the Greater Toronto Area, as well as in Ottawa, Calgary and Edmonton.

 

What We Offer

In keeping with the Mattamy Mission of providing The Best Homeowner Experience, the Construction Labourer safely constructs new homes which meet the high standards of quality set by the company.

 

Responsibilities

  • Prepare house for next trade as required including cutting concrete, covering floors, scraping floors, straw placement and removal and stripping floors
  • On a daily basis, collect and dispose of debris at construction site, placing it in appropriate designated places, while ensuring compliance with waste recycling programs
  • Assist with having porches filled, garages and basements cleaned so cement can be poured. Ensure driveways are cut, stone is ordered and that patio slabs are installed on each lot.
  • Make sure houses are graded and safe for the bricklayer trades to work; ensure footings and walls ready for inspection
  • Advise Administrator when to contact garbage company for delivery and exchange bins for interior cleaning
  • Ensure availability of temporary heat for inside trades (tile setters, tapers, etc.)
  • Locate water boxes (dig up and repair) and ensure water turned on for each house; includes ensuring water boxes are raised and marked for sod
  • Review, assess and report any issues on safety to Health & Safety Rep. or direct supervisor, includes ensuring protective gear used/worn
  • Address any complaints or inquiries forwarded by homeowners

 

What You Bring

  • No formal education is required although any training related to construction skills would be an asset.
  • Experience in residential building or related construction industry.
  • Experience dealing with tools and machinery, includes machine skills – rough grading, digging hydro, gas trenching, water boxes, backhoe operation, etc.
  • Good organizational skills with ability to get things done according to timelines.
  • Good communication skills – especially verbal.
  • Good customer service skills.
  • Must have the ability to perform physically challenging work.
  • Must have a valid driver’s license with a clean driving record.

 

Health & Safety

We are doing our part to safeguard your health and taking extra steps to reduce the spread of COVID-19. All work sites and premises will allow for required physical distancing requirements, and new routines and resources such as hand sanitizer, antiseptic wipes, masks, or other protective equipment.

Vaccination is the single best protection against COVID-19 for us as individuals and our communities and is vital to maintaining our commitment to health and safety. The successful applicant will be required, as a condition of employment with Mattamy, to provide Mattamy with proof that they have received the full series of a COVID-19 vaccine (or combination of vaccines) authorized by Health Canada, subject to accommodations required under applicable human rights legislation.

 

Why Mattamy


At Mattamy, we’re passionate about creating and promoting a diverse and inclusive environment where everyone can do their best work. Diversity and inclusion are important aspects of the work we do to support our homebuyers, colleagues and communities. We offer a workplace that allows our employees to experience exciting possibilities in their career including continuous learning, opportunity for growth, competitive compensation and a comprehensive benefits package.

When you’re part of the Mattamy family, your day to day work has an incredible impact. What we do takes teamwork, and everyone pulls together to give our very best. With a focus on continued growth and industry leadership, exciting career possibilities are waiting for you at Mattamy. Based on the culture we pride ourselves on, we’ve been recognized with external awards as well. Some of our most recent recognition includes:

 

Canada’s Best Managed Companies (2020 & 2021)

Canada’s Top 100 Employers (2020 & 2019)

Greater Toronto’s Top Employers (2022, 2021, 2020 & 2019)

Canada’s Most Admired Corporate Cultures (2017 & 2021)

We have big plans for our business and our team. Be part of our ambitious future!

Mattamy Homes is committed to providing accommodation for people with disabilities. If you require accommodation through any aspects of the selection process, please notify us and we will work with you to meet your needs.

Qualified applicants will be contacted directly by the Talent Acquisition team.

title: General Labourer
description:
Our General Labourers earn a competitive hourly wage based on experience. We offer an exceptional extended health plan including medical, dental, and vision. Our other benefits include an employee assistance program, educational assistance, professional development, internal growth opportunities, the opportunity for national career movement, and a healthy work/life balance. If this sounds like the opportunity for you, apply today!


Position Summary:

The General Labourer is in good physical condition and provides construction work and support required to ensure timely project completion. The Labourer follows good work practices and procedures and sets a good example for new crew members and co-workers. The Labourer may: operate a variety of equipment and instruments, including hand and power tools of all types; clean and prepare sites; clean up rubble and debris; remove mold, asbestos lead, and other hazardous materials.

Responsibilities:

  • Leads by example and follows all health and safety policies and procedures.
  • Strives to continually improve through specific development plans.
  • Accepts direction from the Lead Hand, Lead Water Technician and/or Lead Carpenter and more experienced co-workers.
  • Participates in good housekeeping discipline on the job to ensure a safe non-cluttered workplace and to minimize cross-contamination.
  • Learns and practices correct procedures, especially when environmental work is required.
  • Adheres to company policy regarding acceptable standards to follow at a customer site i.e. smoking policy etc.
  • Displays good manners and attitude toward the property owner, occupants of the property, co-workers, and sub-contractors.
  • Is willing and able to be on-call 24/7 for after hour's emergency work.
  • Directs customer questions or concerns to the most senior company person at the job site.
  • Looks out for and assists co-workers.

Qualifications:

  • Previous construction or cleaning work preferred.
  • Experience with hand tools & power tools preferred.
  • High School graduate or equivalent.

ARE YOU READY TO JOIN OUR TEAM?

If you feel that you would be right for this position, please fill out our initial 3-minute, mobile-friendly application so that we can review your information. We look forward to meeting you!

title: Night Labourer - Temporary
description:
$20/hour - General Labourer - Temporary Project

We are actively recruiting 2 temporary labourer(s) for an overnight store renovation project in SK - Saskatoon .This job is very physically demanding. You would be assisting in moving product and shelving units,discarding of construction material and assisting with other general labourer tasks.
  • Rate: $20/hour + vacation pay
  • Location: SK - Saskatoon
  • Project Dates: May 22nd - September 29th, 2022
  • Availability: Sunday night – Friday morning shift, 1030pm-7am – times may change
  • Hours/week: Hourly - Up to 40 hours/week hours a week

Job Responsibilities: 
  • Moving product and fixtures in a big box retailer
  • Disposing of construction material
  • Cleaning store sections
  • Other general labour tasks as required
  • Physical requirements: Lifting up to 50lbs, on feet for entire shift. 

Successful Candidate Qualifications: 

  • Retail experience considered an asset 
  • Positive attitude, reliable, good communicator and fluent in English
  • PPE required: CSA Approved Safety footwear, Work Gloves, Hard Hat, Safety Vest
  • Reliable way to get to the location (transit will be limited due to nights)
  • Physically able to lift up to 50lbs, remain on feet for entire shift and work in a physically demanding position.
How to apply:
If this job sounds like the perfect fit for you, please apply online and be prepared to provide:
  • a relevant resume
We look forward to hearing from you!

description:
Duties:

Work in a fast-paced glass manufacturing environment;

Operate basic hand tools and power tools;

Reports to the shop supervisor;

Duties are varied and may include activities that assist other departments, such as moving glass panels, washing glasses, lifting, moving;

Handling heavy loads; Repetitive tasks;

Knowledge of safe operation of basic hand and power tools

Ability to communicate effectively in English and attention to detail.

Ability to operate required equipment and tools in a safe and responsible manner;

Requirements:

Knowledge of workplace safety and safe lifting and handling procedures;

Effective verbal and listening communication skills;

Possess leadership qualities, ability to work in a team environment;

Capable of providing solutions to work related challenges.

Job Type: Full-time

title: Labourer
description:
Company Description

Founded in 1936 in Montreal, American Iron & Metal (AIM) is a family-owned company, recognized as a world leader in the metal recycling industry. Over the years, AIM has evolved into a multi-faceted company with successful lines of business including metals recycling, dry materials recycling, manufacturing of solder assembly, environmental services, retail auto parts, and highway transportation. With multiple facilities throughout Canada, the United States, Mexico, Europe, and Asia and over 2000 employees located throughout the world, AIM is uniquely positioned to provide best-in-class service and value to its customers. 

Job Description

  • Sorting, picking, and processing scrap metals 
  • Clean and inspect recycling yard by sweeping and raking materials and debris  
  • Assist with performing routine maintenance 
  • Perform other general labourer duties as assigned 

 

Qualifications

  • A Minimum of 1 year of experience is required in a similar role  
  • Experience in the metal scrap industry will be considered as an asset 
  • Experience in using machines like Lift Truck / Forklift, Skid steer will be considered as an asset 
  • Must be able to lift 50 lbs. and stand for extended periods of time 
  • Successful candidates must be highly motivated and work with little supervision 
  • Always strive for excellence and constant improvement 


Additional Information

WE OFFER 

  • Competitive salaries commensurate with experience and qualifications 
  • Group benefits like insurance and RRSP 
  • Additional training and uniform 
  • Great working environment 
  • Overtime opportunities 

HOURS OF WORK 

  • Permanent and full-time position 
  • 44 hours per week, able to work extended hours/weekends when deemed necessary 

HEALTH AND SAFETY 

  • Must work in compliance with the Occupational Health and Safety Regulation and follow in accordance with AIM’s Health and Safety policies and procedures 
  • Responsible for reporting all accidents, illnesses, or ‘near miss’ incidents to management

title: Labourer
description:
Company Description

ARE YOU CUT OUT FOR KENNY U-PULL?

Get ready to immerse yourself in a professional playground of cars.

Become our clients’ ally to provide the best customer service. At Kenny U-Pull, we adhere to high operational standards to maintain an organized and efficient workspace where we repurpose cars and their parts to give them a second life. Join our team in one of North America’s leading companies in the self-service auto part industry.

It’s simple: we do it right. We aim for excellence.

This position is eligible for an annual retention bonus of up to $1150

Job Description

  • Clean up vehicles by removing liquid chemicals and certain parts, such as the battery, to prepare the vehicle to be displayed in the yard to customers.
  • Remove tires from rims and sort them, fill retail shelves.
  • Clean, test and sort batteries to be displayed for purchase.
    • Fill cans with certain liquids and affix labels.
  • Set vehicles in our yard on rim stands in an orderly manner.
  • Prepare, organize and clean the yard.
  • Keep the work space clean and orderly.
  • Any other tasks required by the business
Qualifications

  • Excellent physical condition
  • Reliability, diligence and punctuality
  • Health and safety awareness
  • Attention to detail
  • Versatility
  • Good manual dexterity
  • Drive to achieve results


Additional Information

  • Typical work schedule: Monday to Friday
  • Occasional additional Saturday shifts
  • Permanent, full-time position
  • Possibility of working indoors and outdoors daily

What we offer:

  • Group insurance after 3 months
  • Group RRSP after 6 months
  • Overtime at time-and-a-half after 44 hours
  • Bonus plan
  • Employee discounts
  • Uniform/Coveralls
  • Tools Provided

American Iron & Metal and its subsidiaries offer equal employment opportunities to everyone. The masculine form is used solely to make the text easier to read. Only applicants selected for an interview will be contacted.

title: General Labour - Full-Time
description:
Company Description

Welcome to EagleCraft Boats! 

At our plant in beautiful Campbell River, British Columbia, our talented team of 25 full-time staff specializes in designing and building custom aluminum boats. Well represented across the globe, our company is proud to have built over 800 aluminum quality vessels ranging from pleasure crafts to commercial work boats.

Job Description

What will you do?

  • Ensure that company property, building, vehicles and tools are safe, secure, operational, organized and clean;
  • Safely operate equipment and vehicles related to the job's needs;
  • Perform scheduled and as-needed maintenance/inspection/calibration/repairs according to machinery specifications ;
  • Ensure work area is kept clean and organized to reduce or remove hazards;
  • Follow all applicable Eaglecraft Boats and WorkSafeBC Occupational Health & Safety regulations.
  • Complete general shop duties as assigned (deburr aluminum, move material, unload/organize deliveries, clean boats, etc)
  • Assist production or other departments, as needed.

 

Qualifications

What do you need to succeed?

  • Relevant experience in a manufacturing/shop/construction environment preferred;
  • Technical certificates and/or professional certifications preferred (crane, forklift, Worksafe training, welding, painting, carpentry);
  • Valid driver’s license required;
  • Continuous physical effort is required (standing, walking, stooping, climbing, grasping/reaching. Lifting/moving items up to 75 pounds.

At EagleCraft, we recognize and embrace the importance of values in our ever-changing workplace. To be successful, all applicants must demonstrate behaviours that are reflective of our values:



Additional Information

What's in it for you?

  • Year-round, full-time permanent work;
  • Year-round indoor working conditions;
  • Working alongside a great team of talented individuals;
  • Building a world-class product;
  • Opportunity for advancement;
  • Family owned company;
  • Fun work events (Christmas Party, BBQ, Golf , etc.);
  • Competitive Salary based on  experience;
    • Wage reviews are conducted after successful completion of the probationary period and annually after the first year of employment.
  • Every other Friday is a day off based on a 9hr day/ 9 day pay period
  • Extended Benefits Coverage;
  • Employee Assistant Programs;
  • Employee Purchase Discount on Marine materials;
  • Education and Apprenticeship Opportunities;

 WORKING CONDITIONS

  • Regular periods during which there is continuous physical effort is required, e.g., walking, standing, stooping, climbing, lifting material or equipment, some of which may be heavy or awkward;
  • Exposure to factors such as temperature variations, fumes, moving machinery, humidity, toxic materials which may cause periods of discomfort, high noise levels;
  • Frequent need to give concentrated attention, either hearing or seeing to work being performed;
  • Noticeable pressure from deadlines, production quotas, accuracy or similar demands exists.

title: General Labourer
description:
Merchandising Specialist – Flowers and Plants 

About the Position

Brand Momentum is looking for two General Labourers to work together at local sites in Prince George. 

6 hours/week

Key Responsibilities:

- Take off shelves by unhooking from slots
- The shelves to be stacked flat on base with hooks fitting into pole openings;
- Make sure the triangular tow bar of the base is not stacked underneath the shelves, so that it can still be used to make a train and be pulled with;
- Stack the shelves not higher than 50 per base;
- All carts with no shelves left are to be further dismantled by taking the poles off and stacking these on a cart with shelves and place 40 poles per shelf.
- Stack the ‘bare' bases not higher than 12 per stack.

;t=436s

Specific Requirements:

· Must be able to lift 50 pounds alone

· Must have access to a vehicle

· Must wear steel toe footwear

· Must be able to work outside in all elements

· Must be able to work independently and as a team member

· Must observe store safety protocols

Job Types: Full-time, Part-time, Temporary

About Brand Momentum

We are a national integrated Sales, Marketing, and Retail solutions agency with two headquarters, one in Toronto and one in Montreal. We deliver authentic and enduring human connections, and we are led by a talented team and supported by a network of trusted partners. Rooted in Goodness, Brand Momentum is a three-time winner of Canada's top 100 Best Workplace® and one of Canada's top 500 fastest growing companies.

About Our Culture

Goodness is at the heart of everything we do. Brand Momentum (BMI) is an enduring market leader in quality and innovation. We deliver on our promises to our clients and each other, and we do it with passion, innovation and a commitment to excellence. Every single day we live our values of integrity, respect, empowerment, commitment, fun, flexibility and fiscal responsibility while putting our valued clients at the center of every decision we make.

title: Labourer I, Edmonton Waste Management Centre - (Job Number: 43671)
description:
Description43671
Qualifications

The Edmonton Waste Management Centre (EWMC) is a unique collection of waste processing and research facilities. Owned and operated by the City of Edmonton, the EWMC is an integral part of Edmonton's sustainable approach to waste management. Join the EWMC’s family as a Labourer I, where you will provide general labouring support around the site. Your success in this role will be measured by your ability to perform all work tasks in a respectful and inclusive way.


With a focus on the City of Edmonton’s Cultural Commitments to Safe, Helpful, Accountable, Integrated and Excellent, you will:

  • General cleaning of the site, including snow removal, litter picking and sweeping
  • Lawn maintenance using grass trimmers and push/ride-on mowers
  • Vegetation management, including weed control operations using mechanical and cultural methods; hand pulling; and applying pesticides in accordance with provincial legislation and City standards
  • Site maintenance, including pruning, edging, fence and repair, pressure washing and watering
  • Maintenance and minor repairs on powered equipment, including push mowers and riding tractors
  • Use tools such as shovels, rakes, stake pounders and various small hand/electric tools
  • Other related duties as required

title: General Labour
description:
Are you searching for a fun, fast-paced opportunity? Want to work full time or part time? PeopleReady is looking for general labourers in your area to work with one of our premier clients. At PeopleReady we value and respect our employees. When you work for PeopleReady you're not just joining a company but joining a family. If you're the type of person who gives 100% to what you do, we want to talk to you. We're not looking for someone who can just get the job done. We are looking for someone who can also be our goodwill ambassador.

Work Locations: Oshawa, Whitby, Bowmanville, Pickering, Ajax, Courtice, Uxbridge and Stouffville.

Shift timing - 1st shift (Day)

Responsibilities Include:

*

General site cleanup

* Working outside

* Loading and unloading materials

* Repackaging skids

* Inventory control

* Delivery assistant

Qualifications:

* There is no minimal educational requirement, but specialized training can help Labourers advance

* Experience on commercial construction sites but not mandatory.

* Strong work ethic

PeopleReady is an equal opportunity employer, and we value diversity. We do not discriminate based on race, religious affiliation, color, national origin, gender, age, marital status, sexual orientation, gender identity, veteran status, disability, or any other basis protected by law. We will get to know you and connect you with jobs that match your skills, experience and preferences. We work hard every single day to find jobs so each employee has opportunity and variety in their work.

title: Skilled Ground Worker in Fort McMurray, Alberta | Careers at North American Construction Group
description:
Position Scope

NACG is looking for a labourer to work on a remote mining site in the Fort McMurray area. You must be well-organized and favor safety above everything else.

 

Site: Fort Hills

Schedule: 14x7- 12 hours (paid for 11.5 hours) (Days and nights)

Accommodations: Camp provided

Transportation: Flights are provided to and from Edmonton or Calgary. All individuals utilizing provided flights must be fully vaccinated as per federal transportation regulations. Bussing provided from Fort McMurray to site (before and after shifts)

Overtime: Provided after 8 hours a day or 44 hours a week

 

The successful candidate will be required to join the International Union of Operating Engineers Local 955. 

 

Qualifications

  • Successful applicants must to be willing to help out in all tasks for general labourer duties.
  • Must be physically fit and be able to lift 50 pounds
  • Must have a valid driver's license.
  • High school diploma, GED, and/or post-secondary education is considered an asset.

Summary

All successful candidates must:

  • Be proficient in English, both verbally and written
  • Have a valid Class 5 Driver’s License
  • Have experience as requested as mentioned above
  • Subject to Random Testing at: Suncor, Suncor Fort Hills and Kearl sites
  • Disclose COVID-19 vaccination status:
    • Fully immunized individuals must provide government issued proof of vaccination to be exempt from site testing requirements
    • Individuals not fully immunized may be subject to site COVID-19 testing requirements and associated costs
  • Undergo and successfully pass the following testing:
    • Breath Alcohol Test
    • Urine Drug Test
    • Fitness-to-Work Assessment
    • Audiometric Testing
    • Vision Screening
    • Criminal Record Check

    Shift, site, and start times are subject to change.

    All successful candidates MUST provide the following items prior to confirmation of their start date:

  • CSO or BSO Certification
  • Copy of Valid Class 5 Driver’s License
  • Copy of recent Driver’s Abstract
  • VOID cheque/direct deposit form
  • Silica Awareness
  • Hydrogen Sulphide Awareness

  • Once dispatched the following processes will occur:

  • Will receive a call from NACG to set up all required pre-employment testing
  • An email will be sent with all required New Hire Paperwork to be filled out
  • After all results are received by NACG candidates will be contacted by Site Admin to schedule orientation and confirm your start date and other site specific details.

  • Please note the entire On-boarding process can take anywhere from 3-8 business days.

     

    NO PHONE CALLS PLEASE, SUCCESSFUL CANDIDATES WILL BE CONTACTED VIA PHONE OR EMAIL.

    Overview

    North American Construction Group (NACG) has served as an industry leader in the heavy construction and mining industries for over 65 years.  In that time, we’ve proven ourselves as a safe and reliable contractor who can complete projects of any size and scope. We’ve also taken a number of bold steps forward to broaden our footprint, expanding to mines outside our provincial borders, and providing third-party maintenance services to clients and customers. 

    In addition to providing employees with rewarding careers, North American has a whole lot more to offer:

    • Significant Growth – As a company, NACG is rapidly expanding, and has practically doubled in size over the past year alone.
    • Long Term Contracts – With over $1 billion dollars in contracted work booked through 2023, NACG can provide long term employment solutions and numerous opportunities for advancement.
    • Commitment To Safety – With a top tier record for safety performance, NACG is dedicated to ensuring that everyone gets home safe, and constantly strives for a goal zero performance.
    • Competitive Compensation – NACG provides competitive compensation packages for all employees.

    North American Construction Group is an equal opportunity employer, and encourages applications from all qualified individuals. We are committed to providing a diverse and inclusive work environment where every employee feels valued and respected.

     

    Become a member of the North American family today!

title: Labourer Summer Student
description:
Benefits/Perks
  • Competitive wages and a flexible working schedule (including opportunities to travel)
  • A challenging, fun atmosphere with a great team
  • Training opportunities and advancement within the company
  • Benefits available after a probationary period
  • Company purpose statement is “to provide our employees with a workplace that is considered a vehicle for personal and professional growth”. We hire based on our company values - The DRIVEN Principles.  You will be with like-minded individuals. 
 We are seeking a Labourer (Summer Student) for our crew.  As the Labourer, you will perform a wide variety of projects for various clients across the city. Company OverviewEverLine Coatings and Services is a premier line painting and maintenance company that proudly has a location in Your City.  We provide high-quality line painting and pavement maintenance services for parking lots, roadways, parkades, and warehouses. In addition to painting services, we offer power sweeping, power washing, asphalt seal coating, crack filling, and more.  Our success is a direct result of our dedicated team. Every employee at EverLine is committed to providing complete customer satisfaction in the delivery of our services. We work hard, have fun, and have an amazing corporate culture. Our teams are DRIVEN. Dedicated, Resourceful, Integrity-Focused, Value-Based, Excelling, and Nourishing. Are you ready to make an impact?  Job SummaryOur Labourer utilize our specialized equipment and apply materials on pavement surfaces in order to provide maximum value for our clients' pavement assets.  Responsibilities WHAT YOU’LL DO
  • Use equipment to perform line painting, asphalt crack filling and seal coating, power washing, epoxy flooring, and more
  • Plan and facilitate the production of a high-quality project
  • Communicate job status daily with the Operations Manager
  • Maintain a safe, hazard-free job site 
  • Additional tasks as required 
 QualificationsWHAT YOU BRING
  • A Ontario driver’s license with a clean driving record (Driver’s Abstract is required) and a reliable mode of transportation
  • You are a self-motivated, critical thinker that likes to problem solve 
  • You understand the importance of punctuality, organization, and attention to detail 
  • Ability to work night shift
  • Ability to work in a physically demanding role with lots of walking, bending, and lifting (up to 75lbs)
  • Ability to work well independently unsupervised
  • Past experience with small engines (like lawnmowers) and/or paint sprayers is an asset
  • Desire to learn and exceed expectations
  • An Engineering educational background is an asset

title: Labourer
description:
Forbes Bros is currently recruiting full-time Laborer's for projects within Wynyard & Wadena, Saskatchewan.


Responsibilities:

The responsibilities of this position include, but are not limited to:

  • Digging and backfilling trenches
  • Pulling and placing underground and overhead cable
  • Carry and move materials as needed
  • Operating small equipment and hand tools
  • Spotting for vehicles and equipment
  • Site setup and cleanup, ensuring trash, debris and potential dangerous materials from the construction site are removed
  • Assisting craft/crew members with work
  • Development of skills on varied and challenging tasks
  • Perform additional labourer duties as assigned

Preferred Qualifications:

As the successful candidate, you will have:

  • Ability to work outdoors in all weather conditions
  • Must be in good physical condition and able to lift up to 23 kg (50 lbs)
  • Must have general knowledge of the principals involved in the operation of construction and maintenance methods and procedures
  • Able to work well with others as well as independently
  • Able to follow instruction and adhere to safe work practices
  • Attention to detail
  • Motivated
  • Punctual

Additional Details:

This position requires candidates to:

  • Have and maintain a valid driver's license and acceptable driver's abstract.
  • Successfully complete pre-employment drug and alcohol testing
  • Travel and work overtime as required

What We Offer:

Forbes Bros offers an attractive compensation package that includes a competitive salary, comprehensive benefit plan and a rewarding pension program. Forbes Bros has an open and team oriented culture that focuses on communication, innovation and respect in the workplace!

Forbes Bros Ltd. (FBL) is an equal opportunity employer committed to best practice recruiting and hiring, to promote gender equity and workplace diversity. We thank all applicants for their interest, however only those candidates who meet the requirements noted and who earn an invitation to interview will be contacted.

title: General Labourer
description:
Company Overview:

Tiercon Corp. is an automotive supplier committed to the design, manufacture and assembly of quality exterior trim and assembled systems used as original equipment in the automotive market. Headquartered in Stoney Creek, the plants have design, mold, paint, assembly and testing capabilities. Tiercon manages 5 sites across 2 cities employing approximately 550 people throughout Canada. Tiercon is seeking knowledgeable, self-directed, experienced and hardworking individuals interested in the automotive industry as a General Labourer at our 591 Arvin facility.

Job Summary & Reporting Structure:

Reporting to the Production Supervisor, the General Labourer is responsible for performing a variety of production tasks, including but not limited to, loading and packing customer product. Employees will be responsible for adhering to the policies and procedures outlined in the TS16949 Quality System and practice continuous improvement wherever possible.

Wages starting at $17.15

Shift premium and shift incentive available for 4am, 1:00pm and 4:00pm shifts.

Shifts Available:

  • 4:00am - 1:00pm
  • 7:15am - 4:15pm
  • 1:00pm - 10:00pm
  • 4:00pm - 1:00am

Responsibilities:

  • Package product according to customer specifications, ensuring that all product is handled in a proper, safe manner at all times, no partial boxes are shipped, similar parts are packaged together and boxes are properly labeled.
  • Load product on production racks and visually inspect ongoing product for defects, ensuring non-conforming product is segregated from production line.
  • Sand product off line when required.
  • Remove product from production racks upon processing and place empty racks into designated buggies.
  • Maintain clean and orderly work area both throughout and after the shift.
  • Notify supervisor immediately of any equipment or production problems.
  • Comply with company work and safety rules at all times and report all accidents, incidents and hazards immediately.
  • Participate in corrective/preventative action when required.
  • Practice continuous improvement; identify processes or procedures that will result in production of non-conforming product, or identifying any processes or procedures that can be improved and result in better company performance.
  • Adhere to all procedures and policies as outlined in the TS 16949 quality system.
  • Perform other duties assigned from time to time by supervisor.

Qualifications:

  • Grade 12 or equivalent work experience
  • Manufacturing experience preferred
  • Demonstrated communication skills
  • Demonstrated ability to follow work instructions
  • Demonstrated organizational skills


Tiercon Corp. is proud to be an inclusive and equal opportunity employer as set out in the Ontario Human Rights Code and the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act, 2005. At Tiercon we are committed to ensuring the workplace is free from discrimination. Tiercon Corp. welcomes and encourages applications from everyone including persons with disabilities. During our hiring process, we will notify job applicants that accommodations are available upon request. If a selected job applicant requests accommodation, Tiercon will consult with the individual and provide or arrange for the appropriate accommodation taking into account the applicant's disability-related needs. Please contact Tiercon Human Resources at

hr@tiercon.com

.

title: General Labourer
description:
Job description

General Labourer

Shift: Day Shift

Competitive start rate based on experience!

Location: Downviews

Here’s what we do at our Ashwarren Yard…

Ferrous Scrap Metal Recycling

RAM’s highly trained and experienced staff, utilize the latest in specialized equipment to collect, sort and process all varieties of Ferrous metals. Our streamlined recycling techniques maximize the recovery of iron to increase value to various mills and foundries in Canada and abroad.

Here’s where you come in!

Are you a motivated self starter that works well contributing to high performing teams and enjoys a dynamic work environment? RAM needs you to help build a sustainable future in recycling management, while doing your part to protect the environment and our neighborhoods.

We are growing and need one (1) General Labourer to join our Ashwarren Yard.

Now that you know about us, we want to know more about you! We are looking for someone who can:

  • Ensure clear roadways,
  • Spot, direct traffic
  • Garage duty
  • Other duties as assigned
  • General labour duties not limited to the above

Make a Positive Change

RAM Iron & Metal Inc. offers great career opportunities with competitive compensation packages; inclusive of comprehensive health care benefits, RRSP contributions, profit sharing, and other incentives to attract and retain great talent like you.

Discover How!

Send us your resume and let us know how you would you make an impact at RAM.

Please note Ram Iron & Metal Inc. is committed to accommodating people with disabilities as part of our hiring process. If you have special requirements, please advise Human Resources during the recruitment process.

title: General Laborer (Construction)
description:
Job Description: All-purpose Renovation Contractor
Go Industries is looking for an ambitiousAll-purpose Renovation Contractor. You will be responsible for all renovation work including layout, installation, and repairs for our client’s commercial, industrial, and residential customers. 

The Opportunity:
We are looking for an experienced full-time All-purpose Renovation Contractor to join our prestigious heating and cooling client’s team. This is a full-time opportunity with plenty of opportunities to learn and grow. 
 
Key Responsibilities:
  • Must have expertise in multiple types of repairs, maintenance, and remodeling.
  • Must possess basic construction skills, be organized, and effectively communicate.
  • General Carpentry - Rough and Finish.
  • Ability to Upgrades / Remodel / Refresh / Remodel all types of commercial, residential, and industrial spaces. 
  • Painting Interior and Exterior.
  • Drywall Repair/Patching / Caulking.
  • Electrical knowledge.
  • Minor Plumbing and Minor Electrical Knowledge.
  • Flooring Repair and Installation.
  • Ceramic Tile Installation.
  • Handyman, General Home Repairs and Maintenance Work.

Qualifications:
  • 2-5 years of renovation experience. 
  • Valid Driver’s license with clean abstract.
  • Able to work at multiple sites in Ontario Primarily in the Hamilton area.
  • Experience working in other trades is a bonus. (HVAC/Plumbing/Electrical)
  • Ceramic tile installation is a bonus.

Pay rate: 
  • Up to $40.00 per hour for the right candidate. 
 




    About Go Heating/Natural Direct Canada:

    GO Heating & Cooling has been proudly serving the communities Simcoe County, Bruce, Grey, Kawartha Lakes, Muskoka, Dufferin, Peel, York, Durham Region and surrounding areas since 1977. Our reputation has been built on Quality Service, Honesty and Integrity and this has made us the service provider of choice. Over the years, the GO company has grown but our commitment to our core values and to our community remains the same today as it did when we first opened our doors. Today we’re more than just furnaces and air conditioners – we’re home comfort experts. We know what it takes to keep your home healthy and comfortable, each and every day.

title: Laborer
description:
Overview

Celanese is a Fortune 500 global chemical innovation company that engineers and manufactures chemicals used in products essential to everyday living. Headquartered in Dallas, TX, we employ over 7,700 dedicated people working between 43 facilities across 18 countries. We are committed to employee growth and creating shareholder value to ensure continued opportunities make a difference. Our company focuses on the safety of its employees, provides competitive compensation (including benefits starting day 1), and emphasizes giving back to the community. For more information about Celanese and our products please visit www.celanese.com

Responsibilities

  • Responsible for carrying out of various general labour duties using a variety of hand tools and motorized equipment in a safe, competent, and efficient manner, all of which contribute to the overall function and operation of the overall facility.
  • Operate general purpose trucks of 5-ton or less (without air brakes)
  • Ability to operate a forklift, man-lift, scissor lift, skid-steer loader, and tractor
  • Delivery of goods on, and off plantsite
  • Understanding of the Laborer roles, responsibilities and accountabilities and has demonstrated their ability to competently fulfill these requirements

Qualifications

  • 5-10 Years experience in the role
  • High School Diploma or recognized equivalent
  • Provincial Vehicle Operating License (Alberta)
  • Fully trained to operate a forklift, man-lift, scissor lift, skid-steer loader, and tractor
  • Operate crane and perform very simple rigging work in a competent manner
  • Safe truck loading and unloading practices for gas cylinders, drums and general parts
  • Safe use of snow removal equipment (Plow-truck, Sanding-truck, backpack blower, etc.)
  • General knowledge of machine lubricants and steps taken to complete oil changes on equipment
  • General knowledge of Safe Work Permitting requirements

Celanese is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Celanese does not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, age, non-disqualifying physical or mental disability, national origin, veteran status or any other basis covered by appropriate law. All employment is decided on the basis of qualifications, merit, and business need.

title: Labourer
description:
Job Description:

ClearStream is seeking Labourers, in the Nanaimo area, with industrial experience in oil and gas service.

 

â€¯Please note that this is an expression of interest posting to strengthen our pool of candidates in the Nanaimo area. These positions could be starting immediately and could run for several months.

 

What would you be doing?

  • Demolition and site  clean.
  • Cleaning and maintenance of  tools, and equipment.
  • Transport materials,  tools, and equipment.
  • Load and unload materials,  tools, and equipment.
  • Assist skilled trades and Equipment Operators in various tasks.
  • Other duties as assigned.

Does this sound like you?

  • Have 1 or more yearsâ€™ experience on industrial sites.
  • Valid and up to date safety tickets:  H2S Alive
  • Standard First Aid  is an asset.
  • Have a high regard for personal safety, safety of company assets and employees.
  • Self-motivated, capable of performing tasks with minimal supervision.
  • Able to prioritize and handle multiple tasks simultaneously.
  • Ability to work well under pressure and handle strict deadline.

Perks of the job

  • Competitive  Pay based on the work you do here and not your previous salary.
  • Working for a reputable and safety conscious company that  values  employees.

Other Clause:

This position has beenâ€¯identifiedâ€¯as a safety  sensitive  position and will require completion of a drug and  alcohol  testing.â€¯â€¯â€¯

 

Why ClearStream

We are the clear choice for rewarding opportunities and challenging careers. Joining our team would mean you would contribute to the quality of work we do and to the success of ClearStream along with the values we share. If you are driven, dedicated and have a passion for helping our customers bring resources to our world, then ClearStream is the team to join.â€¯â€¯    

 

We are committed to creating a culture of equity, diversity, and inclusion, including fostering a safe and respectful environment that allows for diverse perspectivesâ€”a work environment in which all employees are valued and have an equal opportunity to achieve success.â€¯ Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability, protected veteran status, or other legally protected factors.â€¯

title: Labourer (Casual)
description:
Job Description:

Part-Time; Event-Based
Wage: $24.61/hour plus 10% in lieu of benefits and vacation

Date Posted: March 3, 2022

 

Who We Are

 

The Pacific National Exhibition is an iconic institution in BC, famous for bringing generations of people together to celebrate and build memories. This 112-year-old, non-profit organization has an annual operating budget of approximately $58 million dollars and generates revenue through four activity streams:   the 15-day annual summer Fair which averages 800,000 guests each year, Playland amusement park which welcomes 375,000 guests annually including Fright Nights, year-round events including concerts, trade shows and film, cultural and community events.   The fourth activity stream is park care and facility maintenance.   The PNE is proud of the work it does at Hastings Park and has a vibrant team that is passionate about events, guest experience and being the best, we can be.

At the PNE, we strive to create an environment that reflects our organizationâ€™s core values: Enthusiasm, Excellence and Evolution.   With a focus on these core values, we are committed to achieving our mission which is to â€œDeliver Memorable Experiencesâ€ for all who interact with the PNE whether it is our guests, our employees, or the community.

We are seeking diligent and hard-working individuals that have a passion for the Events industry and the Pacific National Exhibition (PNE). Our Labourer team works work under the direction of the Director, PNE Maintenance & Facility Operations and are responsible for site maintenance, and setup/teardown of events. They will operate vehicles and tools/equipment in compliance with all health and safety requirements as determined by WorkSafeBC, and all other applicable legislation and company policies.

 

Why join our Team?

 

  • Exhilarating and fun-loving culture
  • Flexible work environment
  • Opportunity for free or discounted tickets to shows, events, sports games, and much more
  • Staff discounts for Playland, The Fair, and Fright Nights, as well as all PNE Food Stands
  • Competitive compensation package
  • Opportunity to create lasting memories and friendships!

 

What will you do this year?

 

In your role as a Labourer, your primary accountabilities will be to:

  • Help in the set-up of events by moving equipment, furniture, assembling barricades, setting up seating etc.
  • Perform maintenance and janitorial tasks including cleaning washrooms, mopping, sweeping, vacuuming, and stocking supplies as needed.
  • Service and maintain equipment operated by site maintenance.
  • Effectively use heavy and light equipment, depending on the jobsite/assignment.
  • Assemble and dismantle special event facilities.
  • Maintain a safe and clean work environment.
  • Perform other related work as required.

 

What else?

  • Previous general labour and janitorial experience is required.
  • Must be capable of lifting 50lb objects; be highly motivated and able to work alone.
  • A valid class 5 BC driverâ€™s license is required.
  • Previous experience operating a forklift is preferred.
  • A valid forklift operating license is an asset.
  • A valid aerial lift or fall arrest ceritifcation is an asset.  
  • Knowledge of materials, methods and equipment used in janitorial work.
  • Knowledge of methods and practices used in servicing and maintaining equipment operated.
  • Knowledge of methods, materials, tools, and equipment used in assembling and dismantling special event facilities and in performing maintenance and janitorial tasks.
  • Successful completion of grade 12 preferred.
  • OFA Level I (or higher) is considered an asset.
  • Skill in the operation of construction and maintenance equipment and the use of tools used in servicing, minor maintenance tasks are desirable.
  • Ability to carry out work orders and prepare and maintain work records.
  • Must have CSA approved steel toe boots.
  • Must be available to work a variety of shifts including weekends, week days, and overnight shifts.
  • Must be comfortable working an event based schedule, as hours of work will vary.
  • The PNE has implemented a Proof of Vaccination policy and due to requirements of this position the successful candidate must provide proof of vaccination.
  • Candidates must undergo a Criminal Record Check.

 

Who are you?

 

  • Team Player
  • Passionate
  • Skillful communicator
  • Proactive
  • Committed

 

Where and when to APPLY?

 

Applications can be submitted via the PNE website at www.pne.ca/jobs and will be accepted until the role is filled.

We look forward to hearing from you!

 

The PNE is proud to be an  equal  opportunity  employer, committed to creating an inclusive workforce that reflects the diverse community we proudly serve. All applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, colour, national or ethnic origin, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, disability, or age. If you require any support or accommodations throughout any stage of the recruitment process, please contact the People & Culture Department at  

hr@pne.ca

.
