title: General Labourer
description:
Overview:

If you  have experience in a shop, warehouse, or general labour position, come start a career with  Fountain Tire Sudbury (Elisabella) as a General Labourer! We are willing to train interested applicants who are looking for a career in the Automotive Industry  and love to work with their hands.

 

What do we offer?

  • $16 an hour
  • On the job training
  • The opportunity to work with an excellent team and great customers in a clean, safe and respectful environment
  • Regular day shifts, with opportunity for overtime during our busy seasons (spring and fall)
  • Competitive wage, benefit programs for you and your family, including a RRSP program with company matching
  • Discounts for you and your family on tires, parts and services at all Fountain Tire locations
  • The opportunity for growth into apprenticeships and  leadership positions - own your own Fountain Tire location!

You will be responsible for:

  • Installing, balancing, rotating, and repairing passenger and light truck tires and wheels  
  • Resetting and repairing tire pressure monitoring systems (TPMS)
  • Maintaining tire service equipment on a regularly scheduled basis
  • Completing specialty tire work
  • Operating company and customer vehicles in a clean and safe manner

What does it take to get on track?

  • A valid driver's license
  • Some experience in an automotive shop would be great, but mostly we are looking for reliable candidates with a willingness to learn!
  • A customer-service focus with the ability to develop and maintain effective relationships with team members and customers
  • A keen attention to detail
  • Basic computer skills
  • Ability to consistently lift 25 kilograms

Interested candidates are encouraged to apply online or in store today!!

title: Labourer
description:
The Labourer is key member of our team, responsible over our property for cleanliness and organization, and assisting plumbers & apprentices to complete large scale jobs. Exemplifying our code of values, you show respect and courtesy to all customers and employees.  

Ideally you have prior experience in the plumbing industry and have proven communication skills with supervisors, employees, and customers.  You are self-motivated, thrive in fast moving environments, and able to manage time to effectively meet deadlines.  

Mr. Rooter Plumbing of Ottawa is interested in hiring people looking to be introduced into the plumbing trade, or those looking to gain experience in the trade. We are confident that the variety of jobs that are performed at our company will be helpful in education and skill development.

 

Specific Responsibilities:

  • Supporting plumbers and apprentices to complete large scale jobs which may involve digging, chipping concrete, and other labour-intensive tasks.
  • Perform minor to non-complex service work on plumbing systems in commercial and residential environments

  • Communicate problems, propose solutions, and explain billing to customers

  • Organizing tools, materials, and coordinating job activities with team members.
 

Job Requirements:

  • Prior industry experienced preferred

  • Valid Driver's License

  • Ability to operate basic hand tools necessary for the craft

  • Attention to detail

  • Excellent communication skills

  • Professional appearance and personality

 

Benefits: Benefits package varies by location

 

We are actively interviewing for this position - Apply today and our hiring manager will follow up!

Notice

Mr. Rooter LLC is the franchisor of the Mr. Rooter® franchised system. Each Mr. Rooter® franchised location is independently-owned and operated by an independent franchisee performing services. As a service to its independent franchisees, Mr. Rooter LLC lists employment opportunities available throughout the franchised network so those employment opportunities may be conveniently found by interested parties at one central location for brand management purposes only. Mr. Rooter LLC is NOT the employer seeking help. The only employer is the independent franchisee who has listed its available positions on this website.

*Acknowledgement

I acknowledge that each independent Mr. Rooter® franchisee hires and determines the terms and conditions of employment for its own employees. Any employment benefits, compensation and employment practices vary by location. Neither Mr. Rooter LLC (“Franchisor”) nor its affiliates have the power to: (1) hire, fire or modify the employment condition of franchisee’s employees; (2) supervise and control franchisee’s employee work schedule or conditions of employment; (3) determine the rate and method of payment; or (4) accept, review or maintain franchisee employment records. Mr. Rooter LLC is NOT the employer and/or joint employer for: (i) any of the job opportunities listed on this website; (ii) any of the independent franchisees; and, (iii) any of the employees of the independent franchisees.

title: Part-time General Labour
description:
Considering a Career at Maple Leaf Foods?
Maple Leaf Foods is Canada’s leading consumer-packaged protein company, headquartered in Toronto, Ontario. We make high-quality, great tasting, nutritious and innovative food products under leading brands including Maple Leaf®, Maple Leaf Prime®, Maple Leaf Natural Selections®, Schneiders®, Schneiders Country Naturals® and Mina™. Our Company employs approximately 11,500 people in its operations across Canada and exports to more than 20 global markets including the U.S. and Asia.

Our people are passionate about the work they do and the products we make. As we move forward, we are determined to leverage their integrity and passion to continue to build a high-performing, values-based company enabled by high-performing, motivated and talented people.

Maple Leaf Foods Bradford Plant is Hiring for multiple General Labour positions within our Production team!
The General Labour position is responsible for performing packaging, clean-up and other general activities related to food processing.
We are offering part-time work opportunities for people who are interested in working afternoonshift, 2-3 days per week.

Job Title: General Labour
Department: Production
Reports To: Production Supervisor

We have numerous positions available for the following shifts:
  • Tray Pack Department: Monday - Friday, 5:30 pm - 1:30 am (or end of shift)
  • Cut-Up Department: Monday - Friday, 6:30 pm - 3:00 am (or end of shift)
Details regarding wages and shift premium will be discussed when contacted.

Responsibilities:
  • Manually pack product into bags, trays and other packaging formats as per customer specification
  • Check products and packaging for basic quality defects
  • Cut-up product and hang poultry
  • Operate single-function machines
  • Load product onto packaging line for processing
  • Ensure work area is clean and tidy
  • Follow all GMP and food safety principles
Experience:
  • Able to work in a fast-paced work environment
  • Able to stand and walk throughout the shift
  • Able to perform repetitive lifting
  • Can work well in a team environment and support fellow team members
  • Good communication skills

Why Maple Leaf Foods?

  • Training provided where needed, specifically in Human Resources, Health & Safety, Food Safety and on-the-job training
  • Reputable company and well-known brands
  • Competitive Wages
  • Great team environment
  • Strong focus on internal advancement and promotion
  • Employee Assistance Program and Mental Health support


If interested, please send resume by email to:

Jessica.madia@mapleleaf.com

or apply to our job posting onlinewith an updated resume and phone number atCareers and Jobs – Maple Leaf Foods, or through our other job boards.

These positions will remain open until filled.


We thank all applicants for their interest in exploring employment opportunities with Maple Leaf Foods however only those selected for an interview will be contacted. Applicants may be subject to a background check and must meet the security criteria designated for the position.

Maple Leaf Foods is committed to Employment Equity and maintaining a diverse workforce. We ensure that our recruitment practices are supportive of this commitment.

title: Skilled Labourer
description:
Come build with a BC Top Employer 2022 winner!

Jacob Bros Construction is immediately hiringSkilled & GeneralLabourers (Civil Construction)for projects throughout the lower mainland.

Your ​Rewards:

  • Full-time, permanentemployment
  • Work 10-12/h days, 5-6 days per week
  • Earn overtime after8 hours per day, and double time after 12 hours per day
  • Group Medical, Extended Health and Dental Plan
  • Group RRSP contribution
  • Vacation pay
  • 5 Year Service Award (Trip for twoanywhere in North America)
  • Eligibility for up to $2000.00 Referral Bonus Program
Responsibilities:
  • Manual labour, cleaning and preparing sites
  • Raking, shoveling, unloading trucks and maintenance tasks
  • Digging trenches, raking and shoveling
  • Cleaningdebris and removing waste materials from sites
  • Operate hand tools as directed
  • Worksafelyaround heavy construction equipment
  • Other labour duties as assigned
Requirements:

  • One (1) year proven civil constructionexperience for a privately held or family-owned general contracting business is preferred
  • Must be legally eligible to work for any employer in Canada

About Jacob Bros:

At Jacob Bros, our team of talented construction professionals is taking on some the most challenging projects in British Columbia's construction industry.

We are one of BC’s largest and most respected construction organizations, offering construction services in a variety of markets including heavy civil construction, major public infrastructure, and industrial, commercial, institutional and residential projects.

title: General Labourer (Dufferin Aggregates) - $24 - $29/hr
description:
Job ID:  402839 

Work Type:  Full Time Permanent 

 

It is a great time to join the Dufferin Aggregates team! Dufferin Aggregates is going through an exciting business transformation which demands first-class Talent Management support to drive results.


We are building a world- class team. Make your mark!


You will be a successful addition to our team if you look at change as an opportunity to develop and contribute to the business. You will be successful in your role if you like partnering with the business, presenting new ideas and providing excellent customer service.

Dufferin Aggregates, a divison of CRH Canada is looking to hire!

Duties and Responsibilities:

  • Work in a team environment with other co-workers, supervisors and managers.
  • Complete cleanup assignments using shovels and/or small, heavy equipment.
  • Assist in maintenance inspections and activities using appropriate procedures.
  • Operate crushing and screening plant as trained and directed.
  • Report any malfunctions or safety risks to supervisor immediately.
  • Specific job duties will often vary from day to day depending on business needs.

Qualifications:

  • Experience in construction, mining or operating heavy machinery is preferred but not required.
  • Minimum Ontario high school diploma (OSSD) or equivalent.
  • Reliability – Showing up to work on time.
  • Be willing to work rotating shifts, overtime and weekends when required.
  • Physical ability to walk around the plant.
  • Basic maintenance/mechanical aptitude, welding and fitting is preferred but not required.
  • Dependability – follow instructions and respond to direction. Good communication skills are required.  
  • Working outdoors/indoors under varied temperatures and weather conditions.

Health and Safety:

  • Comply with OHSA and all of its applicable regulations.
  • Strict compliance with Dufferin Aggregates safety rules, PPE, policies and procedures.
  • Be aware of environmentally sensitive areas and be alert to correct environmental problems that may develop in the assigned work area.
     

What Dufferin Aggregates Offers You:

  • Pension and benefits included after probationary period.
  • Shift premium applies to night shifts.
  • Bonus pay based on safety and performance.
  • High competitive starting wage with multi-tier wage structure based on skill and ability.
  • Overtime opportunities are available as required.
  • PPE and tools allowance are provided by company for some positions.
  • Company provides training and appreciation events.
  • A culture that values opportunity for growth, development, and internal promotion

Visit our website for more information: http://www.crhcanada.com

CRH Canada Group Inc. recognizes Canada’s diverse landscape. Accommodation is available upon request for applicants with disabilities throughout the recruitment and selection process.

title: Labourer
description:
Company Description

 

We are Chandos

Inclusion. Collaboration. Ingenuity. Innovation.

These values speak to our desire to create places where all people belong, listening and learning from one another in a way that sparks ideas and leads to positive changes in our industry and community. They also demonstrate our commitment to a diverse, equitable, and inclusive culture. And, if they resonate with you too, we should talk!

We are 100 percent employee owned and proud to be the first and largest B Corp certified commercial builder in North America, meaning we put our values at the centre of everything we do. 

Continuous improvement is core to our success. Championing innovative and collaborative ways to build is just one example of that. Collaborative construction leads to more efficiency, cost savings, social value, and a much better working experience for everyone.

Every day, our teams are working to build places for people to live, work, learn, serve, and play. But above all, we’re building community. And, we’re looking for like-minded people to join us. Together, we can build a better world.

 

Job Description

The Labourer is required to perform tasks involving physical labour at commercial construction projects, and to operate a variety of hand and power tools.

Qualifications

  • Knowledge of safe operation of basic hand and power tools
  • Minimum of 1 year previous construction labour experience preferred
  • Knowledge of workplace safety, and safe lifting and handling procedures
  • Knowledge of First Aid and CPR preferred
  • Valid Drivers License and clean abstract preferred
  • Out of town work may be required. Work in all weather conditions.

 



Additional Information

Chandos is an equal opportunity employer and we are committed to a diverse, equitable, and inclusive culture and this includes our recruitment and hiring process. 

We recognize that our differences are our greatest strengths. We uncover talent. We nurture talent. And then we give people the tools they need to use their talent to create a positive impact.

  • We are 100% employee owned. Every person who works for Chandos can become an owner. There is only one class of units at Chandos, because we believe everyone should be treated equal. We talk about being an entrepreneurial-minded organization and you can be sure we mean it!
  • Competitive wages
  • Well rounded employer paid benefits program including health, dental, vision care and employee assistance program
  • RRSP matching program to aid and prepare employees for long-term financial security
  • Educational assistance for employees who wish to pursue job-performance enhancing education
  • Recognition and annual salary reviews program
  • Leadership conferences that allow employees to connect and collaborate
  • Regular company-wide engagement opportunities

title: General Labourer
description:
Oakridge Landscape Contractors has a need for General Labourers (Full-time Year Round) to join our dynamic team of talented individuals!

Oakridge Group Inc. Established in 1992, our team of trusted professionals strives to accomplish the best outcome for every single one of our clients, every time. With 30 years of experience, we stand firmly behind our work and take immense pride in all of our projects, both big and small. Our focus and client dedication can be seen throughout decades of Oakridge Landscape Contractors' award-winning residential and commercial projects. We have won 9 Landscape Ontario awards in 2021 for our residential and commercial projects.

Job Details:
  • Position: General Labourer.
  • Location: Hamilton, Ontario.
  • Pay: $20/hr.
  • Benefits after probationary period.
  • Company events.

Key Job Duties:
  • The job involves lifting, bending, digging, raking, using a wheelbarrow, shovel, rake, and other tools.
  • Ability to dig holes (when needed), place soils, plant trees, and shrubs, etc.
  • Building retaining walls
  • Installation of natural stone (flag, armor, etc).
  • Installation of interlock paving stone.
  • Snow removal in winter months.

Job Requirements:
  • Ability to lift up to 50 lbs.
  • Must have access to your own vehicle.
  • Ability to work long hours.
  • Self-motivated.
  • Ability to think as a team player.
  • Ability to do physical work.
  • Respect for on-site safety.
  • Ability to work Saturdays as required.
  • Tolerance to various weather conditions.

Application Details:
  • Oakridge Group is an equal opportunity employer and welcomes applications from all interested parties.
  • If you are a person with a disability and have a question or require assistance with the application.




    About Oakridge Landscape Contractors:

    Oakridge Landscape Contractors specializes in landscape applications for industrial, commercial, institutional, parks, heritage sites, and highway road infrastructure restoration.Our extensive landscape construction knowledge and installation abilities combined with our team, sub trade relationships and central location allow our company to complete both large and small scale successfully.

title: General Labour
description:
Overview:

Flex-N-Gate is a leading manufacturer and supplier of components for the automotive industry, recently ranked 10th of the 150 Top North American Suppliers in â€œAutomotive News.â€ A growing and vital company, Flex-N-Gate provides a great opportunity for hard-working and skilled individuals.

Scope of the Position:

Busy Automotive manufacturing facility is looking for dedicated people to work 34 to 40 hours per week. No rotating shifts.

Covid Safety Protocols in place.

Responsibilities:

Follow job instructions to assemble parts on production line

Follow company health and safety rules

title: Laborer
company: On The Greener Side Lawn & Tree Service
description:
Looking for a seasonal laborer.
The hours will be 40 hours per week and some Saturdays may be required.

Requirements:
  • Must have a driver's license and a vehicle to get to work.
  • Stamina and strength to perform manual labor.
  • Excellent hand-eye-coordination skills.

The job is to:
  • Assist with the installation of underground sprinklers, so there are physical demands and will be working outdoors.
  • There is digging, backfilling raking.
  • Some lifting is involved in this job, so you must be physically fit.

title: General Labour
description:
Since 1953, ALMAG has built a reputation as an industry leader in extruding high-visual, tight tolerance, complex, thin-walled, lightweight and precision aluminum extrusions. Pushing the limits of industry standards, ALMAG is capable of providing Solutions to some of the most complex designs by combining its skills, knowledge and experience with engineering to deliver best in class, quality Solutions with the industry’s shortest lead times.

We are growing and looking for energetic and dedicated people to join the ALMAG team. If you are energized by a fast pace work environment where every day presents new experiences and challenges, explore a career with ALMAG.

We are looking for Night Shift General Laborer’s (Packers) to work in our packing department. As a Packer, you will work in pairs to inspect and pack finished goods, placing the final touch of quality and customer service on all of our products before they are shipped to our customers.

This position starts at a base rate of $17.50 an hour with a $1.00 shift premium.

During your first year at ALMAG you have the potential for regular increases after 3 and 6 months of service and an ongoing annual increase during your career. We offer our employees a competitive benefits package after 3 months of service, a health care spending account after 1 year of service and a lucrative profit sharing program after 13 months of service.

What you will be doing

  • Double checking material before it is packed to ensure final quality, count and weight
  • Partner with your team and supervisor to pack material according to priority and customer need
  • Use tools, box makers, banding, tape, box knives etc. to custom build high quality cardboard packaging for a wide variety of custom made extrusions
  • Utilize our inhouse software to review and record data as well as print labels for outgoing material
  • Partner with your colleagues and Supervisor to ensure a safe work environment by following safety procedures and reporting concerns immediately

What you bring to the table

  • You have 1 or more years of experience working in a warehouse or industrial environment
  • You have some high school education; a high school diploma or GED is an asset
  • You can communicate effectively in English, both written and verbal
  • You have a command of basic math skills and an ability to take and read precision measurements
  • You are familiar with using computers and computer programs like Microsoft Office
  • You are comfortable lifting up to 30lbs repetitively during your shift

We offer a full and competitive benefits package after 3 months of service including:

  • Profit sharing
  • Health care spending account
  • Education assistance program
  • Health and dental
  • Life AD&D
  • Long-term disability
  • Critical illness insurance
  • Gym memberships
  • Wellness programs
  • Monthly social committee activities

title: Skilled Labourer
description:
OCL Group Inc. (OCL), is a proudly 100% Canadian, privately held, employee-owned fully integrated general contractor with design-build solutions across Western Canada, with the experience you can trust and the quality you can depend on, serving the energy and municipal infrastructure markets since 2009.

We are currently recruiting Labourers for a pipeline project located approximately 45 minutes south of Fort McMurray, AB. The project schedule is 6/1 with camp accommodations provided.

Responsibilities:

  • Read and understand site-specific instructions prior to each shift
  • Demolition and waste removal
  • Site cleaning and preparation
  • Digging and trenching
  • Other duties as assigned
  • Valid drivers license
  • Must have valid safety tickets
  • Ensure a safe team environment
  • Adhere to all company and worksite safety and quality processes and procedures
  • Strong communication skills
  • Desire to work in a team environment
  • Previous industrial experience is an asset
  • Must be able to pass a pre-employment drug and alcohol test
  • Comfortable working in various weather conditions

title: Skilled Labourers
description:
Skilled Labourers
This is a physically and mentally challenging position involving heavy lifting, hard work, solid people skills, willingness to take direction and a desire to perform requested duties with a focus on safety and appropriate precautions.

Requirements:
  • Must pass a pre-employment Drug & Alcohol Test
  • Excellent communication, organizational and interpersonal skills
  • Class 5 driver’s license with clean drivers abstract
  • Comprehension and compliance of all safety procedures
  • A disciplined work ethic and ability to take initiative as well as accept direction
  • Remain alert, and maintain a high level of concentration along with problem solving skills
  • Have good judgement and the ability to react quickly
  • Capable of working in both a team and individual environment
  • Physically fit and capable of long hours
  • Candidates must be legally entitled to work in Canada.
Duties:
  • Must have a good handle on the use of power and hand tools (drills, impacts, wrenches, etc).
  • General unbolting and bolting back up
  • Removing and re-installing PSV’s
  • Installing and removing Pancakes
  • Setting up air movers
  • Removing and installing valves
  • General clean up

Valid H2S Alive and First Aid safety courses would be an asset
Ability and certification operating small equipment such as forklift and skid-steer would also be an asset.

The Company:
If you are energetic and excited to work as part of a team, focused on completing each job to the highest standards and want to contribute your skills and experience then we want to hear from you!
We thank all applicants in advance for your interest in Torque Industrial Ltd, and this position. Only those selected for an interview will be contacted.

title: Labourer
description:
ROLE
The Labourer is responsible for performing general construction activities.
KEY RESPONSIBILITIES
  • Perform various general construction activities such as:
    • Set up and install trench boxes.
    • Erect and take down skid piles.
    • Erect fencing (t-posts and snow fencing).
    • Assist with stringing activities.
    • Assist with lowering in activities.
    • Manual material handling.
    • Operate hand and power tools.
    • Clean and prepare sites.
    • Unload and set up traffic controls and safety equipment.
    • Perform spotting for various types of equipment as well as overhead powerlines.
Note: In addition to these duties personnel are required to carry out such other duties as may be reasonably required in order to support the objectives of the company.
POSITION REQUIREMENTS
Qualifications
  • Various safety tickets/certificates as required depending on project.
Experience
  • Previous work experience in the pipeline construction industry would be an asset.
Skills and Knowledge
  • Knowledge of pipeline construction industry is considered an asset.
  • Knowledge of workplace safety requirements and procedures.
  • Knowledge of handling hazardous materials and industry waste.
  • Good vision and hand-eye coordination.
  • Physically able to lift and handle heavy objects.
  • Manual dexterity.
WORKING CONDITIONS
This position is field based and often works within remote project locations. Travel and/or living in temporary accommodations is required.

REPORTING RELATIONSHIPS
The Labourer reports to the Foreman of his/her crew. The position has no supervisory duties.

title: Nutrien Redwater: Scaffolder Journeyman and Apprentice (Redwater, AB)
description:
SCAFFOLDER - APPRENTICES AND JOURNEYPERSON: Local Drive-in position

Shift is 5x10


MINIMUM REQUIREMENTS:
  • Must have a previous Scaffolding experience.
  • Valid certification from an accredited apprenticeship board.
  • Must be able to work for 8 hours at a time in an environment where temperatures may reach from 0 to 60° C, both indoors and outdoors in the sun.
  • Work in an environment in which vibrations and noise are moderate to severe and noise level may require the wearing of hearing protection devices.
  • Must be able to work in confined spaces for 4-7 hours per day; stand or walk for long periods.
  • Able to wear a full-face respirator for extended periods.
  • Climb and maintain balance on ladders and scaffolding at extreme heights.
  • Stoop, kneel, crouch and crawl.
  • Lift and carry objects weighing up to 50 pounds often and occasionally up to 100 pounds.
  • Maintain footing on surfaces which are sometimes slippery.
  • See well (naturally or with correction) and distinguish colors.
  • Hear well (naturally or with hearing aid).
  • Must be able to effectively communicate with other employees and supervision.
  • Use arms and hands to reach for, handle, and feel objects; and coordinate well the use of hands or fingers and eyes.
  • Must have reliable transportation to and from the work location.
ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS:
  • Must comply with all safety regulations of Brock Canada.
  • Ensures that work is performed in accordance with Contractor Specifications and/or as directed by the Contractor’s Representative.
  • Ensures they are following the applicable Contractor’s Safety Procedures, OH&S, Provincial and/or Contractor’s safety requirements.
  • Assures that the proper materials, tools and equipment is being used for the specified tasks.
  • Reads specifications, such as blueprints and data, to determine requirements.
  • Able to install steel pipes, support braces and clamps to form bases for scaffolds.
  • Able to dismantle scaffold upon job completion.
  • Can identify the type of scaffolding material to be used for the job (frame, tube & clamp, system).
  • Able to thoroughly describe scaffolding materials.
  • Sort and organize material
  • Able to count and place orders for material
  • Required to complete safety paperwork such as FLRA’s, Start Cards, etc.
  • Other duties as assigned

Department: Operations
This is a non-management position
This is a contract position

title: Labourer
description:
Safeguard offers a variety of products and services to satisfy even the most complex event plans. Since our inception into the market, we have been passionate about providing only the best products that meet our vigorous testing requirements. Safeguard is dedicated to being the industry leader is both temporary and permanent protection & event management. 

We are looking to add Labourer positions to our team in Toronto!

Hours are typically 15-20 hours a week, but can go up to 40 hours a week in the Summer months/early Fall!

Responsibilities:

  • Ability to work in all types of weather, with flexibility of the work schedule dependent on the client requirement.
  • Must be available to work days, nights and weekends as required. Hours may vary depending on the season.
  • Must be physically fit and able to lift up to 50lbs regularly
  • Perform a wide variety of jobs and duties as assigned, with a high level of proficiency and accuracy
  • Demonstrate problem solving, planning, and organizing skills
  • Identify requirements for materials, tools and communicate these to Operations
  • Review all jobs assigned to ensure no issues and properly plan to use all materials effectively
  • Accountable to ensure working tools are properly used, treated with care and returned. 
  • Ensure any daily maintenance/inspections are completed
  • Participate in the safety culture and complete all required paperwork such as tool box talks, job sheets, traffic plan etc. in accordance with the company policyâ€™s and work safe procedures
  • Accountable for proper and timely reporting of accidents, near miss, first aid, and incidents to Operations
  • Be available for out of town work should the need arise.
  • Other duties as required

Qualifications:

  • 1 years of labour experience, preferred experience in event setup/traffic control
  • Must be reliable, responsible and conduct oneself in a professional manner; company perception and customer satisfaction are key to our success
  • An energetic team player who can work well and communicate with others, as well as be self-directed and work independently
  • Capable of interpreting various construction related drawings and documents
  • Able to perform physically demanding tasks outside in all types of weather and terrain
  • Valid Ontario driverâ€™s license with a clean driving records
  • Must be comfortable working alongside traffic & busy roadways
  • Health & Safety conscious, ensuring safety and emergency procedures are followed

The Powell Group of Companies encompasses a diverse collection of successful businesses, but our spirit isnâ€™t found in the diversity of our portfolio, itâ€™s found in the diversity of our people. At Powell, we believe that our greatest opportunity for continued success is fostered in the belief that every voice matters. Each one of us has a unique story and we promise to do our part to ensure that those stories are heard, seen, acknowledged, and supported.

Powell Group of Companies is committed to meeting the accessibility needs of persons with disabilities in an effective and timely manner in accordance with the applicable standards set out in the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act, 2005 (AODA), the provisions of the Ontario Human Rights Code, and any other applicable legislation. Powellâ€™s goal is to foster an inclusive organizational culture

title: General Laborer
description:

If you answered yes to those questions, then this is a perfect opportunity for you! 

BB Window Cleaning is one of the Student Works franchises. We operate in Courtice, Bowmanville, Newcastle, and, Cobourg. We offer our clients Window Cleaning, Eavestroughs Cleaning, and Pressure Washing services. We offer a welcoming and positive environment for all of our employees. Looking for: enthusiastic, hardworking students from the ages of 17-25 with access to a vehicle. If you want to have a fantastic summer and make great money while doing it, apply to get jacked and clean some houses while you're at it.

title: General Labourer (Night Shift)
description:
General Labourer (Night Shift)

Apply now »



Date:Apr 29, 2022


Location: Toronto, ON, CA


Company: RailWorks




Job ID: 13542


Position Summary





The Labourer will be reporting to the Foreman/Superintendent. The Electrical Labourer performs all necessary inspections, tests, and maintenance on his assigned territory as well as assisting other Maintainers as required. The work is physically demanding and performed outdoors in a field environment, near live track.





Job Responsibilities/Duties






+ Maintain tools and equipment in ready-for-service condition.


+ Perform all periodic inspection and tests as per railway and PNR standards.


+ Perform special duties as assigned by the Supervisor.


+ Work cooperatively with other maintainers on technical issues and troubleshooting.


+ Perform general labour tasks as necessary including operating equipment.


+ Comply with railway and PNR safe work practices and signal work procedures.


+ Other Duties as assigned






Qualifications






+ 3-5 years of experience in Construction


+ Diploma or experience with electrical an asset


+ Experience in Signals & Communications field experience an asset


+ Ability to work outdoors in all weather conditions






Physical Requirements






+ Work is outdoors in all weather conditions.


+ Exposure to live track/trains and high voltage.


+ Work is safety sensitive and protective equipment is required.









All successful applicants must be in compliance with PNR RailWorks Inc. Mandatory COVID Vaccination Policy, which will be provided prior to hire.








All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment with PNR RailWorks without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or any other characteristics protected by law.


PNR RailWorks Inc. is committed to fostering an equitable, accessible, and inclusive workplace. As such, PNR RailWorks Inc. will ensure reasonable accommodations for candidates with disabilities throughout the hiring process, including the interview. If selected for an interview, requests for accommodation can be confidentially made to a member of the recruitment team who will arrange in advance for reasonable and appropriate accommodation for fair and equitable assessment throughout the process.


All successful applicants must be in compliance with PNR RailWorks Inc. Mandatory COVID Vaccination Policy, which will be provided prior to hire.

Each day is different from the next. You'll get to travel around the nicest areas of the Fraser Valley East while taking away customer’s unwanted items. Variety is the spice of life!

Apply today to join our great team! We EMAIL all potential candidates within two business days - please watch you emails to schedule an interview.

title: Labourer
description:
Labourers with Cando perform a variety of railway related tasks. Working for the Transload department, the Labourer ensures safety is a high priority at all times and procedures are respected and followed.

Roles and Responsibilities

  • Perform general labouring tasks around the rail yard for Central Manitoba Railway
  • Work in teams of two (2) to load 100lb bags of various product
  • Use any necessary tools safely and efficiently
  • Participate in daily job briefings
  • Learn and operate equipment as required
  • Advise when services are needed on equipment; perform daily maintenance on equipment

Skills, Knowledge, and Abilities

  • Able to work as a team player and take direction from foremen and supervisors
  • Be physically fit with the ability to lift up to 50 pounds
  • Understand, record, and apply oral and written instructions; document work activities, and prepare required reports or work orders
  • Mechanically inclined; capable of performing troubleshooting and maintenance
  • Willingness to adapt to new technological changes and improvements and participate in training and self-development programs
  • Ability to work outdoors in all weather conditions

Education & Experience

  • Ability to pass and maintain clean drug and alcohol testing
  • Hold and maintain a valid driver's license   

Note: This description is not intended to limit the assignment of work or be construed as a complete list of the many duties to be performed by the incumbent. The qualifications are provided so interested candidates understand the level of expertise required in this position.

title: GENERAL LABOURER
description:
Job Description

You’ve probably seen quite a few positions as labourer, but being one at EACOM Sullivan, a subsidiary of INTERFOR, means having both hands in something bigger than life. You’re going to be handling wood and more wood. Keeping a close eye on everything that’s going on will help you keep the yard and the mill clean and tidy. We’ll be relying on you to keep everything in its place and running smoothly. You’ll be making a living in a job with us, in our sawmills rooted in northern regions of Ontario and Québec. You’ll discover that they transform much more than wood – they enhance our communities!

Are you hard-working and resourceful? Are you effective at moving into action? Come and see EACOM. We’ll bend over backwards to make things work. The team awaits you.

What you’ll actually be doing:

  • Fastening bundles of raw wood for drying outside;
  • Redoing and stacking bundles of raw or planed wood in the yard;
  • Cleaning up the yard and the mill;
  • Managing sawdust indoors and outdoors;
  • During halts in work, cleaning in places that are inaccessible during operations;
  • Handling related tasks (this may make you nervous, but you’ll learn plenty of new things that will serve you well).

What do you need to succeed with us?

  • Working well on a team;
  • Demonstrating self-reliance and initiative;
  • Showing vigilance and a concern for health and safety.
Qualifications

Your background will help you:

  • High school diploma, vocational diploma or equivalent;
  • Previous work at a mill is an asset;
  • Availability for day and/or night shifts;
  • Be available to work 42 hours per week;
  • Earn $ 22.87 / hour.


Additional Information

At EACOM, we’re there for you.

EACOM supports employment equity, and diversity is welcome – in fact, we encourage it! We’ll contact you if you’re selected for an interview. If you need any special accommodation, let us know. Any information you send us will be handled respectfully and in complete confidence.

title: Construction Worker (FT)
description:
Job Detail.
We have an immediate opening for a Construction Worker. We are looking for an energetic candidate to work alongside our current, experienced concrete repair crew to complete various tasks.

About You.
  • The ideal candidate is comfortable with heights as you will sometimes work on scaffolds.
  • You will be helping chip and repair concrete.
  • We will provide training. We are looking for someone with a good work ethic and you will join a group that works as a team and that enjoys coming to work each day.

title: General Labour
location: North York (Jane And Finch), ON, ON
description:
General Labour - must be able to read

We are looking for 7-10 strong individuals who are comfortable lifting 15lbs to 50lbs.

You will be responsible for lifting boxes onto the convey and labeling the boxes. Once the boxes are labeled you are required to sort the boxes on the convey to the appropriate skid for delivery.

The shift starts at 7am and ends at 4pm Monday to Friday. We have lots of overtime available.

Must be fully vaccinated, WHMIS, safety shoes and be reliable.

We will be hiring 7 individuals permanently with benefits after 3-6 months. The bus stop is right in front of the building for those concern about transportation.

title: General Labourer (12AM to 8AM)
description:
Organization: Real Food for Real Kids 

Website: www.rfrk.com 

Location: East End of Toronto, ON

Job Title: General Labourer

Shift: Tuesday-Friday, 12am-8am

Compensation: $19 per hour + premium + $2.00 (12AM-6AM)

Perks: 2 weeks vacation + 8 PAID Personal Days per year, Health Spending Account, Profit Sharing, RRSP Matching

And

Working at RFRK comes with other perks too:

  • Competitive salary

  • Employee Savings Program (RRSP/TFSA Matching)

  • Health Spending Account (after 6 months of employment)

  • RFK Discounts

Hiring Bonus: 

  • There will be a $500 bonus once you pass your 3 month probation 

Real Food for Real Kids (RFRK) is a growing company on a mission to make real food the standard rather than the exception.

A multiple award-winning company recognized for excellence and innovation, we’re a leading healthy catering company for child care centres, schools and camps. RFRK proudly serves nutritious meals and snacks to over 20,000 children throughout the Greater Toronto & Hamilton Area every day. We’ve also recently launched our Real Food Delivery service, Real Food Kitchen, to get our yummy food directly into households. 

Our Pack team is looking for a fantastic person who loves to organize and arrange food to join us as a Pack Team Member / General Labourer. If you like the sound of us so far, keep reading to see if you have the experience and skills needed for this rewarding role!

About the Role:

At the Real Food Kitchen, a team of cooks, bakers, kitchen helpers, packers, porters, and Super Drivers help to prepare, pack, and deliver nutritious and delicious meals to feed thousands of kids in the GTA. As a member of the production team, you’ll help support the production staff, and ensure that their tasks are performed effectively and to the highest possible health and safety standards. The Pack Team Member jumps in where they are needed to make sure our food gets to the kids every day.

Main responsibilities include ensuring appropriate items and quantities are packed according to the pack sheet. 

Some of the things you’ll get paid to do:

Packing

  • Pack food according to pack sheets
  • Stage and pre-kit items for pack
  • Ensure that FIFO guidelines are followed when staging, pre-kitting or packing products
  • Organize, pack and palletize frozen recipe items 
  • Conduct weekly inventory of all frozen items
  • Ensure that items being packed meet our quality standards, and bring issues to the attention of the kitchen manager 

 Assist Production Staff

  • Support all production related tasks associated with next day production
  • Assist with set-up: organizing items, weighing, and counting food items
  • Ensure that items being packed meet our quality standards, and bring issues to the attention of the production manager
  • Keep fridges and freezers organized

Clean Work Environment

  • Maintaining a clean work environment 
  • Carefully follow health and safety rules
  • Clean-up at the end of shift 

Waste Disposal

  • Disposal of waste in a proper and organized way
  • Help with waste removal
  • Help with dishwashing duties  

Other

  • Carefully follow health and safety rules
  • Carefully adhere to all Covid-19 safety and social distancing policies
  • Other duties as required
About You
  • Positive attitude, with a passion to get things done right!
  • Respect for food safety practices
  • Hard-working
  • Punctual
  • Works well in a team environment 
  • Ability to work on your feet for an 8-hour shift
  • Ability to repetitively lift a minimum of 25 kg
  • Ability to work in cold environments (-10 to 4 degrees Celsius)
  • Attention to cleanliness
  • Ability to read, write and speak English
  • Basic math skills, including: addition, subtraction, multiplication, and division 
Working at RFRK comes with other perks too:
  • Competitive salary
  • Employee Savings Program (RRSP/TFSA Matching)
  • Health Spending Account (after 6 months of employment)

To apply, please upload your résumé and cover letter, including salary expectations, explaining why you’d be a great fit for this role!

Real Food for Real Kids is an equal opportunity employer. We strongly encourage applications from diverse backgrounds and communities. 

Real Food for Real Kids welcomes and encourages applications from people with disabilities. Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process.

No phone calls or emails, please. We’ll contact applicants that fit the bill, and invite them in for an interview. 

Thanks for your interest in Real Food for Real Kids! Copyright © 2022 Real Food for R

title: Labourer (Victoria)
description:
Kinetic Construction provides Construction Manager and General Contracting services on Vancouver Island and the Lower Mainland. “Together Building Better” is who we are, in our day to day these values operationalize as “Relationships, Passion and Continuous Improvement”. Kinetic provides a variety of project delivery methods to complete large commercial, institutional, and multi-unit residential projects for private and public clientele. The organization is 100% employee owned with offices in Victoria, Vancouver and Courtenay. We collaborate with like-minded partners to create a better industry for everyone.

Our people are the most important factor to our shared success. We provide a collaborative, caring culture and the necessary support for everyone to succeed, both personally and professionally. If you see yourself as a continuous learner, curious and driven to succeed as a team we want you to be part of our team.

We are looking for a Construction Labourer to work on projects based in Victoria. This position requires working on construction project sites, assisting the Superintendent and Skilled Tradespersons while also performing labouring activities. In this role, no day is the same! It’s a fast-paced industry and there is a positive energy in the business.

Responsibilities and Duties

Labouring duties include performing tasks involved in:

The physical labour of building a project
Operating hand and power tools of a large variety as necessary
Site preparation and clean-up

Our ideal candidate has the following skills and experience to bring to our team:

Positive, can-do attitude
Natural willingness to pitch in and do what’s needed to help get the job done
Physical capability to safely perform the work on site (i.e., lifting, carrying, standing, walking, kneeling, etc)

No Calls Please

title: General Labourer
description:
Do you have experience troubleshooting and thinking on your feet? Are you looking to support and involve yourself with a high-energy, devoted team? Do you have a passion for building things and helping people? Most importantly, are you looking for a chance to grow and develop with a company that has your back? If you answered yes to any of these questions, you should keep reading to learn more about this exciting opportunity!

With the rapid growth of The Canadian Brewhouse, we are looking for a high energy physically fit labourer to join the #BrewCrew! Candidates will report to the site supervisor and assist in different tasks within the construction of our upcoming locations.

 

Requirements:

  • Ability to lift heavy objects, walk and stand for long periods of time and perform strenuous physical labor
  • Valid class 5 drivers license
  • Adequate hand tool skills
  • Ability to operate required equipment in a safe and responsible manner
  • Comfortable working in all weather conditions
  • Effective verbal and listening communications skills

 

Some of the benefits of joining the Brew Crew: 

  • Competitive pay and perks based on experience
  • A company healthcare spending account that covers:
    • Dental Care
    • Vision Care
    • Extended Healthcare
  • Consistent 40 hours per week
  • Paid Vacation
  • Friendly, fun and supportive colleagues
  • In-house discounts â€“ bring your family and friends, show off your workplace!
  • Advancement opportunities are endless with the right attitude and passion - our CEO started out as a dishwasher!
  • Working with a team of like-minded individuals who have your interests at heart. Our team is our family - We Are Brew Crew!

 

 

Company Information

Welcome to The Canadian Brewhouse (https://youtu.be/fyKRJzJWiu4), Canada's fastest-growing independent restaurant group! We are proud of being the only Canadian-themed sports bar in town, and we know that without our incredible teams we wouldn't be a fraction of where we are today. Our teams live and breathe our Core Values; these are 6 key principles that influence all of our decisions as an organization.

  • Take Care of Each Other and Yourself
  • Think Like a Customer
  • Support Your Community
  • Hurry, Donâ€™t Rush
  • Embrace Innovation
  • Be Persistent

When not at work, you may catch us out in the community volunteering, raising funds for The Canadian Mental Health Association or the local Children's Hospital, or having a couple of drinks with friends. The Brew Crew is a team of devoted, compassionate, and ambitious individuals that are hungry for what the future holds. We believe it's our duty to provide all of our employees with a safe, fun-filled work environment with endless advancement opportunities. Let us tell you more about why you should join the best team in Canada, today!

Powered by JazzHR

title: Ouvrier(ière) Civil (Sept-Îles, QC, CA)
description:
Concours: 136230
Titre: Ouvrier(ière) Civil
Statut: Temporaire
Durée: Indéterminée
Lieu: Sept-Îles
Fin d'affichage: 15/05/2022

VOS DÉFIS

  • Exécute tout travail d'entretien et de réparation de nature civile, tel que: bétonnage, maçonnerie, menuiserie, couverture de bâtiment, soudure, ferblanterie, plomberie, peinture, gréage et mécanique du bâtiment requis sur les bâtiments, les ouvrages de génie civil, la machinerie et les équipements de bâtiments. Effectue également des travaux mineurs de construction justifiés par les besoins de maintenance.
  • Assiste son chef d'équipe dans les responsabilités qui lui sont dévolues.

 

LES RESPONSABILITÉS ET TÂCHES TYPES SONT RÉALISÉES DE CONCERT AVEC LE SUPÉRIEUR ET LES INTERVENANTS DU MILIEU ET SONT RÉALISÉES DE MANIÈRE À AMÉLIORER LA BONNE MARCHE DES OPÉRATIONS.

 

TÂCHES TYPES

  • Remplace le chef d'équipe, lorsque requis.
  • Assiste le chef d'équipe aux différentes étapes de la planification de l'organisation des travaux.
  • Collabore pour que tous les matériaux et les outils nécessaires aux travaux soient acheminés sur les lieux du travail à pied d'œuvre.
  • Collabore au suivi du programme d'entretien de l'outillage et de l'équipement.
  • Informe le chef d'équipe sur l'évolution des travaux en fonction des étapes de réalisation, des problèmes reliés à l'exécution des travaux, des anomalies rencontrées et y apporte les correctifs, s'il y a lieu.
  • Exécute l'ensemble de ses tâches, en respectant les délais et selon les résultats attendus (qualité du travail).
  • Soumet, à son chef d'équipe, toute amélioration au processus de travail dans le but d'optimiser le travail.
  • Assiste le chef d'équipe au niveau de la fiche de sécurité. Respecte et applique les méthodes de travail et règles de sécurité convenues lors de laïus.
  • Utilise et remplit toute la documentation nécessaire au suivi des travaux selon les règles en vigueur en utilisant les systèmes informatiques appropriés: mise à jour des plans, bon de travail, feuilles de temps, etc.
  • Rédige des rapports d'inspection des véhicules, trousses de premiers soins.
  • Participe à l'entraînement des membres de l'équipe et informe son chef d'équipe des besoins de formation nécessaires en fonction des travaux à réaliser.
  • Partage ses connaissances avec les autres membres de l'équipe.

.

  • Effectue le démantèlement, le montage, l'entretien et les réparations requises aux bâtiments et à leurs équipements en y réalisant des travaux de plomberie, menuiserie, mécanique du bâtiment, décapage, peinture, maçonnerie, bétonnage, ferblanterie et gréage.
  • Effectue des travaux mineurs de construction et d'installation de machinerie et d'équipements sur les bâtiments justifiés par les besoins de maintenance, selon des plans, devis et manuels techniques.
  • Effectue tout genre de coupage et de pliage de métaux et de soudures électriques et oxyacétyléniques aux bâtiments et aux ouvrages de génie civil.
  • Fabrique, ajuste et installe toutes pièces de métal requérant l'utilisation de machines-outils appropriées.
  • Aménage les espaces administratifs selon les plans, devis et croquis; manutentionne l'ameublement et, au besoin, en effectue la réparation.
  • Fabrique, entretient et répare tout accessoire en bois tel que: étagères, caisses de transport, boîtes, coffres à outils, armoires, bancs et tables de travail et autres articles de même nature.
  • Entretient, répare, et fabrique selon des plans ou croquis, des bases de béton et les supports propres à recevoir des équipements tels que : appareillage, escaliers, poteaux de clôture ou de signalisation.
  • Érige, modifie et démonte les échafaudages et les structures requises pour l'entretien et la réparation des bâtiments, des ouvrages de génie civil, de la machinerie et des équipements de bâtiments et de production.
  • Effectue l'entretien et les réparations ainsi que les réfections mineures des ouvrages de génie civil et des infrastructures des postes et centrales tels les terrains, clôtures, chemins d'accès…
  • Effectue toute opération de levage avec les équipements appropriés pour le déplacement et la manutention des pièces lourdes reliées à son travail.
  • Fabrique, installe, entretient, répare et modifie des estacades ou l'équivalent (ex: câbles de sûreté ou de sécurité) en utilisant l'équipement approprié.
  • Peut surveiller et aider à la formation des couverts de glace avec l'aide d'équipements spécialisés appropriés.
  • Obtient au besoin les autorisations de travail, selon les règles de sécurité.

.

  • Effectue au besoin l'entretien et la réparation d'outillage.
  • Manutentionne et transporte des matériaux et des équipements.
  • Conduit un véhicule et opère de la machinerie lourde.
  • Peut accomplir les tâches d'emplois de classe inférieure, lorsque requis.
  • Peut donner des premiers soins et la respiration artificielle; prend les mesures prévues en cas d'incendie en utilisant l'équipement requis.

 

N.B. : Dans les tâches ci-dessous ou dans la nature, s'il n'y a pas de chef d'équipe dans l'emploi, l'expression «chef d'équipe» est remplacée par supérieur immédiat lorsque cela s'applique.

 

Les tâches mentionnées reflètent les éléments caractéristiques de l'emploi identifié et ne doivent pas être considérées comme une énumération exhaustive de toutes les tâches reliées à l'emploi.

VOTRE PROFIL

 

  • Détenir un diplôme d’études professionnelles (DEP) dans l’une ou l’autre des (4) formations suivantes : Charpenterie-Menuiserie, Plomberie-Chauffage, Soudage-Montage, Mécanique industrielle de construction et d’entretien.
  • Être en mesure de lire les plans, devis et croquis relatifs aux tâches à effectuer.
  • Répondre aux exigences physiques relatives aux tâches à effectuer.
  • Être en mesure d’utiliser les différents outils informatiques de la fonction.
  • Avoir un permis de conduire du Québec de classe 5 et être mesure d'en obtenir un de classe appropriée si requis.
  • Avoir de la langue française une connaissance appropriée à la fonction.

 

 

N.B. : Les exigences normalisées de l’emploi sont celles en vigueur à ce moment-ci, mais la direction se réserve le privilège d’y apporter toutes modifications que les circonstances dicteront, le tout dans le respect du processus de normalisation des exigences d’emploi convenu avec le syndicat..

.

.

PARTICULARITÉS

  • Horaire de travail du lundi au jeudi, 37 heures par semaine. 
  • Avantages sociaux : vacances, assurances, régime de retraite.
  • Liste de rappel à la fin du contrat.
  • Au moment de postuler, veuillez joindre votre CV et votre diplôme.

Le candidat retenu fera l'objet d'une vérification administrative de sécurité.

Diplôme obtenu à l'extérieur du Canada : Nous exigeons l'évaluation comparative des études émise par le Ministère de l'Immigration, de la Francisation et de l’Intégration. Vous devez présenter le document officiel sur demande.

Pour que votre candidature à ce poste soit prise en considération, vous devez déposer votre candidature sur notre site emplois.

Hydro-Québec applique un programme d'accès à l’égalité et invite les femmes, les membres des minorités visibles et ethniques, les autochtones et les personnes handicapées à présenter leur candidature. Nous vous invitons à lire la déclaration de l'entreprise à cet égard. Nous communiquons uniquement avec les personnes retenues à la suite de l'analyse des dossiers.

title: General Labourer (Light Duty 12H)
description:
Seaside Paper is looking to hire a General Labourer to work our 12-hour shift. The GL is responsible for bundling products, packing products into cases, and putting cases onto a skid, as well as maintaining a clean work area.

Shift:
  • The 12-hour shift starts work at 6:30am and works until 6:30pm - No Graveyards no overnight.
  • Must be able to work alternate weekends (one-weekend work, the next weekend is 3-day-off weekend)
  • This is a full-time permanent position.

Skills and Requirements:
  • Legally entitled to work in Canada at the time of application. NO sponsorships are available.
  • Lifting is required. Repeatedly lift 25-30 pound boxes.
  • Lifting from the ground to waist level and back, as well as occasionally above waist level
  • Must be able to safely lift heavy boxes at a steady pace.
  • Good attention to detail.
  • Works well cooperatively with others.
  • Physically able to stand for extended periods
  • Reasonable English speaking and comprehension.
  • CSA-approved steel-toed boots are required.
  • Own transportation is recommended as Transit does not come reliably to our location.

Compensation:
  • $17 - $18 per hour depending on experience.

Candidates selected for an interview will be contacted by EMAIL. Please ensure to check that the email address you provide is correct. Please also check your & spam/junk folder to ensure you don't miss the interview invitation.

title: General Labourer (Packager)
description:
Company Description

Cratex Industries Ltd. is committed to a safe work environment for its employees from the enforcement of PPE to training and a recognized safety program.  Cratex is a shop environment for the production of wood packaging.

Job Description

Packagers at Cratex Industries Ltd. assist lead hands and supervisors in the daily operations of the company.  And will assist with the fabrication and assembly of wooden crates for the purpose of packaging materials being shipped to various locations both domestically and overseas.  They must work accurately following established procedures and promote a positive and safe attitude.

Qualifications

  • Must have good communication skills

  • A positive and safe attitude

  • Be motivated and work well with others

  • Be able to follow basic instructions and procedures

  • A willingness to learn and be involved in the required training

  • A natural respect for people, property and the environment

  • Must work safely and in compliance with the Occupational Health and Safety Act, Environmental and/or other pertinent regulations, including compliance with all Company policies and procedures. 
     
  • Must know the significant environmental aspects that apply to your job.


Additional Information

  • Competitive Wages
  • Excellent Benefits
  • Profit Share Program
  • Tuition Reimbursement
  • Company supplied PPE and Coveralls

title: Labourer
description:
We are hiring immediately for professional general labourers, pressure washers, softwash labourers, exterior cleaning staff to help us continue to grow.  Wake up each morning and actually want to come to this general labour job. No pressure washing or softwash experience necessary!.  Our general labour pros are trained and provide outstanding residential and small commercial pressure cleaning and softwashing service. Our softwashing teams clean exterior of houses, roofs, gutters, windows and more. We hire from the construction, roofing, contractor, concrete, softwashing, pressure washing, lawn care, lawn maintenance world and more!

If you are looking for a career and not just another job we may be a good fit for YOU!  The owners and managers support and appreciate our employees.  We provide an amazing company culture!  We work hard, but we have fun at the same time.
Compensation:
  • Vacation pay
  • Promotions are available
  • Bonus available for each job completed with no callbacks, production-based pay. So the more efficient you work the money you make
  • Weekly pay-  between $1,000-$1,5000 weekly.  We provide performance pay so the more efficient you clean the more you earn!
  • Tell us your goals and we’ll help you achieve them! 
Some Qualifications: 

  • Not afraid of heights and able to work alone at times moving and climbing ladders
  • Valid driver's license with a clean driving record

Please apply today so we can meet you.

title: Labourer
description:
Goals & Outcomes:
Effectively perform any combination of receiving, storing, and moving parts and equipment to assist the warehouse and service operations of Paramount.

Essential Functions:
  • Load and unload trucks and move items to assigned areas.
  • Loads/unloads equipment and moves items to assigned areas.
  • Completes all required paperwork in an accurate and timely manner.
  • Ability to maintain a valid forklift license issued by the Company.
  • Maintains a clean, sanitary and safe work area.
  • Follow all required work safe practices. This would include wearing all required PPE in designated areas, confined space safety, safe chemical handling, fall restraints, etc.
  • Duties are related to parking lot maintenance and repair.
  • Perform other duties as assigned.

Job Requirements:
  • High School Diploma or equivalent preferred.
  • 1-year experience required.
  • Must be able to lift and/or move up to 50 lbs and occasionally lift and/or move up to 100lbs, frequently lift and/or move above shoulder height, stand, walk, kneel.
  • Be able to effectively work in a team environment.
  • Effective verbal and written communication skills.
  • Familiarity with asphalt repair is a plus.
  • Valid Driver’s License (Class 3 license is a plus).
  • Must be able to pass all pre-employment screens (including drug, background, and criminal checks).

title: Labourer (6 Month Contract)
description:
Location



Edmonton - 204, 4212 Gateway Blvd. NW



Our Company




At Brookfield Properties, the foundation of our success is firmly rooted in our people.


Our company is comprised of experts across a range of specialties who share a goal of ensuring our properties are continuously evolving to meet the needs of our communities and stakeholders. To meet this goal, we hire visionary, entrepreneurial talent who help us innovate and enhance our business. We build collaborative teams who value integrity, creativity and diversity.


Our teams operate an iconic portfolio of irreplaceable properties within the world’s most dynamic markets. As one of the largest real estate services companies, we provide management and development expertise exclusively for properties owned by Brookfield Asset Management.




Job Description




Your Team


Reporting directly to the Site Manager, the Labourer (6 Month Contract) performs comprehensive housekeeping duties on the interior and exterior of homes to ensure home is clean and presentable at all times, the construction site is tidy and safe, and clear of debris and hazards.




Your Key Deliverables


Construction:

+ Collect and dispose of debris at construction sites complying with waste recycling programs

+ Performs scheduled cleaning activities in units under construction

+ Set up heat and hoarding, as required

+ Assist team members in miscellaneous tasks, if needed






Quality Control:

+ Ensure any excess materials are moved to the next site for use and the Site Manager is notified of the material count

+ Ensure garbage collection bins are used efficiently






Reporting:

+ Inform and report on Site Management Team on site conditions

+ Report any onsite safety concerns to immediate supervisor

+ Participate in safety inspection programs and training






Relationships:

+ Develop and build working relationship with managers, construction team and trades






Must Haves

+ 1+ year of construction experience and/or vocational training

+ Ability to work in a fast pace and physically demanding environment

+ Knowledge of multiple trades functions and use of tools

+ Effective customer service and communication skills

+ Ability to perform physical duties, to take directions, and to work in a team environment

+ Ability to work at various locations

+ Valid drivers license and vehicle




The position will include the following physical requirements:

+ Walk uneven terrain

+ Climb stairs

+ Lift/push/pull up to 100 pounds

+ Ability to hear for safety reasons- hearing aids are acceptable

+ Vision- 20/20 and is acceptable if they are wearing glasses or contacts

+ Crawl- maneuver through difficult areas

+ Kneel down

+ Climb up and down a ladder











We are proud to create a diverse environment and are proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We are grateful for your interest in this position, however, only candidates selected for pre-screening will be contacted.

title: General Labourer
description:
Are you a multi-talented individual capable of excellent performance in various areas? Are you organized and meticulous? This job might be for you! VG Meats is looking for a General Labourer (Meat Processing) in Simcoe, ON!

The General Labourer will be a mature individual who will demonstrate the necessary qualities to perform this position with attention to detail and organization. The general labourer will perform daily material handling/picking, processing, clean-up, and packaging duties. Develop your CAREER with VG Meats!

The benefits to working with VG Meats?

  • New programs to help staff progress in their career and hourly rate!
  • Some GL positions starting at $16/hr
  • 25% off employee discount
  • A growing company offering many learning experiences
  • We are a regenerative employer meaning that the organization continues to build a workplace that is good for its staff, producers, customers and communities.

What you will do as the General Labourer:

  • Organize, weigh, package, label products, and fulfil orders.
  • Feed and unload processing machines and assist machine operators with their duties.
  • Remove filled containers from conveyors and manually pack goods into bags, boxes or other containers.
  • Clean work areas and equipment - maintain food safety and housekeeping standards at all times.
  • Transport raw materials, finished products and packaging materials throughout the plant and warehouse manually, or with powered equipment.
  • Prepare skids and outgoing orders in preparation for deliveries and error-free shipments.
  • Receive and unload freight and validate all shipped and received materials.
  • Adhere to and abide by all Health and Safety rules, regulations and procedures.
  • Other duties as assigned

Requirements/Qualifications:

  • Ability to take direction
  • Ability to work in cold conditions
  • Good work ethic and organized
  • Excellent verbal communication skills
  • Strong attention to detail and accuracy
  • Ability to lift and carry up to 50 lbs

About VG Meats:

VG Meats is dedicated to producing high quality, healthy foods through sustainable farming practices. A fourth-generation family business, we produce tenderness tested beef, pork and pastured poultry that our customers love. We're looking for people who share our dedication and vision. Our areas of focus are regenerative farming practices, retailers, farmers, restaurants, distributors and institutions.

VG Meats is an equal opportunity employer and accommodation will be provided during the interviewing and hiring processes.

Job Type: Full-time

Please Note: Our recruitment team will send a Vervoe assessment to your email address listed as the next action in our hiring process. Further consideration requires the timely completion of the assessment.  

VGE

title: Skilled Labourer
description:
Company overview: Mazenga Building Group Ltd. is a Toronto-based construction management firm established to provide clients with an unmatched level of attention, care, and customized management style. Our team strives to streamline the construction management process to deliver exceptional client satisfaction.

Our Office in Toronto is looking for experienced Skilled Labourers to join their team for work at various job sites across the GTA including Oakville, Caledon, Brampton, and downtown Toronto.

Qualifications:

  • 2 years of carpentry experience preferred
  • Ability to read and interpret drawings
  • Strong rough and finished carpentry skills
  • Knowledge of building techniques
  • WHIMIS, Fall Arrest (Working at Heights), First Aid, and Propane certifications are an asset
  • Ability to work with other team members
  • Passion for building with career goals of progressing towards Assistant Site Supervisor
  • Passion for high-end projects
  • Must own a vehicle or have a means to commute to several job sites across the GTA including Oakville, Caledon, Brampton and downtown Toronto 

Responsibilities:

  • Assist Site Supervisor and other trades in completing projects
  • Skilled manual labour in construction, renovations or concrete work
  • Clean and perform preparation of work-site
  • Operate various hand and power tools to complete projects
  • Complete tasks as per work schedule meeting strict deadlines and standards
  • Other tasks as assigned including General Labour duties

title: Skilled Labourer
description:
Who We Are:
Nestled in the southwestern corner of Alberta, in the rugged and legendary Canadian Rockies, Castle is as authentic as it gets. Hard-working, hospitable, and here for the powder is what we’re all about. With less than 200 employees we’re a small, passionate team of winter enthusiasts. Here, we’re all family and you will quickly find you are right at home. If this sounds like you, then we want you to join us.

Our resort is not owned or operated by a large ski conglomerate; rather by a bunch of local skiers and riders who are passionate about steep terrain and great snow. Operational decisions are made here (head office = the basement of the day lodge) and our long-term direction is plotted by a group of passionate, volunteer directors who represent more than 200, predominately local shareholders.

More Info including staff perks can be found at: https://www.skicastle.ca/employment/

 Position Overview:
Work at Beautiful Castle Mountain Resort in southwest Alberta. There are plenty of opportunities to explore the area after work and on days off. Castle Mountain Resort is seeking a Skilled Labourer to join our close-knit Maintenance Team for the Summer season (May to October).

What we offer you:
  • Opportunity to work in the beautiful Southern Alberta Rocky Mountains
  • Small team environment
  • Varied work tasks
  • $16.39/hr starting wage
  • 40hr/ week. Schedule is a 4-on (10hr), 3-off schedule. Overtime may be required, based on operational need
  • Workdays are Mon-Thurs during summer (May-Oct) with occasional weekend or holiday work
  • Opportunity for winter employment for the right candidate
  • Discounted Castle Mountain Resort Season Pass for the 22-23 Ski Season
  • On resort Staff Accommodation may be available

What you will be doing:
  • Assist lift mechanics with yearly maintenance on ski lifts
  • Operate chair lifts and apply safety lockouts (training will be provided)
  • Cleaning and rebuilding of lift parts including sheaves and grips
  • Assist with other building or maintenance tasks on-hill as required
  • Assist with on-site events at the resort as required

Job Requirements:
  • Basic knowledge of hand tools
  • Class 5 driver’s license for parts pick up from the nearest town
  • Ability to lift 50lbs
  • Ability to work outside in all weather conditions performing physical labour

What you offer us:
  • Passion for the ski industry and culture
  • A sense of teamwork and community
  • Experience with general maintenance work
  • Ability to work independently while meeting job tasks
  • Solid judgment
  • Critical thinking skills

Hiring Process:
We are looking to fill the position right away. Candidates will be emailed if they are selected for an interview.
 
Where we are:
Castle Mountain Resort is located at the end of Highway 774, near Pincher Creek, AB. This is a remote work location with no mobile coverage or public transit. There is a communal living Staff Accommodation building on-site for new and returning staff. More information on our location and our resort can be found at skicastle.ca

title: General Labour
description:
Job Description

General Labour

Why join us?

SNC-Lavalin provides cutting-edge engineering solutions to projects in more than 100 countries around the world.  From the Canadian Arctic to the Southern African region, our multicultural workforce is driven by a fierce pride in their work and a pioneering vision.

SNC-Lavalin is truly a global pioneer in its field and has been chosen to design and build some of the most prestigious projects in the world.

SNC Lavalin's Operations and Maintenance is recognized as one of Canada’s leading outsourced operations and maintenance solutions experts, a division of SNC-Lavalin Group Inc.

Our team members across the country and the globe deliver unrivalled service to every one of our clients. Our people are vital to our success, and we build teams that are second to none. Our team embraces challenges and is engaged in working together to contribute to our business objectives.

We are currently hiring General Labour for Summer work to start in May 2022 and end in August 2022. This position is located in North Battleford, SK.

How will you contribute to the team?

Reporting to the Maintenance Team Lead, General Labour monitors and landscape the grounds surrounding buildings and businesses.

  • Planting, mowing, and ground maintenance as necessary.
  • Prune and care for plants, shrubs, trees, and lawns within the gardens.
  • Landscaping, mowing, weeds, watering, landscaping repairs, etc.
  • Garbage and debris pickup and ensuring the site appearance is well maintained.
  • Operate the necessary equipment to maintain landscaped areas, such as lawn mowers, trimmers, and leaf blowers.
  • This is an outdoor job that takes place in all weather.
  • A Criminal Record check and Vulnerability Check will be required.

What will you contribute?

  • High School Diploma.
  • Ability to carry out physically demanding tasks.
  • Ability to work unsupervised.
  • Ability to work outdoors in all weather conditions.
  • Strong interpersonal skills.
  • Class 5 Driver's License is required.

What we offer at SNC-Lavalin:

At SNC-Lavalin, you will enjoy competitive compensation, a safe and healthy work environment.


You think that a career in our team could match your profile, submit your application online now!

**************************

The masculine gender is used only to simplify the wording.

At SNC-Lavalin, we seek to hire individuals with diverse characteristics, backgrounds, and perspectives. We strongly believe that world-class talent makes no distinctions based on gender, ethnic or national origin, sexual identity and orientation, age, religion, or disability, but enriches itself through these differences.  

SNC-Lavalin cares about your privacy. SNC-Lavalin and other subsidiary or affiliated companies of SNC-Lavalin (referred to throughout as “SNC-Lavalin”) are committed to protecting your privacy. Please consult our Privacy Notice  on our Careers site to know more about how we collect, use and transfer your Personal Data.

By submitting your personal information to SNC-Lavalin, you confirm that you have read and accept our Privacy Notice.

Founded in 1911, SNC-Lavalin is a fully integrated professional services and project management company with offices around the world dedicated to engineering a better future for our planet and its people. We create sustainable solutions that connect people, technology, and data to design, deliver and operate the most complex projects. We deploy global capabilities locally to our clients and deliver unique end-to-end services across the whole life cycle of an asset including consulting, advisory & environmental services, intelligent networks & cybersecurity, design & engineering, procurement, project & construction management, operations & maintenance, decommissioning and capital. – and delivered to clients in key strategic sectors such as Engineering Services, Nuclear, Operations & Maintenance and Capital. News and information are available atsnclavalin.comor follow us onLinkedInandTwitter.

Worker Type

Employee

Job Type

Student (Fixed Term)

At SNC-Lavalin, we seek to hire individuals with diverse characteristics, backgrounds and perspectives. We strongly believe that world-class talent makes no distinctions based on gender, ethnic or national origin, sexual identity and orientation, age, religion or disability, but enriches itself through these differences.  

SNC-Lavalin cares about your privacy. SNC-Lavalin and other subsidiary or affiliated companies of SNC-Lavalin (referred to throughout as “SNC-Lavalin”) are committed to protecting your privacy. Please consult our Privacy Notice  on our Careers siteto know more about how we collect, use and transfer your Personal Data.

By submitting your personal information to SNC-Lavalin, you confirm that you have read and accept our Privacy Notice.
