title: General Labourer
description:
Company Description

Gentek is a leading manufacturer and distributor of vinyl/aluminum siding and windows and other exterior home improvement products. With 3 manufacturing facilities and 22 distribution branches in Canada we are well-positioned to provide our customers with the best products and a superior service experience.

At Gentek Building Products, we’ve made a commitment to our customers that they can rely on us to provide the quality exterior home improvement products they need. But that’s not enough. For us to be considered as their business partner, we know we also need to ensure that every transaction with us, at every point of contact, equates to a superior service experience, and that’s where our great employees come in. 

Maybe you are just the person to join our team? Keep reading!

Job Description

We are looking for General Labourers to join the team at our unionized vinyl siding manufacturing facility in Burlington, Ontario!

Must be able and willing to work required weekly rotating shifts: Days (8am - 4pm), Afternoons (4pm - 12am), and Nights (12am - 8am).

Primary Duties:
•    Pack finished product on extrusion lines
•    Monitor and check product quality
•    Responsible for all aspects of product packaging, including making boxes, crating, labeling, identification and reporting

Details:
•    $22.16/hour to start with a $1.00/hr increase after 9 months as per Collective Bargaining Agreement, plus $0.75/hr premium when working the afternoon shift and $1.00/hr premium when working the night shift
•    Full-time, 40 hours/week
•    Physically demanding job: Position requires standing and walking for prolonged periods of time, pushing, pulling, bending, twisting and lifting up to 50 lbs regularly
•    Personal Protective Equipment must be worn as assigned by the Company including but not limited to safety glasses, steel-toed safety shoes and hearing protection
•    Great benefits with 100% company paid premiums and pension plan with 100% employer contributions!!!

Qualifications

•    High school diploma or equivalent
•    Previous production experience in a fast paced manufacturing environment an asset
•    Ability to multitask, work under pressure and work flexible hours when required



Additional Information

We're growing - come grow with us! If you are qualified, please apply with your resume describing your experience. If your qualifications are a match, you will be contacted.

Accommodations for job applicants with disabilities are available upon request.

Duties: All aspects of a custom soil packaging facility - filling and stacking bags of soil.

Qualifications:
  • Forklift and skid steer experience is an asset but not a requirement.  
  • Must work well in a team setting and have your own transportation.

We offer a Full Benefits Package and competitive wages based on experience.

title: General Labour - Dough Dumper Morning Shift-1307
description:
Are you a â€œfoodieâ€ and love cookies, muffins and pancakes?  Are you are looking for a company where we place high value on teamwork, collaboration, innovation?  Are you looking to gain experience and grow your career with a successful international company?

If you are looking to do the best work of your career, be a part of an extraordinary company and have a passion for what we do, we want to hear from you!

Cerelia Bakery Canada is currently looking to add some awesome new team members to our facility in Mississauga, ON. You will be a critical part of delivering our products to customers everywhere!

About Cerelia Bakery Canada:

We develop and produce exceptionally high-quality products including: Fresh & frozen cookie dough and muffin batter in pre-portion sizes and scoop and bake pails for the foodservice industry as well as in-store bakeries of North American grocery, mass and club stores.

Our baked gourmet cookies and muffins are produced for distribution through multiple channels, including quick service restaurants. Refrigerated products including cookie, pastry and biscuit dough sold to North American Grocery Stores in a variety of formats including canister, chub, break-and-bake and place-and-bake.

Our Research and Development is on-going, aimed at introducing new and exciting products to complement our delectable bakery lines. We are an aggressive, flexible company dedicated to providing quality products that satisfy customer needs and market place demands.

Most importantly, we are GROWING.  As we grow, our team members grow with us.  

About this Position:

The Dough Dumper is responsible in ensuring seamless processing of product mixes/dough. The Dough Dumper understands the impact of this position as it directly effects the whole process of our products being made as it is one the first and most important steps in the plant. The Dough Dumper must ensure seamless processing of products. Responsible for the maintenance of prescribed quantity and quality of dough produced and operation of the mixer machine. The Dough Dumper must be prepared to work as a team member and with minimal supervision, follow all safety and food safety procedures, and have a high threshold for heat in a manufacturing environment. 

Responsibilities (including but not limited to):

  • Follow the mixing schedule as required and laid out by the Production Supervisor.
  • Gather, measure, and mix dough ingredients per the quality guidelines using our dedicated mixing machine to be transferred into our dough cutter.
  • Transport dough buggies from one location to the other whenever required.
  • Float from one production station to another effortlessly to ensure product quality standards are maintained.
  • Manage product quality and recipes with other production team members.
  • Ensure our high-quality standards are being met with every batch we produce by checking each batch for quality and accuracy - delivering a world class finished product each time.
  • Support other departments and functions of production as required.
  • Assist sanitation with the cleanliness of production equipment and floor.
  • Adhering to all policies, procedures and programs of the company (GMP, Quality, Food Safety and Health & Safety etc) at all times.
  • Other related duties and assigned.

Working Conditions:

  • Weekend work required
  • Overtime as required
  • Ability to lift at least 50 lbs
  • Fast paced environment
  • Physical Demands: Bend, Carry, Lift, Push/Pull, Reach, Standing for long periods
  • Ability to work in a hot/cold environment. 
  • Shift 6:00 am to 2:30 pm 
  • Hourly Wage CAD 17/Guaranteed Overtime 

What you will receive in return:

  • Competitive Hourly Compensation.
  • Fully Employer Paid Medical Insurance includes Dental & Vision.
  • Life Insurance
  • 2 Weeks Paid Vacation.
  • RRSP
  • Comprehensive training program, tailored to each individual - regardless if you're a food manufacturing veteran or new to the industry, we will ensure you receive the training you need to succeed.
  • Clean and safe production facility.
  • Career advancement opportunities.

Cerelia Bakery welcomes and encourages applications from people with disabilities. Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process.

If you are eager and excited to work with a company driven by quality, commitment to excellence, and an awesome product, we want to hear from you!

title: General Labourer
description:
Business Unit Overview:

At Post Consumer Brands, we have more than 125 years of experience making the breakfast cereals that people love.  And even after a century, weâ€™re still innovating. We are driven by our mission to Make Better Happen â€“ and we want YOU to join our team!

Brand:

With names like Pebbles, Honey Bunches of Oats, Great Grains, and Malt-O-Meal in our portfolio, weâ€™ve earned more spots in the top 50 best-selling brands than any other cereal company. And as the third-ranked company in the cereal category, our business is growing. Thatâ€™s where you come in. Our company is a hearty mix of ambitious people who want to make great things happen. And weâ€™re always looking for more.

Location Description:

Post Consumer Brands in Cobourg, Ontario is home to more than 140 team members and produces the majority of the company's Non-GMO Project Verified and organic products. Cobourg's historic downtown is just a short trip from the plant, perfect for an after-work walk on the towns many pathways and beautiful parks. At Post, you'll not only be a part of a collaborative manufacturing team, but also the community, with the opportunity to participate in a variety of volunteer activities throughout the year.

Responsibilities:

Overview  

As a general labourer you are expected to assist the production floor by supporting line operators.

 

You will be scheduled for 40 hours per week Monday to Friday and included into our MAD shift rotation: Midnights 11:00pm â€“ 7:00am, Afternoons 3:00pm â€“ 11:00pm, Days 7:00am â€“ 3:00pm, with the possibility for overtime, as per the Collective Agreement.

  • Performs all duties in a safe manner, reports unsafe conditions to the immediate shift supervisor
  • Perform sweeping, mopping, vacuuming, waste removal, chemical application for cleaning and sanitizing, operating floor cleaning equipment, working at heights, lifting devices,
  • Maintain a clean workstation at all times
  • Move skids via a hand pump jack
  • Sack Tipping (Pouring Ingredients into mixer)
  • Make minor ingredient mixtures
  • Utilize a scanner to track all mixes
  • Make totes
  • Performs duties requiring some heaving lifting, walking, climbing and height work
  • Maintains the organization and inventory maintenance of all necessary cleaning supplies and equipment.
  • Monitors and maintains recycle, garbage and food waste systems in plant.
  • Perform other duties as assigned.
Qualifications:
  • High School Diploma, GED, or significant relevant experience
  • Production experience is an asset but not necessary
  • Ability to apply basic mathematical skills

title: General Labourer (FT)
description:
The successful candidates will join our team and be responsible for loading and/or unloading and inspection of steel parts from a powder paint line. Starting wages are $18/hour. Upon completion of the 3-month probationary period, benefits will begin.

Responsibilities:
  • Load customer material onto a continuous powder coating line.
  • Unload/inspect painted product ensuring customer requirements are met.
  • Package material for shipment.
  • Ensure the highest degree of quality is shown towards our customers' material.
  • Reports any issues as noted.
  • Utilizes continuous improvement mindset and assists in identifying opportunities to improve processes.
  • Follows good practices and required work safe practices.
  • Maintains a clean, sanitary, and safe work area.
  • Performs other duties as needed.

Day shift - Monday - Friday, 7:30 a.m - 4:00 p.m. Please email resumes with references.

title: Tunneling Labourer AB
description:
We are a growing tunneling contractor based in Calgary, AB that offers its employees exciting opportunities for career growth, a great working environment, and competitive compensation.

The Company: Bothar Inc. specializes in trenchless tunneling technologies, balancing cost-effective drilling solutions with environmental protection. Our trenchless tunneling technology, Direct Pipe, presents unique cost saving and scheduling opportunities for challenging pipeline and municipal projects.

Bothar is respected in the trenchless contracting industry by clients and employees alike, for our integrity, commitment to excellence, and customer orientated service.

Our great team of staff are the best in their field. They are committed to collaboration, quality, and safety. We invest in our people, and they deliver excellence! We believe in leading through innovation and providing superior value and service to our clients and partners by with safe, high quality, and environmentally conscious trenchless solutions.

The Position: As we are expanding our field of operations, we are in need of more motivated and hardworking crew members to join our team. The Labourer position is responsible for assisting in the timely and technical execution of installations, as a part of the operations team on project sites. 

Labourers will have the opportunity to work with equipment used in Micro Tunneling, Horizontal Direction Drilling (HDD), Auger Boring, and Direct Pipe trenchless installations. 

Opportunities are currently available at various project locations across BC and Alberta. 

Compensation includes:

  •    Equitable pay based on experience
  •    Applicable overtime
  •    Living out allowance or paid accommodations
  •    Travel expense coverage

Essential Duties and Responsibilities

  •  Maintain cleanliness / organization / stock of parts container and tool container
  •  Remove/Install cables on spools during de mob / mob.
  •  Efficiently pull and install tunneling utility lines (electrical cables, slurry lines, hydraulics)
  •  Effectively connect / install victaulic clamps and hydraulic connections
  •  Rig, hoist, and direct lifting equipment
  •  Load and unload trucks
  •  Maintain, clean, and refurbish equipment
  •  Effectively pack and secure pallets / boxes / cages
  •  Connect internal and external brackets for utility lines
  •  Inspect, connect, and install airlines
  •  Apply condat grease on machine connections
  •  Fill out required paperwork, such as Field Level Hazard Assessments, HID cards.
  •  Knowledge & ability to operate air compressor, pumps, arial lift, generators etc.

Technical Skills and Knowledge

  •  Basic mechanical/electrical skills
  •  Operate power / hand tools safely and with skill
  •  The ability to determine the necessary tools for assigned tasks
  •  The ability to troubleshoot a problem based on experience and applicable trade knowledge
  •  Good work ethic, ability to work long hours (12-hour shift work)
  •  Able to work in confined spaces
  •  Clearly spot vehicles and equipment, and communicate using basic hand signals
  •  Understand use of and clearly communicate on two-way radios.
  •  Identify lifting points on equipment, able to safely rig equipment / pipe for lifting
  •  Previous experience in tunneling, general construction, or oil field work
  •  Contribute to a safe working environment
  • Travel may be required subject to project locations

Successful candidates will be required to have the following safety tickets ( training is available);

  • WHIMIS, First Aid, CSTS or PCST, Confined Space Entry and Rescue, Fall Arrest / Fall Protection
  • Drug and Alcohol clearance

Other Relevant Information        

    • Travel is required in this position. 
    • While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to sit and walk; use hands and fingers to handle, or feel; reach with hands and arms; talk, and hear.
    • Frequently required to lift and/or move up to 50 lbs.
    • Distance vision, peripheral vision, depth perception, and the ability to adjust focus
    • Employee will be required to work in outdoor weather conditions, including extreme cold and heat
    • Required to work in confined spaces (42-inch or 46-inch pipe)
    • Covid 19 Vaccination Required


    Bothar is an equal opportunity employer, and is committed to providing an equitable, diverse and inclusive workplace where all employees, whatever their gender, race, ethnicity, national origin, age, sexual orientation or identity, education, and/or disability, feel valued and respected. 

    While we appreciate all applications, only those who are selected will be contacted.

title: Labourer
description:
Brock Canada Industrial is seeking Labourers to work in the Scaffold Yard, located in Nisku, Alberta. The hours of work will be Monday to Friday, 7:00 a.m. - 5:30 p.m. daily.

Previous labouring experience considered an asset.
Reliable transportation is required.

title: Labourer
description:
At EVRAZ, our strength starts with our people! As a team we collaborate to solve problems, contribute ideas and challenge each other to ensure growth and ultimately success for the business and our employees.

Job Description and Responsibilities

GenAlta has an immediate opening for a laborer for the Ferrous / Non-Ferrous material streams at our Edmonton location. The laborer will report to the Assistant Operations Manager. Hours of operation will be 6:00 am - 4:00 pm, Monday to Friday. Additional overtime including weekends can also be scheduled in.

  • Observe/Practice all company safety rules and policies

  • Ability to multi task in a progressive environment

  • Mechanically inclined

  • Responsible for lubrication and general cleanup

  • Work closely with loader operator while loading containers

  • Work in the picker shack as well as the non-ferrous separation building

  • Monitor flow of product from a raw material state through to the finished product

  • Able to operate the Skid steer

  • Able to use a torch for general cutting purposes

Requirements

  • Previous work experience in a manufacturing, production, or similar scrap-yard/auto part environment will be considered an asset

  • Able to meet the physical demands of the position including standing, walking, sitting, climbing, crawling, kneeling, bending, moderate to heavy lifting and pushing and pulling up to 50 pounds throughout the day

  • Able to communicate clearly

  • Willing to assist / support with labor duties in other areas of the plant

  • Willing and able to work in variable weather conditions including hot, dry summer conditions and cold, harsh winter conditions

  • Willingness to learn and work responsibly following all safety procedures

  • A proven history of reliability

  • Mentally alert to surroundings

  • Good attention to detail and quality control

This is a unionized position with a 3 month probationary period.

The successful candidate will be asked to undergo a Fitness to Work & Alcohol & Drug test upon a conditional offer of employment being extended.

Our total compensation package includes amazing benefits!

  • Competitive wages and bonus opportunities
  • Family medical, dental, and prescription coverage at minimal employee cost
  • Short and long term disability programs
  • Competitive retirement plans
  • Paid vacations and statutory holidays
  • Apprenticeship and career advancement within the company
  • Tuition reimbursement

All applicants must be eligible to work in Canada without sponsorship.

While we thank all those who apply, only those being actively considered for employment will be contacted.

Equal Opportunity Employer

EVRAZ North America is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability, or protected Veteran status.

 

EVRAZ North America is committed to working with and providing reasonable accommodation to individuals with physical and mental disabilities.

If you need special assistance or an accommodation while seeking employment, please e-mail

careers@evrazna.com

or call: (312) 533-3577. We will make a determination on your request for reasonable accommodation on a case-by-case basis.

Join a team that manufactures excellence, drives success and builds careers!

title: General Laborer
description:
We believe in rising to a challenge, creating a vision, and providing a solution. We believe in dedication, hard work, and a job well done. We believe in superior service, strong relationships and building lasting impressions. Who are we? We are EFCO.

At EFCO, we believe in helping those responsible for the construction of the world's concrete structures with a safe, reliable, and cost efficient concrete formwork solution. We do this by engineering, designing, manufacturing, supplying and field servicing forming and shoring products for concrete construction. Our Core Values represent the manner in which we expect to do business with our customers and interact with those people around us in the business community. At EFCO, our core values are at the very heart of who we are and what we believe. Quality. Innovation. Integrity. Super Service. These 4 Core Values describe very high standards of professional behavior that all EFCO employees must seek to achieve.

DUTIES

This position will perform various hands-on tasks which may include preparing concrete forms for painting, moving and stacking parts, operating banding and material handling equipment, and performing other manual tasks as assigned by supervision.

QUALIFICATIONS

Qualified candidates will possess a High school diploma or equivalent and have the ability to read imperial and metric tape measurements. Preferred candidates will have experience with the following tools: grinders, air chippers, air impact wrench, various wrenches, material handling equipment, banding equipment, overhead crane, and forklifts.

title: General Labourer (Seasonal)
description:
General Labourer (Seasonal)

Amberley, ON

Join our team that shares your Passion & Heart for Canadian agriculture! Parrish & Heimbecker, Limited (P&H) has an opportunity for a motivated, forward-thinking, and dedicated individual as a General Labourer based in Amberley, Ontario.

Work and grow with a family-owned company.

Join our team with Purpose & History! P&Hâ€™s roots go back over 110 years. We have always been a Canadian, family-owned and managed agri-business that understands the qualities and conditions needed for meaningful growth. Our corporate culture values are family values; honesty and integrity with a focus on listening and continuous learning. Like family, we support our staff to always do better.

With over 70 locations spanning from coast to coast, and trade links around the globe, P&H is growth-oriented, diversified and vertically integrated with operations spanning across grain merchandising, flour milling, crop input distribution and animal feed production.

Skills and experience for the next step in your career.

As General Labourer, the successful candidate will be responsible for daily tasks within the grain elevator.

Your day to day activities will include:

  • Warehouse operations: sorting seed, stacking chemicals on shelves, decanting bulk product into totes
  • Work with customers to process and load their orders
  • Unloading trucks
  • Preparing custom application equipment by loading and unloading sprayer trailer and prepping chemical for the next dayâ€™s work
  • Maintain a safe and clean warehouse environment
  • Responsible for ensuring proper shipping and receiving documentation prior to handling product

The successful candidate should enter the position with the following qualifications:

  • Previous general labourer experience
  • Valid driverâ€™s license with a good driving record
  • Experience working in a grain elevator or farm is an asset
  • Experience with forklift and warehouse equipment is an asset

To apply and learn more visit us atwww.pandhcareers.com

We thank all applicants, but only those selected for an interview will be contacted.

P&H is committed to building a skilled and diverse workforce that is reflective of Canadian society. As a result, Parrish & Heimbecker, Limited is an equal opportunity employer and is in compliance with the Employment Equity Act. We welcome applications from women, aboriginal people, people with disabilities and members of visible minorities. Accommodations in relation to the job selection process are available upon request.

title: Labourer
description:
ROLE
The Labourer is responsible for performing general construction activities.

KEY RESPONSIBILITIES
  • Perform various general construction activities such as:
    • Set up and install trench boxes.
    • Erect and take down skid piles.
    • Erect fencing (t-posts and snow fencing).
    • Assist with stringing activities.
    • Assist with lowering in activities.
    • Manual material handling.
    • Operate hand and power tools.
    • Clean and prepare sites.
    • Unload and set up traffic controls and safety equipment.
    • Perform spotting for various types of equipment as well as overhead powerlines.
Note: In addition to these duties personnel are required to carry out such other duties as may be reasonably required in order to support the objectives of the company.

POSITION REQUIREMENTS
Qualifications
  • Various safety tickets/certificates as required depending on project.
Experience
  • Previous work experience in the pipeline construction industry would be an asset.
Skills and Knowledge
  • Knowledge of pipeline construction industry is considered an asset.
  • Knowledge of workplace safety requirements and procedures.
  • Knowledge of handling hazardous materials and industry waste.
  • Good vision and hand-eye coordination.
  • Physically able to lift and handle heavy objects.
  • Manual dexterity.

WORKING CONDITIONS
This position is field based and often works within remote project locations. Travel and/or living in temporary accommodations is required.
 
REPORTING RELATIONSHIPS
The Labourer reports to the Foreman of the crew. The position has no supervisory duties.

 We thank all applicants in advance. Only those selected for an interview will be contacted.

title: General Labourer
description:
ServiceMaster Restore of Winnipeg remediates properties damaged by water, fire, mould, etc. We are looking for general labourers to join our team. We offer a competitive salary, a company-paid benefits package to qualifying employees, and the opportunity for ongoing professional training.
 
JOB DESCRIPTION
Work as a team member to complete the tasks set out on work orders including but not limited to:
  • Stabilize damaged properties in emergency situations
  • Clean up and demolition of affected building materials
  • Packing out & moving contents as needed
  • Clean residential and commercial properties damaged by water and fire, etc.
  • Participate in on-call rotation
 
REQUIREMENTS
  • General labour experience
  • Capable of carrying at least 50lbs
  • Willing to travel out of town for work when required
  • Criminal record search upon hire 
  • Current valid driver’s license
 
ASSETS
  • Construction & demolition knowledge 
  • Ownership of basic hand tools
  • Restoration experience
  • Construction experience
  • First Aid Certification
 Pay based on experience.  Please attach resume when responding to ad.




    About ServiceMaster Restore of Winnipeg:

    As a top Emergency Restoration company in Manitoba, we specialize in the remediation and rebuild of properties damaged by water, fire, title claims, mould, plus much more.

title: Labourer
description:
Looking for a challenge this summer? Join our hard working team in transforming the homes of our
community! We are looking for team players who are driven, results oriented, and eager to make their
mark this summer. We provide high quality home services such as lawn care & painting/staining services
for both Interior and Exterior projects!
 
We are committed to transforming the homes of our local residential communities and leaving our
homeowners in AWE of the transformation. We are offering both full time and part time general labour
positions to the most motivated, coachable individuals to join our business. Looking to hire skilled
labourers who like working outside and motivated to do an incredible job.
 
Requirements:
Preferably some experience with hands-on work (no professional experience necessary),
you will be trained on how to take care of lawns & paint/stain projects and will be a pro in
no time!
Must have own car or reliable transportation
Positive attitude
Reliable and hardworking
Strong communication skills
Coachable
 
Responsibilities:
·        Responsible for the overall completion of projects. Start to finish completion at a high
standard of quality, and in a timely manner
·        Maintain a clean and organized site and project
·        Delivering quality and satisfaction through constant communication with homeowners, crew
chiefs and business owner

·        Drop off flyers and market door-to-door in neighbourhood around work site
 
Compensation: 
·        - $15-$18/hr depending on experience and responsibility
·        - Opportunities for increased responsibilities and leadership positions
 
Benefits: 
·        Bonus incentives/opportunities for advancement
·        Improve communication skills
·        Get to work outside
·        Opportunities to learn the ins and outs of the business from a management level directly
from the business owner
·        Meet and work with amazing people!
 
Resumes should be sent ASAP as positions are filling up quickly.

title: Part-time Labourer
description:
We are looking for a motivated individual to join our spring/summer team! We are looking for a hard-working motivated individual who wants to be apart of a very tight-knit group of awesome people. The position would be part-time with the option of doing more full-time work if desired. Therefore, can work around your busy schedule.  

About the position:

  • Work outdoors!!
  • Pressure Washing exterior of homes, decks and fences
  • Fast paced, fun environment
  • You would carry a pressure washer and hose from job-to-job so a large enough vehicle is required
  • Training is provided; therefore, no experience is necessary!
  • Compensation is paid hourly

title: General Labourer (Contract)
description:
Who We’re Looking for:
IMI is looking for someone who’s self-motivated and result-oriented for upcoming contracts as a General Laborer.

We’re hoping you are someone who has a willingness to accept instruction and a variety of new tasks with a positive attitude. With that being said, we hope that most importantly, you have a high degree of safety awareness.

Experience/Education:
  • The right candidate for this position must have verification of their high school diploma or GED, as well as six months of experience in construction or in a warehouse.

If you suit the above, you could be responsible for:
  • Cleanup of debris.
  • Sweeping/ lifting/ loading and unloading materials.
  • Required lifting boxes up to 100 lbs.
Worksites can be dangerous, so in order to ensure your safety at all times, we require you always possess a hard hat, steel-toe boots, work gloves, safety vests, and work goggles.

Due to the many responsibilities we are tasking our employees with, we ask they have some or all of the following:
  • Hardhat.
  • Safety Vest.
  • Steel-toed work boots.
  • Work gloves.
  • Safety glasses.
  • Mask.

Additional Job Details: 
  • Work Location: Vaughan, ON.
  • Contract Length: TBD *end dates are subject to change.
  • Benefits Offered: Health insurance, Dental insurance, other types of insurance.
  • Temporary Full-time/ Overtime Opportunity: Yes.
  • Pay Frequency: Weekly.

Who We Are:
Founded in 1998, IMI is the largest installation resource company in North America, delivering technical resources and solutions to the supply chain industry. Offering turnkey installation talent and OEM product deployment in fields such as manufacturing, supply chain, automation, and robotics.

IMI has qualified, trained, and deployed thousands of technicians throughout North America and has worked with some of the world’s most progressive Fortune 500 companies for over 20 years. For more information, visit imipeople.com.


About IMI – A Global People Company:

Providing Technical Resources & Solutions to the Supply Chain Industry.For over 20 years, IMI has provided people with amazing careers with the world's best companies. As an IMI technician you will be an integral part of building North America's constantly evolving supply chain network. From conveyor systems, to automation technology to robotics systems. IMI is hiring at all times, at all levels:General LaborersMillwrightsMechanical Conveyor InstallersSite SupervisorsElectriciansAutomation Field TechnciansAnd many others!

title: Skilled Construction Worker
description:
Are you looking for a job where you can put your physical strength, stamina, and team-player attitude to work for you? Our growing company is looking for an experienced construction worker to help us complete tasks correctly and on time. Previous job-site experience is required, working knowledge of both Architectural and Structural drawings is a must, and an understanding of construction methods, tools, and equipment. You’ll work with a close-knit team of other skilled laborers and tradesmen to bring construction plans to life. If you have a strong work ethic, a good track record of attendance and punctuality, looking to help lead a team and are ready to take your construction skills to the next level, please apply today!

Compensation:

$30 - $35 per hour

Responsibilities:
  • Run hand tools, power tools, and heavy equipment such as survey equipment, jackhammers, and forklifts as required
  • Follow all directions of the construction manager, and work with other team members to complete construction projects accurately
  • Support craft workers (painters, electricians, carpenters, roofers, plasterers), sub-contractors, and other tradesmen as needed
  • Transfer, carry, and unload tools and building materials such as sheetrock, lumber, tile, saws, grout, etc.
  • Dismantle old structures, and build temporary structures such as signs, cones, barricades, ramps, and other devices to control traffic around the construction site
Qualifications:
  • Experience working on a construction site, understanding of blueprints and construction plans, and knowledge of construction tools, methods, and equipment is required
  • This position relies on physical strength and stamina
  • Able to work in inclement weather like extreme temperatures, rain, etc.
  • Solid mechanical skills are needed, as are good eye-hand coordination and depth perception
  • Own a valid driver's license
  • High school diploma or equivalent is required - Associate’s degree, trade certification, and/or completed apprenticeship program is highly preferred
About Company

North Built Construction is a general contracting company that specializes in renovation, remodels, new construction, and out-of-the-ordinary projects. We are looking to expand our company to be able to take on bigger projects. We would like the help of energetic and self-motivated people that are interested in learning about new and innovative ways to expand their building knowledge and building practices while being ahead of the step program curve.

title: General Labour
description:
Job Summary

The General Labourer is responsible for the housekeeping of Plant 1, Plant 2, Plant 3 (as required). This individual will comply with provincial and federal legislation, company and health & safety policies and ISO quality program and procedures.

Full Time and Student positions available.

Education and Experience

â€¢ Experience working in a factory environment in a similar role will be considered an asset â€¢ Familiar with safe use and handling of cleaning equipment and supplies Required Knowledge, Skills and Abilities â€¢ Ability to work independently with minimal supervision â€¢ Capable of problem-solving â€¢ Time management skills with the ability to prioritize tasks â€¢ Ability to adapt and welcome change in a positive manner â€¢ Capable of operating heavy equipment such as a forklift and crane

title: General Labourer
description:
The 401 Group of Companies, is proud to be recognized as one of Canada's fastest growing dealer groups offering a full line of automotive, recreational vehicle, powersport and marine products and services. The 401 Group of Companies has 20+ locations across Ontario including the Blackshop Restaurant and Wine Bar as well as our headquarters, both located in the thriving city of Cambridge, Ontario. Our brands include but aren't limited to Kia, Mitsubishi, Volkswagen, Hyundai, Yamaha, 401 Auto Financing, CampMart and Grand River Boats. If you have a growth mindset like us, we'd love to see your resume and have a conversation. The opportunities at the 401 Group of Companies are endless!


Location: 1367 Industrial Road, Cambridge


Hours: Monday to Friday 8 am to 5 pm 


Role and Responsibilities:

    • Assist RV techs to repair and prepare RVs for clients to go camping
    • Desire and capability to fix it right the first time
    • Ability and skills to use various tools and perform repairs
    • Perform miscellaneous job-related duties as assigned by Supervisor
    • Re-parks cars, following sales, to maximize the use of space and maintain lot in order
    • May be required to do some detailing (including but not limited to - washing vehicles, fueling and changing plates, etc.)
    • Work without constant supervision
    • Ability to follow all Health and Safety guidelines
    • Other ad-hoc duties as assigned


    Qualifications and Skills:

    • Carpentry, Plumbing, Electricity, Mechanic, Trim and Detail experience is all relevant!
    • Above Average technical skills
    • Valid G Driver’s License with a clean driver’s abstract
    • High School Diploma or equivalent
    • Positive Teamwork Attitude


    The 401 Group of Companies is an equal opportunity employer and we are pleased to accommodate individual needs within our recruitment process. Please speak with our HR department should you require any accommodation.

title: Labourer – Sawmill / Journalier(ère), Scierie
description:
ROLE:
  • Work within a team to perform a variety of manual duties and tasks throughout the site, specifically in entry-level positions.
  • Based on qualifications, experience and needs, you could become one of the three Entry Level Production Workers in the following Departments: Paper Mill or  Newsprint.
  • You need to be safety-conscious, energetic, and able to understand your role in our team.

REQUIREMENTS: What you bring to our workplace

Education: Secondary School Diploma:

  • Grade 12 mathematics and Grade 12 English or French course.
  • Post-secondary courses will also be recognized. (course code must start with M for Math and E for English/F for French)

Experience:
  • Labour experience is an asset.

Testing:
  • Successful results in a General Aptitude Test is a condition of employment.

CONDITIONS:
  • Wages vary by department
    • News Mill: $26.92/hr (90% for the first 1,000 hrs – $24.23)
    • Paper Mill: $26.70/hr (80% progression program to start – $21.36)
  • Shift work required: 8- or 12-hour shifts, including days, evenings and nights.

COMMITMENTS:
  • Live up to our values, principles, and guidelines.
  • Bring an open and cooperative attitude to your job, contributing to our positive work environment.
  • Comply with all health, safety and environmental standards, applicable regulations, and laws, as well as our collective agreement.

SETTING & LIFESTYLE: What to expect at the site and in the region
  • GFFP Kapuskasing operations include the newsprint mill with some 350 employees, a sawmill with 125 employees, and a forest management operation with 100 employees.
  • Planned as a model town, Kapuskasing is a bilingual community with a population of close to 10,000 that serves several smaller nearby communities.
  • Housing costs in Kapuskasing are about a third of the Ontario average, and the area boasts good schools and health care.
  • The area appeals to outdoor enthusiasts and offers many recreational activities – especially boating, fishing, and hunting.

NOTE:
  • Please note that applicants will be required to submit a copy of their transcripts, as proof of the minimum education requirement.
  • Proof of the language and Math requirements must be provided prior to any potential offer.

Please submit your resume to: careers@greenfirst.ca

Please note that only applicants selected for an interview will be contacted.

Please quote Labourer - (Location Applied) - BETTER in the subject line of your application.

title: Labourer I Calgary, AB
description:
Who We Are

We are the largest supplier and manufacturer of solid wood and composite moulding in North America. At Metrie, we pride ourselves on our commitment to our team members! We like to have fun and we pride in our mission to turn "houses into homes" and to create beautiful interior spaces.

We offer:

  • Starting wage of $18.00+ per hour, negotiable based on related industry experience
  • Increases available based on role progression
  • Benefits & RRSP matching program
  • A clean and safe indoor work environment
  • Training and opportunity for advancement
  • Outstanding team support

Shifts Available:

  • Monday - Thursday day shifts (6:45am - 5:15pm) - 3 Day Weekends!
  • Monday to Thursday night shifts (5:00PM to 3:30AM) - additional $1.00/hour night-shift premium
  • Friday, Saturday and Sunday night shifts (6:30PM to 7:00AM) - Extra $1.00/hour night-shift premium, PLUS work 36 hours and get paid for a 40-hour shift!

What You'll Do

As the Machine Operator Trainee, you will have the opportunity to help our business meet production targets by consistently producing high-quality interior finishing products in our Calgary, AB facility.

Key Interactions: You will report directly to the Production Manager in Calgary and will be a key member of the Metrie Calgary Manufacturing team.

At a high-level, you will:

  • Produce products to meet work order specifications while meeting high standard of quality
  • Operate our machinery and equipment to the specifications of the manufacturer
  • Support plant continuous improvement initiatives
  • Ensure daily production continuously meets requirements of IFOTIS (In full, On Time, In Spec)
  • Participate in cross-training with other departments on the production line to further your skillsets
  • Understand and apply our health and safety policies and regulations

Who You Are

We will provide in-house training to help you be successful in this role! No experience is necessary.

You are an ideal candidate if you:

  • Are comfortable operating machinery and standing/walking for long periods
  • Have a positive attitude, lead by example, and are respectful towards your team members
  • Understand the importance of health and safety at work and can follow instructions

title: Labourer
description:
Labourer

Company

IDL Projects Inc. (IDL) is a dynamic, rapidly expanding company focused on providing a broad array of construction services in Canada and internationally. We have established ourselves as a go-to solutions provider in the construction areas of civil and infrastructure, commercial, residential, public and institutional, industrial, energy, mining and safety services.

 

Position Summary

The Labourer is part of an effective construction team that successfully completes projects according to approved plans, specifications and applicable codes while maintaining high quality and a safe workplace.

 

Responsibilities

  • Load and unload construction materials, and move materials to work areas
  • Erect and dismantle concrete forms, scaffolding, ramps, catwalks, shoring, barricades and other items required at construction sites
  • Assist and work with tradespersons and other members of the construction team
  • Assist and work with heavy equipment operators to secure special attachments to equipment, signal operators to guide them in moving equipment and provide assistance in other activities
  • Assist in aligning pipes and perform other related activities during underground utilities construction
  • Assist in excavation and backfill and other related activities during earthworks construction using shovels, rakes, plate tampers and other applicable tools
  • Checks slopes for conformance to requirements, using levels or lasers
  • Remove rubble and debris to maintain and clean and safe working environment
  • Operate pneumatic hammers, vibrators and tampers as directed
  • Operate and maintain machines or equipment used in construction such as mixers, compressors and pumps
  • May perform other related duties as required

 

Qualifications

  • 2 years experience in a construction environment or in a similar role
  • Familiar with construction terms and practices
  • Effective verbal and listening communication skills
  • Ability to understand and effectively execute verbal and written directions
  • Adheres to company Health, Safety, & Environmental reporting and standard assessments
  • Must possess a valid driverâ€™s license

title: Landscape Construction/Stone Crew Member/Labourer
company: Lawrence Park Complete Garden Care Ltd
description:
Who we are?

Lawrence Park Complete Garden Care is an award-winning full-scale landscaping firm, specializing in landscape design & construction, lawn & garden care, irrigation & lighting, green roofs and horticulture. We are group of dedicated and creative professionals who are proud of the landscapes we create and maintain. We’ve been at it for over 30 years and we continue to grow – this is where you come in!

So what’s in it for you?

  • The chance to work on award-winning projects with an award-winning team.
  • The opportunity to work in beautiful Toronto neighborhoods.
  • Working for a company that values a supportive work environment.
  • Industry leading wages, along with profit sharing bonuses.
  • Group Health Benefits.
  • On the job training.
  • Personal Development Planning.
  • Employee of the Month recognitions and rewards.
  • Employee referral program.
  • Training allowance.
  • Fun social events.

Who are we looking for?

  • A self-motivated individual who is passionate about the work they do.
  • Someone creative, who has problem solving skills, can communicate well, is personable and can be flexible with the fast-paced environment and demands of the work.

What we need?

  • Landscape construction installation experience, that includes installing walkways, patios, driveways & retaining walls.
  • An understanding of hardscape materials and their installation practices.
  • General knowledge of landscaping practices, such as softscape installation, pruning, soil work and clean ups.
  • Experience operating machinery is an asset.
  • A minimum G license and comfortable driving large vehicles is also an asset.
  • Ability to work long hours, starting at 7am from Monday to Friday; along with occasional weekend work in the Spring and Fall.
  • Can meet the physical demands of working outdoors in varying weather conditions – Ontario weather is no joke!

title: General Labour - Pickering
description:
We are looking for talented, reliable and hard-working people. With multiple opportunities on packaging production lines. The current opportunities are available in several production areas of the facility but are not limited to Packing Packaging and Operating Packaging Machines. All production openings are permanent. 

Responsibilities and Duties:

Operating state of the art equipment to manufacture various types of food and beverage packaging.
Visually inspect the finished product prior to placing it into the shipping box.
Make boxes, load product belts, replenish materials around machines such as tape, boxes, and bags.
Complete hourly quality checks and assist with quality inspections as needed.
Ensure housekeeping standards are followed.

Experience:

Prior manufacturing or industrial experience is an asset but not required.
Excellent attendance is essential.
The ability to perform repetitive tasks with high attention to detail.
Works well within a team-based environment

What will help you perform the job?

Ability to comfortably stand for extended periods of time.
Ability to comfortably walk, sit, bend, and crouch.
Able to lift up to 30lbs (occasionally may be required to lift up to 50lbs)

For more details, call now: 905-971-8384 / 905-276-4040

title: Construction Crew Lead Hand
description:
Summary:

The Construction Lead Hand is responsible for assisting the foreperson with daily installations of landscape projects. With a strong work ethic and leadership skills, the Construction Lead Hand will work with small crews to deliver excellence in a variety of projects and apply their knowledge of construction projects to ensure the work is completed to the highest standard.

Job Characteristics:  

  • Passion and pride in your work
  • Work closely with the foreperson on daily projects
  • Run construction jobs when the foreperson is off site
  • Install a variety of projects, including natural stone walkways, walls, precast, grading, excavation, and planting designs
  • Effectively lead and motivate teammates
  • Communicate professionally and clearly with co-workers, management, and clients
  • Operate tools and equipment safely and confidently at all times
  • Be flexible and improvise in a dynamic environment
  • Handle high pressure situations and demonstrate strong time management skills

Qualifications:

  • 3+ years of experience in the construction industry
  • Strong knowledge in landscape and construction best practices and able to interpret drawings
  • Knowledgeable and experienced with a variety of power tools and equipment
  • Leadership skills and the ability to effectively lead a small crew
  • Able to operate a skid steer and excavator
  • Strong communication skills
  • Valid 'G' driver's license

title: SEASONAL LABOURER I - CEMETERY
description:
Job Description:

 

Exciting things are happening at the City of Brampton. Take a look at what employees are working on related to our Term of Council Priorities moving us forward towards The Brampton 2040 Vision.

 

 

2022 SUMMER OPPORTUNITY - SEASONAL LABOURER I - CEMETERY

 

 

Are you looking to gain valuable experience, learn new skills and grow your career doing meaningful work with  one of Canadaâ€™s Top 100 Employers? Then consider a summer job with our Parks Maintenance and Forestry Division. If you are returning to school in the fall and are looking to gain some great experience we want to hear from you.

 

PRIMARY FUNCTION:

 

Under the direction of the Foreperson, Cemetery Services, responsible for the daily maintenance of the cemeteries owned and operated by the City of Brampton.

  • Assist with general turf maintenance â€“ i.e. fertilizing, mowing, trimming, seeding, watering.
  • Perform garbage collection, litter picking and maintenance of amenities.
  • Assist with grave site maintenance and care â€“ i.e. removal of flowers from graves.
  • Edge and level grave markers.
  • Assist with gardening â€“ i.e. soil management, maintain and plant flowerbeds/displays.
  • Assist with tree and shrub care â€“ i.e. pruning, fertilizing, planting and staking.
  • Report all concerns, accidents and incidents to immediate supervisor for follow up and take appropriate action.
  • Responsible for the safe and efficient operation, care of tools and equipment.
  • Communicate courteously with the general public and where necessary refer them to appropriate supervisor.
  • Understand, adhere to, and enforce Corporate Policies & Procedures, Confidentiality Guidelines, Emergency Procedures and Health and Safety Standards for all participants and staff.
  • Performs other duties as assigned.

 

SELECTION CRITERIA:

  • Current Standard First from an accredited organization
  • Ability to perform physical work duties in varied/all weather conditions
  • Exceptional customer service and communication skills
  • G2 for entry level positions â€“ may be required dependant on position
  • Ability to successfully acquire City of Brampton Drivers and Equipment permits

 

**Various tests and/or exams may be administered as part of the selection criteria.

 

Job status:   Summer/Seasonal

Employment period is from April to September, based  on a 40 hour work week.

 

Hourly rate:    $14.35

Applications must be received by July 01, 2022

Alternate formats will be provided  upon request.

 

   

 

 

If this opportunity matches your interest and experience, please apply online by clicking the button above by July 01, 2022 and complete the attached questionnaire. We thank all applicants; however, only those selected for an interview will be contacted. The successful candidate(s) will be required, as a condition of employment, to execute a written employment agreement. A criminal record search will be required of the successful candidate to verify the absence of a criminal record for which a pardon has not been granted.

 

Preference will be given to students that have a permanent residency in Brampton.

 

As part of the application process, applicants will be invited to complete a self identification survey. The survey is voluntary. Participation in the survey will have no impact on hiring decisions.   All information collected is confidential and will not be shared with the hiring manager. The surveys will be anonymized and will be kept separate from applicant or employee files, such that the individuals who completed the surveys will not be identifiable.   The results of the survey will assist in the analysis of disaggregated metrics for organizational planning purposes and our commitment to advance and foster diversity, equity, and inclusion. The City may use anonymized data to produce aggregate reports for internal or external use.

 

Please be advised, the City of Brampton uses email to communicate with their applicants for open job competitions. It is the applicantâ€™s responsibility to include an updated email address that is checked daily and accepts emails from unknown users. As we send time sensitive correspondence via email (i.e. testing bookings, interview dates), it is imperative that applicants check their email regularly. If we do not hear back from applicants, we will assume that you are no longer interested in the Job Competition and your application will be removed from the Competition.  

 

The City is an equal opportunity employer.   We are committed to inclusive, barrier-free recruitment and selection processes and work environments. If you require any accommodations at any point during the application and hiring process, please contact TalentAcquisition@brampton.ca or 905-874-2150 with your accommodation needs, quoting the job opening ID#, job title. Any information received relating to accommodation will be addressed confidentially.

title: General Labourer - Painter
description:
FULL/PART TIME PAINTING POSITIONS AVAILABLE!!!

*CURRENTLY HIRING FOR 2022*

ACT NOW TO SECURE YOUR POSITION IN ONE OF CANADA’S TOP  PAINTING FRANCHISES!

 

 

Our painting team is looking for highly-motivated individuals to join us!

We are looking for the absolute hardest-working, most efficient people in Maple Ridge, BC who want to join a family of awesome staff and team culture, who are also looking to earn what they are worth and optimize their cash flow!

This past year alone, our team provided 75+ top quality paint jobs in the Maple Ridge area, with one strategy in mind: satisfied clients, which created a happy work atmosphere and rewarded employees. 
For 2022 we are hoping to provide an even better service and employ, train and optimize an even stronger team!
We are looking to hire our team, starting in the early spring of 2022!

About this job:
*Fast-paced, fun environment with incentivized pay scale.
*Hands-on experience in customer service and communication
*Working outdoors with a crew of other like-minded people
*Working with friends is encouraged, so apply together and note this in your application, we love hiring teams of Rockstars!
*Training is provided; therefore, no experience is necessary! We teach everyone how to paint!
*We are currently hiring Painters and Crew Managers for 2022. Both positions are full-time jobs and can lead to future promotion opportunities within the company for those with the right attitude!
*We are also hiring seasonal staff for those of you who are just looking for a summer job! Act quickly, our summer positions will fill up fast!

What will be expected of you: 
-Positive Attitude (My team hires for attitude and trains for skill)
-Reliable Transportation (As we will be working at many different job sites you must 100% be capable of getting around town. The team may be required to move job sites mid-day and you must be able to accommodate this, no exceptions!) 
-Motivation for $$$ (With this company you truly get out what you put in)
-Ability to work from ladders (if you are afraid of heights, this job is not for you)
-Ability to work with clients and always represent our company respectably
-Ability to complete and provide certifications for required training provided
-Ability to ensure proper time management and punctuality (lateness is not tolerated)
-Referring our services to friends and family (this is not required but always appreciated)
-A strong mindset dedicated to learning and self-improvement

 

What benefits will you get? 
-Full training on how to paint the interior and exterior of homes/commercial buildings as well as top-notch safety training.
-Lots of opportunities to earn more with greater efficiency, as well as company offered prizes and incentives.
 -Pay starting at $19/hr, with the possibility to make $25+ (Bonuses will depend on performance and the criteria established by the business Owner/Operator.)
-Working with other like-minded and fun individuals. 
-Excellent training and strong mentorship provided during P.A.D (performance, availability and discussion) meetings.
-Working outside in the fresh air! 
-A glowing reference to help really beef up your resume!


Position Descriptions

Painter: This role is a fun but challenging position that is ideal for someone wanting to get hands-on work experience and make money reflective of their efforts. The ideal individual is hard-working, coachable, and has effective communication skills. You will be sometimes required to work at heights or for long hours in warm weather so needless to say endurance is also an asset.
Crew Manager: In addition to painting, in this role, you would gain experience in leadership and management skills. You would take on additional responsibilities for additional pay. This would include moving ladders, making trips to the paint store, motivating your team, solving client issues, training additional painters, and managing other tasks on job sites.
Ask to be considered for this if you feel you may be a good fit.
Bonuses and Incentives, as well as pay increases, are provided for people in this position. 
 

 

If this job sounds like the right fit for you then please get in contact with us!
We would love to hear from you and set up an interview.  
Please complete the application form and I will be in touch with you by phone.

Looking forward to working with you! - Gavin Harper
skills: ['Looking forward to working with you! - Gavin Harper']

title: General Labourer
description:
APS PRECAST, a Division of C&S Group Operations Ltd., based out of Langley, British Columbia, is a manufacturer of architectural and structural precast concrete products. The strength of APS is in the experience and qualifications of its management and employees, its high technology plant, and superior quality control. We are a family business focused on the growth of our company and our people. We are simply a great place to work.
APS PRECAST is seeking highly motivated, General Labourers who can fabricate forms to join their dynamic team. This is a full-time, physically demanding position for an energetic person. The right candidate will be enthusiastic and self-motivated; a person with the passion to come to work each day and make a contribution.

  • Concrete Casting.
  • Layout beds.
  • Clean and oil beds of forms.
  • Understand basics of quality control.
  • Clean workspace on a regular basis.
  • Yard Maintenance as per supervisor’s direction.
  • Clean up work on a regular basis.

  • Ability of lift up to 50 lbs.
  • Safety-conscious.
  • Must have good organizational skills.

  • Certified Steel Toed Boots.
APS PRECAST offers a competitive total compensation package along with an excellent benefits program including medical, dental, vision, etc…

hr@apsprecast.com

Compensation based on experience.
Only resumes of candidates under consideration will be acknowledged.

description:
DI-MOND is a rapidly growing manufacturer, supporting the needs of the Canadian Market. We design and build top-quality, long-lasting heavy duty trailers. We are currently seeking qualified and highly motivated General Labourers to join our team. DI-MOND is located in Stoney Creek, Ontario.

Duties/responsibilities:
  • A General Laborer performs general labor tasks including loading, unloading, lifting, and moving materials.
  • Assist a variety of functions with manual labor tasks as needed.

  • Relies on instruction and pre-established guidelines to perform the functions of the job.
  • He/she works under immediate supervision.
  • Primary job functions do not typically require exercising independent judgment.
  • Typically reports to a supervisor or manager.
  • Maintains a clean and safe workstation.

This is a physical job. Benefits available at 3 months.

Please note: Public transportation does not go out to this location.
Shifts are: 6:30 AM - 4:00 PM (Monday to Thursday) & 6:30 AM - 3:00 PM (Friday).
Job types: Full-time, Permanent

description:

Everyone on our team also learns how to perform some sales roles on the job site. We are a world-class leader in industrial fabrication, construction and maintenance and have built our company and reputation on ensuring visibility, value and accountability are always in the forefront. Come Grow With Us!

title: General Labourer
description:
We specialize in all things glass. Established in 1962 with one shop in Seattle, Wash., today Glass Doctor offers quick and affordable glass services to business, home, and auto owners at more than 270 locations across the United States and Canada. Our team of qualified experts lives our code of values of Respect, Integrity, and Customer Focus while having fun in the process! We hire reliable, friendly, and customer service-focused glass professionals and office staff who are dedicated to creating a delightful customer experience. 
As a general labour, you would be a key member of our team responsible for assisting in the quality and efficient installation of residential and commercial flat glass and related glass products such as windows, storefronts, mirrors, display cases, shower doors, etc. You will also develop new customers by identifying opportunities to sell additional work. Exemplifying our code of values, you show respect and courtesy to all customers and employees.
Ideally you have prior experience in the flat glass industry and have proven communication skills with supervisors, employees, and customers.  You are self-motivated, thrive in fast moving environments, and able to manage time to effectively meet deadlines.  

Specific Responsibilities: 
  • Assisting with installation for interior glass and mirror products, shelving, and interior sliding doors
  • Insure the efficient use of materials and maintain adequate stock of vehicle
  • Conduct accurate field measuring
  • Keep company vehicle and equipment properly serviced, clean, and in good working order and condition
  • Perform other duties as needed which may include cross-training in related positions
Job Requirements:
  • Prior experience in construction is a plus
  • Ability to measure accurately and use tape measures and levels
  • Quality workmanship is a must
  • Physical ability to lift heavy objects such as shower panels and door
  • Excellent communication skills
  • Professional appearance and personality
Benefits: Benefits package available
Wages: Competitive wages

Excellent growth potential!
We are actively interviewing for this position - Apply today and our hiring manager will follow-up!

title: General Labour
description:
Looking for a challenge this summer? Join our hard working team in transforming the homes of our
community! We are looking for team players who are driven, results oriented, and eager to make their
mark this summer. We provide high quality home services such as lawn care & painting/staining services
for both Interior and Exterior projects!
 
We are committed to transforming the homes of our local residential communities and leaving our
homeowners in AWE of the transformation. We are offering both full time and part time general labour
positions to the most motivated, coachable individuals to join our business. Looking to hire skilled
labourers who like working outside and motivated to do an incredible job.

title: General Labourer
description:
Appliance Repair & Cleaning Technician $19-$22

Company Summary 

Canadian BBQ Boys mission is to improve barbecue health, safety and performance by providing a professional barbecue cleaning service that helps residential grillers get the most out of the grilling season.

In just 5 years, the company has grown exponentially across Ontario, making Canadian BBQ Boys the brand name in barbecue cleaning and service. Since our appearance on Dragons Den, we have continued to grow the business and are in the process of Canada wide expansion. 

As we continue to implement our growth plans, we have a number of opportunities with massive growth potential. Our goal is to provide amazing job experiences focused on learning and growth. Each member of our team will have the opportunity to move up in the business, all it takes is a strong work ethic and willingness to learn!

Job Description 

The Appliance Repair & Cleaning Technician position is typically best suited for hard workers who enjoy working with customers, working outdoors in the summer and indoors in the winter and are looking to improve on sales/service skills in a labour intensive environment. 

This role is a very essential role for our operations at Canadian BBQ Boys. As an Appliance Repair & Cleaning Technician, you will be learning the ins and outs of the barbecue industry by conducting the oven and barbecue cleaning services that we offer according to company processes and procedures, facilitating the customer experience, and managing your own set of supplies and equipment.  

Appliance Repair & Cleaning Technicians have the opportunity to work their way into the Territory Manager, and Regional Manager as well as Office positions, which can come with pay increases along with increased responsibilities. 

Job Duties and Responsibilities

  • Cleaning barbecues and ovens at both Commercial and Residential properties
  • Conducting repairs and maintenance to appliances we service
  • Maintaining and organizing company supplies and equipment
  • Interacting with customers
  • Upselling products and add-ons
  • Other duties as assigned

Qualifications

  • Experience working in-home services industry is an asset
  • Able to perform physical labour and operate light equipment
  • Able to work outdoors in various weather conditions
  • Able to understand and carry out verbal and written instructions
  • Able to use technical skills to assess issues with appliances 
  • Able to meet deadlines, problem solve and work well under pressure
  • High attention to details

Compensation

  • Starting at $18/hr + Tips + Commission + Incentives (Most make $19- $22/hr)

Job Type

  • Full-time Position (Year Round)
  • Over-time hours available during May + June 

Requirements

  • G-Licence

title: General Construction Worker
description:
We’re looking for an experienced construction worker with a good work ethic, a history of consistent attendance, and great physical strength and stamina to join our team. You’ll work under our construction manager’s direction, alongside a close-knit team of other skilled laborers and tradesmen, no prior experience is necessary however prior experience in spray painting would be the ideal candidate. will have previous construction experience, have knowledge of construction methods, tools, and equipment. If you’re ready to work hard every day under various conditions, start your application today.

Compensation:

$40,000 - $55,000 yearly

Responsibilities:
  • Follow all directions of the construction manager, and work with other team members to complete construction projects accurately
  • Remove debris and hazardous materials to keep the job site safe and clean to meet safety regulations and OSHA requirements
  • Operate power tools, hand tools, and heavy equipment such as jackhammers, survey equipment, and forklifts as required
  • Dismantle old structures, and build temporary structures such as signs, cones, barricades, ramps, and other devices to control traffic around the construction site
  • Load, unload, and transfer tools and building materials such as lumber, tile, saws, sheetrock, grout, etc.

  • Make sure task is completed in a timely manner

Qualifications:

  • Comfortable working in inclement weather, like extreme temperatures, rain, etc.
  • High school diploma or equivalent is required - Associate’s degree, trade certification, and/or completed apprenticeship program is highly preferred
  • Both physical stamina and physical strength are essential
  • Solid mechanical skills are needed, as are good eye-hand coordination and depth perception
About Company

Canadian Elite Renovation has been in business for the past decade. We are one of the biggest reglazing groups in Ontario, while we have amazing spray painters we are always open to expanding and bringing on new talent on board.

title: General Labourer
description:
Job Description

Our client is seeking GENERAL LABOURERS to work at their sawmills in GOGAMA, Ontario. While you might see a lot of job offers for General Labourer, but being one at the sawmill in Gogamameans getting to work right in the heart ofnature. You'll be aroundwood,woodand morewood. Your eagle eyes will help keep theyardandsawmilllooking their best. To keep things running smoothly, you’ll make sure that there’s a place for everything and that everything is in its place. You'll make a living working at oursawmillswith deep roots in thenorthernregions ofOntario. You'll discover that they do more than just transformwood; they also transform our communities!

Are you hard-working, resourceful and a go-getter? Our team is waiting for you!

What you’ll be doing specifically:

  • Tie up bundles of rough lumber for drying outside.
  • Redo and stack bundles of rough and planed wood in the yard.
  • Perform clean-ups of the yard and sawmill.
  • Perform clean-ups after interior and exterior sawing operations.
  • During work downtime, clean areas that are inaccessible during operations.
  • Do any other related tasks (don’t worry; you'll learn tons of things that will help you in your career!).

What do you need to succeed with us?

  • Be able to work well on a team.
  • Be independent and full of initiative.
  • Show vigilance and a concern for health and safety.

Qualifications

Experience that will help you in this position:

  • DCS, DEC, or equivalent.
  • Prior experience at a sawmill is an asset.
  • Be available to work day and/or night shifts.

WAGE & HOURS:

  • $26per hour, + night shift premium, 40- 44 hours per week
  • Overtimeafter 44 hours per week, Sundays or Statutory Holidays
  • Shift rotation (as applicable): rotating shifts days, afternoons, night

BENEFITS:

  • Disability Insurance
  • Dental Insurance
  • Pension
  • Extended medical insurance (e.g. prescription drugs, paramedical services, medical services and equipment)
  • Paid vacation

title: labourer
description:
Job Brief:Job site preparation and cleanup, setting up and removing access equipment, working on concrete and masonry, steel, wood and pre-cast erecting projects, cutting and removing concrete.





Responsibilities:Knowledge and use of various types of electric and gas powered tools such as chippers, Concrete drills, quick-cut saws, circular saws and reciprocating saws.





Skills Required:Knowledge of various structures such as residential, commercial and industrial buildings. • Knowledge and use of various types of electric and gas powered tools such as chippers, Concrete drills, quick-cut saws, circular saws and reciprocating saws. • Knowledge of safety documentation such as Material Safety Data Sheets (MSDS), Workplace • Hazardous Materials Information System (WHMIS) and symbols. • Knowledge and use of various types of materials such as lumber, earth, piping, concrete and masonry units. • Knowledge of types of ladders such as extension, platform and stepladders with placement, 3-point contact, overhang and kick plates. • Concrete types, strengths, aggregates and properties, plasticizers and accelerators, ratios, mixing times and compatibilities as required. • 1-2 years of experience in a similar role. • General construction knowledge and experience required. • Experience in and understanding of the retail and commercial construction space. • Excellent accuracy and mathematical competency skills. • Strong verbal and written communication skills. • Must be organized, efficient and productive. • Able to work effectively with others in a team environment. • Valid License is mandatory

title: General Labourer
description:
General Labourer (Vacuum Truck Services)
WESSUC INC.

Wessuc is one of Ontario's leading resources for municipal, industrial and agricultural wastewater infrastructure and processes, with a focus on turning waste into value.

As a result of our continued growth in our dewatering, vacuum and clean-out services, we are looking for motivated General Labourers to join our team. An essential part of our vacuum operations crews, our attendants and confined spaces technicians keep the job running smoothly from start to finish by maintaining equipment on site, operating high pressure water systems and assisting the operator with the vacuum truck. 


Job Responsibilities

As a General Labourer with our Vac Services team, you will:
  • Assist the operator in setting up sites efficiently and safely, including vacuum hoses, safety equipment and associated equipment;
  • Service equipment on site and carry out preventative maintenance procedures to ensure that pumps, vehicles and equipment are fuelled, greased, and in proper working order;
  • Clean out and working in confined spaces including waste water holding tanks, pump stations, and various other tanks at sewage treatment plants, water plants and processing facilities;
  • Support and assist the foreperson in paperwork including CSE permits and all other required paperwork as part of daily operations;
  • Assist in all divisions at Wessuc, may be required to help out in other divisions as operational needs arise.

Qualifications

  • High school education;
  • Mechanically inclined; 
  • Experience in the construction or wastewater industry an asset;
  • Valid G or G2 drivers license with good driving record; 
  • Safety certifications of Confined Space Entry and Working at Heights are an asset;
  • Ability to work in confined spaces; walk, bend, and lift 75 lbs.;
  • Flexibility to work a varied schedule, work may include out of town work.

Benefits

  • Competitive wages with overtime paid after 44 hours;
  • Comprehensive benefits plan including health, dental, life and vision;
  • Company matching RRSP-DPSP program;
  • Boot allowance of $150 after one year of service;
  • Supportive team work environment in a family owned and operated company;
  • Opportunity for advancement.

About Us

Established in 2000, Wessuc is a family owned and operated business driven by its values. As leaders in our industry, we take pride in our commitment to safety and our use of innovative waste solution technologies. Our teams contribute to cleaner, greener, and sustainable communities every day. 

Wessuc encourages all qualified candidates to apply. Should you require accommodation in the recruitment process, please let us know by using the “Help” function in the application, or contacting our Human Resources team.

title: Skilled Labourers
description:

Voice Construction is a privately owned civil construction firm providing services for high profile clients and projects across Alberta and British Columbia. We specialize in petrochemical site preparation and related earthwork construction projects. Since our founding in 1939 Voice has grown considerably yet still maintains a family culture. At Voice you will find challenging work and opportunities for career growth through mentorship and career development!

 

Voice is hiring experienced  Local  Skilled Labourers  for work on a project site in  Prince Rupert, BC.

 

Experience in the following will be considered an asset:

  • Load, unload and transport construction materials
  • Assist heavy equipment operators, perform spotting of trucks and other heavy equipment
  • Perform duties of a flag person, direct flow of pedestrians, traffic, and heavy equipment
  • Preferred to have some carpentry/concrete experience
  • Heating and Hoarding experience is preferred
  • Ability to read drawings is an asset
  • Perform all other labourer duties as requested by the supervisor

The following certificates are required for site access:

  • CSTS09
  • Ground Disturbance II
  • Pre-Access Drug & Alcohol Testing

Project Shift Schedule: 5/2; Monday - Friday

 

This is a local position; no camp or living allowance provided.

 

Please apply here or through our website, www.voiceconst.com.

 

We are an equal opportunity employer and encourage applications from all qualified individuals.

title: General Labourer
description:
Job Description:

GENERAL LABOUR

 

Shift: AM: 5.30am to 2pm / 5.45am to 2.15pm

                   PM: 2.45pm to 11.15pm / 3pm to 11.30pm

Hours of work: 40hrs/week

Rate: $19.44 per hour

Days of work: Mon to Fri

Working Conditions: Plant environment (cold: 0 to 4 Degrees)

Job Description:

  • Take an active role in changeover procedures and achieve line speed efficiencies
  • Visual quality checks of product against customer and internal specifications (including foreign materials and weight checks).
  • Ability to maintain cleanliness of areas of responsibility.
  • Adhere to individual Product Standard Operating Procedures for components and packaging material.
  • Must wear proper Personal Protective Equipment (PPE) and comply with Health and Safety requirements. including ensuring power is shut down on equipment prior to specified tasks.
  • Packaging cooked or semi product on various meat production equipment.
  • Verification of Best Before Date and labels.
  • Supply packaging lines with boxes, films and labels.
  • Inventory control of label room and staging area.
  • Pack various meat products into trays/boxes.
  • Operate slicing machine and weight scale when necessary.
  • Palletizing.
  • Other duties as required/assigned.
  •  

Required Skills:

  • Ability to read, write and communicate in English.
  • Must be able to work with all types of meat products including pork.
  • Must be able to work in a cold environment.
  • Ability to stand and reach for extended periods of time.
  • Must be able to lift up to 25kgs.

 

Next Steps for qualified candidates:

  • Submit your resume for consideration.
  • A member of HR Team will contact qualified candidates to schedule a telephone interview.
  • For selected candidates, we will undergo a criminal background check prior to joining.
  • After which the selected candidates, will require to undergo a COVID-19 test prior to joining.
