title: Night Shift General Labourer - Metcalfe, ON
description:
Job ID:  334520

 

Permacon, a CRH Company, is a leader and pioneer in the manufacturing of concrete masonry and landscaping products.  Permacon is a division of Oldcastle®Architectural and operates 9 plants in Ontario and Quebec. 

 

We are currently looking for a Nightshift General Labourerat our Metcalfe plant (located south of Ottawa at 6860 Bank Street).  The successful candidates must be available to work on a shift rotation.

 

JOB SUMMARY:

 

Reporting to the Production Supervisor, the General Labourer must be able to handle various tasks including the following:

 

 

  • Clean mixers
  • Participate in production and preventative maintenance of equipment as requested.
  • Perform yard and plant clean-up and keeps his work area clean
  • Sort and manipulate concrete products
  • Repair broken pallets
  • Apply all health and safety procedures and wear personal protective equipment
  • Maintain quality standards on products

           

REQUIRED QUALIFICATIONS:

 

  • High School Diploma
  • Manufacturing work experience
  • Forklift certification
  • Good team work skills and initiative
  • Safety oriented
  • Good mechanical aptitudes and capability to progress as a machine operator
  • Good learning capabilities
  • Capability to perform continual physical work in a dusty environment

 

SCHEDULE :

 

  • Monday to Friday,  12h15 am to 9h45 am
  • 9 Hours per day
  • 44 Hours a week

 

 

We are offering a competitive salary and benefits package as per the collective agreement.  If you are interested with this challenge, please send your resume by e-mail.

 

Permacon

Human Resources Department

 

E-Mail : rh-hr@permacon.ca

 

Individual accommodation shall be provided for applicants with disabilities who meet required qualifications.

title: General Labourer (FT)
description:
A very busy and award winning Home Renovations company, servicing the GTA, is looking to fill General Labour Positions.

Who we are looking for: 
We are looking for good people to join our team. Ideally we want students of construction or individual to have some construction experience. You must be able to start immediately and are willing to commit to steady work with one company. We need people who are willing to except an entry level position willing to work their way up. 
  • Are you reliable and responsible? 
  • Do you have some construction experience? 
  • Are you presentable and professional? 
  • Are you in good physical and mental shape? 
  • Do you want to work with a company that puts quality first? 
  • Do you want to work for an established and in demand growing company? 
  • Do you have a vehicle? 
  • Do you have some required tools? 
  • Do you take direction clearly?
  • Are you a team player?
  • Do you have a valid WHMIS and Fall Arrest Certificate?
 Responsibilities:
  • Operate construction vehicles.
  • Use power tools.
  • Haul goods from the receiving area.
  • Maintain a clean work environment.
If you feel you meet all or most of the requirements, please send us your resume or a detailed email listing your experience and qualifications to info@obornecontracting.com.  
 
Wage range for this position is approximately $30,000.00 - $44,000.00+ per year depending on skill, experience, qualifications and certifications (paid our hourly).
 
********************* Serious Applicants Only**********************
 
While we appreciate the time and effort taken to respond to this ad, only those applicants we feel worthy of an interview will receive a reply. 
 
You can learn about us at www.obornecontracting.com 
 
We look forward to hearing from you!

title: General Labour
description:
We are looking for physically fit individuals to work in a warehouse and on deliveries. You must be able to lift up to 75lbs repetitively for the duration of your shift. Steel-toed boots and a vest are mandatory. Location is on a bus route but the shift starts at 7:00am. Pay rate is $17/hour.

We thank all interested applicants, however, only those who are currently residing in Alberta and are legal to work in Canada will be considered. Please do not apply if you do not reside in Canada, we are not seeking international applicants at this time.

title: Skilled Laborer (FT)
description:
Canadian Erosion and Containment is currently hiring full-time skilled laborers for the upcoming construction season. These positions will be based out of the Calgary with opportunity for travel to sites in Western Canada.

Responsibilities of this position include but are not limited to:
  • Assisting with the deployment of geosynthetic materials in the installation of Erosion Control Systems.
  • Installation of erosion control measures, GCL Liners, Silt fence, Erosion Matting, Gabion Walls and mattresses, MSE walls, Wrap Slopes, Barb Wire fence, Radon Barriers, Drill seeding, and Hydroseeding.

Requirements:
  • Must have a valid Driver’s License and reliable vehicle.
  • Must have valid safety tickets: CSTS 09 WHMIS 2015. First aid and H2S Alive would be an asset.
  • Must have PPE (steel toe boots, reflective vest, hard hat, safety glasses, gloves).
  • Must have a cell phone.
  • Previous industrial or construction experience.
  • Be able and willing to travel to remote locations and be away for extended periods of up to 24 days.
  • Availability to work up to 12 hours per day seven days a week.
  • Be adaptable to changing schedules.
  • Be comfortable working outdoors in various weather conditions.
  • Be comfortable working around heavy equipment.
  • Ability to lift to 50 pounds throughout the day.
  • Be a safety-focused individual.
  • Be able to successfully pass 8-panel pre-employment test as required for site-specific access.

Other details:
  • Rate of Pay: General Labourer position with opportunities for advancement within the company.
  • Paid Travel Time & Per Diems (daily food allowance) and hotels or camps provided for out-of-town work.
  • Accommodations, transportation, and travel time paid while on remote job sites.
  • Job Type: Full-time, Temporary, Permanent.

title: General Construction Labourer
description:
Verity Construction is hiring! Are you looking for a great opportunity with a well-established construction team? We are an industry leader and are looking for the right candidate to join our team of professionals. We are currently looking for a full-time General Labourers.

Verity is dedicated to obtaining a supportive and positive work environment, as well as continuous training, skill development and more. We offer competitive wages and benefits to successful applicants. Wages will be based upon skill set, work ethic, and attitude. If you are looking for long term employment this is the opportunity for you!

title: Labourer
description:
Primoris Canada is an infrastructure contractor serving major firms in the oil, gas, power, petrochemical, and heavy oil industries and include services covering tailings and hydro-transport pipeline construction and maintenance, storage tank construction and maintenance, industrial facilities multi-discipline construction and maintenance, piping fabrication, and pipeline integrity services.

 

Summary: 

A Labourer is involved in a variety of job scopes assisting ticketed tradesmen. This work may exist indoors or outdoors and may be physically demanding.

 

Shift: Day/Night

Location: CNRL Horizon

Accomodation: Camp available


  • Comply with PSC and Client Safety rules, as well as OH&S standards
  • Assisting tradesmen in completing daily duties
  • Sorting and selecting tools, as requested by journeymen
  • Acting as fire/spark watch for welders
  • General Clean-Up
  • Load and unload materials as required
  • Attend required safety and tailgate/toolbox meetings
  • May perform other duties as assigned

  • Previous experience working on an industrial site is considered an asset, but not required
  • CSTS-09 (or CSO if not already in possession of CSTS-09)
  • OSSA Fire Watch is considered an asset
  • Valid Class 5 Drivers License
  • Must be physically able to lift 50lbs
  • Able to work well in a team environment

Pre-employment alcohol and drug testing is a condition of employment.

title: Summer Student - General Laborer - Tsiigehtchic
description:
Under the general supervision of the Manager Generation Support, you contribute to the safe and efficient operation of the NTPC Plant. Duties would include heavy lifting, weed whacking, painting, mopping, cleaning and assisting the Mechanics, Electrical Technicians, Electricians and Power Linepersons



Qualifications:

  • Are enrolling/enrolled to attend full time post-secondary studies at the start of the Fall 2021 semester.
  • Related experience in a labourer position an asset.

 How to Apply:

  • Submit your cover letter, and a current copy of your resume including two references from your most recent supervisor or instructors.
  • You will be required to provide proof of registration in a post-secondary institution.

This position pays $26.97 per hour plus 6% vacation pay.  No housing or relocation assistance provided.

 

This job opening is limited to student residents living in Tsiigehtchic.

 

Affirmative Action Employer - Candidates must clearly identify eligibility status via our online portal in order to receive priority consideration.

 

We thank all those who apply and advise that only those selected for further consideration will be contacted.

title: Landscape Construction Labourer
description:
Job Summary:
The Landscape Construction Laborer is responsible for working as a team member under the direct
supervision of the Landscape Construction Foreman. This role is responsible for completing construction landscape installation jobs in an efficient manner, promoting job worksite safety, providing excellent customer service, and exhibits pride and quality workmanship.

Job Responsibilities:
  • Work closely with Foreman and Crew Leader in the installation of landscape construction projects.
  • Always represent the company’s best interest, maintain the highest level of professionalism.
  • Maintain a clean and safe job site
  • Maintain and care for company equipment, tools, and vehicles.
  • Perform highly physical installation work on a consistent basis.
  • Work as part of a team and take direction.
  • Keep accurate timesheet records
  • Attend training classes and seminars as requested by management.
  • Perform other tasks or projects as assigned/instructed by Foreman and/or Crew Leader.
  • Frequently operates machinery such as a powered auger, compactor, sprayer, cutoff saw, and masonry saw.
Qualifications/Requirements:
  • Knowledge and experience in installing a variety of hardscape applications and assets.
  • Highly motivated, self-driven, and detailed oriented.
  • Must be professional in appearance and actions.
  • Great time management skills; available for seasonal long hours, weekends, and although rare potential holidays.
  • Punctual and dependable with a can-do attitude.
  • Ability to work effectively with individuals of differing backgrounds, knowledge, and skill levels.
  • Physical demands require constantly moving, walking, stooping, kneeling, crouching, or crawling.
  •  Frequently required to stand and walk, lift and/or move up to 50 to over 100 lbs. with assistance. 
  • Constantly required to communicate with the ability to talk and hear. 
  • Requires to constantly work outdoors in all types of weather conditions and exposure to elements. This can include heavy to moderate noise, extreme proximity to moving equipment or machinery, proximity to electrical energy, exposure to tools and machines used in construction industries.
  • Be flexible and ready to learn new job skills on a weekly basis.
  • A first-aid certificate is a bonus.
  • Must have steel-toed boots.
Examples of duties:
  • Construct cement block retaining walls.
  • Install paving stones.
  • Level and prepare grades for playgrounds, yards, commercial properties.
  • Install natural sod or artificial turf.
  • Plant landscaping trees or bushes.
  •  Work as a heavy equipment assistant.
  • Install and paint panel fencing.
  • New duties all of the time based on the customer's needs.




    About House 2 Home Landscaping:

    At House2Home Landscaping, our strong appreciation for the landscaping trade and our love for precise, functional, creative landscape design helps us shape every single project we work on.Our first priority is producing custom-made, quality landscaping designs that are executed with the highest attention to detail and are perfectly suited to meet the needs of each unique client. No matter how small or complex a project we are working on, the challenge of creating practical, functional, and aesthetically beautiful pieces is the most rewarding thing we can do.

This can include heavy to moderate noise, extreme proximity to moving equipment or machinery, proximity to electrical energy, exposure to tools and machines used in construction industries.']

title: General Labor - General Packer - Hamilton, ON 12 Hour Continental Shift Rotation
description:
Job Description

Are You Ready to Make It Happen at Mondelēz International?

Join our Mission to Lead the Future of Snacking. Make It With Pride.

You independently operate and maintain at least one process, equipment or systems following autonomous maintenance (AM) standards and use your technical skills to improve line and/or system performance to meet business needs.

How you will contribute

You are a key ingredient in changing how the world snacks. With coaching, you will operate and maintain equipment to deliver on our safety, quality, cost, delivery, sustainability and morale targets. You will use execute all standard work processes on your equipment using AM (autonomous maintenance) and PM (progressive maintenance) standards and ensure that safety processes are observed, and that quality assurance activities are performed. You will understand the losses in their area and equipment and report them.

What you will bring

A desire to drive your future and accelerate your career. You will bring experience and knowledge in:

  • Operating machines with coaching
  • Safety and quality standards for operating machines
  • Reading and writing, and fluently conversant in the language of communication as appropriate to the site
  • Collaborating well in a diverse work environment

Education

  • High School Diploma (required)

Experience / Skills

  • Experience in warehouse environment strongly preferred.
  • Previous experience using production line type machinery or food processing machinery would be an asset.

Business Unit Summary

We are the second-largest snacking company in Canada and in the top 10 food companies in North America. We make and distribute delicious household favorites including Cadbury, Oreo, Mr. Christie and Maynards. We are an ambitious business—in the past few years alone, we have invested $250 million in our Ontario-based factories. Our community of over 2,600 employees is based across Canada, with our head office on Bloor Street West in Toronto. Canada plays a strategic role for Mondelēz North America and globally. We are proud of our “local-first” commercial focus that enables us to take ownership of our own market and make more, faster decisions closer to our consumers. We are also proud of our top 100 position on Forbes magazine’s 2019 Canada’s Best Employers list.

If you are applying to a position in Canada, accommodations for applicants with disabilities or other grounds protected by human rights legislation are available upon request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the employment selection process. For all internal and external applicants who require accommodation in the recruitment and selection process please contact 847-943-5460 for assistance/support.

Job Type

Regular

Manufacturing core

Manufacturing

title: Construction Lead (Subway Projects)
description:
Company Description

We are a global architecture, engineering, planning, and technology firm defining the cities of tomorrow.

By connecting design and technology, we change how people experience their built environment. We work across disciplines to create the intelligent systems, sustainable buildings, and efficient infrastructure that shapes the way people live, move, learn, and heal.

With over 3,000 employees and 60 offices around the world, we understand what it takes to work locally and scale globally.

At IBI, we’re defining the cities of tomorrow.

Job Description

IBI Group’s Toronto office is seeking an experienced Construction Lead to work on major transit/subway projects in Toronto.  Reporting to the Project Director, the Construction Lead will be responsible for leading and managing a multidisciplinary construction team in the execution of the Yonge-North Subway Extension (YNSE) project under various procurement delivery models (i.e. Alliance, CMAR, Progressive DB, etc.). The successful candidate will also be responsible for building a collaborative team to work initially to deliver the project through to commissioning of the project. This individual should be highly organized and a project driver exhibiting extremely strong project management skills with the ability to work with individuals across multiple disciplines.

Most Of The Things You’ll Work On:

  • Reporting to the Project Lead, oversee the entire construction effort between the Construction Team and CA Construction Team to ensure project is constructed in accordance with design, budget and schedule
  • Collaborate with Contracting Authority and applicable Contracting Authority Consultants to understand and document Project scope and identify any risks (including gaps in scope, site readiness, and in-market schedule) and develop mitigation strategies for such identified risks
  • Plan, coordinate and/or supervise activities of all company personnel working in accordance with the overall program objectives
  • Oversee the review of  work plans, construction submissions, commissioning and operations submissions and any other submissions by the Construction Team; ensuring that the project is conducted with the highest standards of quality and integrity
  • Oversee the overall coordination between Construction and Quality Team to ensure implementation of the quality program and audits for Construction activities
  • Provide oversight on the monthly report to Contracting Authority outlining findings of any incomplete work, discrepancy or inconsistency with intended dimensions, materials or finishes, substandard performance or failures, or other noncompliance/ non-conformance
  • Review, monitor, and report on Project Co's construction schedules and activities on site; Provide opinions on the validity of the construction schedule as presented by Project Co in coordination with the Owner’s Engineer
  • Monthly reporting to the CA on general project status, milestone activities, NCRs, Risks, and any additional commentary
  • Seeks innovation and cost effectiveness during the project lifecycle.
  • Ensure all company, client, and project policies, procedures, standards, etc., are adhered to
  • Provide oversight to support Contracting Authority, if requested, in liaising with municipalities, utility companies government agencies, Indigenous communities and Early Works Contractors to assess and determine requirements that need to be incorporated into the Project and advise on potential impacts to the schedule
  • Mentor and lead team members in their development and growth
Qualifications

You’ll Need To Have:

  • Ideally a minimum 20 years experience with a University or College degree/diploma; 10 years of construction management experience
  • Must have very strong experience in transit stations (specifically subways).  Experience with other complex P3 level projects are an asset
  • Must have expert knowledge on Construction Safety Standards with ability to drive safety culture
  • Have an integrated team approach to construction; IPD experience an asset.
  • Must be a proven people and project leader with solid experience managing and developing multidisciplinary teams
  • Results-oriented with an extremely high work ethic, excellent communication, planning skills stringent quality standards, and a can-do attitude
  • Thorough knowledge of all aspects of modern construction techniques including incorporation of digital modeling and tools for efficiency in construction and for the benefit of client life cycle


Additional Information

We are currently in a work from home model during COVID-19, but when we do return to the office we're located at 55 St. Clair Ave West, this office is steps away from St. Clair station and is easily accessible by bike, TTC and car. Occupying 7 floors, with over 700 employees, it is the largest office at IBI Group. The floors are open concept and represent our collaborative approach to projects.

IBI Group provides a competitive benefit package and pays association dues and licensing fees.

As an Equal Opportunity Employer, we are proud to support the growth and equality of our people through initiatives like our Mentorship Program, Global Women’s Network, and Diversity & Inclusion Council. We welcome applications from all suitably qualified candidates regardless of age, race, disability, gender reassignment, marriage and civil partnership, pregnancy and maternity, religion or belief, sex and sexual orientation. We thank all applicants for their interest. However, only those selected for an interview will be contacted.

As part of IBI Group's selection process, candidates may be requested to consent to background checks relevant to the role under consideration for, prior to receiving a job offer. These could include: work references, education and credential confirmation, employment verification, identity check, credit report, criminal offence and driver’s license record. Candidates will also need to confirm they are fully vaccinated in accordance with IBI Group’s mandatory vaccination policy in Canada. 

We request applicants submit RESUME AND PORTFOLIO highlighting relevant work experience. Please limit PDF files to 10MB or provide a WebLink.

title: Sales Professional, Tile and Stone Installation Systems, Toronto
description:
ARDEX Americas (www.ArdexAmericas.com), is the Global industry leader in the manufacturing and development of high-performance specialty building materials.

We are immediately hiring for a SALES PROFESSIONAL with experience of developing business opportunities with commercial contractors, installers, architects, and distributor partners and retailers.

Industry experience is essential (experience with tile and stone installation systems, flooring levelling systems, polished concrete systems). This is a field sales position to cover ONTARIO, with a home base and focus on TORONTO. Up to 30% territory travel with some overnight.

Responsibilities:

  • Drive, develop, promote and grow sales of ARDEX products and systems throughout territory
  • Develop and maintain solid working relationships with distributors, contractors, specifiers and other key business influencers
  • Retain current accounts and prospect new business development
  • Successfully launch and promote new products via hands on product demonstrations, presentations & professional product displays
  • Collaborate with Corporate resources such Technical, Customer Service, Marketing, Logistics etc., to deliver exceptional standards of service to ARDEX customers
  • Drive lead generation through jobsite visits, lead generation services, cold calls etc.
  • Develop and successfully execute field sales action plans
  • Achieve and exceed targets, goals and objectives, as established with Sales Manager
  • Represent ARDEX as an industry leader through exceptional professional standards, and a 'customer first' approach.

Keyword: sales, tile, installation, installer, contractor, flooring, ARDEX, manufacturer, building products, concrete, project manager, cement, account manager, manufacturer, representative
Required Experience:
  • Minimum 5 years outside sales experience and / or minimum 5 years knowledge of building materials industries is required
  • Knowledge of flooring installation systems is highly desirable. Tile and Stone installation experience is preferred
  • Able to confidently and professionally conduct product presentations and demonstrations
  • Able to operate non power and power tools. Demonstrates good mechanical or hands-on skills to meet the needs of intensive and physically demanding field support and service
  • Technically proficient and familiar with architectural specifications and construction design elements
  • High level of energy and enthusiasm for the business and be customer-driven and professional
  • Self-starter. Able to use initiative, work and adapt to a fast paced and changing market
  • Able to make sound business decisions, influence, be assertive and close a sale
  • Proficient in digital systems: Microsoft Word, Email, Internet, PowerPoint and CRM systems
  • Demonstrates ARDEX Growth Mindset competencies: Innovation, Open Mindedness, Collaboration, Agility, Initiating Action and Execution, Ownership
  • Must possess a valid driver’s license and a clean driving record. Must be able to travel throughout assigned territory as per advertised amounts, including some overnight
  • Must be able to lift to 70 pounds (on occasion) with a carrying capability of 55 pounds

Education

  • College degree preferred or minimum high school diploma /GED and industry related experience

From: ARDEX Americas

title: Labourer
description:
Do you like warehouse work? Do you want to start your career in warehouse?
Are you physically fit with a good attitude and eager to work immediately?
Do you like to work in a fast-paced, fun and inclusive work environment?

If your answer is YES! We have an exciting entry-level warehouse labor work located West of Edmonton!










Advantages
This company in West of Edmonton offers you
- Great entry-level position for you who wants to get your foot into a warehousing environment
- Great starting wages from $17 per hour
- Benefits available after the first pay
- Full-time hours with shifts flexibility
- Great training and work environment
- Parking area available
- Lunchroom is provided

Responsibilities
As a Warehouse Worker, your typical workday includes
- Order Picking/stacking of Tires manually
- Putting away the product in an orderly fashion
- Manually loading and unloading products from trailers
- Consistently lifting up to 50lbs
- Working in a team-oriented environment
- Maintaining a safe and clean warehouse
- Maintaining inventory and cycle counts

Qualifications
What do you need for this warehouse worker position
- Entry-Level work with no experience is necessary!
- Great work ethic with a strong focus on punctuality and attendance
- Must be comfortable repetitively lifting 50lbs
- Location is not on a transit route, reliable transportation is an absolute must

Summary
If you are interested in applying for this warehouse worker position, please apply today!

How to apply:
1) email your resume to justine.babicz@randstad.ca
2) call our branch number 780-420-1120 today and look for Justine
3) apply online at randstad.ca today!

We are also accepting referrals and offer a bonus that will put extra cash into your pocket - ask us about it to learn more.

Randstad Canada is committed to fostering a workforce reflective of all peoples of Canada. As a result, we are committed to developing and implementing strategies to increase the equity, diversity and inclusion within the workplace by examining our internal policies, practices, and systems throughout the entire lifecycle of our workforce, including its recruitment, retention and advancement for all employees. In addition to our deep commitment to respecting human rights, we are dedicated to positive actions to affect change to ensure everyone has full participation in the workforce free from any barriers, systemic or otherwise, especially equity-seeking groups who are usually underrepresented in Canada's workforce, including those who identify as women or non-binary/gender non-conforming; Indigenous or Aboriginal Peoples; persons with disabilities (visible or invisible) and; members of visible minorities, racialized groups and the LGBTQ2+ community.

Randstad Canada is committed to creating and maintaining an inclusive and accessible workplace for all its candidates and employees by supporting their accessibility and accommodation needs throughout the employment lifecycle. We ask that all job applications please identify any accommodation requirements by sending an email to

accessibility@randstad.ca

to ensure their ability to fully participate in the interview process.

title: Labourer
description:
Labourer









Location: Edmonton, AB, Canada Job ID: R9882 Job Status: Full-Time



Share:











Apply Now



Ledcor Employee? Apply internally in Workday.













Description





Job Summary:

You are a knowledgeable General Laborer that has extensive experience working in an industrial shop setting. We are looking for a General Laborer to support us in our Module Fabrication shop in Nisku, AB. The successful candidate will be responsible for working in accordance with quality, safety, and efficiency standards.







Responsibilities:



+ Completing work in the module yard such as cutting grass, moving materials, loading and unloading materials


+ Perform manual labor such as shovel / broom work, digging, pulling and removing material, job site cleans up and various tasks associated with module fabrication


+ Competently operate equipment, hand tools and lift items up to 50 lbs.


+ Working with and assisting trades as required


+ Meet and follow all safety requirements and applicable safety policies





Requirements:



+ Must have at least 1 years of previous experience in oil field or general construction


+ Module yard experience considered an asset


+ Knowledge and tools, materials and equipment used in modular yard


+ Strong attention to detail with the ability to problem solve


+ Vaccinations against COVID 19 are not required on site, however masks (provided by Ledcor) must be worn when social distancing is not possible





Additional Information:


Company Description


Ledcor Industrial offers an integrated range of services from construction, engineering, and maintenance to pipe fabrication and module assembly. We offer turnkey solutions to our oil and gas clients and have built some of the continent’s largest oil and gas projects.




But when you work for Ledcor, your experience will go far beyond the project. Do you want a career that means more? Join our True Blue team now!




Employment Equity


At Ledcor we believe diversity, equity, and inclusion should be part of everything we do. We are proud to be an equal-opportunity employer. All qualified individuals, regardless of race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or any other identifying characteristic are encouraged to apply.



Our True Blue team consists of individuals from all backgrounds who contribute diverse perspectives and experiences to Ledcor. We are committed to continuing to build on our culture of empowerment, inclusion and belonging.




View our full Inclusion & Diversity statement here (https://www.ledcor.com/who-we-are/inclusion-and-diversity) .

May 6, 2022

title: Skilled Labourer
description:
Our Skilled Labourers earn a competitive hourly wage based on experience. We offer an exceptional extended health plan including medical, dental, and vision. Our other benefits include an employee assistance program, educational assistance, professional development, internal growth opportunities, the opportunity for national career movement, and a healthy work/life balance. If this sounds like the opportunity for you, apply today!

Position Summary:

The Skilled Labourer is in good physical condition and provides construction work and support required to ensure timely project completion. The Skilled Labourer follows good work practices and procedures and sets a good example for new crew members and co-workers. The Skilled Labourer may: operate a variety of equipment and instruments, including hand and power tools of all types; clean and prepare sites; clean up rubble and debris; remove mold, asbestos lead and other hazardous materials.

Responsibilities:

  • Leads by example and follows all health and safety policies and procedures.
  • Strives to continually improve through specific development plans.
  • Accepts direction from the Lead Hand, Lead Water Technician and/or Lead Carpenter and more experienced co-workers.
  • Participates in good housekeeping discipline on the job to ensure a safe non-cluttered workplace and to minimize cross contamination.
  • Learns and practices correct procedures, especially when environmental work is required.
  • Adheres to company policy regarding acceptable standards to follow at a customer site i.e. smoking policy etc.
  • Displays good manners and attitude toward the property owner, occupants of the property, co-workers and sub-contractors.
  • Is willing and able to be on-call 24/7 for after hour's emergency work.
  • Directs customer questions or concerns to the most senior company person at the job site.
  • Looks out for and assists co-workers.

Qualifications:

  • Previous construction or cleaning work preferred.
  • Experience with hand tools & power tools preferred.
  • High School graduate or equivalent.

ARE YOU READY TO JOIN OUR TEAM?

If you feel that you would be right for this position, please fill out our initial 3-minute, mobile-friendly application so that we can review your information. We look forward to meeting you!

title: Night Labourer - Temporary
description:
$19/hour - General Labourer - Temporary Project

We are actively recruiting 2 temporary labourer(s) for an overnight store renovation project in SK - Regina .This job is very physically demanding. You would be assisting in moving product and shelving units,discarding of construction material and assisting with other general labourer tasks.
  • Rate: $19/hour + vacation pay
  • Location: SK - Regina
  • Project Dates: May 22nd - October 13th, 2022
  • Availability: Sunday night – Friday morning shift, 1030pm-7am – times may change
  • Hours/week: Hourly - Up to 40 hours/week hours a week

Job Responsibilities: 
  • Moving product and fixtures in a big box retailer
  • Disposing of construction material
  • Cleaning store sections
  • Other general labour tasks as required
  • Physical requirements: Lifting up to 50lbs, on feet for entire shift. 

Successful Candidate Qualifications: 

  • Retail experience considered an asset 
  • Positive attitude, reliable, good communicator and fluent in English
  • PPE required: CSA Approved Safety footwear, Work Gloves, Hard Hat, Safety Vest
  • Reliable way to get to the location (transit will be limited due to nights)
  • Physically able to lift up to 50lbs, remain on feet for entire shift and work in a physically demanding position.
How to apply:
If this job sounds like the perfect fit for you, please apply online and be prepared to provide:
  • a relevant resume
We look forward to hearing from you!

title: General Labour
description:
Are you looking for immediate work and that makes an immediate positive impact? Are you the type of person who loves diversity in your work day? We are now hiring for General Labour with a real passion for working with their hands to chip in at clients' jobsites. General Labour can be found on almost all sites, performing a wide range of tasks from very easy to hazardous. They are at building, highway, and heavy construction sites; residential and commercial sites; tunnel and shaft excavations; and demolition sites. Many of the jobs they perform are physically strenuous and may require special training or experience. Other jobs require little skill and can be learned quickly.

The job duties of a General Labour vary, sometimes even day-to-day at the same site. They may include cleaning and preparing a jobsite, loading and delivering materials; using different tools and machines, such as blowtorches; driving forklifts; reading levels; operating lifts; and manning power drills, grinders, saws, pressure washers, and water spraying equipment. Labourers set up and take down ladders, scaffolding, and other temporary structures. They help carpenters, masons, and other specialized contractors.

General Labour and helpers work in all fields of construction, commercial jobs, and other businesses, and the demand for these workers should mirror the level of overall activity. We would love to add more General Labour like you.

Shift Timing - 1st Shift (Day) and Weekends 

Responsibilities Include:

* Moving, securing, installing, building, loading, or unloading materials

* Assisting in the building or construction of various things

* Some specialized tasks may require on-the job training

* Effectively using heavy and light equipment, depending on the jobsite/assignment

* Moving items from place to place, according to direction from the site supervisor

* Moving dirt or other material as directed in plans or by supervisor

Qualifications:

* There is no minimal educational requirement, but specialized training can help Labourers advance

* Experience on commercial construction sites”.

* Verifiable work history that shows professional skills and experience

* Strong work ethic

PeopleReady is an equal opportunity employer, and we value diversity. We do not discriminate based on race, religious affiliation, color, national origin, gender, age, marital status, sexual orientation, gender identity, veteran status, disability, or any other basis protected by law. We will get to know you and connect you with jobs that match your skills, experience and preferences. We work hard every single day to find jobs so each employee has opportunity and variety in their work.

title: Labourer
description:
Forbes Bros is currently recruiting full-time Laborer's for projects within Yorkton, Saskatchewan.


Responsibilities:

The responsibilities of this position include, but are not limited to:

  • Digging and backfilling trenches
  • Pulling and placing underground and overhead cable
  • Carry and move materials as needed
  • Operating small equipment and hand tools
  • Spotting for vehicles and equipment
  • Site setup and cleanup, ensuring trash, debris and potential dangerous materials from the construction site are removed
  • Assisting craft/crew members with work
  • Development of skills on varied and challenging tasks
  • Perform additional labourer duties as assigned

Preferred Qualifications:

As the successful candidate, you will have:

  • Ability to work outdoors in all weather conditions
  • Must be in good physical condition and able to lift up to 23 kg (50 lbs)
  • Must have general knowledge of the principals involved in the operation of construction and maintenance methods and procedures
  • Able to work well with others as well as independently
  • Able to follow instruction and adhere to safe work practices
  • Attention to detail
  • Motivated
  • Punctual

Additional Details:

This position requires candidates to:

  • Have and maintain a valid driver's license and acceptable driver's abstract.
  • Successfully complete pre-employment drug and alcohol testing
  • Travel and work overtime as required

What We Offer:

Forbes Bros offers an attractive compensation package that includes a competitive salary, comprehensive benefit plan and a rewarding pension program. Forbes Bros has an open and team oriented culture that focuses on communication, innovation and respect in the workplace!

Forbes Bros Ltd. (FBL) is an equal opportunity employer committed to best practice recruiting and hiring, to promote gender equity and workplace diversity. We thank all applicants for their interest, however only those candidates who meet the requirements noted and who earn an invitation to interview will be contacted.

title: Labourer - Full-time
description:
Company Description

ARE YOU CUT OUT FOR KENNY U-PULL?

Get ready to immerse yourself in a professional playground of cars.

Become our clients’ ally to provide the best customer service. At Kenny U-Pull, we adhere to high operational standards to maintain an organized and efficient workspace where we repurpose cars and their parts to give them a second life. Join our team in one of North America’s leading companies in the self-service auto part industry.

It’s simple: we do it right. We aim for excellence.

This position is eligible for an annual retention bonus of up to $1150

Job Description

  • Depollute vehicles: this means removing chemical fluids and certain parts such as the battery in order to prepare the vehicle for display in the customer's yard;
  • Dismantle wheels and classify tires;
  • Clean, test and classify batteries in order to install them in the sales displays;
  • Filling cans with certain liquids and affixing cards;
  • Prepare, organize and clean the yard;
  • Maintain a clean and orderly work area.
Qualifications

  • Excellent physical condition
  • Reliability, diligence and punctuality
  • Health and safety awareness
  • Versatility
  • Good manual dexterity


Additional Information

  • Work schedule: Monday to Friday from 7:00 AM to 4:00 PM
  • Permanent, full-time position (40 hours / week) 
  • Possibility of working indoors and outdoors

What we offer:

  • Group insurance (after 3 months);
  • Group RRSP with employer contribution (after 6 months);
  • Overtime at time and a half after 44 hours;
  • Bonus plan up to $1150/ year
  • Employee discount;
  • Free parking;
  • Paid steel toe boot from day 1;
  • Uniform provided from day 1

American Iron & Metal and its subsidiaries offer equal employment opportunities to everyone. Only applicants selected for an interview will be contacted

title: General Laborer (Construction)
description:
Job Description: All-purpose Renovation Contractor
Go Industries is looking for an ambitiousAll-purpose Renovation Contractor. You will be responsible for all renovation work including layout, installation, and repairs for our client’s commercial, industrial, and residential customers. 

The Opportunity:
We are looking for an experienced full-time All-purpose Renovation Contractor to join our prestigious heating and cooling client’s team. This is a full-time opportunity with plenty of opportunities to learn and grow. 
 
Key Responsibilities:
  • Must have expertise in multiple types of repairs, maintenance, and remodeling.
  • Must possess basic construction skills, be organized, and effectively communicate.
  • General Carpentry - Rough and Finish.
  • Ability to Upgrades / Remodel / Refresh / Remodel all types of commercial, residential, and industrial spaces. 
  • Painting Interior and Exterior.
  • Drywall Repair/Patching / Caulking.
  • Electrical knowledge.
  • Minor Plumbing and Minor Electrical Knowledge.
  • Flooring Repair and Installation.
  • Ceramic Tile Installation.
  • Handyman, General Home Repairs and Maintenance Work.

Qualifications:
  • 2-5 years of renovation experience. 
  • Valid Driver’s license with clean abstract.
  • Able to work at multiple sites in Ontario Primarily in the Hamilton area.
  • Experience working in other trades is a bonus. (HVAC/Plumbing/Electrical)
  • Ceramic tile installation is a bonus.

Pay rate: 
  • Up to $40.00 per hour for the right candidate. 
 




    About Go Heating/Natural Direct Canada:

    GO Heating & Cooling has been proudly serving the communities Simcoe County, Bruce, Grey, Kawartha Lakes, Muskoka, Dufferin, Peel, York, Durham Region and surrounding areas since 1977. Our reputation has been built on Quality Service, Honesty and Integrity and this has made us the service provider of choice. Over the years, the GO company has grown but our commitment to our core values and to our community remains the same today as it did when we first opened our doors. Today we’re more than just furnaces and air conditioners – we’re home comfort experts. We know what it takes to keep your home healthy and comfortable, each and every day.

title: General Labourer
description:
Company Overview:

Tiercon Corp. is an automotive supplier committed to the design, manufacture and assembly of quality exterior trim and assembled systems used as original equipment in the automotive market. Headquartered in Stoney Creek, the plants have design, mold, paint, assembly and testing capabilities. Tiercon manages 5 sites across 2 cities employing approximately 550 people throughout Canada. Tiercon is seeking knowledgeable, self-directed, experienced and hardworking individuals interested in the automotive industry as a General Labourer at our 591 Arvin facility.

Job Summary & Reporting Structure:

Reporting to the Production Supervisor, the General Labourer is responsible for performing a variety of production tasks, including but not limited to, loading and packing customer product. Employees will be responsible for adhering to the policies and procedures outlined in the TS16949 Quality System and practice continuous improvement wherever possible.

Wages starting at $17.15

Shift premium and shift incentive available for 4am, 1:00pm and 4:00pm shifts.

Shifts Available:

  • 4:00am - 1:00pm
  • 7:15am - 4:15pm
  • 1:00pm - 10:00pm
  • 4:00pm - 1:00am

Responsibilities:

  • Package product according to customer specifications, ensuring that all product is handled in a proper, safe manner at all times, no partial boxes are shipped, similar parts are packaged together and boxes are properly labeled.
  • Load product on production racks and visually inspect ongoing product for defects, ensuring non-conforming product is segregated from production line.
  • Sand product off line when required.
  • Remove product from production racks upon processing and place empty racks into designated buggies.
  • Maintain clean and orderly work area both throughout and after the shift.
  • Notify supervisor immediately of any equipment or production problems.
  • Comply with company work and safety rules at all times and report all accidents, incidents and hazards immediately.
  • Participate in corrective/preventative action when required.
  • Practice continuous improvement; identify processes or procedures that will result in production of non-conforming product, or identifying any processes or procedures that can be improved and result in better company performance.
  • Adhere to all procedures and policies as outlined in the TS 16949 quality system.
  • Perform other duties assigned from time to time by supervisor.

Qualifications:

  • Grade 12 or equivalent work experience
  • Manufacturing experience preferred
  • Demonstrated communication skills
  • Demonstrated ability to follow work instructions
  • Demonstrated organizational skills


Tiercon Corp. is proud to be an inclusive and equal opportunity employer as set out in the Ontario Human Rights Code and the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act, 2005. At Tiercon we are committed to ensuring the workplace is free from discrimination. Tiercon Corp. welcomes and encourages applications from everyone including persons with disabilities. During our hiring process, we will notify job applicants that accommodations are available upon request. If a selected job applicant requests accommodation, Tiercon will consult with the individual and provide or arrange for the appropriate accommodation taking into account the applicant's disability-related needs. Please contact Tiercon Human Resources athr@tiercon.com.

title: Laborer
description:
Overview:

Celanese is a Fortune 500 global chemical innovation company that engineers and manufactures chemicals used in products essential to everyday living. Headquartered in Dallas, TX, we employ over 7,700 dedicated people working between 43 facilities across 18 countries. We are committed to employee growth and creating shareholder value to ensure continued opportunities make a difference. Our company focuses on the safety of its employees, provides competitive compensation (including benefits starting day 1), and emphasizes giving back to the community. For more information about Celanese and our products please visit www.celanese.com

Responsibilities:
  • Responsible for carrying out of various general labour duties using a variety of hand tools and motorized equipment in a safe, competent, and efficient manner, all of which contribute to the overall function and operation of the overall facility.
  • Operate general purpose trucks of 5-ton or less (without air brakes)
  • Ability to operate a forklift, man-lift, scissor lift, skid-steer loader, and tractor
  • Delivery of goods on, and off plantsite
  • Understanding of the Laborer roles, responsibilities and accountabilities and has demonstrated their ability to competently fulfill these requirements
Qualifications:
  • 5-10 Years experience in the role
  • High School Diploma or recognized equivalent
  • Provincial Vehicle Operating License (Alberta)
  • Fully trained to operate a forklift, man-lift, scissor lift, skid-steer loader, and tractor
  • Operate crane and perform very simple rigging work in a competent manner
  • Safe truck loading and unloading practices for gas cylinders, drums and general parts
  • Safe use of snow removal equipment (Plow-truck, Sanding-truck, backpack blower, etc.)
  • General knowledge of machine lubricants and steps taken to complete oil changes on equipment
  • General knowledge of Safe Work Permitting requirements

Celanese is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Celanese does not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, age, non-disqualifying physical or mental disability, national origin, veteran status or any other basis covered by appropriate law. All employment is decided on the basis of qualifications, merit, and business need.

title: General Labourer
description:
Overview:

Career wheels spinning but getting nowhere? Put yourself in the driverâ€™s seat and get some traction with Fountain Tire! We are searching for a General Labourer in our Kamloops Retread Plant (140 Lafarge Road, RETREAD)  

 

What do we offer?  At Fountain Tire Retread youâ€™ll have a great place to work:

  • The opportunity to work with an excellent team and great customers in a safe and respectful environment
  • Comprehensive benefit programs for you and your family, including a RRSP program with company matching
  • Discounts for you and your family on tires, parts and services at all Fountain Tire locations
  • The opportunity for growth into apprenticeship and leadership positions
  • Easy access by car to our plant
  • Quick hiring process - we need people asap!

Your duties will include:

  • Initial tire inspections to determine which casings are suitable for retreading, and identify required repairs
  • Buff tire casings using automated buffing equipment and skive and/or section tires requiring repairs
  • Operate manual and computer controlled equipment as part of the retreading process
  • Operating curing chamber, and/or curing presses
  • Provide final inspection of tires

What does it take to get on track?

  • While previous experience is an asset we provide onsite training
  • Ability to work shift work
  • A dedicated team player
  • Proven ability to work in a fast paced and physical environment
  • Basic computer skills
  • Ability to consistently lift 50 pounds and stand for long periods of time

Join Fountain Tire and be part of an organization that rewards achievements, supports your development and provides you with the tools, training and knowledge to be successful. Apply online today!

title: General Labourer -Sault St Marie
description:
Company Description

ARE YOU CUT OUT FOR AIM RECYCLING?

Founded in 1936 in Montreal, Canada, AIM is a private company with multiple sites located in Canada, the United States, Mexico, Europe and Asia. Recognized as a world leader in metal recycling and solder manufacturing for a broad range of industries, we focus on creating high-quality products, setting AIM apart. Our continually expanding company offers many exciting career opportunities, a stimulating work environment, competitive salaries and an excellent employee benefits program.

Job Description

American Iron & Metal, a Hamilton based Metal Recycling Yard has an opening for an enthusiastic individual to fill a General Labour position at our AIM Recycling Sault St Marie.

The successful candidate will be responsible for supporting and ensuring the smooth and safe day to day activities in our yard. There are many potential growth opportunities within our organization for a career minded candidate!

Duties Will Include

  • Working both inside the warehouse and outside in our yard
  • Sorting and processing metal pieces
  • Operating a tow motor and or forklift on occasion to tip or dump bins
  • Other manual labour duties will apply

 

Qualifications

  • Reading, writing and basic math skills are required
  • Computer literacy is considered an asset as the position evolves
  • Must be able to stand and walk for long periods of time
  • Must be able to lift up-to 50lbs
  • Must be able to work independently as well as in a team orientated environment
  • Ability to work in outside in all-weather conditions
  • Safety orientated
  • Tow motor or forklift license considered an asset however we will provide training to the right candidate

 



Additional Information

We Offer:

  • RRSP Match
  • Dental care
  • Extended health care
  • Vision care

American Iron & Metal and its subsidiaries offer equal employment opportunities to everyone. The masculine form is used solely to make the text easier to read. Only applicants selected for an interview will be contacted.

title: Labourer
description:
Company Description

 

We are Chandos

Inclusion. Collaboration. Ingenuity. Innovation.

These values speak to our desire to create places where all people belong, listening and learning from one another in a way that sparks ideas and leads to positive changes in our industry and community. They also demonstrate our commitment to a diverse, equitable, and inclusive culture. And, if they resonate with you too, we should talk!

We are 100 percent employee owned and proud to be the first and largest B Corp certified commercial builder in North America, meaning we put our values at the centre of everything we do. 

Continuous improvement is core to our success. Championing innovative and collaborative ways to build is just one example of that. Collaborative construction leads to more efficiency, cost savings, social value, and a much better working experience for everyone.

Every day, our teams are working to build places for people to live, work, learn, serve, and play. But above all, we’re building community. And, we’re looking for like-minded people to join us. Together, we can build a better world.

 

Job Description

The Labourer is required to perform tasks involving physical labour at commercial construction projects, and to operate a variety of hand and power tools.

Qualifications

  • Knowledge of safe operation of basic hand and power tools
  • Minimum of 1 year previous construction labour experience preferred
  • Knowledge of workplace safety, and safe lifting and handling procedures
  • Knowledge of First Aid and CPR preferred
  • Valid Drivers License and clean abstract preferred
  • Out of town work may be required. Work in all weather conditions.

 



Additional Information

Chandos is an equal opportunity employer and we are committed to a diverse, equitable, and inclusive culture and this includes our recruitment and hiring process. 

We recognize that our differences are our greatest strengths. We uncover talent. We nurture talent. And then we give people the tools they need to use their talent to create a positive impact.

  • We are 100% employee owned. Every person who works for Chandos can become an owner. There is only one class of units at Chandos, because we believe everyone should be treated equal. We talk about being an entrepreneurial-minded organization and you can be sure we mean it!
  • Competitive wages
  • Well rounded employer paid benefits program including health, dental, vision care and employee assistance program
  • RRSP matching program to aid and prepare employees for long-term financial security
  • Educational assistance for employees who wish to pursue job-performance enhancing education
  • Recognition and annual salary reviews program
  • Leadership conferences that allow employees to connect and collaborate
  • Regular company-wide engagement opportunities

Together, we can build a better world.', 'Educational assistance\xa0for employees who wish to pursue job-performance enhancing education']

title: Laborers
description:
Job Description:

We are seeking Laborers for an immediate start with maintenance and construction experience. We are looking to build our roster of qualified candidates to work maintenance and projects throughout our organization.

 

This is an entry level position located in Calgary, AB. This will be a temporary contract beginning May 9th, 2022. Successful applicants must have completed WHMIS and CSTS certifcations and must have reliable transportation to and from site.  

 

What would you be doing?

 

  • Pull wire through conduits and holes in walls and floors.
  • Cleaning and maintenance of tools, and equipment  
  • Transport materials, tools, and equipment  
  • General facility maintenance
  • Load and unload materials, tools, and equipment  
  • Help equipment operators in various tasks
  • Assist electrical trades with daily tasks  

Does this sound like you?

  • Valid and up to date safety tickets: CSTS, WHMIS
  • Have a high regard for personal safety, safety of company assets and employees.
  • Self-motivated, capable of performing tasks with minimal supervision.
  • Able to prioritize and handle multiple tasks simultaneously.
  • Ability to work well under pressure and handle strict deadline.

Perks of the job:    

  • $20.90/per hour  
  • Monday-Friday schedule, with the ability to be home every night.
  • Working for a reputable and safety conscious company that values employees.  

Other important details:  

 

This position has beenâ€¯identifiedâ€¯as a safety sensitive position and will require completion of a drug and alcohol testing.  

Why ClearStream

 

We are the clear choice for rewarding opportunities and challenging careers. Joining our team would mean you would contribute to the quality of work we do and to the success of ClearStream along with the values we share. If you are driven, dedicated and have a passion for helping our customers bring resources to our world, then ClearStream is the team to join.

 

We are committed to creating a culture of equity, diversity, and inclusion, including fostering a safe and respectful environment that allows for diverse perspectivesâ€”a work environment in which all employees are valued and have an equal opportunity to achieve success. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability, protected veteran status, or other legally protected factors. #CSES2

title: Labourer
description:
Labourer I with Complete Energy Innovations Inc. (CEI)

Rate of Pay: $18.00 - $27.50 per hour

Job Summary

CEI specializes in the design and fabrication of pressure piping, fittings, vessels and structural fabrication. Our expertise includes a wide range of alloy materials and specialized fabrication and welding processes. We pair engineering and manufacturing capabilities to deliver tailored solutions for our clients. We understand quality begins on the inside, and we deliver excellence through value-based relationships and unwavering execution. We cater to the Oil & Gas, Energy, Petrochemical, Forestry, Mining and Refrigeration sectors.


Responsibilities

  • Perform tasks to support the welding and fitting crews
  • Organize plate & pipe as required
  • Assist with bolt-up & hydrotesting
  • Communicate with delivery personnel
  • Assist with material handling, loading & unload trucks using skidsteer
  • Keep shop, lunchroom & yard clean, tidy and organized including sweeping, emptying garbages
  • Cleans, checks for defects and shapes component parts, sometimes using a cutting torch
  • Welding parts, and may also build up worn parts by welding layers of high-strength hard-metal alloys onto them
  • Understand weld types, welding materials, tools, and equipment
  • Operate small power tools for the preparation or clean up of materials
  • Operate hand tools, band saw, overhead crane
  • Pick up and drop off materials, orders, consumables, inventory etc.
  • Provide general clean up and ongoing monitoring and maintenance of the work area
  • Skidsteer operating experience
  • Must be able to complete pre-access & incident drug and alcohol testing
  • Previous welding experience in a fabrication shop an asset
  • Must possess valid government issued photo identification
  • Training & experience with skid steer & overhead crane an asset

Work Conditions

  • Applicants that reside near Nisku, Beaumont, Leduc, or Edmonton and area. Only local candidates will be considered due to the location of this project and no travel allowances are provided.
  • Work will be primarily inside Fabrication facility, however some field work may also be required
  • This position will be project based
  • Work will be primarily in the shop and outdoors in various weather conditions
  • Ability to lift up to 50lbs, work at heights, be agile and able to go on/off equipment


CEI offers a safety focused, team based environment, a good work/home life balance schedule and competitive industry wages.

Rate of Pay: $18.00 - $27.50 per hour

title: Skilled Labourer
description:
Benefits/Perks
  • Competitive wages and a flexible working schedule (including opportunities to travel)
  • A challenging, fun atmosphere with a great team
  • Training opportunities and advancement within the company
  • Benefits available after a probationary period
  • Company purpose statement is “to provide our employees with a workplace that is considered a vehicle for personal and professional growth”. We hire based on our company values - The DRIVEN Principles.  You will be with like-minded individuals. 
 We are seeking a Skilled Labourer for our crew.  As theSkilled Labourer, you will perform a wide variety of projects for various clients across the city. Company OverviewEverLine Coatings and Services is a premier line painting and maintenance company that proudly has a location in Your City.  We provide high-quality line painting and pavement maintenance services for parking lots, roadways, parkades, and warehouses. In addition to painting services, we offer power sweeping, power washing, asphalt seal coating, crack filling, and more.  Our success is a direct result of our dedicated team. Every employee at EverLine is committed to providing complete customer satisfaction in the delivery of our services. We work hard, have fun, and have an amazing corporate culture. Our teams are DRIVEN. Dedicated, Resourceful, Integrity-Focused, Value-Based, Excelling, and Nourishing. Are you ready to make an impact?  Job SummaryOur Skilled Labourer utilize our specialized equipment and apply materials on pavement surfaces in order to provide maximum value for our clients' pavement assets.  Responsibilities WHAT YOU’LL DO
  • Use equipment to perform line painting, asphalt crack filling and seal coating, power washing, epoxy flooring, and more
  • Plan and facilitate the production of a high-quality project
  • Communicate job status daily with the Operations Manager
  • Maintain a safe, hazard-free job site 
  • Additional tasks as required 
 QualificationsWHAT YOU BRING
  • A Ontario driver’s license with a clean driving record (Driver’s Abstract is required) and a reliable mode of transportation
  • You are a self-motivated, critical thinker that likes to problem solve 
  • Ability to work night shift
  • You understand the importance of punctuality, organization, and attention to detail 
  • Ability to work in a physically demanding role with lots of walking, bending, and lifting (up to 75lbs)
  • Ability to work well independently unsupervised
  • Past experience with small engines (like lawnmowers) and/or paint sprayers is an asset
  • Desire to learn and exceed expectations
  • An Engineering educational background is an asset

title: General Labourer $16.98/hr - Brampton (FULL-TIME: AM/PM Shifts)
description:
Maple Leaf Foods Inc. is a Canadian consumer packaged meats company. At our facilities, our employees work with various types of meat including chicken and pork.

As this is a FULL-TIME permanent opportunity, we require availability of 40 hours/week on a permanent basis.
*********************************************************************************************************************************************
Please email resumes to hrwalker@mapleleaf.com

Do you love taking on new challenges? Are you detail-oriented with the ability to problem solve under tight deadlines? Do you love working in a fast-paced environment? If this sounds like you, Maple Leaf Foods has the role for YOU!

We are looking for upbeat general labourers who thrive working in a team-based challenging environment!

Snapshot of your role:

The successful candidate will place appropriate quantities of components into the trays.

What you’ll learn:
  • Organization and how to effectively meet or exceed productivity goals while maintaining high quality standards
  • Communicating effectively in a team-based environment
  • General troubleshooting and problem-solving in a fast paced-work environment
  • Time management by learning how to effectively manage workloads based on business needs
Required Skills, Ability & Experience:
  • Ability to read, write and communicate in English
  • Positive interaction and information sharing with Associates and Salaried Team
  • Active participation in Work Group meetings
  • Ability to obtain pertinent information, evaluate information objectively and explore alternative solutions to problems
  • Actively finding new and improved ways of completing tasks
  • Willing to try new things and assume additional responsibilities
  • Cross-shift communication
  • Interact and share information with employees at all levels (Team members, Lead Hands, Supervisors, Others). Actively participates in their work group.
  • Actively finds new and improved ways of completing tasks. Is willing to try new things and assume additional responsibilities (assists with changeovers, keeps up with line speed requirements)
  • Employees may be required to complete aptitude testing
  • For training purposes, you must be available to work the day shift
  • Must be able to handle all food products and work in a cold environment

Role Responsibilities:
  • Take an active role in changeover procedures and achieve line speed efficiencies
  • Visual quality checks of product against customer and internal specifications (Including foreign materials and weight checks)
  • Ability to maintain cleanliness of areas of responsibility
  • Adhere to individual Product Standard Operating Procedures for components and packaging materials
  • Must wear proper PPE and comply with Health and Safety requirements including ensuring power is shut down on equipment prior to specified tasks
  • Frequent reaching and standing are required
  • Other tasks as assigned

Quality & Food Safety Skills:
  • Thorough, accurate, and neat completion of forms for HACCP & Quality Assurance (including brining product to the lab for testing)
  • Product quality checks against customer and internal specifications
  • Ability to maintain cleanliness of areas of responsibility

Health and Safety:
  • Demonstrated ability to wear proper PPE and comply with safety requirements
  • Pushing, pulling and overhead reaching, bending and reaching
  • Lifting, bending, pushing and pulling
  • Reaching, gripping with both hands
  • Ability to lift up to 50lbs
  • Prolonged standing and climbing (ladder to the hopper)
Considering a Career at Maple Leaf Foods?

Maple Leaf Foods is Canada’s leading consumer-packaged protein company, headquartered in
Toronto, Ontario. We make high-quality, great tasting, nutritious and innovative food products under leading brands including Maple Leaf®, Maple Leaf Prime®, Maple Leaf Natural Selections®, Schneiders®, Schneiders Country Naturals® and Mina™. Our Company employs approximately 11,500 people in its operations across Canada and exports to more than 20 global markets including the U.S. and Asia.

Our people are passionate about the work they do and the products we make. As we move forward, we are determined to leverage their integrity and passion to continue to build a high-performing, values-based company enabled by high-performing, motivated and talented people.

We thank all applicants for their interest in exploring employment opportunities with Maple Leaf Foods however only those selected for an interview will be contacted. Applicants may be subject to a background check and must meet the security criteria designated for the position.

Maple Leaf Foods is committed to Employment Equity and maintaining a diverse workforce. Job applicants with a disability who require reasonable accommodation for any part of the application or hiring process can contact our Talent Attraction Team at

accommodations@mapleleaf.com

or 905-285-5862. Reasonable accommodations will be determined on a case-by-case basis and your request will be responded to as soon as possible.

title: Construction Labourers (Whitecourt)
description:
At Golderado, we're constantly pushing the limits of what we've done in the past - propelling ourselves toward bigger and better opportunities, while exploring new market sectors and services. So it only seems natural that we'd hire people who have their own voice and aren't afraid to use it. These are people who are simultaneously critical, creative and captivated by construction. They make our business their business, and follow a path that with continuous learning and an innovative spirit leads them to be recognized as leaders in the industry. We hire these types of people knowing they are as diverse as we are, and they come on board because they share our core values.

In the position of an upcoming job for Construction Labourer, we would ask you to do the following: Handle and distribute construction materials (e.g., load and unload vehicles with supplies, equipment and construction materials; move tools, equipment and construction materials to and from work areas; remove rubble and other debris) Assemble and dismantle scaffolding, ramps, catwalks, shoring and barricades at construction sites Prepare and clean up construction sites, move materials and equipment, and perform demolition, excavation and compaction activities Work on a wide variety of buildings, structures and premises including municipal sewer and water mains, roads, dams and bridges, tunnels, railways and canals

Sounds challenging and exciting right? Here are a few of the attributes and experience you need to be successful in this position:

  • You have one to two years of industrial construction experience and must have Construction Safety Training Systems (CSTS 09) Certificate, WHMIS 2015, Ground Disturbance (Original tickets required), Standard First Aid considered an asset.
  • You have experience in using compactors, and trampers (jumping jack) You are able to lift up to 13.5 kg (30 lbs) 9-23 Kg You have a safety conscious attitude and able to work with others in a team
  • Valid driver's license - Driver's Abstract is required
  • Drug and Alcohol Screening required.

Please note, there is NO TRAVEL or LIVING ALLOWANCE for this project.

title: Summer Student - General Labour (Burlington)
description:
JFE Shoji Power Canada Inc. is looking for Summer Students to join our teams in Burlington, ON!

Formerly Cogent Power Inc., JFE Shoji Power Canada Inc. is under new management.

While we appreciate all applicants, we will only be contacting those selected for an interview.

This position is located in Burlington, Ontario.

We have two facilities located on 801 & 845 Laurentian Drive, L7N 3W7 (Conveniently located by bus route) 

Salary: $18.12 an hour 

Hours: This position will be on a straight day shift from 7 am to 3 pm Monday to Friday. 

Position Type: Summer Contract, 4-month period (flexible). 

The Perks:

  • Travel Subsidy:
    • Starting April to September 2022 we will be providing a subsidy to all employees that incur the costs of travelling to work. These subsidies will be provided at the end of the month in the form of a gas card (i.e April subsidy will be provided by mid-May).
    • For those who take a city bus to work, we will be providing a transit pass.  
  • Perkopolis Account - get access to 5000 exclusive online discounts to stores & sports events (Hello Fresh, Apple, Indigo, Toronto Marlies, Toronto Raptors, etc.)
  • $100 Coverage on CSA-Approved Safety Boots
  • Summer Gatorade Program (Free Gatorades over the summer term)

As a Summer Student, you will be working in one of these Departments:

Wound Core Department: 

  • Receiving and inspecting incoming slit steels, assuring that they are correct for the intended order
  • Issue materials to work orders accurately and correctly on both paperwork order, and through the visual software system
  • Set up machine according to work order and operating procedures.
  • Produce distributed gap cores
  • Ensure product meets quality requirements as per work order, operating procedures and customers specifications
  • Follow priority schedule

Stacked Core Department:

  • Set up machine according to work order and operating procedures.
  • Material stacking into a repeating specific pattern
  • Ability to follow detailed prints & procedures to create the finished product
  • Work in a team environment ensuring group success
  • Issue materials to work orders accurately and correctly

About you, simply stated:

  • Ability to follow health & safety policies
  • Strong measuring skills 
  • Exceptional communication skills
  • Strong attention to detail
  • An eagerness to learn and dedication to improvement 
  • Mechanically inclined
  • Organized

Requirements: 

  • Must be 18 years of age or older
  • Must be able to show proof of enrolment at a post-secondary college or university
  • Must be legally entitled to work in Canada with a valid Social Insurance Number
  • Students on Visa's welcome to apply 

(Must be 18 years of age or older - students from all levels are welcome to apply. Training for your first two weeks is paid).

About JFE Shoji Power Canada Inc:

On September 20th, 2019, JFE Shoji Trade Corporation acquired 100% of the shares of Cogent Power Inc, from Tata Steel Europe. Grouped, the Cogent and JFE Shoji Steel America business make it possible for JFE Shoji to capture greater market share in the electrical steel market for both transformer and automotive products. The combination of Cogent and JFE Shoji has become one of the largest processors of electrical steel transformers in the world. JFE Shoji currently has many other production and processing facilities throughout Asia, as well as a facility in Tijuana, Mexico.

Globally, JFE Shoji enhanced the businessâ€™ competitiveness by sharing and integrating technical skills with deep business experience, which can be strongly applied to the global and North American markets. With this investment, JFE Shoji has one of the worldâ€™s leading processing and distribution functions for core design and manufacturing for transformers.

Based in Tokyo, JFE is one of the worldâ€™s largest steel producers with over 45,000 employees and operations globally. 

If you would like to be considered, please apply in confidence. For more information about starting your career with JFE Shoji Power Canada, please visit https://www.jfeshojipower.com/

Job Type: Summer, Contract, Students

Salary: $18.12 an hour

#JFEHP

title: Labourer
description:
You enjoy working with your hands and take pride in hard work. You are motivated by seeing the end product that you helped create. We're looking for labourers to join our crew in Saskatoon.
RESPONSIBILITIES
  • Load and unload vehicles with supplies, equipment and construction materials
  • Move tools, equipment, and construction materials to and from work areas
  • Operate hand and power tools
  • Clean up rubble and debris on a regular basis to ensure a safe and well maintained construction site
  • Move and level earth using shovels and rakes
  • Clean, lubricate, and refill tanks as instructed
  • Practice work place safety at all time
  • Perform other duties as required

REQUIREMENTS

  • Previous experience in a related position
  • Positive can-do attitude
  • Willing and able to easily follow direction
  • Able to lift 50lbs
  • Willing and able to work long hours in a fast-pace, physical environment

 

WHY SEYMOUR PACIFIC?

Seymour Pacific Developments is an industry leader in building multi-family homes with unparalleled speed and efficiency. We develop and build over 1,500 units a year by leveraging effective teamwork and industry expertise. We offer excellent wages and benefits, as well as a variety of training for employees who are motivated to succeed and want to expand their horizons. Seymour Pacific Developments is an equal opportunity employer, and is committed to following safe and inclusive hiring practices.
