title: Skilled Ground Worker in Fort McMurray, Alberta | Careers at North American Construction Group
description:
Position Scope

NACG is looking for a labourer to work on a remote mining site in the Fort McMurray area. You must be well-organized and favor safety above everything else.

 

Site: Fort Hills

Schedule: 14x7- 12 hours (paid for 11.5 hours) (Days and nights)

Accommodations: Camp provided

Transportation: Flights are provided to and from Edmonton or Calgary. All individuals utilizing provided flights must be fully vaccinated as per federal transportation regulations. Bussing provided from Fort McMurray to site (before and after shifts)

Overtime: Provided after 8 hours a day or 44 hours a week

 

The successful candidate will be required to join the International Union of Operating Engineers Local 955. 

 

Responsibilities

  • Successful applicants must to be willing to help out in all tasks for general labourer duties.
  • Familar with pumps/hoses & dewatering activities
  • Must have a valid driver's license.

**Must be physically fit and be able to lift 50 pounds** 

Summary

All successful candidates must:

  • Be proficient in English, both verbally and written
  • Have a valid Class 5 Driver’s License
  • Have experience as requested as mentioned above
  • Subject to Random Testing at: Suncor, Suncor Fort Hills and Kearl sites
  • Disclose COVID-19 vaccination status:
    • Fully immunized individuals must provide government issued proof of vaccination to be exempt from site testing requirements
    • Individuals not fully immunized may be subject to site COVID-19 testing requirements and associated costs
  • Undergo and successfully pass the following testing:
    • Breath Alcohol Test
    • Urine Drug Test
    • Fitness-to-Work Assessment
    • Audiometric Testing
    • Vision Screening
    • Criminal Record Check

    Shift, site, and start times are subject to change.

    All successful candidates MUST provide the following items prior to confirmation of their start date:

  • CSO or BSO Certification
  • Copy of Valid Class 5 Driver’s License
  • Copy of recent Driver’s Abstract
  • VOID cheque/direct deposit form
  • Silica Awareness
  • Hydrogen Sulphide Awareness

  • Once dispatched the following processes will occur:

  • Will receive a call from NACG to set up all required pre-employment testing
  • An email will be sent with all required New Hire Paperwork to be filled out
  • After all results are received by NACG candidates will be contacted by Site Admin to schedule orientation and confirm your start date and other site specific details.

  • Please note the entire On-boarding process can take anywhere from 3-8 business days.

     

    NO PHONE CALLS PLEASE, SUCCESSFUL CANDIDATES WILL BE CONTACTED VIA PHONE OR EMAIL.

    Overview

    North American Construction Group (NACG) has served as an industry leader in the heavy construction and mining industries for over 65 years.  In that time, we’ve proven ourselves as a safe and reliable contractor who can complete projects of any size and scope. We’ve also taken a number of bold steps forward to broaden our footprint, expanding to mines outside our provincial borders, and providing third-party maintenance services to clients and customers. 

    In addition to providing employees with rewarding careers, North American has a whole lot more to offer:

    • Significant Growth – As a company, NACG is rapidly expanding, and has practically doubled in size over the past year alone.
    • Long Term Contracts – With over $1 billion dollars in contracted work booked through 2023, NACG can provide long term employment solutions and numerous opportunities for advancement.
    • Commitment To Safety – With a top tier record for safety performance, NACG is dedicated to ensuring that everyone gets home safe, and constantly strives for a goal zero performance.
    • Competitive Compensation – NACG provides competitive compensation packages for all employees.

    North American Construction Group is an equal opportunity employer, and encourages applications from all qualified individuals. We are committed to providing a diverse and inclusive work environment where every employee feels valued and respected.

     

    Become a member of the North American family today!

title: General Labourer
description:
General Labourer

Apply now »



Date:Apr 29, 2022


Location: Toronto, ON, CA


Company: RailWorks




Job ID: 13543


Job Location: GTA





Don't Live in the GTA?


PNR Offers LOA coverage that offers Hotel and Food Allowance





What we Offer:


Unionized Benefits


Competitive Pay


Career and Growth Opportunities


Overtime Available





All Applicants must be in compliance with PNR RailWorks Inc. Mandatory COVID Vaccination Policy, which will be provided prior to hire.





Position Summary


Reporting to the Signal Construction Foreman, the Laborer is responsible for successfully completing day-to-day tasks by meeting or exceeding corporate and project goals for safety, quality, profitability and schedule, resulting in extreme customer satisfaction.





Primary/Essential Responsibilities and Duties



+ Embrace our safety culture and adhering to industry and company policies and procedures


+ Repair and/or replace turnout components as needed, such as switch points, frogs, plates etc.


+ Repair and/or replace track components as needed, such as rail, ties, plates, spikes, timber crossings etc.


+ Observes conditions of track, track beds, and track right-of-way to detect, report and repair problems or defects


+ Responsibly operates company vehicles and/or equipment and ensures all daily maintenance and inspections of the units are completed


+ Performs special duties as assigned by the Track Maintenance Foreman


+ Performs any administrative duties related to proper documentation as per PNR Quality Management System






Qualifications



+ Completion of Grade 12 or equivalent.


+ Familiarity with materials, methods, equipment and tools used in construction including their designs, uses, repair and maintenance.


+ Ability to read and understand instructions and work specifications.


+ Ability to understand and follow safety rules, policies, procedures and regulars.


+ Ability to work as a team, to jointly carry out assigned tasks.


+ Physical ability to perform the duties of the job.


+ Valid and clean driver’s license.


+ Ability to pass pre-employment background checks including drug screening.


+ Minimum 2 years of Construction related experience






Physical Requirements



+ Works outdoors at construction sites.


+ Frequently stands, walks, climbs, balances, lifts, bends, and moves objects up to 50 pounds.


+ Exposed to all weather conditions including very hot and very cold weather.


+ Exposed to loud noise.


+ Exposed to live track/trains and high voltage.


+ Ability to work rotating shifts


+ Travel Required






This job description is not intended to represent a complete, comprehensive list of all duties and responsibilities that may be required in this position. There may be unplanned activities and other duties as assigned.





PNR RailWorks Inc. is committed to fostering an equitable, accessible, and inclusive workplace. As such, PNR RailWorks Inc. will ensure reasonable accommodations for candidates with disabilities throughout the hiring process, including the interview. If selected for an interview, requests for accommodation can be confidentially made to a member of the recruitment team who will arrange in advance for reasonable and appropriate accommodation for fair and equitable assessment throughout the process.





#LI-RC1-PNR





All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment with PNR RailWorks without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or any other characteristics protected by law.


PNR RailWorks Inc. is committed to fostering an equitable, accessible, and inclusive workplace. As such, PNR RailWorks Inc. will ensure reasonable accommodations for candidates with disabilities throughout the hiring process, including the interview. If selected for an interview, requests for accommodation can be confidentially made to a member of the recruitment team who will arrange in advance for reasonable and appropriate accommodation for fair and equitable assessment throughout the process.


All successful applicants must be in compliance with PNR RailWorks Inc. Mandatory COVID Vaccination Policy, which will be provided prior to hire.

title: STUDENT SUMMER JOB - GENERAL LABOURERS
description:
Company Description

ABOUT EACOM

At EACOM, we transform more than wood. Our talented team of 1,100 employees is committed to working, building, and growing together. Embedded in northern Ontario and Quebec communities, our mills have a long, rich history. We responsibly manage and transform forest resources into high-quality wood products. From the Canadian woodlands to the North American home building market, we strive for sustainability, collaboration, safety, and continuous improvement.

Job Description

EACOM – Ear Falls sawmill, a subsidiary of INTERFOR, is looking to fill SUMMER JOBS - GENERAL LABOURERS term positions in from May to August 2022.

10 OPEN JOBS - JOIN THE TEAM!
HOURLY RATE: $23.15/ hour

Reporting to the supervisor, you will be performing in various tasks related to production.

JOB DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:

  • Operate production equipment as assigned
  • Stack and strap lumber bundles indoors and/or outdoors
  • Preform production and assembly processes within the facility
  • Ensure smooth flow of processes throughout the sawmill
  • Preform maintenance and housekeeping duties as instructed
  • Clean-up work areas during work stoppages
  • Safe work practices such as Lock-out, Pre-task hazard assessments, etc.
  • Preform other related duties

SKILLS PROFILE:

  • Autonomy and initiative.
  • Exercise vigilance and adhere to all health/safety policies.
  • Ability to work as part of a team and communicate with all levels of department assigned to
  • Competent individual willing to learn

ADDITIONAL INFORMATION

Week schedule: 40 hours / week (6:00am – 4:30pm / 6:00pm – 4:30am)

APPLY TO

Please attach resume and cover letter and send to tyler.boon@interfor.com

Qualifications

  • Hold high school diploma or the equivalent.
  • To have completed one year of post-secondary education, or proof of enrolment for post-secondary in the fall of 2022.
  • Ability to meet physical demands including walking, standing, sitting, stairs, bending and lifting up to 20 lbs.
  • Must be able to work in an environment that may include exposure to noise, dust, chemicals, moving mechanical parts and outdoor weather conditions.
  • Have relevant physical labour experience, industrial experience in a wood manufacturing environment considered an asset.
  • Knowledge of English.
  • Be available to preform day and night shifts as needed (flexible schedule).


Additional Information

At EACOM, we're here for you.

EACOM supports employment equity. Diversity is not only welcome, it’s encouraged! We’ll contact you if you are selected for an interview. If you need special accommodations, let us know. Any information you send us will be treated with respect and confidentiality. Gender diversity is also important. Know that women are definitely welcome!

title: General Labourer (Light Duty 12H)
description:
Seaside Paper is looking to hire a General Labourer to work our 12-hour shift. The GL is responsible for bundling products, packing products into cases, and putting cases onto a skid, as well as maintaining a clean work area.

Shift:
  • The 12-hour shift starts work at 6:30am and works until 6:30pm - No Graveyards no overnight.
  • Must be able to work alternate weekends (one-weekend work, the next weekend is 3-day-off weekend)
  • This is a full-time permanent position.

Skills and Requirements:
  • Legally entitled to work in Canada at the time of application. NO sponsorships are available.
  • Lifting is required. Repeatedly lift 25-30 pound boxes. 
  • Lifting from the ground to waist level and back, as well as occasionally above waist level
  • Must be able to safely lift heavy boxes at a steady pace.
  • Good attention to detail.
  • Works well cooperatively with others.
  • Physically able to stand for extended periods 
  • Reasonable English speaking and comprehension.
  • CSA-approved steel-toed boots are required.
  • Own transportation is recommended as Transit does not come reliably to our location.

Compensation:
  • $17 - $18 per hour depending on experience.

Candidates selected for an interview will be contacted by EMAIL. Please ensure to check that the email address you provide is correct. Please also check your & spam/junk folder to ensure you don't miss the interview invitation.




    About Seaside Paper Products:

    For more than 40 years, Seaside Paper Products has been leading the industry as an innovative custom converter of specialty paper products for a diverse range of industries across North America. Seaside Paper operates from a 90,000-square-foot state-of-the-art manufacturing facility located in Delta, BC.*No Recruitment or Placement Agency calls please*

title: Labourer
description:
Goals & Outcomes:
Effectively perform any combination of receiving, storing, and moving parts and equipment to assist the warehouse and service operations of Paramount.

Essential Functions:
  • Load and unload trucks and move items to assigned areas.
  • Loads/unloads equipment and moves items to assigned areas.
  • Completes all required paperwork in an accurate and timely manner.
  • Ability to maintain a valid forklift license issued by the Company.
  • Maintains a clean, sanitary and safe work area.
  • Follow all required work safe practices. This would include wearing all required PPE in designated areas, confined space safety, safe chemical handling, fall restraints, etc.
  • Duties are related to parking lot maintenance and repair.
  • Perform other duties as assigned.   

Job Requirements:
  • High School Diploma or equivalent preferred. 
  • 1-year experience required.
  • Must be able to lift and/or move up to 50 lbs and occasionally lift and/or move up to 100lbs, frequently lift and/or move above shoulder height, stand, walk, kneel. 
  • Be able to effectively work in a team environment.
  • Effective verbal and written communication skills.
  • Familiarity with asphalt repair is a plus.
  • Valid Driver’s License (Class 3 license is a plus).
  • Must be able to pass all pre-employment screens (including drug, background, and criminal checks).





    About Paramount Services:

    Paramount Service Ltd. began as Paramount Restaurant Service Ltd. over 25 years ago. Since then, the company has evolved into a full-service equipment supply and facility maintenance company based from Winnipeg, Manitoba. Our presence is focused in South West Ontario & North West Ontario, Manitoba and Saskatchewan but we have strong partnerships spanning coast-to-coast-to-coast across Canada. As part of our full-service commitment throughout the country, we employ refrigerationber, HVAC, plumbing and electrical journeymen, handymen, general labourers and we have over 600 subcontractors at our disposal. Our customer relationships are based on our performance and built on trust. As a result, our customers ask us if we can do more, and we do. From general contracting to minor service calls, landscape and parking lot maintenance, to hot and cold beverage services, equipment sales to preventative maintenance – we do it all.

title: General Labourer (Dufferin Aggregates) - $24 - $29/hr
description:
Job ID:  400835 

Work Type:  Full Time Permanent 

 

It is a great time to join the CRH Canada team! CRH Canada is going through an exciting business transformation which demands first-class Talent Management support to drive results.


We are building a world- class team. Make your mark!


You will be a successful addition to our team if you look at change as an opportunity to develop and contribute to the business. You will be successful in your role if you like partnering with the business, presenting new ideas and providing excellent customer service.

Dufferin Aggregates, a divison of CRH Canada is looking to hire!

Duties and Responsibilities:

  • Work in a team environment with other co-workers, supervisors and managers.
  • Complete cleanup assignments using shovels and/or small, heavy equipment.
  • Assist in maintenance inspections and activities using appropriate procedures.
  • Operate crushing and screening plant as trained and directed.
  • Report any malfunctions or safety risks to supervisor immediately.
  • Specific job duties will often vary from day to day depending on business needs.

Qualifications:

  • Experience in construction, mining or operating heavy machinery is preferred but not required.
  • Minimum Ontario high school diploma (OSSD) or equivalent.
  • Reliability – Showing up to work on time.
  • Be willing to work rotating shifts, overtime and weekends when required.
  • Physical ability to walk around the plant.
  • Basic maintenance/mechanical aptitude, welding and fitting is preferred but not required.
  • Dependability – follow instructions and respond to direction. Good communication skills are required.  
  • Working outdoors/indoors under varied temperatures and weather conditions.

Health and Safety:

  • Comply with OHSA and all of its applicable regulations.
  • Strict compliance with Dufferin Aggregates safety rules, PPE, policies and procedures.
  • Be aware of environmentally sensitive areas and be alert to correct environmental problems that may develop in the assigned work area.
     

What Dufferin Aggregates Offers You:

  • Pension and benefits included after probationary period.
  • Shift premium applies to night shifts.
  • Bonus pay based on safety and performance.
  • High competitive starting wage with multi-tier wage structure based on skill and ability.
  • Overtime opportunities are available as required.
  • PPE and tools allowance are provided by company for some positions.
  • Company provides training and appreciation events.
  • A culture that values opportunity for growth, development, and internal promotion

Visit our website for more information: http://www.crhcanada.com

CRH Canada Group Inc. recognizes Canada’s diverse landscape. Accommodation is available upon request for applicants with disabilities throughout the recruitment and selection process.

title: General Labourer
description:
Merchandising Specialist – Flowers and Plants

About the Position

Brand Momentum is looking for two General Labourers to work together at local sites in Prince George.

6 hours/week

Key Responsibilities:

- Take off shelves by unhooking from slots
- The shelves to be stacked flat on base with hooks fitting into pole openings;
- Make sure the triangular tow bar of the base is not stacked underneath the shelves, so that it can still be used to make a train and be pulled with;
- Stack the shelves not higher than 50 per base;
- All carts with no shelves left are to be further dismantled by taking the poles off and stacking these on a cart with shelves and place 40 poles per shelf.
- Stack the ‘bare’ bases not higher than 12 per stack.

;t=436s

Specific Requirements:

· Must be able to lift 50 pounds alone

· Must have access to a vehicle

· Must wear steel toe footwear

· Must be able to work outside in all elements

· Must be able to work independently and as a team member

· Must observe store safety protocols

Job Types: Full-time, Part-time, Temporary

About Brand Momentum

We are a national integrated Sales, Marketing, and Retail solutions agency with two headquarters, one in Toronto and one in Montreal. We deliver authentic and enduring human connections, and we are led by a talented team and supported by a network of trusted partners. Rooted in Goodness, Brand Momentum is a three-time winner of Canada’s top 100 Best Workplace® and one of Canada’s top 500 fastest growing companies.

About Our Culture

Goodness is at the heart of everything we do. Brand Momentum (BMI) is an enduring market leader in quality and innovation. We deliver on our promises to our clients and each other, and we do it with passion, innovation and a commitment to excellence. Every single day we live our values of integrity, respect, empowerment, commitment, fun, flexibility and fiscal responsibility while putting our valued clients at the center of every decision we make.

Our team strives to streamline the construction management process to deliver exceptional client satisfaction.

  • Clean and perform preparation of work-site
  • Operate various hand and power tools to complete projects
  • Complete tasks as per work schedule meeting strict deadlines and standards
  • Other tasks as assigned including General Labour duties

title: Asphalt Workers
description:
Company in GTA requires full time asphalt laborers
Full Time
Good pay

Duties:
  • Load and unload construction materials, and move materials to work areas
  • Erect and dismantle concrete forms, scaffolding, ramps, catwalks, shoring and barricades required at construction sites
  • Mix, pour and spread materials such as concrete and asphalt
  • Assist in drilling and blasting rock at construction sites
  • Level earth to fine grade specifications using rake and shovel
  • Remove rubble and other debris at construction sites using rakes, shovels, wheelbarrows and other equipment
  • Operate pneumatic hammers, vibrators and tampers as directed
  • Tend or feed machines or equipment used in construction such as mixers, compressors and pumps
  • Clean up chemical spills and other contaminants, and remove asbestos and other hazardous materials
  • Direct traffic at or near construction sites
  • Perform other activities at construction sites, as directed.

title: General Labour - Summer Students (May - Sept)
description:
Summer Students: May - September 

Weston Foods is a leading North American bakery company with a specialized focus across all key bakery categories, including breads and rolls, donuts, pies, cakes, alternatives breads, and others. We bake our products in more than 35 facilities across Canada and the USA.

On our ambient side of our business, we bake cookies, crackers, cones and wafers products in 6 facilities across Canada and the USA, conducting our business with integrity, contributing to our communities, and fostering a respectful culture. We are building a culture of success here, and it depends on our people striving for greatness and having the courage and commitment to getting better every day.

RESPONSIBILITIES (currently the major responsibilities include but are not limited to the following):

·      Must have/maintain regular & consistent attendance.

·      Must adhere to all safety, sanitation, and good manufacturing practices.

·      Ability to perform repetitive work.

·      Duties may include accurate weighing of ingredients, handling ingredients, general sanitation, garbage removal, packing cookies, packing cases, inspections, and general duties.

·      Duties shall be assigned by the employer, including other duties outside the work area. 

 

QUALIFICATIONS:

·      Ability to follow procedures according to company standards.

·      Ability to work independently and as a team.

·      Ability to multi-task.

·      Attention to detail.

·      May require heavy lifting.

title: Labourer
description:
Why work for Lafarge?

As the global leader in innovative and sustainable building materials, we’re committed to shaping a greener, smarter and healthier world. At Lafarge Canada Inc., safety comes first, collaboration matters and diversity is celebrated with people who share our desire to continually make our materials better. 

 

Do you have the drive, the skills, and the passion to join us?

 

Overview

The Labourer is an unskilled position which involves extensive physical labour at the Mamquam River Pit aggregate processing plant. Candidate for this position must be physically fit and have an interest and willingness to learn new skills in an active mining setting.

Responsibilities

  • This position required candidate to possess a valid driver’s license, Level 1 Occupational First Aid or equivalent, WHIMIS and/or any other certifications deemed necessary for operations under the C.Mines Act and the Mine Health, Safety and Reclamation Code for Mines in British Columbia.
  • Responsible for assisting in the daily checks required for operation of crushing/washing conveyance gallery.
  • Responsible for keeping grounds maintained and free of waste material, garbage and scrap metal and crushing and washing spread during daily operations.

Qualifications

  • Must be able to read, write, verbally communicate and understand verbal and written instructions in English. 
  • Must be able to verbally communicate directly with supervisors, co-workers and customers; using radio and/or telephone equipment.
  • Must be able to take direction, follow instructions, have the ability to work with others, and have an acute attention to details.
  • Must possess a valid driver`s license
  • Possess a willingness to learn new skills and a positive attitude in their execution.
  • Must maintain an on-time attendance work record and safe completion of scheduling shifts.

Education and Experience

  • Experience an asset but not essential
  • Completion of company training programs (incl. OFA Level 1 and WHIMIS) and any other ticketing/certifications required under the Mines Code.

Physical Demands

While performing the duties of this job the employee will be exposed to extensive moderate to heavy manual labour for prolonged periods of time. This will include ongoing maintenance and cleaning of working area. Labourer will be required to stand, walk, crawl, kneel, bend, and reach with hands and arms above their shoulders. Ability to climb ladders is necessary. Specific vision abilities required by this job include acute central and peripheral vision as well as depth and color perception.

 

Work Environment

While performing the duties of this job, the employer will be exposed to moving mechanical parts; outside weather conditions; and extreme cold and/or heat. The noise level in the work environment is moderate to high. Dusty working conditions could also necessitate the need for a respirator to be worn. Employee can expect a variety of tasks in a high paced working environment for the duration of shift.

 

As part of our dedicated focus on the health and safety of all employees, a pre-employment medical, including drug and alcohol testing and a criminal record check, may be required.

LafargeHolcim

As we are reinventing the way the world builds, we need world-class talent to join our Lafarge Canada team: people who are passionate, driven by curiosity and keen to grow, learn, develop and thrive in our high-performance culture.

 

Whatever you do, you will make a difference here. Because we know that your passion and curiosity are the natural resources the world needs.

 

Check out our YouTube channel to learn more about our operations and see all career opportunities at www.lafarge.ca/careers.

 

We thank you for your interest. Only candidates selected for an interview will be contacted.  Lafarge is committed to the principles of employment equity and encourages the applications from women, visible minorities, and persons with disabilities.

title: General Labourer (Packager)
description:
Company Description

Cratex Industries Ltd. is committed to a safe work environment for its employees from the enforcement of PPE to training and a recognized safety program.  Cratex is a shop environment for the production of wood packaging.

Job Description

Packagers at Cratex Industries Ltd. assist lead hands and supervisors in the daily operations of the company.  And will assist with the fabrication and assembly of wooden crates for the purpose of packaging materials being shipped to various locations both domestically and overseas.  They must work accurately following established procedures and promote a positive and safe attitude.

Qualifications

  • Must have good communication skills

  • A positive and safe attitude

  • Be motivated and work well with others

  • Be able to follow basic instructions and procedures

  • A willingness to learn and be involved in the required training

  • A natural respect for people, property and the environment

  • Must work safely and in compliance with the Occupational Health and Safety Act, Environmental and/or other pertinent regulations, including compliance with all Company policies and procedures. 
  • Must know the significant environmental aspects that apply to your job.


Additional Information

  • Competitive Wages
  • Excellent Benefits
  • Profit Share Program
  • Tuition Reimbursement
  • Company supplied PPE and Coveralls

About:

Evertz Microsystems (TSX:ET) is a leading global manufacturer of broadcast equipment and solutions that deliver content to television sets, on-demand services, WebTV, IPTV, and mobile devices (like phones and tablets). Evertz has expertise in delivering complete end-to-end broadcast solutions for all aspects of broadcast production including content creation, content distribution and content delivery. Considered as an innovator by their customers, Evertz delivers cutting edge solutions that are unmatched in the industry in both hardware and software. Evertz delivers products and solutions that can be found in major broadcast facilities on every continent. Evertzâ€™ customer base also includes telcos, satellite, cable TV, and IPTV providers. With over 1500 employees, that include hardware and software engineers, Evertz is one of the leaders in the broadcast industry. Evertz has a global presence with offices located in: Canada, United States, United Kingdom, Germany, United Arab Emirates, India, Hong Kong, China, Singapore, and Australia. Evertz was named one of Canadaâ€™s 50 Best Managed Companies, which recognizes excellence in Canadian-owned and Canadian-managed companies. Evertz makes certain there is an equal employment opportunity for all employees and applicants for employment, including persons with disabilities. title: Ouvrier(ère) Civil (Havre-Saint-Pierre, QC, CA)
description:
Concours: 139175
Titre: Ouvrier(ère) Civil
Statut: Temporaire
Durée: Indéterminée
Lieu: Havre-Saint-Pierre
Fin d'affichage: 15/05/2022

VOS DÉFIS

  • Exécute tout travail d'entretien et de réparation de nature civile, tel que: bétonnage, maçonnerie, menuiserie, couverture de bâtiment, soudure, ferblanterie, plomberie, peinture, gréage et mécanique du bâtiment requis sur les bâtiments, les ouvrages de génie civil, la machinerie et les équipements de bâtiments. Effectue également des travaux mineurs de construction justifiés par les besoins de maintenance.
  • Assiste son chef d'équipe dans les responsabilités qui lui sont dévolues.

 

LES RESPONSABILITÉS ET TÂCHES TYPES SONT RÉALISÉES DE CONCERT AVEC LE SUPÉRIEUR ET LES INTERVENANTS DU MILIEU ET SONT RÉALISÉES DE MANIÈRE À AMÉLIORER LA BONNE MARCHE DES OPÉRATIONS.

 

TÂCHES TYPES

  • Remplace le chef d'équipe, lorsque requis.
  • Assiste le chef d'équipe aux différentes étapes de la planification de l'organisation des travaux.
  • Collabore pour que tous les matériaux et les outils nécessaires aux travaux soient acheminés sur les lieux du travail à pied d'œuvre.
  • Collabore au suivi du programme d'entretien de l'outillage et de l'équipement.
  • Informe le chef d'équipe sur l'évolution des travaux en fonction des étapes de réalisation, des problèmes reliés à l'exécution des travaux, des anomalies rencontrées et y apporte les correctifs, s'il y a lieu.
  • Exécute l'ensemble de ses tâches, en respectant les délais et selon les résultats attendus (qualité du travail).
  • Soumet, à son chef d'équipe, toute amélioration au processus de travail dans le but d'optimiser le travail.
  • Assiste le chef d'équipe au niveau de la fiche de sécurité. Respecte et applique les méthodes de travail et règles de sécurité convenues lors de laïus.
  • Utilise et remplit toute la documentation nécessaire au suivi des travaux selon les règles en vigueur en utilisant les systèmes informatiques appropriés: mise à jour des plans, bon de travail, feuilles de temps, etc.
  • Rédige des rapports d'inspection des véhicules, trousses de premiers soins.
  • Participe à l'entraînement des membres de l'équipe et informe son chef d'équipe des besoins de formation nécessaires en fonction des travaux à réaliser.
  • Partage ses connaissances avec les autres membres de l'équipe.

.

  • Effectue le démantèlement, le montage, l'entretien et les réparations requises aux bâtiments et à leurs équipements en y réalisant des travaux de plomberie, menuiserie, mécanique du bâtiment, décapage, peinture, maçonnerie, bétonnage, ferblanterie et gréage.
  • Effectue des travaux mineurs de construction et d'installation de machinerie et d'équipements sur les bâtiments justifiés par les besoins de maintenance, selon des plans, devis et manuels techniques.
  • Effectue tout genre de coupage et de pliage de métaux et de soudures électriques et oxyacétyléniques aux bâtiments et aux ouvrages de génie civil.
  • Fabrique, ajuste et installe toutes pièces de métal requérant l'utilisation de machines-outils appropriées.
  • Aménage les espaces administratifs selon les plans, devis et croquis; manutentionne l'ameublement et, au besoin, en effectue la réparation.
  • Fabrique, entretient et répare tout accessoire en bois tel que: étagères, caisses de transport, boîtes, coffres à outils, armoires, bancs et tables de travail et autres articles de même nature.
  • Entretient, répare, et fabrique selon des plans ou croquis, des bases de béton et les supports propres à recevoir des équipements tels que : appareillage, escaliers, poteaux de clôture ou de signalisation.
  • Érige, modifie et démonte les échafaudages et les structures requises pour l'entretien et la réparation des bâtiments, des ouvrages de génie civil, de la machinerie et des équipements de bâtiments et de production.
  • Effectue l'entretien et les réparations ainsi que les réfections mineures des ouvrages de génie civil et des infrastructures des postes et centrales tels les terrains, clôtures, chemins d'accès…
  • Effectue toute opération de levage avec les équipements appropriés pour le déplacement et la manutention des pièces lourdes reliées à son travail.
  • Fabrique, installe, entretient, répare et modifie des estacades ou l'équivalent (ex: câbles de sûreté ou de sécurité) en utilisant l'équipement approprié.
  • Peut surveiller et aider à la formation des couverts de glace avec l'aide d'équipements spécialisés appropriés.
  • Obtient au besoin les autorisations de travail, selon les règles de sécurité.

.

  • Effectue au besoin l'entretien et la réparation d'outillage.
  • Manutentionne et transporte des matériaux et des équipements.
  • Conduit un véhicule et opère de la machinerie lourde.
  • Peut accomplir les tâches d'emplois de classe inférieure, lorsque requis.
  • Peut donner des premiers soins et la respiration artificielle; prend les mesures prévues en cas d'incendie en utilisant l'équipement requis.

 

N.B. : Dans les tâches ci-dessous ou dans la nature, s'il n'y a pas de chef d'équipe dans l'emploi, l'expression «chef d'équipe» est remplacée par supérieur immédiat lorsque cela s'applique.

 

Les tâches mentionnées reflètent les éléments caractéristiques de l'emploi identifié et ne doivent pas être considérées comme une énumération exhaustive de toutes les tâches reliées à l'emploi.

VOTRE PROFIL

  • Détenir un diplôme d’études professionnelles (DEP) dans l’une ou l’autre des (4) formations suivantes : Charpenterie-Menuiserie, Plomberie-Chauffage, Soudage-Montage, Mécanique industrielle de construction et d’entretien.
  • Être en mesure de lire les plans, devis et croquis relatifs aux tâches à effectuer.
  • Répondre aux exigences physiques relatives aux tâches à effectuer.
  • Être en mesure d’utiliser les différents outils informatiques de la fonction.
  • Avoir un permis de conduire du Québec de classe 5 et être mesure d'en obtenir un de classe appropriée si requis.
  • Avoir de la langue française une connaissance appropriée à la fonction.

 

PARTICULARITÉS

 

  • L'horaire de travail est à déterminer selon le lieu de travail.
  • Avantages sociaux : vacances, assurances, régime de retraite.
  • Liste de rappel à la fin du contrat.
  • Au moment de postuler, veuillez joindre votre CV et votre diplôme.

 

INSTRUCTIONS AUX POSTULANTS

 

Hydro-Québec applique un programme d'accès à l’égalité et invite les femmes, les membres des minorités visibles et ethniques, les autochtones et les personnes handicapées à présenter leur candidature. Nous vous invitons à lire la déclaration de l'entreprise à cet égard.

Pour déposer votre candidature, veuillez cliquer sur l'icône "Postuler" et complétez votre dossier de candidature.

Les candidats intéressés doivent fournir tous les renseignements pertinents à leur candidature pour le poste en question, car le comblement du poste sera effectué à partir de ces renseignements.

En cas de problème avec votre dossier de candidature vous pouvez communiquer avec nousau:

Téléphone interne : 800-RHRH (7474)
Téléphone externe : 514 788-7474 ou 1 844 800-7474 (sans frais)

title: Labourer
description:
Looking to Start Your Driving Career? Looking to Learn New Skills? Austin Powder is seeking to add a career-minded entry-level team member! This is a full-time opportunity to handle site maintenance, manage inventory, be responsible for customer deliveries, as well as, customer support and assist the at job sites.

This position offers a competitive wage and generous benefits. Our benefits include extended health, dental, voluntary RPP, AD&D, weekly income (STD), long term disability, group life and dependent life. If this sounds like the opportunity that you've been searching for, apply for this blasting worker position today!

ABOUT AUSTIN POWDER

Austin Powder manufactures a full line of industrial explosives and provides blasting services to customers in the quarrying, mining, construction, and oil and gas industries -- all for the purpose of providing aggregate, energy, and mineral products to consumers.

Our values of commitment to safety, attention to detail, and the power of family are the very bedrock upon which our company's culture is built. We truly value our team which is why we offer competitive opportunities for career growth and advancement.

A DAY IN THE LIFE

As a Labourer, you will handle packaged explosive products, operate manufacturing vehicles on the job site (if licensed), and load and drive box trucks (if licensed). All activity is done in strict compliance with safety and company procedures. You will assist blasters load and stem blast holes prior to initiating the blast. This position involves being outside in all weather conditions, lifting and carrying 50+ pounds of product and other materials, and frequently squatting and bending as you prepare for the shot.

Safety is always a priority whether you are driving or assisting the Blaster in charge with site preparation and equipment setup. Under the direction of the Blaster in charge or Location Manager, you will inspect product bins, inventory of product, and complete required paperwork. To keep your truck and equipment running properly, you will perform both general and preventative maintenance. You will enjoy keeping busy and being on the move throughout the day.

QUALIFICATIONS

  • Must submit drivers abstract with resume
  • Valid Class 5 - no restrictions and desire to obtain Class 3
  • Preferred Class 3 license
  • Ability to work outside in all weather conditions
  • Physical ability to lift 23 kg.
  • Must meet requirements of all Provincial and Federal explosive laws and qualify as an ERD explosive possessor

Are you a self-starter that is hardworking and passionate? Do you enjoy being outdoors? Are you a dependable team player? Are you willing to learn and expand your skills? If so, you may be perfect for this position!

ARE YOU READY TO JOIN OUR TEAM?

If you feel that you would be right for this Labourer position, please fill out our initial 3-minute, mobile-friendly application so that we can review your information. We look forward to meeting you!

This contractor and subcontractor shall abide by the requirements of 41 CFR 60-1.4(a), 60-300.5(a) and 60-741.5(a). These regulations prohibit discrimination against qualified individuals based on their status as protected veterans or individuals with disabilities, and prohibit discrimination against all individuals based on their race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, and for inquiring about, discussing or disclosing compensation. Moreover, these regulations require that covered prime contractors and subcontractors take affirmative action to employ and advance in employment individuals without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability or veteran status.

title: Nutrien Carseland: Scaffolder Apprentices (Calgary, AB; Carseland, AB)
description:
SCAFFOLDER - APPRENTICES : Calgary Local Drive-in position

NEW LOA $125 Daily Tax Free

SUMMARY:
A Scaffolders’ duties may vary from site to site, however the main responsibilities of a Scaffolder are to erect temporary work platforms using steel pipes, support braces and clamps with a high standard of workmanship using a variety of tools. Scaffolders work both indoors and outdoors, year-round in commercial and industrial settings.
On going work in 2023 and turn around for 2024.Large project and turnaround.
4-10 hour shifts (Monday-Thursday) with Overtime after 10 hours.

Journeyman rate: $38.46 and there is room to advance those with the right skill sets for the upcoming turn around as we will be looking to fill supervisor positions. This is also a very diversified site where can also look to pursue getting involved in other roles such equipment operating, fitting and HVAC, scaffold and insulation.

MINIMUM SAFETY TICKET REQUIREMENTS:
  • CSTS-09
  • Fall Protection
  • Ability to pass an A&D test
If you feel you would be a good fit, please apply with your resume and safety tickets!

Department: Operations
This is a non-management position
This is a turnaround position

title: Skilled labourer
description:
Our client is growing and looking for a fourth member of full-time crew. Company philosophy is to train workers to ensure our timelines, quality of work and customer satisfaction is met.

The right candidate must be able to lead tasks with minimal supervision and must have a minimum of five years of renovation experience with relevant construction education. One of the key requirements of this role is leadership ability. The candidate must be able build and maintain strong site team morale.

The position is for a small-sized General Contracting company in the residential and commercial market that focuses on interior renovations for clients of various sizes across Toronto and the GTA. This is a strategic hire for the company as we are looking for an individual who is passionate about the industry and enjoys learning about construction techniques/methods, and who will be a future candidate for a foreman or site manager.

Requirements:
  • Must have a valid Ontario Driver's License, and your own vehicle; a truck is preferable.
  • Must have, at minimum, cordless drill, tool belt and hand tools.
  • Must be clean cut and presentable to clients – public perception is very important.
  • Must be hard working, flexible, reliable and take pride in your work.
  • Must have the ability to work within a team as well as alone.
  • Must provide a criminal record check.
  • Must provide a resume and professional references upon request.
  • Post-secondary education is preferred in a construction-related field of study.
Duties and Responsibilities:
  • Assist the Supervisor or General Contractor with basic work site project management.
  • Read and interpret plans, instructions, and specifications to determine daily work activities.
  • Provide assistance to sub trades, skilled trades, Supervisor and General Contractor on the job-site when required.
  • Build, install, and repair structural woodwork, flooring, ceilings and cabinetry.
  • Operate, maintain, and calibrate hand and power tools.
  • Read and comprehend plans and blueprints.
  • Clean and make minor repairs to equipment and tools when required.
  • Follow proper safety rules to maintain a safe working environment.
  • Operate all equipment in a safe and efficient way according to all relevant legislation,
  • policies and procedures.
  • Set up the accompanying tools, equipment, materials and supplies for trades, such as carpenters, drywallers, plumbers, electricians, etc., who are completing work on-site, when needed.
  • Load, unload and organize tools, equipment, materials and supplies to and from the work truck, work site, and designated tool boxes and bins.
  • Maintain a clean and organized work site to eliminate possible hazards.
  • Ensure daily time sheets and any other forms requested by Supervisor are consistently completed by team.
  • Maintain daily communication with General Contractor and record daily construction activity.
  • Assist with communication between sub trades, skilled trades, labourers and GC.
Knowledge - The employee must have proficient knowledge in the following areas:
  • Comprehensive knowledge of general construction and repair methods, and the proper utilization and care of tools, materials, and equipment used in building construction.
  • Comprehensive knowledge of traditional building materials, practices, and techniques
  • Strong knowledge of electrical, plumbing, tiling, drywalling, framing, flooring, painting and carpentry.
  • Minimum technical college education but college- or university-level education is preferred (post-secondary education such as George Brown College, Ryerson University, or equivalent is ideal).
Skills/Experience - The employee must demonstrate the following skills/experience:
  • Five (5) years or more of renovation experience.
  • Strong carpentry skills, and general trade and interior finishing experience.
  • Plumbing, electrical and HVAC experience is preferred.
  • Excellent project management, organizational and time management skills.
  • Strong verbal and listening communications skills.
  • Ability to work in a fast-paced environment.
  • Ability to work as a team or unaccompanied on various tasks.
  • Ability to communicate effectively in English.
Personal Attributes:
  • The employee must demonstrate the following personal attributes:
  • Fast-thinking and good judgement (common sense).
  • Hardworking, detail-oriented and thorough.
  • Honest, trustworthy and flexible.
  • Respectful and conscientious of the people and environment around them.
  • Demonstrates sound work ethics and self-motivation to work with minimal supervision.
  • Interacts with supervisors, coworkers and clients in a positive, courteous and respectful manner.

title: Summer Relief Labour
description:
Lehigh Cement is currently looking for responsible, safe, and dependableSummer Relief Labour to join our local team. As aSummer Relief Labour you will support plant needs by ensuring a safe and productive work environment.

Who We Are:

Lehigh Cement is part of the Lehigh Hanson group of companies. Lehigh Hanson is one of the largest construction materials companies in North America with more than 550 active operations in the U.S. and Canada. Our core activities include the production and distribution of cement and aggregates, ready-mixed concrete, asphalt and other concrete products.

With our diverse product lines and locations across North America, there are opportunities to explore different roles and work on a variety of exciting and interesting projects. At Lehigh Hanson, we believe our employees play a key role in the company’s success and future growth.

We offer:
  • Competitive wage
  • OT available
What You Will Get to Do:
  • Maintain cleanliness of plant work areas
  • Transport materials to and from storage and shop areas
  • Ensure compliance with all health, safety, and environmental regulations, as well as company policies and procedures; assist with physical inspections of plant property/departments.
Who We Are Looking For:
  • High school diploma or GED required
  • Previous experience using (or ability to learn) plant mobile equipment
  • Desire to work cooperatively as part of a productive team
  • Ability to work safely, and independently without constant supervision
  • Excellent communication and interpersonal skills
  • Capable of learning through on the job training
  • Able to work inside and outside in year-round weather conditions
  • In good physical condition, able to lift and carry up to 75 lbs., sit and stand for extended periods of time, kneel, climb ladders, and walk on varied terrain
  • Ability to work different extended hours, holidays and/or overtime as required

title: Skilled Labourer (Aurora)
description:
Position Scope:

NACG is looking for Skilled Ground Workers to work on a remote mining site in the Fort McMurray area. You must be well-organized and favor safety above everything else.

 

Site: Syncrude-Aurora

Schedule: 14x7 Days/Nights -11.5 hours/day

Accommodations: Not provided

Transportation: Bussing provided from Fort McMurray to site (before and after shifts)

Overtime: Provided after 8 hours a day or 44 hours a week

The successful candidate  will be required to join the International Union of Operating Engineers Local 955.  

 

Qualifications:

- Minimum of 1 years experience working as a Labourer and driving in the mine.

- Able to do heavy manuel labour and shoveling

- Able to run hand packers

- Able to communicate fluently via radio and understand direction

- High school diploma, GED, and/or post-secondary education cosidered an asset

Summary:

All successful candidates must:

  1. Be proficient in English, both verbally and written
  2. Have a valid Class 5 Driverâ€™s License
  3. Have experience as requested as mentioned above
  4. Subject to Random Testing at: Suncor, Suncor Fort Hills and Kearl sites
  5. Undergo and successfully pass the following testing:
    • Breath Alcohol Test
    • Urine Drug Test
    • Fitness-to-Work Assessment
    • Audiometric Testing
    • Vision Screening
    • Criminal Record Check

Shift, site, and start times are subject to change.

 

All successful candidates MUST provide the following items prior to confirmation of their start date:

  1. CSO or BSO Certification
  2. Copy of Valid Class 5 Driverâ€™s License
  3. Copy of recent Driverâ€™s Abstract
  4. VOID cheque/direct deposit form

Once dispatched the following processes will occur:

  1. Will receive a call from NACG to set up all required pre-employment testing
  2. An email will be sent with all required New Hire Paperwork to be filled out
  3. After all results are received by NACG candidates will be contacted by Site Admin to schedule orientation and confirm your start date and other site specific details.

Please note the entire On-boarding process can take anywhere from 3-8 business days.

 

NO PHONE CALLS PLEASE, SUCCESSFUL CANDIDATES WILL BE CONTACTED VIA PHONE OR EMAIL.

 

Overview:

North American Construction Group (NACG) has served as an industry leader in the heavy construction and mining industries for over 65 years.   In that time, weâ€™ve proven ourselves as a safe and reliable contractor who can complete projects of any size and scope. Weâ€™ve also taken a number of bold steps forward to broaden our footprint, expanding to mines outside our provincial borders, and providing third-party maintenance services to clients and customers.  

In addition to providing employees with rewarding careers, North American has a whole lot more to offer:

  • Significant Growth â€“ As a company, NACG is rapidly expanding, and has practically doubled in size over the past year alone.
  • Long Term Contracts â€“ With over $1 billion dollars in contracted work booked through 2023, NACG can provide long term employment solutions and numerous opportunities for advancement.
  • Commitment To Safety â€“ With a top tier record for safety performance, NACG is dedicated to ensuring that everyone gets home safe, and constantly strives for a goal zero performance.
  • Competitive Compensation â€“ NACG provides competitive compensation packages for all employees.
  • Attractive Benefits Package â€“ With a substantial benefits package provided to all employees, NACG ensures that you are covered for lifeâ€™s many surprises.
  • GRRSP Matching â€“ As you begin your new career, you can also start planning for the future thanks to NACGâ€™s GRRSP matching.

North American Construction Group is an equal opportunity employer, and encourages applications from all qualified individuals. We are committed to providing a diverse and inclusive work environment where every employee feels valued and respected.

 

Become a member of the North American family today!

title: Construction Labourer
description:
Location:

GTA - East, Ontario

Department:

Employment Type:

Construction, GTA Lowrise Division

Full-Time

Reports to:

Builder

 

Who We Are

 

Mattamy Homes is the largest privately owned homebuilder in North America, with 40-plus years of history across the United States and Canada. Every year, Mattamy helps more than 8,000 families realize their dream of home ownership. In Canada, our communities stretch across the Greater Toronto Area, as well as in Ottawa, Calgary and Edmonton.

 

What We Offer

In keeping with the Mattamy Mission of providing The Best Homeowner Experience, the Construction Labourer safely constructs new homes which meet the high standards of quality set by the company.

Responsibilities

  • Prepare house for next trade as required including cutting concrete, covering floors, scraping floors, straw placement and removal and stripping floors
  • On a daily basis, collect and dispose of debris at construction site, placing it in appropriate designated places, while ensuring compliance with waste recycling programs
  • Assist with having porches filled, garages and basements cleaned so cement can be poured. Ensure driveways are cut, stone is ordered and that patio slabs are installed on each lot.
  • Make sure houses are graded and safe for the bricklayer trades to work; ensure footings and walls ready for inspection
  • Advise Administrator when to contact garbage company for delivery and exchange bins for interior cleaning
  • Ensure availability of temporary heat for inside trades (tile setters, tapers, etc.)
  • Locate water boxes (dig up and repair) and ensure water turned on for each house; includes ensuring water boxes are raised and marked for sod
  • Review, assess and report any issues on safety to Health & Safety Rep. or direct supervisor, includes ensuring protective gear used/worn
  • Address any complaints or inquiries forwarded by homeowners

 What You Bring

  • No formal education is required although any training related to construction skills would be an asset.
  • Experience in residential building or related construction industry.
  • Experience dealing with tools and machinery, includes machine skills – rough grading, digging hydro, gas trenching, water boxes, backhoe operation, etc.
  • Good organizational skills with ability to get things done according to timelines.
  • Good communication skills – especially verbal.
  • Good customer service skills.
  • Must have the ability to perform physically challenging work.
  • Must have a valid driver’s license with a clean driving record.

Health & Safety
 

We are doing our part to safeguard your health and taking extra steps to reduce the spread of COVID-19. All work sites and premises will allow for required physical distancing requirements, and new routines and resources such as hand sanitizer, antiseptic wipes, masks, or other protective equipment.

 

Vaccination is the single best protection against COVID-19 for us as individuals and our communities and is vital to maintaining our commitment to health and safety. The successful applicant will be required, as a condition of employment with Mattamy, to provide Mattamy with proof that they have received the full series of a COVID-19 vaccine (or combination of vaccines) authorized by Health Canada, subject to accommodations required under applicable human rights legislation.

 

Why Mattamy

 

At Mattamy, we’re passionate about creating and promoting a diverse and inclusive environment where everyone can do their best work. Diversity and inclusion are important aspects of the work we do to support our homebuyers, colleagues and communities. We offer a workplace that allows our employees to experience exciting possibilities in their career including continuous learning, opportunity for growth, competitive compensation and a comprehensive benefits package.

 

When you’re part of the Mattamy family, your day to day work has an incredible impact. What we do takes teamwork, and everyone pulls together to give our very best. With a focus on continued growth and industry leadership, exciting career possibilities are waiting for you at Mattamy. Based on the culture we pride ourselves on, we’ve been recognized with external awards as well. Some of our most recent recognition includes:

 

 

Canada’s Best Managed Companies (2021 & 2020)

Canada’s Top 100 Employers (2020 & 2019)

Greater Toronto’s Top Employers (2022, 2021, 2020 & 2019)

Canada’s Most Admired Corporate Cultures (2021 & 2017)

 

 

 

 

We have big plans for our business and our team. Be part of our ambitious future!

 

Mattamy Homes is committed to providing accommodation for people with disabilities. If you require accommodation through any aspects of the selection process, please notify us on your application and we will work with you to meet your needs.

 

Qualified applicants will be contacted directly by the Talent Acquisition team.

title: Labour Worker
description:
CUSTOMER SERVICE REPRESENTATIVE Gold’s Gym British Columbia is hiring a labour worker, with potential to grow! Are you hard working, a good team player, with a passion for fitness? We would love to hear from you!

About Gold’s GymGold’s Gym has been the authority on fitness since 1965. It was then that fitness legend Joe Gold took the knowledge and expertise he gained from training at the world famous “Muscle Beach” and opened up the first Gold’s Gym on Pacific Avenue in Venice, California. At Gold’s Gym, our goal is simple: We’re here to help you Know Your Own Strength®. We are committed to helping people find their inner strength and reach their goals.

Key Responsibilities
  • Basic maintenance work (moving equipment, driving parts, manual labour, painting, general maintenance)
  • Assist in gym maintenance at 4 lower mainland locations (Port Coquitlam, Langley, West Broadway, University Market Place)
  • Assist in general equipment repair
Qualifications
  • Must be able to move and carry up to 50lbs 
  • Drivers License and vehicle 
  • No prior experience is required but it is an asset 
What We Offer

title: General Labourer
description:
Job ID:  392182

 

Oldcastle BuildingEnvelope®, a CRH company, is the leading supplier of products specified to close the building envelope. They include: custom-engineered curtain wall and window wall, architectural windows, storefront systems, doors, skylights and architectural glass.

 

GENERAL LABOUR - Langley, B.C. 


Langley BC, CA, V4W 0A8
Oldcastle BuildingEnvelope®
Architectural Glass

 

Starting wage: $20.50 - 21.50 /hr
 
BENEFITS


•    Life Insurance, Extended Health & Dental coverage for you and your family
•    All PPE provided with a $150 boot allowance or supplied 
•    Company contribution match of 5% to RRSP/DPSP
•    Health and wellness programs
•    Group retirement savings program
•    Cross training and advancement opportunities, we promote great talent from within
•    Employee appreciation days
•    $150 Health Spending Account
•    Employee referral program

 

JOIN US


We are a rapidly growing supplier of specialized glass products and we need motivated team players like you!  Jump start your career with a company that can provide fully integrated building envelope products in a professional environment where outstanding performance is rewarded.


•    This is a Full-Time role, Monday to Friday with 8-hour shifts starting between 6:00am – 8:00am
•    Wages are based on experience
•    Previous experience is not required, we are willing to train the right candidate with a great attitude towards learning the business
•    All specialty training provided - (Cranes, Forklifts, OFA, CNC Operators and much more)
•    Must have reliable transportation – Not located near public transit

 

RESPONSIBILITIES


•    Become part of the team by communicating positively with lead-hand, co-workers, and supervisor
•    Ensure equipment is in safe operating condition 
•    Loading and unloading glass will require crane operation and/or manual lifting
•    Ensure proper reading of tags for glass selection and review specifications for machine adjustments
•    Set up machines to have the correct specifications for glass orders
•    Sort and load glass on to equipment for completion while maintaining all safety policies and procedures
•    Inspect finished product for dimensions, quality finish and thickness and reject not within acceptable quality tolerance level
•    Encompass best practices in all aspects of safety policies and procedures
•    Adhere to all corporate safety policies while operating company machinery
•    Maintain and operate equipment to ensure continuous plant production
•    Responsible for proper disposal of broken glass and general housekeeping within the department

 

QUALIFICATIONS


•    Physically fit and able to lift 50 lbs. consistently throughout their shift and a maximum of 75 lbs. on occasion with assistance
•    Enjoys working in a team-based environment with a positive attitude
•    Multitasking capabilities and responsive to changing priorities
•    Must have reliable transportation **located in Gloucester Industrial Park**
•    Mechanically inclined an asset
•    Basic understanding of English
•    Prefer one or more years of metal, granite, stone or glass fabrication experience
•    Prefer Crane certification
 
SAFETY


Leading the industry in safety, our COR certification is another reason that sets us apart from our competitors.  We offer an employment environment that integrates production and worker safety on a world class level.  Our training packages have been developed to give you the tools to do the job confidently and continue your career development safely.  We provide a technically challenging and rewarding career where growth and learning never stops.

 

 

 

What CRH Offers You

 

  • Highly competitive base pay
  • Comprehensive medical, dental and disability benefits programs
  • Group retirement savings program
  • Health and wellness programs
  • A culture that values opportunity for growth, development, and internal promotion

 

 

About CRH

 

CRH has a long and proud heritage. We are a collection of hundreds of family businesses, regional companies and large enterprises that together form the CRH family. CRH operates in a decentralized, diversified structure that allows you to work in a small company environment while having the career opportunities of large international organization.

 

If you’re up for a rewarding challenge, we invite you to take the first step and apply today! Once you click apply now, you will be brought to our official employment application. Please complete your online profile and it will be sent to the hiring manager. Our system allows you to view and track your status 24 hours a day. Thank you for your interest!

 

CRH is an Affirmative Action and Equal Opportunity Employer.

 

EOE/Vet/Disability--If you want to know more, please click on this link.

title: Skilled Labourer (FT)
description:
We are searching for a dependable Skilled Laborer to join our excellent construction crew. The Skilled Laborer's responsibilities include ensuring worksites are clean and safe, a demo of windows, and torched on roofing, spreading gravel, using drills, saws, and other power tools, and providing assistance with heavy machinery. You should also be able to take instruction from superiors and complete on-the-job training. To be successful as a Skilled Laborer, you will have completed apprenticeships and acquired suitable skills. An outstanding Skilled Laborer should be hungry to expand their skill set and increase their level of expertise. You should also be willing to learn from other crew members and receive off-site training wherever possible. 
 
With over two decades of experience, New City is staffed with an amazing group of professionals, engineers, project managers, and people from different trades that delivers reliable and cost-effective solutions to a wide range of building renewal challenges on both new and existing buildings. Come join our team! 
 
Location: 844 Fisgard St, Victoria, BC V8W 3M5  
 
Responsibilities:
  • Clean interior suites and possible areas around so the site.
  • Installing exterior air barrier and assisting Superintendents do daily tasks.
  • Interior suites wood working on windows frames and trims.
  • Moving materials to the worksite and ensuring all tools, machinery, and other equipment are safely set up.
  • Assisting with various window removal and roofing demo procedures.
  • Obeying health and safety codes, as well as the company's principles.
  • Removing hazardous materials from sites.
  • Driving scissor and boom lifts if necessary.
  • Performing site and equipment inspections.
  • Ensuring tasks are completed to deadlines.
  • Other duties that may be assigned.
 
Requirements:
  • High school diploma or similar.
  • Completed apprenticeships recommended.
  • Driver's license recommended.
  • Sound knowledge of construction and practical experience with tools.
  • Excellent time management, organizational, and communication skills.
  • A good understanding of safety procedures.
  • Great hand, eye, and foot coordination.
  • Willingness to learn and be flexible.
  • Positive attitude and great interpersonal skills
 
Benefits:
We offer world-class health benefits, a competitive salary package, salary based on performance, a registered retirement savings program, additional time off between Christmas and New Year’s Day, a stable work-life balance, a positive and fun corporate culture, Right Directions Employee Assistance Program, and many more!
 
New City Contracting strives to ensure that its employment practices are free from direct and indirect discrimination and is committed to upholding the human rights of those participating in the hiring process. In pursuit of this commitment, New City Contracting will not condone or tolerate any acts of discrimination or harassment under any of the grounds protected under human rights legislation. This commitment extends to the hiring process and throughout employment.




About New City Contracting Ltd.:

Over 20 years ago, Edward Buset — New City’s founder and president — saw that the Lower Mainland was missing something: a resource for property managers, homeowner associations (HOAs), engineers, and other professionals involved in the building renewal business. Edward envisioned this resource that will work on new builds or maintain existing buildings, one that will develop cost-effective plans for the renewal of all types of buildings in our area’s unique climate. From this vision rose today’s New City, one of Vancouver’s leading general contractors. With over two decades of experience, New City is staffed with an amazing group of professionals, engineers, project managers, and people from different trades that delivers reliable and cost-effective solutions to a wide range of building renewal challenges on both new and existing buildings. We know what needs to be done, when it needs to be done, and how to get it done — in the most beneficial way for the building. Whether its envelope renewal, deep renovation, concrete restoration, or other building envelope management concerns, New City has the expertise and resources to handle the largest and most complex work smoothly and efficiently. Today, New City Contracting is a trusted leader in envelope renewal for commercial and residential projects. New City is an expert in the investigation, analysis, and repair of building envelopes — for all material types and vintages. Our extensive building renewal services include: Building Envelope RenewalExterior and Interior PaintingRoof Renewal and ReplacementTenant ImprovementWaterproofingExterior and Industrial CleaningEnvironmental AbatementConcrete Restoration

title: Construction Labour
description:
CONSTRUCTION LABOUR POSITION

About WaterFarmers:

WaterFarmers Urban Agriculture is a progressive environmental design/build firm that supports the next generation of farmers, gardeners, and property managers. We provide consultation, general contracting, and construction services to clients interested in operating farm properties or producing food, as well as those interested in greening their urban environment or community. We are a small company entering our fifth year of operation, and are looking forward to a busy year working on a variety of interesting projects with a talented and diverse team. Our upcoming projects include greenhouse construction, irrigation system installations, rainwater harvesting installations, and landscaping for rain gardens and native plant/ pollinator gardens. We work with a wide variety of clientele, including homeowners, farmers, property managers, municipalities, academic institutions, not-for-profits, and other food related commercial operations. We enjoy the ongoing challenge of creating custom solutions for our clients, whether we are working on a simple backyard vegetable garden or a sophisticated indoor agriculture facility.

WaterFarmers is based in Guelph and operates across Southern Ontario, most often along the Highway 6/ Guelph-Hamilton corridor, and occasionally farther abroad when project budgets allow for travel expenses. Our worksite is located in Morriston, just south of the 401 and east of Highway 6.

 

Job Description:

WaterFarmers is looking for an ambitious, hard working, positive individual for part-time work (minimum 24 hours / week) providing on-site labour for a variety of tasks related to our upcoming landscaping and construction projects. A typical workday would consist of arriving at a project site, reviewing work tasks and safety concerns, moving material and tools, and assisting with physical labour tasks to accomplish on-site goals. Staff are expected to work safely, efficiently, and bring concerns to the attention of team leaders. Staff are also expected to participate in project discussions via email & mobile messaging in order to report on progress, raise concerns & issues, ask questions, and share photos. Daily input of timesheets for hours worked is required. We work indoors and outdoors year round, and provide all PPE and tools required. Safety & machinery training is provided to staff as needed. 

Basic Requirements:

  • Reliable transportation. Must have a valid G license and access to a vehicle

  • Work safely and effectively in a construction or farm environment

  • Physical ability & stamina to work outdoors and lift/ move heavy construction and landscaping materials around project sites

  • Access to mobile phone for daily communication via Email, Slack, Trello, and to input timesheets via QuickBooks T-Sheets

Assets:

  • Familiarity with hand tools, power tools & machinery is an asset

  • Construction, plumbing, landscaping, horticulture, or farming experience are assets

  • Ability to work independently and solve problems

  • Effective written and verbal communication skills

  • Entrepreneurial interest is a plus - we are open to employee ideas for running the best business possible, fostering a positive staff environment, and pursuing new projects, products, opportunities, and collaborations

Compensation:

  • Starting wage: $18 per hour

  • 24 hours minimum scheduled hours required per week

  • Potential for more shifts as projects and availability dictate

  • Paid training where required (WHMIS, Standard First Aid, Working from Heights, etc.)

  • Breaks throughout day - flexible and based on work tasks & staff needs

  • 1 hour unpaid lunch

  • 3 month probation period

  • Upon completion of probation period, access to profit sharing program and allowances for work boots, seasonal work clothing, phone expenses, and gas expenses.

  • Opportunities for advancement of roles & responsibilities

 

Commitment to Diversity and Inclusion

WaterFarmers is committed to treating our staff in a respectful and fair manner, and ensuring a safe and healthy work environment. We are an equal opportunity employer and invite any candidate who meets the above requirements to apply. Only successful candidates will be contacted for an interview. Interviewees will be paid $36 (2 hours @ $18/hour) for their time, and will be asked to complete a paid trial shift.

 

Application Process 

This job posting is open until April 15, with an immediate start date following a paid trial day. To apply, please send resumes and brief cover letter to

garrett@waterfarmers.ca

title: Hardscape Laborer
description:
Why CSL? 

CSL Group is a dynamic family-based company committed to its employees. We are a growing company with a fantastic reputation and are searching for new team members to grow and develop. If you are looking for a career, not just a job, we offer exciting growth and advancement opportunities. All employees at CSL are committed to our company values (SHARING - Safety, Humility, Accountability, Respect, Integrity, Nurturing, Growth). If working for a company that is committed to upholding its SHARING values excites you, please apply today! 

Job Duties:

  • 2 years of experience in the landscape enhancements industry 
  • Demonstrates initiative: ability to think, work and make decisions based on sound judgment
  • Able to operate basic construction equipment (excavator, skid steer, earth movers, etc)
  • Experience in working in repairing fences, tree planting/cutting, hardscaping, laying mulch, patio stones etc. 
  • Superior strengths including lifting, climbing, bending, digging
  • Examples of duties include excavation, grading, layout and basic construction labour tasks
  • Perform preventative maintenance on tools and equipment by conducting inspections, lubricating, and cleaning on a daily basis
  • Comply with all company policies and regulations
  • Comfort working in a fast-paced environment with extreme weather fluctuation
  • This is a full time position throughout the spring, summer, and fall seasons. This position transitions into winter duties.  

Work Perks:

  • Competitive wages
  • Company paid benefits package
  • Employee appreciation events
  • Company paid uniforms & safety boot allowance
  • RRSP and DPSP

Other companies may call this job: Full Time, Full-Time, Landscape, Landscaper, Enhancement, Construction

title: General Labourer
description:
Description:
Looking for a career, instead of just a job?
Agilus is recruiting for multiple General Labourers in the construction industry in Woodstock, Ontario.

A day in the life:
  • Assembling, preparing, and dismantling concrete forms
  • Placing and tying of reinforced steel
  • General labour duties within a concrete facility

Requirements:
  • Ability to handle physically demanding work
  • Previous labour experience in the concrete and/or construction industry considered an asset
  • Willingness to rapid test for Covid19, as required
  • Willingness to complete a pre employment drug screening for illegal substances

What's in it for you:
  • Full time, permanent employment
  • Becoming a member of the union
  • Employer paid medical and dental benefits
  • $23.97 per hour, starting wage. Increases up to $26/hour
  • Daytime hours - no evenings or weekends!

Let's connect!
Please apply directly online by phone 902.491.4494 or by email lreynolds@agilus.ca or by text 902.491.4494
Agilus would like to thank all candidates for their interest in this opportunity. Due to the volume of resumes we receive; we may only be able to respond directly to those candidates being selected for an interview.
We encourage you to visit agilus.ca regularly or subscribe to our email alerts at agilus.ca/Account/Register as new exciting employment opportunities become available daily.

We value a diverse workplace.
Agilus Work Solutions is committed to employ people from diverse backgrounds and we actively demonstrate inclusiveness through fair, equitable and accessible hiring practices. We recognize the strength that comes from different experiences, backgrounds and perspectives and welcome candidates who identify as visible minorities, Indigenous people, persons with disabilities, and persons within the LGBTQ+ community. We feel it is important as an organization that all people have access and opportunity to be employed, to be valued and to be respected.

 Accommodations for job applicants with disabilities will be provided upon request during the recruitment, assessment, selection and placement process. Alternative format available onRequest.

title: Skatepark Construction Builders / Finishers
description:
Are you a passionate, creative team player with a desire to travel and work and make a difference in communities across Canada? We have openings for experienced Carpenters and Concrete Finishers who take pride in their workmanship. Successful candidates will possess a positive attitude, be community driven, adaptable, responsible and have the ability to work and travel out of town for extended periods of time. We provide very comfortable homes away from home, travel provided to and from locations and a healthy compensation allowance for living away from home.

We are looking for individuals with experience in carpentry and formwork, welding and concrete placing/finishing. Experience with shaping and finishing vertical shotcrete and experience with concrete line pumps an asset. With safety as our top priority, we are interested in individuals with Health and Safety certifications and relative training certifications.

Preference may be given to those with a journeyman carpentry ticket, previous concrete finishing work experience, ACI certification. We are seeking interested candidates with experience in: framing and excavation, ability to read architectural drawings, rebar and form installation, measure/calculate concrete volumes, handling and troweling concrete.

New Line Skateparks offers a productive fast paced work environment in an exciting industry. Salary will be commensurate with qualifications and experience. We offer a complete benefits plan including, medical, dental, and insurance as well as a performance bonus program.
