title: Labourer - Casual
description:
Labourers with Cando are responsible for performing the safe and efficient securement of truck frames to railcars, and sorting spacers to assist plant production. Working in a fast-paced, customer oriented environment, the Labourers must work well in teams to maximize efficiency while demonstrating a strong initiative and safety focus.

Roles and Responsibilities

  • Conduct and participate in clear and concise job briefings.
  • Operate equipment such as lift truck, genie lift, spacer machine, etc. according to the safety rules and regulations of Cando and its customer
  • Prepare railcars for loading by unchaining harnesses and pallets on returning unloaded railcars.
  • Prepare stock for shipment by setting up tie rods and chains, lubricating turnbuckles as needed, and securing product on railcars.
  • Lift 25 lb rods into caps above head height and secure by pulling a chain through the rod; ratchet turnbuckles on chains until chain is tight and load is secure, lift and sort 20 lb spacers to support production
  • Adhere to all Health and Safety Programs; conduct job hazard analysis, report unsafe working conditions, and ensure they are repaired immediately
  • Contribute to team effort by assisting other team members in all functions of the job; take direction from Shift Supervisor
  • Work and operate equipment according to customer and Cando's safety rules and regulations
  • Ensure the site is clean, tidy, organized, and a safe work place at all times

Skills, Knowledge, and Abilities

  • Prioritize and perform multiple tasks with the ability to meet daily demands and function in busy situations
  • Ability to operate and perform daily maintenance checks on required machinery, including the ability to change clamps and exchange propane cylinders
  • Medically fit to work in a safety sensitive environment; physically fit including the ability to pull self up and down from forklift, genie lift, and rail car
  • Ability to work outside in all weather conditions in a plant that operates 24 hours a day, seven (7) days a week
  • Demonstrate initiative to work with others to foster a respectful workplace
  • Able to accept new challenges and responsibilities as they arise

Education & Experience

  • Training will be provided; Must be able to hold and maintain required certification

Note: This description is not intended to limit the assignment of work or be construed as a complete list of the many duties to be performed by the incumbent. The qualifications are provided so interested candidates understand of the level of expertise required in this position.

title: General Labourer - Fittings
description:
Here at KP Building Products, our employees are at the forefront of everything we do. We are the leading Canadian manufacturer and distributor of vinyl siding and strive to be the best in customer experience. We are a company rich in history and proud to be Canadian owned and operated.

KP Building Products has an immediate employment opportunity in the Brampton area for General labourers for the fitting department. The Special Fittings Operator workers manually produce specially formed fittings by heating and molding, bending, joining and cutting PVC plastics using tools such as molds, mold presses, and a press cutter.

Shifts: 8 hour shifts
Salary: $15.50 per hour

We offer:

  • Health and Dental benefits
  • RRSP
  • Ongoing training initiatives
  • Yearly Safety Boot Allowance
  • Prescription Safety Glasses Allowance
  • Vacation & paid time off

Responsabilities:

  • Determines parts to be made as per customer order
  • Cut long PVC flat sheets using cutter
  • Cut plastic sheets using band saw
  • Cut pipe using table saw
  • Welding and assembling of pieces
  • Heat plastic for forming into molds and bending
  • Set-up and replace molds and cutters
  • Cut holes into parts using a hole cutter
  • Application of labels to parts; packing of parts
  • Participate in training as required by the company
  • Adhere to all applicable company policies and procedures, including quality and health and safety
  • Perform other duties as assigned

Requirements:

  • Completed high school diploma, GED, or equivalent.
  • Two (2) years experience as a special fittings operator within a manufacturing environment, preferably working with PVC plastics is an asset
  • Ability to follow instructions from team lead and plant manager
  • Must be able to lift up to 50 lbs.

We thank all candidates for their interest, however only those candidates who fit the requirements of the role will be contacted.

KP Products is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. Upon request, KP Products will provide reasonable accommodation for disabilities to support participation of candidates in all aspects of the recruitment process.

title: Labourer
description:
Steel River Solutions is seeking Labourers for a potential upcoming pipeline integrity project in Kamloops, BC.  

The Labourer is responsible for a wide range of general construction activities.

Key Job Duties:

  • Perform demanding physical work activities and operate hand tools and trucks in a safe manner
  • Assist operators and perform a wide range of tasks at construction sites
  • Active participation in all safety and planning meetings, identification of hazards
  • Load, unload, identify and utilize tools and materials required to perform the various tasks to be executed by the crew
  • Assist with assembling and dismantling of equipment
  • Act as a spotter for trucks and other heavy equipment entering the work area
  • Clean and prepare construction work areas where needed
  • Ensure the appropriate use of Personal Protective Equipment while performing tasks
  • Adhere to all Company policies, plans, standards, and procedures
  • Identify safety risks and hazards, and comply with relevant safety procedures and regulations
  • Other tasks as assigned as deemed appropriate by management

Job Requirements:

Qualifications & Experience:

  • Various safety tickets, certificates and Personal Protective Equipment are required depending on the project and position
  • Valid Class 5 Driverâ€™s License or government issued photo identification
  • Must successfully complete pre-employment drug and alcohol testing
  • High school diploma or equivalent; and/or a combination of education and relevant work experience is an asset
  • Previous construction experience in a labourer position is an asset

Skills & Knowledge:

  • Excellent hand-eye coordination and manual dexterity
  • Knowledge of handling hazardous materials and waste
  • Physically able to perform manual labour for long hours outdoors and in all weather conditions
  • Physically able to handle and lift heavy objects up to 50 pounds
  • Knowledge of workplace safety requirements and procedures
  • Knowledge of the pipeline construction industry
  • Ability to receive instructions and carry out instructions in a safe manner
  • Excellent time management and organization abilities
  • Manual dexterity with the ability to use various hand tools
  • Ability to be reliable and have a strong work ethic
  • Strong communication skills: written and verbal skills, listening skills, proven attention to detail, and ability to develop positive working relationships
  • Ability to work in a growing, dynamic and changing environment
  • Optimistic/collaborative approach and attitude towards work

Working Conditions:

  • Field based.  Applicants must be willing to work long hours outdoors
  • Schedule: 6 days on, 1 day off with 12-hour shifts
  • Anticipated Project Start/End: May 2022 â€“ October 2022

Why Steel River Solutions?

Steel River Solutions offers a diverse range of pipeline and civil construction, maintenance, and management support services to meet the ever-growing demands of the oil and gas construction industry. Services include all the disciplines required to plan, build, execute, and maintain a project from beginning to end. Our focused dedication to completely understand a project allows us to deliver efficient, cost-effective services that also create value for our Indigenous partners.

Our objective is to provide our clients with outstanding service and to be first in class in construction, maintenance, and facilities. Through our alliances, we can provide turnkey project solutions including design, engineering support, and world-class design and construction expertise.

The Steel River team is equipped with substantial experience and has worked on small to large diameter pipeline and related pipeline projects across Canada. Steel River strives to find innovative solutions that promote health, safety, and environmental sustainability.

Our commitment is to look beyond any one single project, to cultivate opportunities, create long-lasting relationships, and to seek sustainable initiatives that enhance the communities in which we operate.

Follow us on LinkedIn and Facebook for the latest job postings and news.

Steel River Solutions is an equal opportunity employer.  Only selected candidates will be contacted.  Thank you in advance for including us in your career search! 

#LI-DNI

title: Labourer
description:
JOURNALIERS POSTES DISPONIBLES DÈS MAINTENANT!
Prim d'embauche $1000
 
Êtes-vous prêt à travailler avec une équipe dédiée à la sécurité et à la croissance de ces employés? Triumvirate Environmental ne fait pas que promettre des opportunités de croissance, nous les créons par la formation et le mentorat des employés. Joignez-vous à une équipe aussi dévouée à votre carrière que vous l'êtes!  
Triumvirate Environmental est l'une des plus grandes entreprises de services environnementaux en Amérique du Nord. Triumvirate offre des services et des conseils diversifiés pour aider à gérer la conformité des institutions de premier plan des secteurs de l'enseignement supérieur, des sciences de la vie, des soins de santé et des secteurs industriels. Chez Triumvirate, nous nous efforçons d'épater nos employés et nos clients. Notre culture unique favorise la croissance, le développement, l'éducation et la créativité.
 
 Responsabilités et les tâches essentielles:
  • Le déchargement et le chargement des camions.
  • Préparation des déchets et des documents; révision de la réglementation et de la sécurité.
  • Gestion de l'inventaire des déchets .
  • Apprendre et appliquer une connaissance de base des pratiques de travail quotidiennes.
  • Se familiariser avec les directives d'emballage et le choix des installations d'élimination.
  • Développer une compréhension des réglementations SIMDUT, des pratiques de santé et de sécurité de Triumvirate, et des réglementations TMD.
  • Communiquer efficacement avec les autres employés pour résoudre des problèmes complexes.
  • Développer le respect et les relations de travail avec ses collègues.
  • Démontrer sa capacité à être créatif et à résoudre des problèmes uniques.
  • Attitude positive!
  • Épater les clients internes et externes!
  • Capacité à travailler en équipe.
  • Suivre une formation sur les chariots élévateurs à fourche et être capable d'utiliser la machinerie en toute sécurité.
 
Qualifications requises:
  • Diplôme d'études secondaires.
  • Connaissance de base ou le désir d'aquérir des connaissances dans le domaine des déchets dangereux.
  • Passer un test d'ajustement pour un respirateur et être à l'aise pour porter un respirateur pendant plusieurs heures par semaine.
  • Permis de conduire valide.
 
Les exigences énumérées ci-dessus sont représentatives des connaissances, des compétences et/ou des aptitudes requises.  Une formation sera donnée sur place.

title: General Labourer - Night shift ($24/h & $600 signing bonus)
description:
Company Description

The launch of our production season 2022 has several surprises in store for you!!

Hurry now is the time to initiate a new career!!  First hires will be eligible to receive $600 sign on bonuses and be eligible to participate in several draws with a value of up to $500, including tickets to the Montreal Canadiens and gift cards!

No experience required. We are searching for bright, hard-working and reliable individuals interested in a successful career in manufacturing. Take your chance and come join us!

Here is why you must join Techo-Bloc:

  • Competitive salary
  • Shift Premiums available
  • End of year Bonus 
  • Overtime opportunities 
  • Several shift options available (day, evening, weekend)
  • Refer a friend for a competitive referral bonus
  • Weekly pay
  • RRSP Program available in 2022
  • Group insurance plan after 3 months of service for permanent employees
  • Career path opportunities – move to production, distribution, maintenance, transportation or supervisory roles

Shift offered:

  • Monday - Friday 5h30PM to 3h30AM
Job Description

Snapshot of your day to day

Are you a diligent worker that loves to work with your hands and you are looking for a stimulating and well-paid job? This is the right place for you!

At Techo-Bloc, our general laborers are a crucial part to our day to day operations. This role is a perfect fit for those newer to the industry, or anyone looking for a career steppingstone in manufacturing. 

Speaking of stones, our laborers are true concrete connoisseurs!  Your day-to-day will entail handling and inspecting concrete blocks, while serving as the ‘right hand’ to our machine operator and maintenance team.

  • Complete examination of finished product by checking height, shape, color and consistency by applying knowledge of proper company standards as instructed and applicable for in process systems;
  • Complete block checks, remove any defective pieces from pallet or board and replace defective pieces with quality pieces. These tasks vary by line and by product and process that the General Labourer is assigned to;
  • Sort, pack, crate and package materials and products;
  • Performs other laboring and elemental activities;
  • Clean machines and immediate work areas.
Qualifications

  • No experience required, training will be provided;
  • You will be using your manual skills. The employee must frequently lift and/or move up to 50 pounds (23kg). We won’t hide it from you, this is a physically demanding position;
  • Manual dexterity, hand-eye co-ordination and a combination of sitting, standing and walking required;
  • Punctuality, concentration and thoroughness;
  • Team spirit and collaboration.


Additional Information

Interested? Here is how you can apply:

  • Apply online right here
  • Apply by phone to this number: 1 877-832-4625 ext. 2
  • If you prefer, you can drop by with your resume at our Chambly Plant (7800 Rue Samuel-Hatt, Chambly, QC J3L 6W4)

We will be happy to answer any questions you may have. We look forward to meeting you!

Other benefits we offer:

  • Employee discounts on Techo-Bloc’s products
  • On-site training and additional courses available such as forklift certification (if it`s a work requirement)
  • Awesome uniforms and swag
  • Newly renovated plant kitchens and bathrooms in St-Hubert plants
  • Free Parking
  • Epic barbecues and Christmas parties
  • Employee Assistance Program (EAP available 24/7)

Additional information

Headquartered on the South Shore of Montreal, Techo-Bloc is a leader in outdoor landscape products. We passionately create new products to allow all design enthusiasts to transform ordinary spaces into exceptional spaces.

Why work for Techo-Bloc, you may ask? We listen and respect our employees and encourage them to make an impact. We love talent and people who are ready to roll up their sleeves to get the job done. If you're looking to put your knowledge, experience and passion into play, this is the place for you. We celebrate change, welcome your bold initiatives, and support you in bringing them to life. Our company has grown rapidly and this is just the beginning. Come join one of Canada’s Best Managed Companies and make this your next big move. You will not be disappointed!

COVID-19 considerations

The health and safety of our employees is important to us. To keep our staff safe, we've implemented safety guidelines in line with prevalent Quebec laws and regulations.

 

We thank all applicants for their interest; however, only those under consideration will be contacted.

#IndeedCHA

title: General Labour - Mixing Morning Shift-1307
description:
Are you a â€œfoodieâ€ and love cookies, muffins and pancakes?  Are you are looking for a company where we place high value on teamwork, collaboration, innovation?  Are you looking to gain experience and grow your career with a successful international company?

If you are looking to do the best work of your career, be a part of an extraordinary company and have a passion for what we do, we want to hear from you!

Cerelia Bakery Canada is currently looking to add some awesome new team members to our facility in Mississauga, ON. You will be a critical part of delivering our products to customers everywhere!

About Cerelia Bakery Canada:

We develop and produce exceptionally high-quality products including: Fresh & frozen cookie dough and muffin batter in pre-portion sizes and scoop and bake pails for the foodservice industry as well as in-store bakeries of North American grocery, mass and club stores.

Our baked gourmet cookies and muffins are produced for distribution through multiple channels, including quick service restaurants. Refrigerated products including cookie, pastry and biscuit dough sold to North American Grocery Stores in a variety of formats including canister, chub, break-and-bake and place-and-bake.

Our Research and Development is on-going, aimed at introducing new and exciting products to complement our delectable bakery lines. We are an aggressive, flexible company dedicated to providing quality products that satisfy customer needs and market place demands.

Most importantly, we are GROWING.  As we grow, our team members grow with us.  

About this Position:

The Mixer is responsible in ensuring seamless processing of product mixes/dough. The Mixer understands the impact of this position as it directly effects the whole process of our products being made as it is one the first and most important steps in the plant. The Mixer must ensure seamless processing of products. Responsible for the maintenance of prescribed quantity and quality of dough produced and operation of the mixer machine. The Mixer must be prepared to work as a team member and with minimal supervision, follow all safety and food safety procedures, and have a high threshold for heat in a manufacturing environment. 

Responsibilities (including but not limited to):

  • Follow the mixing schedule as required and laid out by the Production Supervisor.
  • Gather, measure, and mix dough ingredients per the quality guidelines using our dedicated mixing machine to be transferred into our dough cutter.
  • Transport dough buggies from one location to the other whenever required.
  • Float from one production station to another effortlessly to ensure product quality standards are maintained.
  • Manage product quality and recipes with other production team members.
  • Ensure our high-quality standards are being met with every batch we produce by checking each batch for quality and accuracy - delivering a world class finished product each time.
  • Support other departments and functions of production as required.
  • Assist sanitation with the cleanliness of production equipment and floor.
  • Adhering to all policies, procedures and programs of the company (GMP, Quality, Food Safety and Health & Safety etc) at all times.
  • Other related duties and assigned.

Working Conditions:

  • Weekend work required
  • Overtime as required
  • Ability to lift at least 50 lbs
  • Fast paced environment
  • Physical Demands: Bend, Carry, Lift, Push/Pull, Reach, Standing for long periods
  • Ability to work in a hot/cold environment. 
  • Shift 6:00 am to 2:30 pm 
  • Hourly Wage CAD 17/Guaranteed Overtime 

What you will receive in return:

  • Competitive Hourly Compensation.
  • Fully Employer Paid Medical Insurance includes Dental & Vision.
  • Life Insurance
  • 2 Weeks Paid Vacation.
  • RRSP
  • Comprehensive training program, tailored to each individual - regardless if you're a food manufacturing veteran or new to the industry, we will ensure you receive the training you need to succeed.
  • Clean and safe production facility.
  • Career advancement opportunities.

Cerelia Bakery welcomes and encourages applications from people with disabilities. Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process.

If you are eager and excited to work with a company driven by quality, commitment to excellence, and an awesome product, we want to hear from you!

title: Tunneling Labourer BC
description:
We are a growing tunneling contractor based in Calgary, AB that offers its employees exciting opportunities for career growth, a great working environment, and competitive compensation.

The Company: Bothar Inc. specializes in trenchless tunneling technologies, balancing cost-effective drilling solutions with environmental protection. Our trenchless tunneling technology, Direct Pipe, presents unique cost saving and scheduling opportunities for challenging pipeline and municipal projects.

Bothar is respected in the trenchless contracting industry by clients and employees alike, for our integrity, commitment to excellence, and customer orientated service.

Our great team of staff are the best in their field. They are committed to collaboration, quality, and safety. We invest in our people, and they deliver excellence! We believe in leading through innovation and providing superior value and service to our clients and partners by with safe, high quality, and environmentally conscious trenchless solutions.

The Position: As we are expanding our field of operations, we are in need of more motivated and hardworking crew members to join our team. The Labourer position is responsible for assisting in the timely and technical execution of installations, as a part of the operations team on project sites. 

Labourers will have the opportunity to work with equipment used in Micro Tunneling, Horizontal Direction Drilling (HDD), Auger Boring, and Direct Pipe trenchless installations. 

Opportunities are currently available at various project locations across BC and Alberta. 

Compensation includes:

  •    Equitable pay based on experience
  •    Applicable overtime
  •    Living out allowance or paid accommodations
  •    Travel expense coverage

Essential Duties and Responsibilities

  •  Maintain cleanliness / organization / stock of parts container and tool container
  •  Remove/Install cables on spools during de mob / mob.
  •  Efficiently pull and install tunneling utility lines (electrical cables, slurry lines, hydraulics)
  •  Effectively connect / install victaulic clamps and hydraulic connections
  •  Rig, hoist, and direct lifting equipment
  •  Load and unload trucks
  •  Maintain, clean, and refurbish equipment
  •  Effectively pack and secure pallets / boxes / cages
  •  Connect internal and external brackets for utility lines
  •  Inspect, connect, and install airlines
  •  Apply condat grease on machine connections
  •  Fill out required paperwork, such as Field Level Hazard Assessments, HID cards.
  •  Knowledge & ability to operate air compressor, pumps, arial lift, generators etc.

Technical Skills and Knowledge

  •  Basic mechanical/electrical skills
  •  Operate power / hand tools safely and with skill
  •  The ability to determine the necessary tools for assigned tasks
  •  The ability to troubleshoot a problem based on experience and applicable trade knowledge
  •  Good work ethic, ability to work long hours (12-hour shift work)
  •  Able to work in confined spaces
  •  Clearly spot vehicles and equipment, and communicate using basic hand signals
  •  Understand use of and clearly communicate on two-way radios.
  •  Identify lifting points on equipment, able to safely rig equipment / pipe for lifting
  •  Previous experience in tunneling, general construction, or oil field work
  •  Contribute to a safe working environment
  • Travel may be required subject to project locations

Successful candidates will be required to have the following safety tickets ( training is available);

  • WHIMIS, First Aid, CSTS or PCST, Confined Space Entry and Rescue, Fall Arrest / Fall Protection
  • Drug and Alcohol clearance

Other Relevant Information        

    • Travel is required in this position. 
    • While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to sit and walk; use hands and fingers to handle, or feel; reach with hands and arms; talk, and hear.
    • Frequently required to lift and/or move up to 50 lbs.
    • Distance vision, peripheral vision, depth perception, and the ability to adjust focus
    • Employee will be required to work in outdoor weather conditions, including extreme cold and heat
    • Required to work in confined spaces (42-inch or 46-inch pipe)
    • Covid 19 Vaccination Required


    Bothar is an equal opportunity employer, and is committed to providing an equitable, diverse and inclusive workplace where all employees, whatever their gender, race, ethnicity, national origin, age, sexual orientation or identity, education, and/or disability, feel valued and respected. 

    While we appreciate all applications, only those who are selected will be contacted.

title: General Labour
description:
Location : Hamilton ON 

City : Hamilton 

State : Ontario (CA-ON) 

Country : Canada (CA) 

Requisition Number : 20682 

Position Summary:

This position involves various shift arrangements and the incumbents must be flexible to accommodate the frequently changing shift arrangements.  Shifts can be day shift, Monday to Friday 0700 hours to 1530 hours. However the incumbents will frequently be required to fill in on twelve hour rotating shifts as a spare person on shift.  Shift schedules and job assignments for this position are arranged by the Material Handling Supervisor in accordance with the business requirements for the various plant areas.  The position requires a conscientious person in the areas of operational procedures, quality control, GMP, reporting, safety and housekeeping and customer service.  This area of responsibility requires a person whom can work flexible schedules, on relatively short notice, as directed by the needs of the business.

This position will start out doing general housekeeping type work in the plant.

 

 

Core Functions:

  • Totally responsible for any area of operations assigned to during all hours of work to which assigned on a particular shift or week.
  • Compliance with any Work Instruction – Operational Procedures
  • Maintaining the safe and efficient use of all equipment, ensuring only the equipment that needs to run is operating and in good order
  • Maintaining Good Manufacturing Practices (GMP) at all times
  • Safely and efficiently operating the Locomotive Switch Engine and Trackmobile as required.
  • Safely and efficiently operating the plant Bob Cat and Case Skid Steer as required.
  • Safely and efficiently operating the plant forklift as required.
  • Safely and efficiently operating the rail car tugger as required.
  • Maintaining a stock of sufficient cleaning supplies and equipment in the stockroom.
  • Maintaining a stock of sufficient safety supplies in the stockroom, and distributing the same to various plant storage areas.
  • Cleaning up of plant grounds and perimeter areas as required and directed by Supervision.
  • Loading of meal and hulls products and unloading of incoming beans and seed rail cars, trucks and vessels (ships) as required.
  • Completing the proper paperwork for all loads received and loaded.  As these loads are shipped and received in bulk, the incumbents are responsible for the accurate operation of truck and rail bulk weighing scales and accurately recording of the weights received or shipped, as the case may be.
  • Basic computer and keyboard skills sufficient to accurately use the plant OneWeigh and System 2000 programs. 
  • Maintaining Safety Standards in all areas of the operation
  • Maintain and clean all areas of the operations at all times. Will also be responsible for cleaning in any other area of the plant as required by Supervision.
  • Maintaining personal hygiene, cleanliness and appearance including compliance with Bunge Hamilton dress code as, at times, this person will be dealing directly with our customers.
  • Must comply with Bunge Safety Policy E-3 Respiratory Equipment.  The incumbent must be and remain sufficiently free of facial hair so as to guarantee the necessary proper fitting of respirator equipment at all times while on site and be willing to undergo periodic fit testing as required by the policy.
  • The ability to wear and use proper fall restraint apparatus when working at heights.
  • Provide written reports of Operational/Equipment problems and discrepancies to the Supervisor, utilizing the “Employee Departmental Report” form, and following the “Operator Protocol for Calling the On-call Supervisor” and the Company Call-In Procedures when necessary.  Work orders to be processed through the direct report unless priority #1 during off hours.
  • Provide accurate written reports on any Incidents, Accidents, Fire or Spills as necessary, utilizing the “Employee Departmental Report” form.
  • Complying with all Bunge Corporate and Hamilton policies, including Safe Work Practices, Emergency Measures Plan, Hourly Employee’s Handbook, and the Health and Safety Act of Ontario.  Maintaining Safety Standards in all areas of work.
  • Reporting on small inventories needed for the area of operations
  • Call in to the Boiler Room Operator at 3:00 am for attendance check-in when on shift.
  • Must complete any other tasks required to run a safe and efficient operation or as requested by the Company

 

Skill/Experience Requirements:

  • Grade 12 education required, technical college diploma preferred.
  • Good mechanical aptitude.
  • Good computer / keyboard skills
  • Able to consistently lift up to 22.7 kg.
  • Must be able to work from heights and in confined spaces.
  • Ability to communicate effectively both oral and written

 

 

Bunge Canada – Hamilton is a tenant of the Hamilton-Oshawa Port Authority (federal property), Transport Canada requires us to require that all of our employees be vaccinated in order to be on-site.  As a condition of your employment, you must be fully vaccinated with a government-approved type of COVID-19 vaccine and provide proof of vaccination. 

 

Bunge (NYSE: BG) is a world leader in sourcing, processing and supplying oilseed and grain products and ingredients. Founded in 1818, Bunge’s expansive network feeds and fuels a growing world, creating sustainable products and opportunities for more than 70,000 farmers and the consumers they serve across the globe. The company is headquartered in St. Louis, Missouri and has 25,000 employees worldwide who stand behind more than 350 port terminals, oilseed processing plants, grain facilities, and food and ingredient production and packaging facilities around the world.

 

Bunge is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, transgender status, national origin, citizenship, age, disability or military or veteran status, or any other legally protected status.  Bunge is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Minorities/Women/Veterans/Disabled

title: Labourers - Ontario
description:
The Nuna Group of Companies is now accepting resumes for Labourers with large earthworks and construction projects experience.
 
Nuna is the largest Inuit-owned heavy civil construction, earthworks and mine construction contractor in Canada.  
 
We offer: 
  • 2 week on / 2 week off rotations; 12 hour days
  • Competitive hourly rate with Overtime pay (1.5x),
  • Employee recognition/ rewards program,
  • Commercial flights and accommodations are covered,
  • Long-term employment opportunities
This position is located on our project site located in the Northern Ontario, Timmins / Gogama

PLEASE NOTE: Only candidates from Ontario will be considered for this role.

RESPONSIBILITIES:
  • Load and unload construction materials
  • Working around heavy equipment
  • Assist heavy equipment operators; spotting of trucks and other heavy equipment
  • Manual labor including shoveling, sweeping, raking
  • Working in remote locations in a camp setting
  • Previous Dewatering experience


QUALIFICATIONS:
  • Ability to lift up to 50 lbs on a regular basis
  • Must hold a valid Driver's License
  • Must be 18+ years old
  • Must be willing to work outdoors and in various weather conditions
  • Willing and capable of committing to a 2x2 rotation,
  • Surface Miner CORE an asset. (Please submit copy with your resume).

Candidates will have to be Covid Vaccinated to gain site access and to fly. Covid-19 testing will be conducted on site.
 
How to Apply:
Applicants are asked to apply online at http://nunalogistics.com/jobs.html or by email: hr@nunalogistics.com
 
Nuna is committed to the principle of employment equity. We welcome diversity and encourage all who are qualified to express their interest.   
We thank all who apply but only those selected for interviews will be contacted.
 
Nuna is a highly regarded civil construction company with hundreds of employees working across the Arctic and Northern Canada. Working often in remote locations, Nuna offers unique on-the-job experience and opportunity to build an exciting career. Our multi-disciplined teams provide a comprehensive array of services and innovative solutions to the most challenging and remote sites in northern Canada. Nuna's core values of: Safety - Integrity - Teamwork - Respect for Cultural Diversity and for Community & Environment; reflect our reputation as a safe, cost-effective and innovative operator in the north.

title: Landscape Construction Labourer
description:
BOFFO LANDSCAPING INC.

Boffo Landscaping Inc. is a family-owned and operated landscape maintenance, construction, and snow & ice control service operation.  Established in 1996, Boffo Landscaping is now a leader in the landscape industry throughout the GTA.  Boffo has been a proud and valued member of Landscape Ontario since inception and Boffo will continue to provide exceptional services for years to come.  Boffo is currently seeking high quality, highly motivated and experienced individuals who are willing to join our Landscape Maintenance Team as a full-time position.

 



LANDSCAPING & CONSTRUCTION PROFESSIONAL

 

DEPARTMENT:                      Landscaping & Construction

 

COMMENCEMENT:                        Spring 2022   

(** Immediate positions available **)

 

SUMMARY:  Boffo Landscaping Inc. is looking for hard working, punctual, dependable and motivated individuals with an excellent work ethic.  Candidates should have a minimum of 1 year landscaping/construction experience (with flexibility for increased training).  This position is "full-time" seasonal with the potential for year-round employment & an opportunity for future growth and advancement in this field.     

 



REQUIREMENTS, FUNCTIONS & RESPONSIBILITIES:

  • Perform all aspects of the company's "Landscaping & Construction" Operations including: tree and shrub planting, grading, sod work, interlocking, retaining walls, natural stone work, soil/mulch installation, etc.
  • Should have knowledge, experience and capability in using various tools, equipment, and machines required for landscape construction work (for example, skid steer, backhoe, mini excavator, plate tampers, concrete saw, etc.).
  • Knowledge and hands-on competence of various plant material, aggregates, and other landscape construction materials and supplies required for project work (is an asset).
  • Perform both small and large scale landscape construction enhancements/improvements as assigned to crew unit. Ensure efficient completion of work in the allotted timeframe for each project in conjunction with Crew Foreman. 
  • Continually deliver a high standard of work and productivity with field work operations. Demonstrate good interpersonal skills and respect for customers, suppliers, and co-workers.  Effectively and safely operate crew trucks & tandem trailers, crew equipment, and machines.  Ensure safe use and operation of all equipment and machines.   
  • Must be a "team player" dedicated to achieving both crew and company goals. Perform other related duties, as assigned, that are in accordance with job responsibilities or necessary department and corporate objectives.  Must arrive to work in a timely fashion and in uniform.
  • Learn, uphold, understand, and respect the rules and regulations as outlined in the company's "Corporate Policy Manual" and "Safety Manual". Manage and enforce all safety policies and procedures.
  • Must have a high school diploma and possess minimum 1 year experience in landscaping/construction. Candidates should have a valid "G" license and a clean driving record and reliable transportation to and from work.

 

**** Opportunity for full-time, year-round employment will be available for successful candidates ****

**** $25.00-$35.00/hr depending on qualifications****

 

 

SUBMIT RESUME & CONTACT:

Boffo Landscaping Inc. welcomes and encourages applications from people with disabilities.  Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process.

 

Please submit your resume:

 

* Office:  905-832-3850                                                  Address: 12000 Keele Street, Maple, ON

* Email: careers@boffolandscaping.com                                     L6A 1S1                    

 

Note:  We would like to thank (in advance) all applicants for their resume submittal and interest; however, we will only be contacting those candidates who are selected for an interview.

title: General Laborer (Landscape Construction)
description:
General Laborer (Landscape Construction)

Reports to:  Crew Foreman

Company:

We are a growing company that specializes in Design Build Landscape work in a busy landscaping and excavation industry. Ability to grow with company, options for advancement.  No weekend work, working Monday to Friday approximately 40-50 hrs. With Fridays being a shortened day. Paid weekly, bonus on a yearly basis. Great rate of pay, training available. Options to work yearly. Snowplowing and excavation work in the winter months. Working hours are 7-5pm, except Fridays. 

Character:

We are looking for motivated employees, that have valid transportation, clean drivers abstract, ability to work as a team member in an environment that promotes professional workmanship, quality work, and passion for working in one of the most rewarding and wonderful industries.  Abilities should include, fast thinker, problem solving, attention to details, abilities to work in a fast-paced environment, working in all weather conditions. Working with and around heavy equipment.  Good mathematical skills, some knowledge of small engine repair and maintenance.  Priorities will be given to those with previous experience, and or AR, DZ or AZ licenses. 

Summary:

The Landscape Laborer is responsible for performing a variety of work tasks (generally physical labor) in order to assist with the completion of landscape construction projects. The landscape laborer will be required to operate a variety of tools and equipment to carry out specified job tasks.

  Core Capabilities:

  • Customer and quality focus
  • Effective communication skills (both verbal and written)
  • Teamwork
  • Excellent problem-solving abilities
  • Responsibility and dependability
  • Ethics and integrity

  Job Duties:

  •   Assist in the preparation of jobsites prior to the beginning of a project
  • Operate various tools and equipment, including chainsaws, jackhammers, laser levels, measurement equipment, shovels, hammers, drills, etc.
  • Mix, pour, and spread concrete
  • Assist in the construction of walkways, fences, decks, posts, etc.
  • Perform preventative maintenance on tools and equipment by conducting inspections, lubricating, and cleaning on a daily basis
  • Dig ditches or trenches
  • Perform land clearing activities
  • Plant and maintain garden beds and lawns
  • Load and unload materials, tools, and equipment required to complete landscape construction projects
  • Transport materials using shovels, wheelbarrows, carts, dollies, and hand lifting/carrying
  • Assist foreman with job-related tasks
  • Read and interpret blueprints, structural drawings, and specifications to perform work activities
  • Always wear appropriate personal protective equipment
  • Comply with all company policies and regulations
  • Work in accordance with all local health and safety laws and regulations

  Requirements:

  •   High School Diploma, GED or equivalent
  • Minimum one year experience in the landscape/construction industry
  • Capable of operating required equipment and tools in a safe and responsible manner
  • Effective communication skills (both verbal and written)
  • Time management skills
  • Ability to read and interpret blueprints and specifications
  • Knowledge of specific materials, methods, tools, and equipment required to complete various landscape/construction practices
  • Ability to work both independently with little supervision, and as part of a team
  • Ability to walk, stand, crouch for long periods of time and carry out strenuous physical tasks
  • Preference will be given to candidates with a valid driver’s license and safe driving record

Work Conditions:

  • Ability to work with hand tools, power tools, small engine equipment, and materials
  • Ability to lift a minimum of 50 lbs. repeatedly through an entire work shift
  • Ability to work in a fast-paced environment
  • Requires good manual dexterity
  • Excellent stamina is required
  • Work near heavy equipment and other vehicles on a regular basis
  • Work outdoors in various conditions including heat and humidity, rain, dust, noise, and cold
  • Flexible working hours including occasional weekend work

Wages:

Wage Rate start at $19.00 and can range to $24.00.

Winter work avaliable for those wishing to work with our snowplowing division.

title: Laborer/Junior Building Operator
description:
ABOUT THIS CAREER OPPORTUNITY

Black & McDonald is currently seeking an entry level Labourer/Junior Operator to join our Vancouver team! If you are a hands-on, customer service-oriented, and technically-inclined professional searching for the opportunity to build a solid foundation for your career, this position is for you. This position is located in Vancouver and will report directly to the Supervisor.

The Labourer/Junior Operator for the Single Room Occupancy (SRO) Sites in the Downtown Eastside (DTES) Vancouver area is responsible for maintaining safe conditions inside and outside of the facilities, performing minor tasks, cleaning, and minor repairs. Under the direction of the Building Operator, Supervisor or Project Manager, this individual will conduct minor mechanical inspections and maintenance of equipment using Facilities Management & Operations processes to ensure optimum operation. For the right individual, this position offers the potential to grow into a Building Operator role.

  • In conjunction with the Building Operator, Supervisor/Project Manager and the team, execute responsive and planned maintenance in accordance with the computerized maintenance management system (CMMS).
  • Respond to Housing Operator requests and complaints.
  • Perform basic tours and log reading of equipment, as instructed.
  • Assist in the movement of materials to various work areas.
  • Assist tradespersons, technicians or sub-contractors as required.
  • Establish methods to meet work schedules and co-ordinate work activities with other subcontractors.
  • Perform light duties such as cleaning, painting, garbage removal, plumbing and other mechanical duties.
  • Direct pedestrian traffic when assisting with building exterior work & building washing.
  • Assist in purchasing parts and materials when requested.

COMPETENCY REQUIREMENTS

  • Communicates Effectively
  • Continuous Learning
  • Customer Focus
  • Values and Respects Others

EDUCATION REQUIREMENTS

  • High School completion would be an asset.

WORK EXPERIENCE REQUIREMENTS

  • 1-3 years’ experience as a general Labourer would be considered an asset.
  • 1-3 years’ experience working within commercial buildings/facilities or in construction would be considered an asset.
  • Knowledge and experience of working in the DTES location with 1-3 years social housing experience may be an asset.

SKILLS, ABILITIES, AND OTHER REQUIREMENTS

  • Excellent verbal and written communications skills required.
  • Ability to follow written and verbal instruction.
  • Must be a team player, work well with others.
  • Excellent customer service skills.
  • Maintain a professional demeanor at all times with fellow employees and customer.
  • Must be comfortable working within the DTES environment.
  • Comply with all company policies and procedures and adhere to company standards.
  • Must be available for occasional Emergency after hours duties.
  • Available to travel within the DTES.

We welcome and encourage applications from persons with disabilities. Accommodations are available upon request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the recruitment and selection process.

title: Labourer
description:
Labourer - (2200002L)

Description

 

We invite you to Explore the Potential of being part of something Clearly Essential! 

At Compass Minerals, we harvest, mine and produce essential minerals that deal with nature’s challenges, including – but not limited to – highway deicing salt for the winter months, water softening salt and plant nutrition that improves the quality and yield of crops. We transform Earth’s resources that ultimately help keep people safe, feed the world and enrich lives, every day.

With our company headquarters in Overland Park, KS, Compass Mineralsoperates 15 production and packaging facilities with more than 2,000 employees throughout the U.S., Canada, Brazil and the U.K. We’re committed to creating an inclusive workplace where everyone’s voice matters. We believe in work that creates value for all stakeholders, encourages collaboration at all levels and focuses on a high-performance environment where employees are challenged to be their best. 

 

Summary:  

We are currently seeking to fill a Labourer position that will cover as a spare operator in several capacities when required, Training will be provided to ensure competency prior to being scheduled to various production lines. This is a permanent full-time position located in Unity, SK.

The Unity Evaporation Plant is located in a friendly community of 2,500 that loves hockey, curling, baseball/softball, situated in the beautiful big-sky prairies an hour from North Battleford and a 2 hour drive from Saskatoon. We’re proud to be one of Unity’s steadfast employers, currently employing 55-60 people. Annually, we produce 135,000 tons of food grade, water conditioning and agricultural salt, serving our customers throughout Western Canada.

Essential Job Positions & Functions:Include but are not limited to the following:  (Management reserves the right to add or modify the duties and responsibilities, in all positions, at any time.)

Labourer

  • Responsible for various clean up duties and sanitation of areas assigned by supervisor.
  • Responsible to stack boxes for the slim line production.
  • Responsible to occasionally assist in the maintenance department.
  • Responsible for other duties as assigned and assisting on various production lines as a spare operator assigned by supervisor, when required, and/or scheduled

 

Spare Operator Functions, as required:

               (Training will be provided to ensure competency prior to being scheduled to various production lines)

Block Press Operator

  • Production of 20 kg agricultural blocks

Bagger/Palletizer Operator

  • Production of up to 25 kg bags of various salt product

Dust Collector Operator

  • Responsible for cleaning and maintaining the dust collection equipment and piping

IBC Bagger Operator

  • Production of 1,000 kg salt totes

Slim Line Packaging Operator

  • Production of 1 kg household boxed salts

 

 

Qualifications

 

Qualifications:

To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily.  The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required.

  • The ideal candidate will:
    • have previous work experience in a process-related industry, be knowledgeable about process equipment and control systems, and be flexible to different task assignments.
    • have the ability to understand manufacturer’s operating instruction books, follow complex oral and/or written instructions
    • have the ability to maintain records & reports relative to the operations of the plant
    • have the ability to multi-task, and possess excellent communication and interpersonal skills
    • be mechanically inclined and have the ability to troubleshoot, problem solve, repair and resolve issues related to the position
    • have a clear understanding of how to accurately perform safety and regulatory responsibilities (i.e. equipment, safe work procedures, etc.)
    • be able to work at heights and confined spaces.
    • be successful with basic math skills and equations
    • have own transportation to report to scheduled shifts on time
    • have valid class 5 driver’s license
    • be available for varied shifts
      • 8 hour (Monday to Friday) or rotating 12 hours (which sometimes include weekends)

 

Education and/or Experience:

  • Experience with Microsoft Office programs: Word, Excel
  • Previous Forklift Experience is an asset
  • For future growth within the Company a 3rd or 4th Class Interprovincial Power Engineer’s certificate, recognized in the Province of Saskatchewan, is a definite asset, however not necessary

 

Physical Requirements: The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job.  Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

  • Stand for extended periods of time while performing work tasks
  • Bend or crouch throughout the work shift to work on equipment.
  • Capability of lifting up to 50 pounds (25 kg) and move items short distances.
  • Reach in all directions to adjust valves and make adjustments to equipment.
  • Comfort with climbing flights of stairs/ladders between floors of the building multiple times a day.
  • Perform fine hand and finger movements to hold tools appropriately and make precise adjustments to equipment

 

Compass Minerals is an equal opportunity and affirmative action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, disability, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, veteran status, or genetic information. Compass Minerals is committed to providing access, equal opportunity and reasonable accommodation for individuals with disabilities in employment, its services, programs, and activities. To request reasonable accommodation, contact 519 524 8351 orcareers@compassminerals.com.

 

Primary Location

: CA-CA-Unity

Work Locations

: 
Unity, SK CAN 
Highway 14 East 
 Unity S0K 4L0

: Salt

Schedule

: Regular

Shift

: Full-time

 Rotating

title: General Labourers
description:
General Labourers

This is a physically and mentally challenging position involving heavy lifting, hard work, solid people skills, willingness to take direction and a desire to perform requested duties with a focus on safety and appropriate precautions.

Requirements:
  • Must pass a pre-employment Drug & Alcohol Test
  • Excellent communication, organizational and interpersonal skills
  • Class 5 driver’s license with clean drivers abstract
  • Comprehension and compliance of all safety procedures
  • Must have a good handle on the use of power and hand tools (drills, impacts, wrenches, etc).
  • A disciplined work ethic and ability to take initiative as well as accept direction
  • Remain alert, and maintain a high level of concentration along with problem solving skills
  • Have good judgement and the ability to react quickly
  • Capable of working in both a team and individual environment
  • Physically fit and capable of long hours
  • Candidates must be legally entitled to work in Canada.
  • Ability and certification operating small equipment such as forklift and skid-steer would be an asset.

If you are energetic and excited to work as part of a team, focused on completing each job to the highest standards and want to contribute your skills and experience then we want to hear from you!
We thank all applicants in advance for your interest in RoskaDBO Inc., and this position. Only those selected for an interview will be contacted.

description: <section class="cached-bot-fjv-skeletonstyle__CachedSkeletonDescription-sc-gqtazs-0 gbrdjA">Conagra Brands is one of North America's leading branded food companies. We have a rich heritage of making great food, and a team that’s passionate about innovation and growth. Conagra offers choices for every occasion through iconic brands, such as Hunts, Aylmer, Marie Callender's®, Healthy Choice®, Slim Jim®, VH Sauces, Pogo and Vlasic®, and emerging brands, including Angie's® BOOMCHICKAPOP®, Duke's®, Earth Balance®, Gardein®, and Frontera®. We pride ourselves on having the most impactful, energized and inclusive culture in the food industry. For more information, visit www.conagrabrands.ca. Conagra Brands est une des principales entreprises d’aliments de marque en Amérique du Nord. Son histoire est jalonnée de grands succès alimentaires qui sont le fruit du travail d’une équipe passionnée par l’innovation et la croissance. Conagra offre des choix pour toute occasion grâce à des marques réputées comme Hunt’s®, Aylmer®, Marie Callender's®, Healthy Choice®, Slim Jim®, les sauces VH®, Pogo®, Vlasic® et des marques émergentes, dont Angie's® BOOMCHICKAPOP®, Duke's®, Earth Balance®, Gardein® et Frontera®. Nous sommes très fiers d’avoir la culture la plus influente, la plus dynamique et la plus inclusive du secteur alimentaire. Pour en savoir plus, visitez www.conagrabrands.ca. Perform operations including but not limited to: equipment operation, sanitation, packaging, labelling, dispensing spices, sorting and processing of fresh tomatoes. Demonstrate behaviours in support of safe food handling practices and company safety procedures with a focus on zero injuries. Repetitive tasks, hand-eye co-ordination, standing for extended periods of time and ability to work overtime are required. Own transportation and steel toed safety boots are required. Ability to lift up to 50lbs No experience necessary. Conagra Brands is an equal opportunity employer and considers qualified applicants for employment without regard to race, color, creed, religion, national origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity and expression, age, disability, or any other protected factor. ConAgra Foods is committed to working with and providing accommodation to individuals with disabilities. If you need special assistance or an accommodation while seeking employment, please e-mail Canada.Recruitment@conagrafoods.com. We will make a determination on your request for accommodation on a case-by-case basis. À titre d'employeur souscrivant au principe de l'égalité d'accès à l'emploi, Conagra Brands considère les postulants qualifiés pour les offres d'emplois sans égard à la race, la couleur, les croyances religieuses, l'origine, le sexe, l'orientation sexuelle, l'identité de genre, la langue parlée, l'âge, le handicap ou tout autre facteur discriminatoire. Conagra Brands s'engage à travailler et offrir des accommodements aux individus ayant des handicaps. Si vous avez besoin d'assistance ou si vous avez des besoins spécifiques pour votre emploi, vous pouvez transmettre votre demande par courriel à Canada.Recruitment@conagrafoods.com. Nous prendrons en considération votre demande d'accommodement au cas-par-cas.</section>

title: SEASONAL LABOURER II - CEMETERY
description:
Job Description:

 

Exciting things are happening at the City of Brampton. Take a look at what employees are working on related to our Term of Council Priorities moving us forward towards The Brampton 2040 Vision.

 

 

2022 SUMMER OPPORTUNITY - SEASONAL LABOURER II - CEMETERY

 

 

Are you looking to gain valuable experience, learn new skills and grow your career doing meaningful work with  one of Canadaâ€™s Top 100 Employers? Then consider a summer job with our Parks Maintenance and Forestry Division. If you are returning to school in the fall and are looking to gain some great experience we want to hear from you.

 

PRIMARY FUNCTION:

 

Reporting to the Foreperson, this position is responsible to assist with the daily maintenance of Bramptonâ€™s cemeteries. Ensure the safe operation of equipment and vehicles and compliance with rules and regulations.  

  • Assist with restoration and maintenance of burial plots after burial or removal of human remains â€“ i.e. level graves, topsoil, seed, sod, irrigate.
  • Assist with general turf maintenance â€“ i.e. fertilizing, mowing, trimming, seeding, watering.
  • Perform garbage collection, litter picking and maintenance of amenities.
  • Assist with grave site maintenance and care â€“ i.e. removal of flowers from graves.
  • Edge and level grave markers.
  • Assist with gardening â€“ i.e. soil management, maintain and plant flowerbeds/displays.
  • Assist with tree and shrub care â€“ i.e. pruning, fertilizing, planting and staking.
  • Report all concerns, accidents and incidents to immediate supervisor for follow up and take appropriate action.
  • Responsible for the safe and efficient operation, care of tools and equipment.
  • Communicate courteously with the general public and where necessary refer them to appropriate supervisor.
  • Understand, adhere to, and enforce Corporate Policies & Procedures, Confidentiality Guidelines, Emergency Procedures and Health and Safety Standards for all participants and staff.
  • Performs other duties as assigned.

 

SELECTION CRITERIA:

  • Completion of Grade 11
  • Current Standard First from an accredited organization
  • Ability to perform physical work duties in varied/all weather conditions
  • Exceptional customer service and communication skills
  • Valid Ontario non-probationary Class G Drivers Licence
  • Ability to successfully acquire City of Brampton Drivers and Equipment permits

 

**Various tests and/or exams may be administered as part of the selection criteria.

 

Job status:   Summer/Seasonal

Employment period is from April to September, based  on a 40 hour work week.

 

Hourly rate:    $16.75

Applications must be received by July 01, 2022

Alternate formats will be provided  upon request.

 

   

 

If this opportunity matches your interest and experience, please apply online by clicking the button above by July 01, 2022  and complete the attached questionnaire. We thank all applicants; however, only those selected for an interview will be contacted. The successful candidate(s) will be required, as a condition of employment, to execute a written employment agreement. A criminal record search will be required of the successful candidate to verify the absence of a criminal record for which a pardon has not been granted.

 

Preference will be given to students that have a permanent residency in Brampton.

 

As part of the application process, applicants will be invited to complete a self identification survey. The survey is voluntary. Participation in the survey will have no impact on hiring decisions.   All information collected is confidential and will not be shared with the hiring manager. The surveys will be anonymized and will be kept separate from applicant or employee files, such that the individuals who completed the surveys will not be identifiable.   The results of the survey will assist in the analysis of disaggregated metrics for organizational planning purposes and our commitment to advance and foster diversity, equity, and inclusion. The City may use anonymized data to produce aggregate reports for internal or external use.

 

Please be advised, the City of Brampton uses email to communicate with their applicants for open job competitions. It is the applicantâ€™s responsibility to include an updated email address that is checked daily and accepts emails from unknown users. As we send time sensitive correspondence via email (i.e. testing bookings, interview dates), it is imperative that applicants check their email regularly. If we do not hear back from applicants, we will assume that you are no longer interested in the Job Competition and your application will be removed from the Competition. The City is an equal opportunity employer.  

 

The City is an equal opportunity employer.   We are committed to inclusive, barrier-free recruitment and selection processes and work environments. If you require any accommodations at any point during the application and hiring process, please contact TalentAcquisition@brampton.ca or 905.874-2150 with your accommodation needs, quoting the job opening ID#, job title. Any information received relating to accommodation will be addressed confidentially.

title: Labourer
description:
Inland Technologies

Labourer (Seasonal Full-time)

YYZ â€“ Toronto Pearson International Airport

The members of the Inland Group of Companies (Inland Technologies, IDS and Quantem Aviation Services) are highly experienced in environmental management, aircraft de-icing, ground handling and pretty much any other aviation support service you can think of. We operate at over 50 airports in four countries. Inland Technologies core business is the delivery of airport environmental compliance programs. We are continuously innovating the technologies we use to provide our range of services including, spent aircraft de-icing fluid collection and recycling, wastewater management, and aircraft de-icing fluid manufacturing for reuse.

Our business is built on a foundation of excellence in customer service, innovation and continuous improvement and safety is at the forefront of everything we do.  We provide a workplace where respect, integrity and a high degree of ethical behaviour is a minimum expectation.  To learn more about our organization, please visit our website at:  www.inlandgroup.ca

 

We are currently providing an opportunity for a well-rounded safety focused individual to join our team in the position of Labourer at our YYZ Toronto Pearson International Airport station.

 

About You:

The ideal candidate will be someone who is passionate about safety, doesnâ€™t shy away from a challenge and is comfortable working in an environment where the noise level can be excessive at times.

 

About the Position:

Aside from the excitement of working in a busy production facility, the essential duties and responsibilities of this position include:

  • Promoting and adhering to our safety and respectful workplace culture and instilling this culture in the station while ensuring safety and regulatory compliance with all Government Labour, Health and Safety laws, regulations and policies. HAVE ZERO TOLERANCE FOR UNSAFE ACTS!;
  • Plan and carry out work assignments and handle problems in accordance with instructions, policies, previous training or accepted company practices and procedures;
  • Keep all Inland owned or managed equipment, tools and materials in good working condition, including keeping clean and returning to assigned storage areas when not in use;
  • Clean MVR plates, change filters on concentrators, clean cyclones, clean area in around and under concentrators, and cleaning heat exchanger plates;
  • Maintain facility cleanliness and appearance including garbage removal, washroom cleaning and restocking and other general cleaning requirements;
  • Promptly and accurately complete all associated paperwork as required;
  • Perform and record light maintenance tasks and immediately report any repair requirements;
  • Perform/complete other additional projects, duties, and assignments as required and/or by management request.

 

Qualifications:

  • High school diploma or equivalent;
  • Valid RAIC and AVOP considered an asset; 
  • Must be available and flexible to work variable shifts including weekends and holidays for the duration of the season;
  • Ability to work independently showing good judgement;
  • Ability to read, write, speak and communicate effectively;
  • Ability to interpret documents including safety rules, operating, maintenance and procedure manuals;
  • General mechanical competence and ability to effectively use hand tools;
  • Ability to work as part of a team;
  • Ability to maintain a positive and good-natured attitude;
  • Self-starter with the ability to prioritize workload to ensure deadlines are met;
  • Willing to learn new skills and adapt to change in order to support the growth of the company and meet needs of customers.

 

About Inland: 

At Inland, we offer the following benefits, some of which are subject to eligibility:

  • A rewarding and safe work environment (company provided PPE);
  • On the job training, mentoring and coaching;
  • Growth and advancement opportunities for high potential employees;
  • Employee and family assistance program;
  • Competitive compensation and benefits package;
  • Pension plan with employer contribution;
  • Access to group rates and discounts.

 

If you are a self-starter who is committed to providing the highest level of customer satisfaction and your experience and ability meet with the above minimum requirements, please forward your cover letter and resume to the Inland HR Team, quoting posting number 22-18.  Full job description available upon request. 

 

Please apply online.

Inland is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer.

 

Please note:  All employees working in Canada are required to be fully vaccinated against Covid-19 unless provided by Inland with an approved accommodation under Canada's Human Rights Act.

title: Labourer
description:
At EVRAZ, our strength starts with our people! As a team we collaborate to solve problems, contribute ideas and challenge each other to ensure growth and ultimately success for the business and our employees.

Job Description and Responsibilities

GenAlta is looking for a Labourer to maintain and perform minor repairs to equipment associated with the MSS plant including conveyors, shakers, compressors, trammel and batch feeder.

EVRAZ is committed to maintaining and promoting a safe, healthy and injury-free environment.  It is required for all jobs.

  • Keeps work area is clean and ready to go daily

  • Responsible for maintaining a productive and consistent flow of material through the MSS, optimizing the balance between throughput and quality

  • Monitor flow of product from a raw material state through to the finished product

  • Responsible for accurately documenting daily startup and any delays

  • Keeps conveyor bearings clean and ensure they have grease

  • Reports any issues that arise immediately 

  • Assists in meeting monthly production goals

  • Performs other duties that they might be assigned

Job Requirements

  • Completion of High School and/or equivalent.

  • Previous work experience in a manufacturing, production, or similar scrap-yard/auto part environment will be considered an asset

  • Ability to push, pull and lift materials up to 50 lbs

  • Standing for up to 12 hours, regular walking, squatting and climbing

  • Ability to learn and follow direction

  • Mechanically inclined

  • Able to operate the skid steer

  • Good attention to detail and quality control

  • Mentally alert to surroundings

  • Self-motivated: Initiates and takes action before being required to do so

  • Strong work ethic: uses time efficiently, work safely and making sure everyone around him/her are working safely

  • Strong command of the English language both written and spoken

Our total compensation package includes amazing benefits!

  • Competitive wages and bonus opportunities
  • Family medical, dental, and prescription coverage at minimal employee cost
  • Short and long term disability programs
  • Competitive retirement plans
  • Paid vacations and statutory holidays
  • Apprenticeship and career advancement within the company
  • Tuition reimbursement

All applicants must be eligible to work in Canada without sponsorship.

While we thank all those who apply, only those being actively considered for employment will be contacted.

Equal Opportunity Employer

EVRAZ North America is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability, or protected Veteran status.

 

EVRAZ North America is committed to working with and providing reasonable accommodation to individuals with physical and mental disabilities.

If you need special assistance or an accommodation while seeking employment, please e-mail

careers@evrazna.com

or call: (312) 533-3577. We will make a determination on your request for reasonable accommodation on a case-by-case basis.

Join a team that manufactures excellence, drives success and builds careers!

title: Journeyman Ironworkers for the Bonnyville/ Cold Lake area!!!!
description:
Currently we are looking for Journeyman Ironworkers for the Bonnyville/ Cold Lake area!!!!

Who we Are - We are an Alberta based, family owned industrial contractor with over 25 years of successful industrial construction experience. We are a world-class leader in industrial fabrication, construction and maintenance and have built our company and reputation on ensuring visibility, value and accountability are always in the forefront. We are rapidly growing and are always seeking qualified and talented individuals to join our team and grow with us.

What We Offer:

  • Competitive Compensation
  • Employee Benefit Program
  • Employee Assistance Program

Requirements:

  • Successfully complete a pre-access drug and alcohol testing
  • Valid Alberta Ironworker Journeyman or Red Seal Certification
  • CSTS-09 or CSTS-20 / WHMIS 2015
  • Valid Fall Protection Certificate
  • Valid Aerial Work Platform
  • Physically capable of performing all tasks required of field Ironworkers
  • Invested in a safety-oriented work environment

**At this time, our client’s may request contractors, vendors and suppliers to be fully vaccinated while providing service to their sites and therefore may require candidates to attest their vaccination disclosure status**
At Phoenix Industrial, we believe we are stronger together. That’s why we believe that investing in our people and the communities in which we work and live returns to us ten-fold. We invest in your growth because we believe it is essential for our continued success. 
We are proud of our company, our projects, our sustainable growth and most importantly our people. And we’d be proud to welcome you to the Phoenix family.
Come Grow With Us!

title: General Labourer
description:
Job Description

We are looking for GENERAL LABOURERS for our clien's sawmill in NAIRN CENTRE, in Ontario.

Reporting to the production supervisor, you will be performing various tasks related to production.

RESPONSIBILITIES

  • Stacking lumber bundles for drying, ensuring proper placement of stickers.
  • Operating various plant equipment to ensure flow of lumber and maintain quality and efficiency of process.
  • Rotating through various roles within the assigned area.
  • Clean-up of the mill and yard, sweeping and shoveling sawdust and picking up broken pieces of wood.
  • Training on various other roles as required.
  • Perform other duties as required to ensure efficiency of the production process.

SKILLS PROFILE

  • Teamworking skills.
  • Autonomy and initiative.
  • Exercise vigilance and adhere to all health/safety policies.

Qualifications

  • Ability to work safely in an industrial environment.
  • Relevant experience is an asset.
  • Be available to work on day and/or night shifts as well as weekends.

Additional Information

If you are invited to continue the selection process, please notify us of any particular adaptive measures you might require. Any information you send us will be handled respectfully and in complete confidence.

The client is an employer that respects equal opportunities in employment.

The masculine gender is only for abbreviation.

title: Labourer I Bolton, ON
description:
Metrie remains open as an essential business in Bolton to serve our communities as a supplier of home improvement and construction products, and we are looking for motivated individuals like YOU to join our team.

COVID-19 Note: At Metrie, we are committed to the health and safety of our team members and are following health authority recommendations in practicing regular cleaning procedures and enforcing social distancing at our facility.

Who We Are

At Metrie, we pride ourselves on our commitment to our team members! We like to have fun and we pride in our mission to turn "houses into homes" and to create beautiful interior spaces.

We offer:

  • Competitive wages and benefits
  • RRSP matching program
  • A clean and safe indoor work environment
  • Training and opportunity for advancement
  • Outstanding team support

Positions Available:

Moulder Operator - $18.60-22.50/Hour

  • Weekday Day Shift: Monday – Thursday, 6:00 AM to 5:00 PM (4 Days – 10 Hours)
  • Weekday Night Shift: Monday – Thursday, 5:00 PM to 4:00 AM ) (4 Days – 10 Hours)

Raw Line Operator - $18-20/Hour

  • Weekend Day Shift: Friday – Sunday, 6:00 AM to 6:00 PM (3 Days – 12 hours)
  • Weekday Night Shift: Monday – Thursday, 5:00 PM to 4:00 AM (4 Days – 10 Hours)

Saw Operator - $17.60-20.15/Hour

  • Weekday Day Shift: Monday – Thursday, 6:00 AM to 5:00 PM (4 days – 10 Hours)

Tool Room Operator - $18-20/Hour

  • Weekend Day Shift: Friday – Sunday, 6:00 AM to 6:00 PM (3 Days – 12 Hour)

Who You Are

We will provide in-house training to help you be successful in this role! No experience is necessary.

You are an ideal candidate if you:

  • Are reliable and able to commit to the work schedule
  • Have a positive attitude and are respectful towards your team members
  • Are able to follow instructions to ensure safety of yourself and others in the workplace
  • Are capable of performing physically demanding work
  • Warehouse or construction background preferred

title: General Laborer
description:
We are looking for a capable and reliable general laborer to join our team. You’ll take direction from the project foreman to help prepare job sites, load and unload construction materials, remove debris, assist team members, and perform any other general labor needed to get the job done right. You should be great at following instructions, with a can-do attitude. If you’re looking for good pay, flexible hours, and a job you can take pride in that lets you do something different every day, apply now!Compensation:

45000 - 60000 yearly

Responsibilities:
  • Follow all health and safety guidelines to ensure you and your team members are free from injury
  • Load, unload and prepare any tools or materials on site that will be used to complete the build, so the crew can operate efficiently
  • Work with your crew through all stages of the project to make sure that the job is done efficiently
  • Ensure that all materials, tools and other debris from the build have been removed at the end of the project to make sure the work site is clean
  • Clear away any trash, debris, or hazardous materials to prep the site before construction begins
Qualifications:
  • Our crew members must be physically able to do the work with reliable hand-eye coordination and balance
  • Should have general knowledge of building and construction, but we are willing to provide training
  • High school diploma or GED preferred
  • Must be able to take direction, work well independently and as part of a team for efficiency and productivity
  • Candidates who have experience using construction equipment such as forklift, power tools, and hand tools highly preferred
About Company

Canadian Elite Renovation has been in business for the past decade. We are one of the biggest reglazing groups in Ontario, while we have amazing spray painters we are always open to expanding and bringing on new talent on board.

title: Labourer (Layout Person)
description:
Tuesday, July 6, 2021

We are currently hiring for a full-time permanent Labourer (Layout Person) to join our growing Fabrication Team. We offer competitive wages, comprehensive benefits, and opportunities to further develop your skillset and grow your career.

Job Description:

  • Follow all safety procedures.
  • Operate band saws, ironworker, radial drill, grinder, and overhead cranes.
  • Perform proper setup of machines.
  • Perform Preventative Maintenance on machines.
  • Translate drawings into measurements for production.
  • Produce quality parts.
  • Mark out holes in Beam/channel/ angle/ plate.
  • Tack small mounts and leave for welders.

Qualifications:

  • Able to read a metric tape measure.
  • Good work ethic.
  • Positive attitude.
  • Steel Fabrication experience is an asset, but we are willing to train the ideal candidate.

At WesTower Communications Ltd. you can expect to be treated fairly. We recognize that it is our people who drive the success of our business, so we make it our priority to foster inclusive work environments welcomed to diverse backgrounds, experiences, and perspectives. We are an equal opportunity employer and are committed to accommodating prospective employees. We proudly offer a drug-free workplace with a zero-tolerance safety program.
