title: Skilled Laborer (FT)
description:
Canadian Erosion and Containment is currently hiring full-time skilled laborers for the upcoming construction season. These positions will be based out of the Calgary with opportunity for travel to sites in Western Canada.

Responsibilities:
Responsibilities of this position include but are not limited to:
  • Assisting with the deployment of geosynthetic materials in the installation of Erosion Control Systems.
  •  Installation of erosion control measures, GCL Liners, Silt fence, Erosion Matting, Gabion Walls and Mattress, MSE walls, Wrap Slopes, Barb Wire fence, Radon Barriers, Drill seeding, and Hydroseeding.
Requirements:
  • Must have a valid Driver’s License and reliable vehicle.
  • Must have valid safety tickets: CSTS 09 WHMIS 2015. First aid and H2S Alive would be an asset
  • Must have PPE (steel toe boots, reflective vest, hard hat, safety glasses, gloves).
  • Must have a cell phone.
  • Previous industrial or construction experience.
  • Be able and willing to travel to remote locations and be away for extended periods of up to 24 days.
  • Availability to work up to 12 hours per day seven days a week.
  • Be adaptable to changing schedules.
  • Be comfortable working outdoors in various weather conditions.
  • Be comfortable working around heavy equipment.
  • Ability to lift to 50 pounds throughout the day.
  • Be a safety-focused individual.
  • Be able to successfully pass 8-panel pre-employment test as required for site-specific access.
Other details:
  • Rate of Pay: General Labourer position with opportunities for advancement within the company.
  • Paid Travel Time & Per Diems (daily food allowance) and hotels or camp provided for out-of-town work.
  • Accommodations, transportation, and travel time paid while on remote job sites.
  • Pay to be negotiated
  • Job Type: Full-time, temporary, Permanent

title: Summer Student - General Laborer - Fort Simpson
description:
Under the general supervision of the Manager Generation Support, you contribute to the safe and efficient operation of the NTPC Plant. Duties would include heavy lifting, weed whacking, painting, mopping, cleaning and assisting the Mechanics, Electrical Technicians, Electricians and Power Linepersons



Qualifications:

  • Are enrolling/enrolled to attend full time post-secondary studies at the start of the Fall 2021 semester.
  • Related experience in a labourer position an asset.

 How to Apply:

  • Submit your cover letter, and a current copy of your resume including two references from your most recent supervisor or instructors.
  • You will be required to provide proof of registration in a post-secondary institution.

This position pays $26.97 per hour plus 6% vacation pay.  No housing or relocation assistance provided.

 

This job opening is limited to student residents living in Fort Simpson.

 

Affirmative Action Employer - Candidates must clearly identify eligibility status via our online portal in order to receive priority consideration.

 

We thank all those who apply and advise that only those selected for further consideration will be contacted.

description:
Casman Projects (B.C.) is seeking experienced Labourers in the greater Victoria area, initially close to downtown. Duties to include general labour, clean up and related tasks on construction projects. Applicants must be safety conscious, physically fit, able to lift up to 25 kg (50 lb), and able to work in a variety of indoor and outdoor settings.

Local to Greater Victoria area preferred.

CASMAN'S COMPENSATION INCLUDES:

title: Sales Representative, Tile and Stone Installation Systems - Toronto (GTA)
description:
ARDEX Americas (www.ArdexAmericas.com), is the Global industry leader in the manufacturing and development of high-performance specialty building materials.

We are immediately hiring for a SALES PROFESSIONAL, with experience of TILE AND STONE INSTALLATION SYSTEMS, ONTARIO, with a concentration on GREATER TORONTO AREA (GTA).

The successful individual will have a proven track record of developing and delivering new sales business opportunities with commercial tile contractors, installers, architects and ARDEX distributor partners and retailers. Experience of Tile and Stone Installation industry is essential.

This is a field sales position with a preferred home-office location close to City of TORONTO. Up to 30% territory travel, including overnight on occasions.

Responsibilities:

  • Drive, develop, promote and grow sales of ARDEX products and systems throughout territory
  • Develop and maintain solid working relationships with distributors, contractors, specifiers and other key business influencers
  • Retain current accounts and prospect new business development
  • Successfully launch and promote new products via hands on product demonstrations, presentations & professional product displays
  • Collaborate with Corporate resources such Technical, Customer Service, Marketing, Logistics etc., to deliver exceptional standards of service to ARDEX customers
  • Drive lead generation through jobsite visits, lead generation services, cold calls etc.
  • Develop and successfully execute field sales action plans
  • Achieve and exceed targets, goals and objectives, as established with Sales Manager
  • Represent ARDEX as an industry leader through exceptional professional standards, and a 'customer first' approach.

Keyword: sales, tile, installation, installer, contractor, flooring, ARDEX, manufacturer, building products, concrete, project manager, cement, account manager, manufacturer, representative
Required Experience:
  • Minimum 5 years outside sales experience is essential
  • Demonstrable experience of Tile and Stone Installation Systems is essential (thin sets, sub floor preparation, cement & epoxy grouts, under tile waterproofing, commercial & residential). Tile and stone installation experience is desirable
  • Able to confidently and professionally conduct product presentations and demonstrations
  • Able to operate non power and power tools. Demonstrates good mechanical or hands-on skills to meet the needs of intensive and physically demanding field support and service
  • Technically proficient and familiar with architectural specifications and construction design elements
  • High level of energy and enthusiasm for the business and be customer-driven and professional
  • Self-starter. Able to use initiative, work and adapt to a fast paced and changing market
  • Able to make sound business decisions, influence, be assertive and close a sale
  • Proficient in digital systems: Microsoft Word, Email, Internet, PowerPoint and CRM systems
  • Demonstrates ARDEX Growth Mindset competencies: Innovation, Open Mindedness, Collaboration, Agility, Initiating Action and Execution, Ownership
  • Must possess a valid driver’s license and a clean driving record. Must be able to travel throughout assigned territory as per advertised amounts, including some overnight
  • Must be able to lift to 70 pounds (on occasion) with a carrying capability of 55 pounds

Education

  • College degree preferred or minimum high school diploma /GED and industry related experience

From: ARDEX Americas

title: General Labour
description:
A CAREER OPPORTUNITY IN BARRIE

ASSEMBLERS NEEDED!

Monday to Friday
Days or Afternoons... you choose!
$18.50/hr to start!
On Bus route

Details:

• Days $18.50 hrly 7am - 3pm
• Afternoons - $19.50/hr 3:30pm - 11:30pm Monday to Friday
• Overtime after 40 hours
• Experienced working with tools, hand and power
• Read drawings
• Team worker
• On bus route

Please apply online at www.randstad.ca and then call the branch at 705-735-1106.



Advantages
• Work Monday - Friday + overtime
• Welcoming company
• Lots of room for growth
• On Bus Route
• Opportunity to be hired on permanent
• Once hired on - RRSP match program starting Jan. 1 2022
• Full benefits, paid vacation, & 3 PTO days

Responsibilities
• Duties include putting small assemblies together with nuts and bolts utilizing wrenches, sockets and hand drills
• Must be able to read drawings
• Comfortable using hand tools - wrenches, sockets, drills
• Building metal parts to be shipped

Qualifications
• Comfortable using large variety of hand tools
• Manufacturing experience
• Able to read drawings
• Eye for detail
• Reliable transportation

Summary
Please apply online at www.randstad.ca and then call the branch at 705-735-1106.
Please keep in mind we have a referral bonus program for anyone we find a placement for both permanent and temporary.

Looking forward to hearing from you!

Randstad Canada is committed to fostering a workforce reflective of all peoples of Canada. As a result, we are committed to developing and implementing strategies to increase the equity, diversity and inclusion within the workplace by examining our internal policies, practices, and systems throughout the entire lifecycle of our workforce, including its recruitment, retention and advancement for all employees. In addition to our deep commitment to respecting human rights, we are dedicated to positive actions to affect change to ensure everyone has full participation in the workforce free from any barriers, systemic or otherwise, especially equity-seeking groups who are usually underrepresented in Canada's workforce, including those who identify as women or non-binary/gender non-conforming; Indigenous or Aboriginal Peoples; persons with disabilities (visible or invisible) and; members of visible minorities, racialized groups and the LGBTQ2+ community.

Randstad Canada is committed to creating and maintaining an inclusive and accessible workplace for all its candidates and employees by supporting their accessibility and accommodation needs throughout the employment lifecycle. We ask that all job applications please identify any accommodation requirements by sending an email to

accessibility@randstad.ca

to ensure their ability to fully participate in the interview process.

title: General Labourer
description:
Our General Labourers earn a competitive hourly wage based on experience. We offer an exceptional extended health plan including medical, dental, and vision. Our other benefits include an employee assistance program, educational assistance, professional development, internal growth opportunities, the opportunity for national career movement, and a healthy work/life balance. If this sounds like the opportunity for you, apply today!


Position Summary:

The General Labourer is in good physical condition and provides construction work and support required to ensure timely project completion. The Labourer follows good work practices and procedures and sets a good example for new crew members and co-workers. The Labourer may: operate a variety of equipment and instruments, including hand and power tools of all types; clean and prepare sites; clean up rubble and debris; remove mold, asbestos lead, and other hazardous materials.

Responsibilities:

  • Leads by example and follows all health and safety policies and procedures.
  • Strives to continually improve through specific development plans.
  • Accepts direction from the Lead Hand, Lead Water Technician and/or Lead Carpenter and more experienced co-workers.
  • Participates in good housekeeping discipline on the job to ensure a safe non-cluttered workplace and to minimize cross-contamination.
  • Learns and practices correct procedures, especially when environmental work is required.
  • Adheres to company policy regarding acceptable standards to follow at a customer site i.e. smoking policy etc.
  • Displays good manners and attitude toward the property owner, occupants of the property, co-workers, and sub-contractors.
  • Is willing and able to be on-call 24/7 for after hour's emergency work.
  • Directs customer questions or concerns to the most senior company person at the job site.
  • Looks out for and assists co-workers.

Qualifications:

  • Previous construction or cleaning work preferred.
  • Experience with hand tools & power tools preferred.
  • High School graduate or equivalent.

ARE YOU READY TO JOIN OUR TEAM?

If you feel that you would be right for this position, please fill out our initial 3-minute, mobile-friendly application so that we can review your information. We look forward to meeting you!

title: Labourer
description:
Forbes Bros is currently recruiting full-time Laborer's for projects within Wynyard & Wadena, Saskatchewan.


Responsibilities:

The responsibilities of this position include, but are not limited to:

  • Digging and backfilling trenches
  • Pulling and placing underground and overhead cable
  • Carry and move materials as needed
  • Operating small equipment and hand tools
  • Spotting for vehicles and equipment
  • Site setup and cleanup, ensuring trash, debris and potential dangerous materials from the construction site are removed
  • Assisting craft/crew members with work
  • Development of skills on varied and challenging tasks
  • Perform additional labourer duties as assigned

Preferred Qualifications:

As the successful candidate, you will have:

  • Ability to work outdoors in all weather conditions
  • Must be in good physical condition and able to lift up to 23 kg (50 lbs)
  • Must have general knowledge of the principals involved in the operation of construction and maintenance methods and procedures
  • Able to work well with others as well as independently
  • Able to follow instruction and adhere to safe work practices
  • Attention to detail
  • Motivated
  • Punctual

Additional Details:

This position requires candidates to:

  • Have and maintain a valid driver's license and acceptable driver's abstract.
  • Successfully complete pre-employment drug and alcohol testing
  • Travel and work overtime as required

What We Offer:

Forbes Bros offers an attractive compensation package that includes a competitive salary, comprehensive benefit plan and a rewarding pension program. Forbes Bros has an open and team oriented culture that focuses on communication, innovation and respect in the workplace!

Forbes Bros Ltd. (FBL) is an equal opportunity employer committed to best practice recruiting and hiring, to promote gender equity and workplace diversity. We thank all applicants for their interest, however only those candidates who meet the requirements noted and who earn an invitation to interview will be contacted.

title: Labourer (Vancouver Island)
description:
Company Description

 

We are Chandos

Inclusion. Collaboration. Ingenuity. Innovation.

These values speak to our desire to create places where all people belong, listening and learning from one another in a way that sparks ideas and leads to positive changes in our industry and community. They also demonstrate our commitment to a diverse, equitable, and inclusive culture. And, if they resonate with you too, we should talk!

We are 100 percent employee owned and proud to be the first and largest B Corp certified commercial builder in North America, meaning we put our values at the centre of everything we do. 

Continuous improvement is core to our success. Championing innovative and collaborative ways to build is just one example of that. Collaborative construction leads to more efficiency, cost savings, social value, and a much better working experience for everyone.

Every day, our teams are working to build places for people to live, work, learn, serve, and play. But above all, we’re building community. And, we’re looking for like-minded people to join us. Together, we can build a better world.

 

Job Description

The Labourer is required to perform tasks involving physical labour at commercial construction projects, and to operate a variety of hand and power tools.

Qualifications

  • Knowledge of safe operation of basic hand and power tools
  • Minimum of 1 year previous construction labour experience preferred
  • Knowledge of workplace safety, and safe lifting and handling procedures
  • Knowledge of First Aid and CPR preferred
  • Valid Drivers License and clean abstract preferred
  • Out of town work may be required. Work in all weather conditions.

 



Additional Information

Chandos is an equal opportunity employer and we are committed to a diverse, equitable, and inclusive culture and this includes our recruitment and hiring process. 

We recognize that our differences are our greatest strengths. We uncover talent. We nurture talent. And then we give people the tools they need to use their talent to create a positive impact.

  • We are 100% employee owned. Every person who works for Chandos can become an owner. There is only one class of units at Chandos, because we believe everyone should be treated equal. We talk about being an entrepreneurial-minded organization and you can be sure we mean it!
  • Competitive wages
  • Well rounded employer paid benefits program including health, dental, vision care and employee assistance program
  • RRSP matching program to aid and prepare employees for long-term financial security
  • Educational assistance for employees who wish to pursue job-performance enhancing education
  • Recognition and annual salary reviews program
  • Leadership conferences that allow employees to connect and collaborate
  • Regular company-wide engagement opportunities

Together, we can build a better world.', 'Educational assistance\xa0for employees who wish to pursue job-performance enhancing education']

title: General Labourer
description:
Company Description

ARE YOU CUT OUT FOR AIM RECYCLING?

Founded in 1936 in Montreal, Canada, AIM is a private company with multiple sites located in Canada, the United States, Mexico, Europe and Asia. Recognized as a world leader in metal recycling and solder manufacturing for a broad range of industries, we focus on creating high-quality products, setting AIM apart. Our continually expanding company offers many exciting career opportunities, a stimulating work environment, competitive salaries and an excellent employee benefits program.

Job Description

American Iron & Metal, a Hamilton based Metal Recycling Yard has an opening for an enthusiastic individual to fill a General Labourer position at our Timmins Metal Recycling Operation. 

Duties Will Include: 

  • Working inside our warehouse on a metal recycling production line 
  • Sorting, picking, and processing metal pieces 
  • Cleaning your work area at the end of your shift 
  • Other general labour duties will apply 
Qualifications

 

  • Experience working on an assembly line 
  • Previous recycling experience is considered an asset 
  • Must be able to stand and walk for long periods of time 
  • Must be able to lift up-to 50lbs 
  • Must be able to work independently as well as in a team orientated environment 
  • Ability to work in a loud, dusty environment 

 



Additional Information

We Offer: 

  • Full time hours with potential overtime, paid after 44 hours 
  • Some mandatory overtime on Saturdays (based on company needs) 
  • Competitive wages, pension, benefits offered 

American Iron & Metal and its subsidiaries offer equal employment opportunities to everyone. The masculine form is used solely to make the text easier to read. Only applicants selected for an interview will be contacted.

title: Labourer
description:
Company Description

ARE YOU CUT OUT FOR KENNY U-PULL?

Get ready to immerse yourself in a professional playground of cars.

Become our clients’ ally to provide the best customer service. At Kenny U-Pull, we adhere to high operational standards to maintain an organized and efficient workspace where we repurpose cars and their parts to give them a second life. Join our team in one of North America’s leading companies in the self-service auto part industry.

It’s simple: we do it right. We aim for excellence.

This position is eligible for an annual retention bonus of up to $1150

Job Description

  • Depollute vehicles: this means removing chemical fluids and certain parts such as the battery in order to prepare the vehicle for display in the customer's yard;
  • Dismantle wheels and classify tires;
  • Clean, test and classify batteries in order to install them in the sales displays;
  • Filling cans with certain liquids and affixing cards;
  • Prepare, organize and clean the yard;
  • Maintain a clean and orderly work area.
Qualifications

  • Excellent physical condition
  • Reliability, diligence and punctuality
  • Health and safety awareness
  • Versatility
  • Good manual dexterity


Additional Information

  • Work schedule: Monday to Friday, day shift
  • Permanent, full-time position
  • Possibility of working indoors and outdoors

What we offer:

  • Group insurance (after 3 months);
  • Group RRSP with employer contribution (after 6 months);
  • Overtime at time and a half after 44 hours;
  • Bonus plan up to $1150/ year
  • Employee discount;
  • Free parking;
  • Paid steel toe boot from day 1;
  • Uniform provided from day 1

American Iron & Metal and its subsidiaries offer equal employment opportunities to everyone. Only applicants selected for an interview will be contacted

title: Skilled Labourer
description:
OCL Group Inc. (OCL), is a proudly 100% Canadian, privately held, employee-owned fully integrated general contractor with design-build solutions across Western Canada, with the experience you can trust and the quality you can depend on, serving the energy and municipal infrastructure markets since 2009.

We are currently recruiting Labourers for a pipeline project located approximately 45 minutes south of Fort McMurray, AB. The project schedule is 6/1 with camp accommodations provided.

Responsibilities:

  • Read and understand site-specific instructions prior to each shift
  • Demolition and waste removal
  • Site cleaning and preparation
  • Digging and trenching
  • Other duties as assigned
  • Valid drivers license
  • Must have valid safety tickets
  • Ensure a safe team environment
  • Adhere to all company and worksite safety and quality processes and procedures
  • Strong communication skills
  • Desire to work in a team environment
  • Previous industrial experience is an asset
  • Must be able to pass a pre-employment drug and alcohol test
  • Comfortable working outside in various weather conditions

title: Construction Labourers (Swift Current, SK)
description:
At Golderado, we're constantly pushing the limits of what we've done in the past - propelling ourselves toward bigger and better opportunities, while exploring new market sectors and services. So it only seems natural that we'd hire people who have their own voice and aren't afraid to use it. These are people who are simultaneously critical, creative and captivated by construction. They make our business their business, and follow a path that with continuous learning and an innovative spirit leads them to be recognized as leaders in the industry. We hire these types of people knowing they are as diverse as we are, and they come on board because they share our core values.

In the position of an upcoming job for Construction Labourer, we would ask you to do the following: Handle and distribute construction materials (e.g., load and unload vehicles with supplies, equipment and construction materials; move tools, equipment and construction materials to and from work areas; remove rubble and other debris) Assemble and dismantle scaffolding, ramps, catwalks, shoring and barricades at construction sites Prepare and clean up construction sites, move materials and equipment, and perform demolition, excavation and compaction activities Work on a wide variety of buildings, structures and premises including municipal sewer and water mains, roads, dams and bridges, tunnels, railways and canals

Sounds challenging and exciting right? Here are a few of the attributes and experience you need to be successful in this position:

  • You have one to two years of industrial construction experience and must have Construction Safety Training Systems (CSTS 09) Certificate, WHMIS 2015, Ground Disturbance (Original tickets required), Standard First Aid considered an asset.
  • You have experience in using compactors, and trampers (jumping jack) You are able to lift up to 13.5 kg (30 lbs) 9-23 Kg You have a safety conscious attitude and able to work with others in a team
  • Valid driver's license - Driver's Abstract is required
  • Drug and Alcohol Screening as well as Criminal Background Check Required.

Go ahead and be yourself. We'll pay you for it! Apply today at resumes@pmeinc.com We are an equal opportunity employer. While only qualified candidates will be contacted for an interview, be sure to continually

Please note, there is NO TRAVEL or LIVING ALLOWANCE for this project.

title: Summer Student - General Labour (Burlington)
description:
JFE Shoji Power Canada Inc. is looking for Summer Students to join our teams in Burlington, ON!

Formerly Cogent Power Inc., JFE Shoji Power Canada Inc. is under new management.

While we appreciate all applicants, we will only be contacting those selected for an interview.

This position is located in Burlington, Ontario.

We have two facilities located on 801 & 845 Laurentian Drive, L7N 3W7 (Conveniently located by bus route) 

Salary: $18.12 an hour 

Hours: This position will be on a straight day shift from 7 am to 3 pm Monday to Friday. 

Position Type: Summer Contract, 4-month period (flexible). 

The Perks:

  • Travel Subsidy:
    • Starting April to September 2022 we will be providing a subsidy to all employees that incur the costs of travelling to work. These subsidies will be provided at the end of the month in the form of a gas card (i.e April subsidy will be provided by mid-May).
    • For those who take a city bus to work, we will be providing a transit pass.  
  • Perkopolis Account - get access to 5000 exclusive online discounts to stores & sports events (Hello Fresh, Apple, Indigo, Toronto Marlies, Toronto Raptors, etc.)
  • $100 Coverage on CSA-Approved Safety Boots
  • Summer Gatorade Program (Free Gatorades over the summer term)

As a Summer Student, you will be working in one of these Departments:

Wound Core Department: 

  • Receiving and inspecting incoming slit steels, assuring that they are correct for the intended order
  • Issue materials to work orders accurately and correctly on both paperwork order, and through the visual software system
  • Set up machine according to work order and operating procedures.
  • Produce distributed gap cores
  • Ensure product meets quality requirements as per work order, operating procedures and customers specifications
  • Follow priority schedule

Stacked Core Department:

  • Set up machine according to work order and operating procedures.
  • Material stacking into a repeating specific pattern
  • Ability to follow detailed prints & procedures to create the finished product
  • Work in a team environment ensuring group success
  • Issue materials to work orders accurately and correctly

About you, simply stated:

  • Ability to follow health & safety policies
  • Strong measuring skills 
  • Exceptional communication skills
  • Strong attention to detail
  • An eagerness to learn and dedication to improvement 
  • Mechanically inclined
  • Organized

Requirements: 

  • Must be 18 years of age or older
  • Must be able to show proof of enrolment at a post-secondary college or university
  • Must be legally entitled to work in Canada with a valid Social Insurance Number
  • Students on Visa's welcome to apply 

(Must be 18 years of age or older - students from all levels are welcome to apply. Training for your first two weeks is paid).

About JFE Shoji Power Canada Inc:

On September 20th, 2019, JFE Shoji Trade Corporation acquired 100% of the shares of Cogent Power Inc, from Tata Steel Europe. Grouped, the Cogent and JFE Shoji Steel America business make it possible for JFE Shoji to capture greater market share in the electrical steel market for both transformer and automotive products. The combination of Cogent and JFE Shoji has become one of the largest processors of electrical steel transformers in the world. JFE Shoji currently has many other production and processing facilities throughout Asia, as well as a facility in Tijuana, Mexico.

Globally, JFE Shoji enhanced the businessâ€™ competitiveness by sharing and integrating technical skills with deep business experience, which can be strongly applied to the global and North American markets. With this investment, JFE Shoji has one of the worldâ€™s leading processing and distribution functions for core design and manufacturing for transformers.

Based in Tokyo, JFE is one of the worldâ€™s largest steel producers with over 45,000 employees and operations globally. 

If you would like to be considered, please apply in confidence. For more information about starting your career with JFE Shoji Power Canada, please visit https://www.jfeshojipower.com/

Job Type: Summer, Contract, Students

Salary: $18.12 an hour

#JFEHP

title: STUDENT SUMMER JOB - GENERAL LABOURERS
description:
Company Description

ABOUT EACOM

At EACOM, we transform more than wood. Our talented team of 1,100 employees is committed to working, building, and growing together. Embedded in northern Ontario and Quebec communities, our mills have a long, rich history. We responsibly manage and transform forest resources into high-quality wood products. From the Canadian woodlands to the North American home building market, we strive for sustainability, collaboration, safety, and continuous improvement.

Job Description

EACOM – Nairn sawmill, a subsidiary of INTERFOR, is looking to fill SUMMER JOBS - GENERAL LABOURERS term positions in from May to August 2022.

JOIN THE TEAM!
Hourly rate: as per Collective Agreement

Reporting to the supervisor, you will be performing in various tasks related to production.

RESPONSIBILITIES:

  • Rebuild and replenish packages of lumber that have spilled.
  • Perform housekeeping and cleaning, shovel and sweep shavings and chips and pick up broken pieces of lumber in the plant and in the yard as required.
  • Train on and replace on operating positions as needed.
  • Perform other related duties.

SKILLS PROFILE:

  • Team working skills.
  • Autonomy and initiative.
  • Exercise vigilance and adhere to all health/safety policies.
Qualifications

  • Be available to work day and/or night or weekend shifts as needed (flexible schedule).


Additional Information

At EACOM, we're here for you.

EACOM supports employment equity. Diversity is not only welcome, it’s encouraged! We’ll contact you if you are selected for an interview. If you need special accommodations, let us know. Any information you send us will be treated with respect and confidentiality. Gender diversity is also important. Know that women are definitely welcome!

title: Labourer
description:
Seymour Pacific Developments Ltd. is a national leader in land development and residential construction, and we are currently looking for Construction Labourers to perform a variety of construction-related duties at our multifamily site.

RESPONSIBILITIES

  • Load and unload vehicles with supplies, equipment and construction materials
  • Move tools, equipment, and construction materials to and from work areas
  • Operate hand and power tools
  • Clean up rubble and debris on a regular basis to ensure a safe and well maintained construction site
  • Move and level earth using shovels and rakes
  • Clean, lubricate, and refill tanks as instructed
  • Practice work place safety at all time
  • Perform other duties as required

REQUIREMENTS

  • Previous experience in a related position
  • Positive can-do attitude
  • Willing and able to easily follow direction
  • Able to lift 50lbs
  • Willing and able to work long hours in a fast-pace, physical environment

 

WHY SEYMOUR PACIFIC?

Seymour Pacific Developments is an industry leader in building multi-family homes with unparalleled speed and efficiency. We develop and build over 1,500 units a year by leveraging effective teamwork and industry expertise. We offer excellent wages and benefits, as well as a variety of training for employees who are motivated to succeed and want to expand their horizons. Seymour Pacific Developments is an equal opportunity employer, and is committed to following safe and inclusive hiring practices.

title: Student Laborer's
description:
POSITION(S):General Labor
LOCATION: 70 Heritage Drive, New Hamburg, Ontario
STARTINGWAGE:$19.30/hour after 6 months of employment
Why Maple Leaf Foods?
  • Essential business through COVID-19
  • Leading Consumer Protein Company
  • Part-Time and Full-Time Permanent Positions Available
  • Competitive Wages
  • Pension & Benefit Opportunities
  • Paid time off
  • $1000 RETENTION BONUS!

Now is a very exciting time to join the Maple Leaf family. Maple Leaf Foods is located in New Hamburg, ON and presently employees approximately 120 employees between in the hatchery. Currently, the New Hamburg Hatchery has the ability to hatch approximately 900,000 chicks per week. Our work includes everything from receiving the eggs from our farms to distributing chicks to many growers across the province. It is important that you understand that we are an agricultural facility and therefore you will be handling live animals.

POSITION SUMMARY:
Shifts are Monday, Tuesday, Thursday & Friday with hours The starting wage of $18.30 which increases to $19.00 after six months of employment.Maple Leaf Foods supplies all necessary safety equipment at no cost to the employee. Must be available to cross-trained in sever general labor positions.

HOURS
Flexible for days and afternoons - depending on the department - ranging from 24-44+ (flexibility and production dependent)*Must be available Monday-Saturday (will vary)

RESPONSIBILITIES INCLUDE:
The successful applicants will be responsible for:
Sanitation: operation of power hoses and box wash machine
Production line: quality control, stacking, loading
Machine Operator: loader/off-loader
Driver Helper: deliver loads to various locations
Other General Labor duties including lifting up-to approx. 50lbs

REQUIRED SKILLS AND QUALIFICATIONS:
To be successful in this position, you must:
Be reliable and dependable, able to be at work every day, on time
Able to work in a fast paced and repetitive task environment
Able to work in a wet/humid environment
Have the desire to learn
Be physically fit and able to lift, push, and/or pull, weight of up to 50lbs overhead
Have commitment to safe work practices
Able to work varying and flexible hours until job is complete (including statutory holidays)
Have good communication and business relationship building skills for interaction with customers
Adhere to HACCP, Biosecurity & Animal Welfare requirements (Training will be provided)
Be looking for a long-term job opportunity
**Drivers Licence would be considered an asset

Please note completion of High School Diploma is not required to be successful in this position.

“Maple Leaf Foods is committed to ensuring the health and safety of all our employees. As part of this commitment, we have adopted a number of COVID-19 safety measures, including a requirement for all employees to be fully vaccinated byMarch 31, 2022and to show proof of vaccination. In keeping with this policy, successful candidates will need to provide proof of vaccination by March 31, 2022 (or prior to their first day of work if the start date is after March 31, 2022). We will of course consider accommodations for anyone unable to be vaccinated following human rights and other applicable laws.

APPLICATION PROCESS:

Resumes can be dropped off in person at 70 Heritage Drive in New Hamburg.
By Fax: 519-662-3637 or by Email:

stephen.germano@mapleleaf.com



We thank all applicants for their interest in exploring employment opportunities with Maple Leaf Foods however only those selected for an interview will be contacted. Applicants may be subject to a background check and must meet the security criteria designated for the position.

Maple Leaf Foods is committed to Employment Equity and maintaining a diverse workforce. Job applicants with a disability who require reasonable accommodation for any part of the application or hiring process can contact our Talent Attraction Team at

accommodations@mapleleaf.com

. Reasonable accommodations will be determined on a case-by-case basis and your request will be responded to as soon as possible.

title: Labourer
description:
Brandt is currently seeking a Labourer for our Grande Prairie location.The successful applicant for this position will be responsible for assisting in the dismantling of construction, forestry and mining based heavy equipment and components.

Duties & Responsibilities

  • Cleaning parts and components
  • Cleaning and organizing the yard
  • Some inventory maintenance.
  • Assisting the other shop personnel fulfill their duties and increase overall shop productivity
  • Demonstrate safe and efficient workplace practices
  • Highly motivated, with excellent communication and interpersonal skills
  • Able to carry out and understand verbal and written instructions
  • Strong attention to detail
  • Must be able to lift up to 50 pounds

  • Capable of meeting the physical demands of the heavy duty equipment environment (ie: lifting up to 75 pounds)
  • Must be capable of working under minimal supervision
  • Previous mechanical aptitude and willingness to learn required
  • Forklift experience and heavy duty parts handling considered an asset

title: General Labour- Part-time
description:
Part-Time opportunity to work approximately 24 -40 hours a week

Weston Foods, Mount Pearl, NL  
WAGE: Starting from $16.70/ hour.
SHIFT: Monday to Friday, Shift Rotation every 2 weeks between Mornings and Evenings, (flexibility with working overtime, Overtime available after 40 hours or after shifts >8 hours)

Mornings - Starts between 7:00AM and 8:00AM

Afternoons - Starts between 2:00PM and 3:00PM

We are a premier North American bakery company and we’ve been in business for 135 years. Our team is passionate about baking the foods your family and friends love to eat, including breads and rolls, donuts, pies, cakes, cookies and more!  

Weston Foods proudly serves communities through our ~35 bakeries across North America, and every day, our team strives to elevate moments for our customers and your loved ones by producing high quality baked goods. 

Our bakery team is the heart of our company and plays an important role in keeping North America’s food supply going. Our General labourers are an integral part of the baking and production process, ensuring our delicious baked goods are packaged, and safely end up on grocery store shelves and at your favorite restaurants across North America. 

We are not just a job, we are an extended family, committed to elevating everyday moments and feeding communities and families across the country. Join us and find fulfillment and purpose in your work. 

In a typical day, you’ll: 

  • Pick, pack, sort, and package fresh products into bags and boxes 

  • Work in production/packaging area to make and stack boxes onto pallets  

  • Inspect filled packages to ensure product is packaged according to specifications. 

  • Work closely with production team members to ensure product quality  

  • Mix the ingredients, package the breads, Load the bread trays as per the instructions.

  • Assist machine operators/mixers/oven captains and crew with other duties as assigned.  

  • May assist sanitation crew in the cleanliness of production equipment and area   

  • Ensure all Food Safety and Health & Safety policies and procedures are followed   

About You: 

  • A lover of bread and baked goods! 

  • You should be comfortable lifting 50 pounds.

  • You have strong people skills—you’re approachable, a good listener, and empathetic  

  • You have previously worked in a manufacturing environment (even better if it was food manufacturing!) 

  • You’re dedicated to the health and safety of yourself and your colleagues  

  • You digest constructive feedback as an opportunity to listen, and improve your skills, abilities, and performance 

  • You are someone who listens to comprehend a situation first, asking questions to clarify your own understanding, instead of listening to be able to reply quickly 

 

We offer a competitive benefits package for full-time and Part-time employees, including strong benefit and pension plans, paid vacation and holidays, overtime opportunities, and a growth path to line leader and supervisory roles. 

If you’re excited about this opportunity and love baked goods, we invite you to apply! 

Weston is committed to fostering a work environment with strong core values that support diversity through various policies, programs and activities that encourage sensitivity and accommodations. Weston offers employment regardless of race, colour, gender, national origin, religion, age, disability, or sexual orientation. Diversity is integral to our success as an organization and we will use diversity as a model to help identify and develop the best talent, create effective teams, and achieve overall excellence.

title: Construction Labourer
description:
Job Description:

Construction Labourer

 

 

Maple Reinders Constructors Ltd. is currently looking for local Construction Labourers to work on a project in Ruthven, ON. This is your chance to work with one of Canadaâ€™s Best Managed Companies!

 

$20.40 - $40.40 /hr, plus benefits

 

Qualifications:

title: Temporary Labourer
description:
$25/hour - General Labourer - Temporary Project

We are actively recruiting 1 temporary labourer(s) for a store-setup in BC - Victoria .This job is very physically demanding. You would be assisting in moving product and shelving units, discarding of construction material and assisting with other general labourer tasks.
  • Rate: $25/hour + vacation pay
  • Location: BC - Victoria
  • Project Dates: ASAP -May 13th, 2022
  • Availability: First Shift: 7am-3:30pm Second Shift: 830am-5pm
  • Hours/week: Hourly - Up to 40 hours/week hours a week

Job Responsibilities: 
  • Moving product and fixtures in a big box retailer
  • Unloading trailers with pallets loaded with heavy fixtures
  • Using hand jacks to pull heavy pallets of fixtures to the sales floor
  • Loading and unloading fixtures in a service elevator is required     
  • Disposing of construction material
  • Cleaning store sections
  • Other general labour tasks as required
  • Physical requirements: Lifting up to 50lbs, on feet for entire shift. 

Successful Candidate Qualifications: 

  • Retail experience considered an asset 
  • Positive attitude, reliable, good communicator and fluent in English
  • PPE required: CSA Approved Safety footwear, Work Gloves, Hard Hat, Safety Vest, Face Mask
  • Required Certifications: WHMIS - Taken within the last 12 months - training is available if required
  • Reliable way to get to the location
  • Physically able to lift up to 50lbs, remain on feet for entire shift and work in a physically demanding position.
  • Valid equipment tickets (Forklift, Power Jack, Scissor Lift, WAH etc) is a definite asset 
How to apply:
If this job sounds like the perfect fit for you, please apply online and be prepared to provide:
  • a relevant resume
We look forward to hearing from you!

title: Labourer - Bridge Construction
description:
Why work for Lafarge?:

As the global leader in innovative and sustainable building materials, weâ€™re committed to shaping a greener, smarter and healthier world. At Lafarge Canada Inc., safety comes first, collaboration matters and diversity is celebrated with people who share our desire to continually make our materials better.  

 

Do you have the drive, the skills, and the passion to join us?

 

Overview:

We are currently looking for skilled Labourers to join our Bridge Construction team. Successful candidates should be hard working, adaptable, and enthusiastic team players, willing and ready to learn and work in all conditions.

Responsibilities:
  • Receive oral instructions to determine work assignments.
  • Perform physical activities that require considerable use of your arms and legs and moving your whole body, such as climbing, lifting, balancing, walking, stooping, and handling of materials
Qualifications:
  • Experience will be considered an asset.
  • Class 5 license and own means of transportation is required as not all sites will have public transit access.
  • Safety Oriented
  • Able to lift 50 lbs
  • Able to work in a fast paced environment
  • Willing to work overtime and shifts when needed including Saturdays
  • Able to work unsupervised
  • Able to work well with others
  • Good communication skills

As part of our dedicated focus on the health and safety of all employees, a pre-employment medical, including drug and alcohol testing and a criminal record check, may be required.

LafargeHolcim:

As we are reinventing the way the world builds, we need world-class talent to join our Lafarge Canada team: people who are passionate, driven by curiosity and keen to grow, learn, develop and thrive in our high-performance culture.

 

Whatever you do, you will make a difference here. Because we know that your passion and curiosity are the natural resources the world needs.

 

Check out our YouTube channel to learn more about our operations and see all career opportunities at www.lafarge.ca/careers.

 

We thank you for your interest.  Only candidates selected for an interview will be contacted.   Lafarge is committed to the principles of employment equity and encourages the applications from women, visible minorities, and persons with disabilities.

title: General Labourer (Dufferin Aggregates) - $24 - $29/hr 1
description:
Job ID:  394381 

Work Type:  Regular 

 

It is a great time to join the CRH Canada team! CRH Canada is going through an exciting business transformation which demands first-class Talent Management support to drive results.


We are building a world- class team. Make your mark!


You will be a successful addition to our team if you look at change as an opportunity to develop and contribute to the business. You will be successful in your role if you like partnering with the business, presenting new ideas and providing excellent customer service.

Dufferin Aggregates, a divison of CRH Canada is looking to hire!

Position: General Labourer

Reports to: Mosport Foreman

 

Duties and Responsibilities:

•    Work in a team environment with other co-workers, supervisors and managers.
•    Complete cleanup assignments using a skid steer and/or hand-held tools; working safely around moving and/or rotating equipment while using the required personal protective safety equipment.
•    Perform pre-operational checks and operate assigned mobile equipment as trained and directed.
•    Complete scheduled maintenance inspections and lubrication of plant equipment using the appropriate job plans, procedures and manuals.
•    Assist in repairing broken or malfunctioning equipment.
•    Run crushing and screening plant as trained and directed.
•    Assist with plant repairs as needed.
•    Keep foreman informed of any problems affecting assigned work.
•    Be aware of environmentally sensitive areas and be alert to correct environmental problems that may develop in the assigned work area.
•    Specific job duties will often vary from day to day depending on business needs.

 

Qualifications:

•    Experience in construction, mining or operating heavy machinery is preferred but not required.
•    Basic welding and fitting is preferred but not required.
•    Minimum Ontario high school diploma (OSSD) or equivalent.
•    Mechanical aptitude.
•    Be willing to work rotating shifts, overtime and weekends when required.
•    Good written and oral communication skills.
•    Dependability – follow instructions and respond to supervisor direction.

 

Working Conditions and Physical Demands:

•    Working outdoors and varied temperatures and weather conditions.
•    Working indoors in varied conditions (ie. hot, noisy, dusty).
•    Working rotating shifts, overtime and weekends when required.
•    Effortless mobility through all areas of the plant.
•    Working at heights.
•    Physical abilities to perform duties.

 

Health and Safety:

•    Comply with OHSA and all of its applicable regulations.
•    Wear all Personal Protective equipment as prescribed.
•    Strict compliance with CRH Canada safety rules, policies and procedures.
•    Report all incidents and near misses.
•    Report all safety hazards.
•    Follow Lockout/Tag out procedures.
•    Emergency response plan awareness.

Visit our website for more information: http://www.crhcanada.com

CRH Canada Group Inc. recognizes Canada’s diverse landscape. Accommodation is available upon request for applicants with disabilities throughout the recruitment and selection process.

title: Skilled Ground Worker in Fort McMurray, Alberta | Careers at North American Construction Group
description:
Position Scope

NACG is looking for Skilled Ground Workers to work on a remote mining site in the Fort McMurray area. You must be well-organized and favor safety above everything else.

 

Site: Syncrude-Aurora

Schedule: 14x7 Days/Nights -11.5 hours/day

Accommodations: Not provided

Transportation: Bussing provided from Fort McMurray to site (before and after shifts)

Overtime: Provided after 8 hours a day or 44 hours a week

The successful candidate will be required to join the International Union of Operating Engineers Local 955. 

 

Qualifications

- Minimum of 1 years experience working as a Labourer and driving in the mine.

- Able to do heavy manuel labour and shoveling

- Able to run hand packers

- Able to communicate fluently via radio and understand direction

- High school diploma, GED, and/or post-secondary education cosidered an asset

Summary

All successful candidates must:

  • Be proficient in English, both verbally and written
  • Have a valid Class 5 Driver’s License
  • Have experience as requested as mentioned above
  • Subject to Random Testing at: Suncor, Suncor Fort Hills and Kearl sites
  • Undergo and successfully pass the following testing:
    • Breath Alcohol Test
    • Urine Drug Test
    • Fitness-to-Work Assessment
    • Audiometric Testing
    • Vision Screening
    • Criminal Record Check

    Shift, site, and start times are subject to change.

     

    All successful candidates MUST provide the following items prior to confirmation of their start date:

  • CSO or BSO Certification
  • Copy of Valid Class 5 Driver’s License
  • Copy of recent Driver’s Abstract
  • VOID cheque/direct deposit form

  • Once dispatched the following processes will occur:

  • Will receive a call from NACG to set up all required pre-employment testing
  • An email will be sent with all required New Hire Paperwork to be filled out
  • After all results are received by NACG candidates will be contacted by Site Admin to schedule orientation and confirm your start date and other site specific details.

  • Please note the entire On-boarding process can take anywhere from 3-8 business days.

     

    NO PHONE CALLS PLEASE, SUCCESSFUL CANDIDATES WILL BE CONTACTED VIA PHONE OR EMAIL.

     

    Overview

    North American Construction Group (NACG) has served as an industry leader in the heavy construction and mining industries for over 65 years.  In that time, we’ve proven ourselves as a safe and reliable contractor who can complete projects of any size and scope. We’ve also taken a number of bold steps forward to broaden our footprint, expanding to mines outside our provincial borders, and providing third-party maintenance services to clients and customers. 

    In addition to providing employees with rewarding careers, North American has a whole lot more to offer:

    • Significant Growth – As a company, NACG is rapidly expanding, and has practically doubled in size over the past year alone.
    • Long Term Contracts – With over $1 billion dollars in contracted work booked through 2023, NACG can provide long term employment solutions and numerous opportunities for advancement.
    • Commitment To Safety – With a top tier record for safety performance, NACG is dedicated to ensuring that everyone gets home safe, and constantly strives for a goal zero performance.
    • Competitive Compensation – NACG provides competitive compensation packages for all employees.
    • Attractive Benefits Package – With a substantial benefits package provided to all employees, NACG ensures that you are covered for life’s many surprises.
    • GRRSP Matching – As you begin your new career, you can also start planning for the future thanks to NACG’s GRRSP matching.

    North American Construction Group is an equal opportunity employer, and encourages applications from all qualified individuals. We are committed to providing a diverse and inclusive work environment where every employee feels valued and respected.

     

    Become a member of the North American family today!

title: Labourer
description:
Lehigh Cement is currently looking for responsible, safe, and dependable Labourers to join our local team. As a Labourer you will support plant needs by ensuring a safe and productive work environment. In this position, you will have the opportunity to use a variety of skills every day as you learn the cement manufacturing process and fill in for vacancies in various areas of our plant.

Who We Are:

Lehigh Cement is part of the Lehigh Hanson group of companies. Lehigh Hanson is one of the largest construction materials companies in North America with more than 550 active operations in the U.S. and Canada. Our core activities include the production and distribution of cement and aggregates, ready-mixed concrete, asphalt and other concrete products.

With our diverse product lines and locations across North America, there are opportunities to explore different roles and work on a variety of exciting and interesting projects. At Lehigh Hanson, we believe our employees play a key role in the company’s success and future growth.

We offer:
  • Secure, long-term employment
  • Competitive wage and benefits package
  • Training and development
  • Opportunities for advancement
  • OT available
What You Will Get to Do:
  • Operate mobile equipment on plant site
  • Maintain cleanliness of plant work areas
  • Transport materials to and from storage and shop areas
  • Ensure compliance with all health, safety, and environmental regulations, as well as company policies and procedures; assist with physical inspections of plant property/departments.
Who We’re Looking For:
  • High school diploma or GED required
  • Previous experience in an open pit mine is an asset
  • Experience using (or ability to learn) plant mobile equipment
  • Desire to work cooperatively as part of a productive team
  • Ability to work safely, and independently without constant supervision
  • Excellent communication and interpersonal skills
  • Capable of learning through on the job training
  • Able to work inside and outside in year-round weather conditions
  • In good physical condition, able to lift and carry up to 75 lbs., sit and stand for extended periods of time, kneel, climb ladders, and walk on varied terrain
  • Ability to work different extended hours, holidays and/or overtime as required

description:

About Gold’s GymGold’s Gym has been the authority on fitness since 1965. It was then that fitness legend Joe Gold took the knowledge and expertise he gained from training at the world famous “Muscle Beach” and opened up the first Gold’s Gym on Pacific Avenue in Venice, California. At Gold’s Gym, our goal is simple: We’re here to help you Know Your Own Strength®. We are committed to helping people find their inner strength and reach their goals.

Key Responsibilities
  • Basic maintenance work (moving equipment, driving parts, manual labour, painting, general maintenance)

  • Assist in general equipment repair
Qualifications
  • Must be able to move and carry up to 50lbs 
  • Drivers License and vehicle 
  • No prior experience is required but it is an asset 
What We Offer
  • Positive, rewarding, and collaborative team environment
  • Competitive compensation
  • Complimentary club membership
  • Discount on Gold’s Gym products and services
NOTE: This job description is intended to describe the general requirements for the position. It is not a complete statement of duties, responsibilities or requirements. Other duties not listed here may be assigned as necessary to ensure the proper operations of the department.Gold’s Gym British Columbia is an equal opportunity employer. For more information regarding our career opportunities, please visit one of our clubs or our website at https://goldsgymbc.ca/Only those applicants under consideration will be contacted. title: Construction Labourer
description:
Construction Labourer

Apply now »



Date:Apr 29, 2022


Location: Mississauga, ON, CA


Company: RailWorks




Job ID: 12764


PNR RailWorks is the leading subcontractor in new rail construction and rail maintenance in Canada, covering projects from new track construction, maintenance to large signalling upgrade projects. With the rail industry continuing to grow, we are looking for experienced individuals in the electrical and civil construction fields. PNR offers a competitive salary, benefits, vacation and RRSP’s. Apply today!!





All successful applicants must be in compliance with PNR RailWorks Inc. Mandatory COVID Vaccination Policy, which will be provided prior to hire.





Job Summary


Reporting to the Track Maintenance Foreman, the Track Laborer is responsible for successfully completing day-to-day tasks by meeting or exceeding corporate and project goals for safety, quality, profitability and schedule, resulting in extreme customer satisfaction.





Primary/Essential Responsibilities and Duties



+ Embrace our safety culture and adhering to industry and company policies and procedures


+ Repair and/or replace turnout components as needed, such as switch points, frogs, plates etc.


+ Repair and/or replace track components as needed, such as rail, ties, plates, spikes, timber crossings etc.


+ Observes conditions of track, track beds, and track right-of-way to detect, report and repair problems or defects


+ Responsibly operates company vehicles and/or equipment and ensures all daily maintenance and inspections of the units are completed


+ Performs special duties as assigned by the Track Maintenance Foreman


+ Performs any administrative duties related to proper documentation as per PNR Quality Management System






Qualifications



+ A minimum of 2 years related experience in the railway industry.


+ Knowledge of all aspects of track maintenance.


+ Track Inspection Guidelines certification is an asset


+ Certified in Canadian Railway Operating Rules


+ Ability to read and understand specific documents including schedules, standard railway plans and specifications.


+ Ability to understand and efficiently carry out instructions.


+ Knowledge of the occupational hazards and safety precautions of the work being performed.


+ Strong verbal and written communication skills.


+ Proficient use of computers, tablets etc.


+ Valid Ontario class G driver’s license






Physical Requirements



+ Works outdoors at construction sites.


+ Frequently stands, walks, climbs, balances, lifts, bends, and moves objects up to 50 pounds.


+ Exposed to all weather conditions including very hot and very cold weather.


+ Exposed to loud noise.


+ Exposed to live track/trains and high voltage.


+ Ability to work rotating shifts






This job description is not intended to represent a complete, comprehensive list of all duties and responsibilities that may be required in this position. There may be unplanned activities and other duties as assigned.





PNR RailWorks Inc. is committed to fostering an equitable, accessible, and inclusive workplace. As such, PNR RailWorks Inc. will ensure reasonable accommodations for candidates with disabilities throughout the hiring process, including the interview. If selected for an interview, requests for accommodation can be confidentially made to a member of the recruitment team who will arrange in advance for reasonable and appropriate accommodation for fair and equitable assessment throughout the process.



#LI-RC1-PNR





All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment with PNR RailWorks without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or any other characteristics protected by law.

description:
Description:
We are Agilus Work Solutions, the best staffing solutions provider for the top industrial companies across Winnipeg. We are always looking for strong committed workers!

If you are in search for new opportunities in general labour work, have the work ethic, skill and experience, then we are in looking for you to part of our team! We are only considering candidates with FULL SHIFT FLEXIBILITY (AM-MID-OVERNIGHT availability)
Responsibilities:
  • Working inside a warehouse, production facilities, or outside in different areas inside the city depending on availability
  • Shipping/receiving products and inventory
  • Material handling, stocking, stacking products and cleaning the work area after
  • Use of simple tools and machines such as - Pallet jacks, hammer, screw drivers, rf scanner, shovels, fork trucks, and picker machine

You bring:
  • Able to lift 50lbs repetitively throughout the day
  • Have steel toes and a high visibility vest
  • Able to work at heights
  • Depending on the position, able to wear appropriate PPEs for the duration of the shift (provided by client)
  • Able to work flexible shifts (days - evenings -overtime because job opportunity varies from client to client and candidates must be available at any shift)
  • Reliable transportation
  • Must be reliable, strong work ethic, and punctual
  • A vehicle is an asset as some positions not on bus routes

What's in it for you:
  • Since we cater to many clients across the city that provide different types of General labour roles wage depends on the role but expectations are as follows:
  • General labourers : 12$- 15$/hr (could be higher depending on the roles available)
  • Forktruck drivers: 16$ - 18$ /hr

Let's connect!
Please apply directly online by email jvirtucio@agilus.ca
Agilus would like to thank all candidates for their interest in this opportunity. Due to the volume of resumes we receive; we may only be able to respond directly to those candidates being selected for an interview.
We encourage you to visit agilus.ca regularly or subscribe to our email alerts at agilus.ca/Account/Register as new exciting employment opportunities become available daily.

We value a diverse workplace.
Agilus Work Solutions is committed to employ people from diverse backgrounds and we actively demonstrate inclusiveness through fair, equitable and accessible hiring practices. We recognize the strength that comes from different experiences, backgrounds and perspectives and welcome candidates who identify as visible minorities, Indigenous people, persons with disabilities, and persons within the LGBTQ+ community. We feel it is important as an organization that all people have access and opportunity to be employed, to be valued and to be respected.

 Accommodations for job applicants with disabilities will be provided upon request during the recruitment, assessment, selection and placement process. Alternative format available onRequest.

title: Construction Labourer (FT)
description:
We are searching for a dependable Construction Laborer to join our excellent construction crew. The Skilled Laborer's responsibilities include ensuring worksites are clean and safe, a demo of windows, and torched on roofing, spreading gravel, using drills, saws, and other power tools, and providing assistance with heavy machinery. You should also be able to take instruction from superiors and complete on-the-job training. To be successful as a Skilled Laborer, you will have completed apprenticeships and acquired suitable skills. An outstanding Skilled Laborer should be hungry to expand their skill set and increase their level of expertise. You should also be willing to learn from other crew members and receive off-site training wherever possible.

With over two decades of experience, New City is staffed with an amazing group of professionals, engineers, project managers, and people from different trades that delivers reliable and cost-effective solutions to a wide range of building renewal challenges on both new and existing buildings. Come join our team!
Responsibilities:
  • Moving materials to the worksite and ensuring all tools, machinery, and other equipment are safely set up.
  • Operating equipment like drills, saw, shovels, and other heavy machinery.
  • Assisting with various window removal and roofing demo procedures.
  • Obeying health and safety codes, as well as the company's principles.
  • Removing hazardous materials from sites.
  • Driving scissor and boom lifts
  • Performing site and equipment inspections.
  • Attending meetings and workshops.
  • Completing on-the-job training.
  • Ensuring tasks are completed to deadlines.

Requirements:
  • High school diploma or similar.
  • Completed apprenticeships recommended.
  • driver's license recommended.
  • Sound knowledge of construction and practical experience with tools.
  • Excellent time management, organizational, and communication skills.
  • A good understanding of safety procedures.
  • Great hand, eye, and foot coordination.
  • Willingness to learn and be flexible.
  • Positive attitude and great interpersonal skills

Benefits:
We offer world-class health benefits, a competitive salary package, salary based on performance, registered retirement savings program, additional time off between Christmas and New Year’s Day, stable work life balance, positive and fun corporate culture, Right Directions Employee Assistance Program, and many more!
New City Contracting strives to ensure that its employment practices are free from direct and indirect discrimination and is committed to upholding the human rights of those participating in the hiring process. In pursuit of this commitment, New City Contracting will not condone or tolerate any acts of discrimination or harassment under any of the grounds protected under human rights legislation. This commitment extends to the hiring process and throughout employment.

title: Labourer (Acheson)
description:
Position Scope:

Reporting to the Brake North American (BNA) Remanufacturing Supervisor, you will ensure the proper deployment of job resources, operating part washer, and helping Bench Hands as directed. The Laborer is instrumental in enabling the department to achieve all established safety, quality, and productivity goals.

 

Schedule is 7x7

Responsibilities:
  • Cleaning parts as required.
  • Operating cranes to move parts and components around shop.
  • Operating fork trucks for moving parts and other items.
  • Keeping the shop and yard clean.
  • Snow removal around shop and front parking lot (seasonal).
  • Interacting with shop employees and becoming a part of a remanufacturing team.
  • Complete shop equipment inspections prior to use.
  • Perform basic preventative maintenance on support equipment as directed by supervisor.
  • Ensure compliance to all company, client and legislated safety policies and procedures.  
  • Using adequate and suitable safety equipment, including PPE.
  • Reviewing safe work plans/ hazard assessment with prior to job commencement.
Qualifications:
  • Warehouse materials handling experience in a distribution setting or similar environment considered an asset.  
  • 6 months experience with various fork-lift(s) battery standup,   propane or fuel type.
  • 6 months experience working in a safety sensitive work place.
  • Industrial construction and/or mining experience preferred.
  • High school diploma
  • Forklift operating certificate
  • Overhead crane operating certificate
  • Able to operate forklift, skid steers, small loaders
  • Must have valid class 5 driver's license
  • Always demonstrate safety
  • Be proficient in English, both verbally and written
  • Undergo and successfully pass the following testing:
    • Breath Alcohol Test
    • Urine Drug Test
    • Fitness-to-Work Assessment
    • Audiometric Testing
    • Vision Screening
    • Criminal Record Check
  • Basic computer literacy/skills.
  • Experience around heavy equipment is an asset
Summary:

All successful candidates must:

  1. Be proficient in English, both verbally and written
  2. Have a valid Class 5 Driverâ€™s License
  3. Have experience as requested as mentioned above
  4. Subject to Random Testing at: Suncor, Suncor Fort Hills and Kearl sites
  5. Undergo and successfully pass the following testing:
    • Breath Alcohol Test
    • Urine Drug Test
    • Fitness-to-Work Assessment
    • Audiometric Testing
    • Vision Screening
    • Criminal Record Check

Shift, site, and start times are subject to change.

 

All successful candidates MUST provide the following items prior to confirmation of their start date:

  1. CSO or BSO Certification
  2. Copy of Valid Class 5 Driverâ€™s License
  3. Copy of recent Driverâ€™s Abstract
  4. VOID cheque/direct deposit form

Once dispatched the following processes will occur:

  1. Will receive a call from NACG to set up all required pre-employment testing
  2. An email will be sent with all required New Hire Paperwork to be filled out
  3. After all results are received by NACG candidates will be contacted by Site Admin to schedule orientation and confirm your start date and other site specific details.

Please note the entire On-boarding process can take anywhere from 3-8 business days.

 

NO PHONE CALLS PLEASE, SUCCESSFUL CANDIDATES WILL BE CONTACTED VIA PHONE OR EMAIL.

 

Overview:

BNA Remanufacturing is located in Acheson, Alberta, and is a joint venture between North American Construction Group and Brake Supply Heavy Equipment.

 

This dynamic new partnership is designed to provide a cost effective and flexible pricing model for the supply of mining and construction drive train components.

 

BNA Remanufacturing provides a secure, local supply of drive train components to meet equipment production and availability targets. As well as exchanging components, we also provide rebuild and return service options for customer-owned components. All components are rebuilt to the highest exchange specification using OEM reusability guidelines and procedures.

 

BNA Remanufacturing is a trusted partner that you can help you develop product improvements and processes to achieve the most economical cost per equipment operating hour.

 

Learn more today by contacting us at BNA Remanufacturing.

title: General Labourer
description:
Mazenga Building Group Ltd. is a Toronto-based construction management firm established to provide clients with an unmatched level of attention, care, and customized management style. Our team strives to streamline the construction management process to deliver exceptional client satisfaction.

Our office in Toronto, ON is looking for Full Time General Labourers to perform work at sites throughout the Greater Toronto Area

Responsibilities

  • Unload, move and lift materials and equipment throughout the job site
  • Assist in managing traffic in construction areas
  • Housekeeping: general cleaning, moving materials, sweeping to ensure the site is clean and organized
  •  Report to Site Supervisor at start and end of day to receive job tasks and related communications
  • Assist carpenters or other staff members
  •  Under the direction of the Site Supervisor, occasionally perform work using small hand tools
  • Other duties as assigned

Qualifications:

  • Ability to perform physically demanding tasks, lifting, bending, walking, standing for long periods of time
  • Excellent Communication skills both verbal and written
  • Time Management skills to adapt to changing requirements and schedules
  • Ability to safely use hand tools and other construction equipment
  • Able to perform tasks with a focus on safety
  • Able to clean and maintain a variety of equipment, including but not limited to small repairs and routine maintenance
  • Valid G Driverâ€™s license and own transportation preferred to travel to different job sites ranging from the West End (Oakville, Brampton, Caledon) as well as downtown Toronto

title: General Labourer
description:
Merchandising Specialist – Flowers and Plants

About the Position

Brand Momentum is looking for two General Labourers to work together at local sites in Squamish.

6 hours/week

Key Responsibilities:

- Take off shelves by unhooking from slots
- The shelves to be stacked flat on base with hooks fitting into pole openings;
- Make sure the triangular tow bar of the base is not stacked underneath the shelves, so that it can still be used to make a train and be pulled with;
- Stack the shelves not higher than 50 per base;
- All carts with no shelves left are to be further dismantled by taking the poles off and stacking these on a cart with shelves and place 40 poles per shelf.
- Stack the ‘bare’ bases not higher than 12 per stack.

;t=436s

Specific Requirements:

· Must be able to lift 50 pounds alone

· Must have access to a vehicle

· Must wear steel toe footwear

· Must be able to work outside in all elements

· Must be able to work independently and as a team member

· Must observe store safety protocols

Job Types: Full-time, Part-time, Temporary

About Brand Momentum

We are a national integrated Sales, Marketing, and Retail solutions agency with two headquarters, one in Toronto and one in Montreal. We deliver authentic and enduring human connections, and we are led by a talented team and supported by a network of trusted partners. Rooted in Goodness, Brand Momentum is a three-time winner of Canada’s top 100 Best Workplace® and one of Canada’s top 500 fastest growing companies.

About Our Culture

Goodness is at the heart of everything we do. Brand Momentum (BMI) is an enduring market leader in quality and innovation. We deliver on our promises to our clients and each other, and we do it with passion, innovation and a commitment to excellence. Every single day we live our values of integrity, respect, empowerment, commitment, fun, flexibility and fiscal responsibility while putting our valued clients at the center of every decision we make.

title: Labourer
description:
Skwlax Resource Management is seeking Labourers for an upcoming construction project.  Positions are field-based and are in the region of Chase, British Columbia. 

Key Job Duties:

  • Manual material handling and a wide range of general construction activities
  • Operate hand and power tools
  • Clean, construction works areas where needed
  • Load, unload, identify and distribute materials and equipment
  • General minor maintenance and checks on equipment
  • Operate light equipment and tools
  • Fluid hauling, handling and pumping

General Requirements:

  • Previous construction experience, an asset
  • Excellent hand-eye coordination and manual dexterity
  • Ensure the appropriate use of Personal Protective Equipment
  • Ability to identify safety risks and hazards, and complying with relevant safety procedures and regulations
  • Physically able to perform manual labour outdoors (8-12 hours per shift, 5-6 days on, adjusted as projects demand)
  • Physically able to handle and lift heavy objects up to 50 pounds
  • Other tasks, duties and requirements as assigned

Qualifications:

Various safety tickets and certificates as required including but not limited to:

  • Positions are safety-sensitive, pre-employment drug and alcohol testing may be required
  • WHMIS 2015
  • Valid Class 5 Driverâ€™s License or government-issued photo ID
  • Ground Disturbance 2 if participating in Ground Disturbance activities, an asset
  • Confined Space Entry/Monitor if entering confined spaces/trench boxes
  • Alberta Standard First Aid, an asset
  • Other safety certifications as projects may require

Working Conditions:

  • Positions are field-based
  • The typical work schedule is 5-6 days per week, and 8-12-hour shifts depending on the project

Why Skwlax Resource Management?

Skwlax Resource Management is committed to fostering excellence and creating sustainable opportunities within the British Columbia Interior.

As a Little Shuswap Lake Band majority-owned company, Skwlax Resource Management is a fast-growing organization with purpose and promise. We are engaged in numerous large-scale projects and economic opportunities throughout the Interior.

The core of our business is a collaborative, knowledgeable, and dedicated team that is connected through a strong workplace culture. We encourage every member of our team to achieve great things, whether thatâ€™s through personal, professional, or community development.

If you are a team player who is driven to explore greater opportunities, we want to hear from you.

Follow Skwlax Resource Management on LinkedIn and Facebook for the latest job postings and news.

Skwlax Resource Management is an equal opportunity employer.  Only selected candidates will be contacted.  Thank you in advance for including us in your career search!

title: General Laborer (Construction)
description:
Job Description: All-purpose Renovation Contractor
Go Industries is looking for an ambitiousAll-purpose Renovation Contractor. You will be responsible for all renovation work including layout, installation, and repairs for our client’s commercial, industrial, and residential customers.

The Opportunity:
We are looking for an experienced full-time All-purpose Renovation Contractor to join our prestigious heating and cooling client’s team. This is a full-time opportunity with plenty of opportunities to learn and grow.
Key Responsibilities:
  • Must have expertise in multiple types of repairs, maintenance, and remodeling.
  • Must possess basic construction skills, be organized, and effectively communicate.
  • General Carpentry - Rough and Finish.
  • Ability to Upgrades / Remodel / Refresh / Remodel all types of commercial, residential, and industrial spaces.
  • Painting Interior and Exterior.

  • Valid Driver’s license with clean abstract.
  • Able to work at multiple sites in Ontario Primarily in the Hamilton area.
  • Experience working in other trades is a bonus. (HVAC/Plumbing/Electrical)

Pay rate:
  • Up to $40.00 per hour for the right candidate.
