title: Labourer - Alberta
description:
Forbes Bros is currently recruiting full-time Yard Laborer's for projects within Alberta.


Responsibilities:

The responsibilities of this position include, but are not limited to:

  • Digging and backfilling trenches
  • Pulling and placing underground and overhead cable
  • Carry and move materials as needed
  • Operating small equipment and hand tools
  • Spotting for vehicles and equipment
  • Site setup and cleanup, ensuring trash, debris and potential dangerous materials from the construction site are removed
  • Assisting craft/crew members with work
  • Development of skills on varied and challenging tasks
  • Perform additional labourer duties as assigned

Preferred Qualifications:

As the successful candidate, you will have:

  • Ability to work outdoors in all weather conditions
  • Must be in good physical condition and able to lift up to 23 kg (50 lbs)
  • Must have general knowledge of the principals involved in the operation of construction and maintenance methods and procedures
  • Able to work well with others as well as independently
  • Able to follow instruction and adhere to safe work practices
  • Attention to detail
  • Motivated
  • Punctual

Additional Details:

This position requires candidates to:

  • Have and maintain a valid driver's license and acceptable driver's abstract.
  • Successfully complete pre-employment drug and alcohol testing
  • Travel and work overtime as required

What We Offer:

Forbes Bros offers an attractive compensation package that includes a competitive salary, comprehensive benefit plan and a rewarding pension program. Forbes Bros has an open and team oriented culture that focuses on communication, innovation and respect in the workplace!

Forbes Bros Ltd. (FBL) is an equal opportunity employer committed to best practice recruiting and hiring, to promote gender equity and workplace diversity. We thank all applicants for their interest, however only those candidates who meet the requirements noted and who earn an invitation to interview will be contacted.

title: Construction Labourers (Redwater, AB)
description:
At Golderado, we're constantly pushing the limits of what we've done in the past - propelling ourselves toward bigger and better opportunities, while exploring new market sectors and services. So it only seems natural that we'd hire people who have their own voice and aren't afraid to use it. These are people who are simultaneously critical, creative and captivated by construction. They make our business their business, and follow a path that with continuous learning and an innovative spirit leads them to be recognized as leaders in the industry. We hire these types of people knowing they are as diverse as we are, and they come on board because they share our core values. 

In the position of an upcoming job for Construction Labourer, we would ask you to do the following: Handle and distribute construction materials (e.g., load and unload vehicles with supplies, equipment and construction materials; move tools, equipment and construction materials to and from work areas; remove rubble and other debris) Assemble and dismantle scaffolding, ramps, catwalks, shoring and barricades at construction sites Prepare and clean up construction sites, move materials and equipment, and perform demolition, excavation and compaction activities Work on a wide variety of buildings, structures and premises including municipal sewer and water mains, roads, dams and bridges, tunnels, railways and canals

Sounds challenging and exciting right? Here are a few of the attributes and experience you need to be successful in this position:

  • You have one to two years of industrial construction experience and must have Construction Safety Training Systems (CSTS 09) Certificate, WHMIS 2015, Standard First Aid considered an asset.
  • You have experience in using compactors, and trampers (jumping jack) You are able to lift up to 13.5 kg (30 lbs) 9-23 Kg You have a safety conscious attitude and able to work with others in a team
  • Valid driver's license - Driver's Abstract is required
  • Drug and Alcohol Screening required. 

Go ahead and be yourself. We'll pay you for it!  Apply today at resumes@pmeinc.ca We are an equal opportunity employer. While only qualified candidates will be contacted for an interview, be sure to continually 

 Please note, there is NO TRAVEL or LIVING ALLOWANCE for this project.

title: General Labour - Seasonal Part Time
description:
General Labour- Part-Time Seasonal 

Wonderbrands, Amherst, Nova Scotia
WAGE: $17.40/ hour, $1 night shift premium
SHIFT: Guaranteed 12+ hours per week. Rotating Days, Nights, Weekends (flexibility with working overtime, and on weekends, as necessary)

Our bakery located at 35 Tantramar Crescent is currently recruiting for Part-Time Production workers for days, afternoons and evening shifts

Wonderbrands, is a leading North American bakery (formerly Weston Foods, fresh and frozen businesses) with 140 years of experience in baking packaged breads, artisan breads, and donuts. We are one of the largest bakeries in North America and makers of Wonder Bread, Country Harvest, D’Italiano, Gadoua, and Casa Mendosa.

Wonderbrands, a division of FGF Brands, is unlocking an incredible opportunity for growth through a focus on production innovation capabilities, through a leading edge supply chain practice and investing deeply in communities where we bake.

Our bakery team is the heart of our company and plays an important role in keeping North America’s food supply going. Our Packers and General labourers are an integral part of the baking process, ensuring our delicious baked goods are packaged, and safely end up on grocery store shelves and at your favorite restaurants across North America.

We are not just a job, we are an extended family, committed to elevating everyday moments and feeding communities and families across the country. Join us and find fulfillment and purpose in your work.

 

In a typical day, you’ll:

 

  • Pick, pack, sort, and package fresh products into bags and boxes

  • Work in production/packaging area to make and stack boxes onto pallets

  • Inspect filled packages to ensure product is packaged according to specifications.

  • Work closely with production team members to ensure product quality

  • Assist machine operators/mixers/oven captains and crew with other duties as assigned.

  • May assist sanitation crew in the cleanliness of production equipment and area

  • Ensure all Food Safety and Health & Safety policies and procedures are followed

 

We offer a competitive wage, overtime opportunities, and a growth path to full time, line leader and supervisory roles.

If you’re excited about this opportunity and love baked goods, we invite you to apply!

 


About You:

  • A lover of bread and baked goods!

  • You have strong people skills—you’re approachable, a good listener, and empathetic

  • You have previously worked in a manufacturing environment (even better if it was food manufacturing!)

  • You’re dedicated to the health and safety of yourself and your colleagues

  • You digest constructive feedback as an opportunity to listen, and improve your skills, abilities, and performance

  • You are someone who listens to comprehend a situation first, asking questions to clarify your own understanding, instead of listening to be able to reply quickly

title: Full-Time Night Shift General Labour $17.25/hour (Mon-Fri 12:45am-9:15am)
description:
FULL-TIME NIGHT SHIFT GENERAL LABOUR $17.25/hour (Mon-Fri 12:45am - 9:15am)


Considering a Career at Maple Leaf Foods?

Maple Leaf Foods is Canada’s leading consumer-packaged protein company, headquartered in Toronto, Ontario. We make high-quality, great tasting, nutritious and innovative food products under leading brands including Maple Leaf®, Maple Leaf Prime®, Maple Leaf Natural Selections®, Schneiders®, Schneiders Country Naturals® and Mina™. Our Company employs approximately 11,000 people in its operations across Canada and exports to more than 20 global markets including the U.S. and Asia.

Our people are passionate about the work they do and the products we make. As we move forward, we are determined to leverage their integrity and passion to continue to build a high-performing, values-based company enabled by high-performing, motivated and talented people.
 

RESPONSIBILITIES:

  • Contributes to a healthy work environment, while maintaining high food safety standards
  • Works on the production line to process chicken and turkey products
  • Moves and lifts skids, tanks, totes and combos
  • Trims and removes bones from product
  • Takes action to correct any issues and to make improvements
  • Other responsibilities as required
 

WHAT DOING A GOOD JOB LOOKS LIKE:

  • Directly helps the department to meet targets and goals while maintaining a healthy and safe work environment
  • Dedicated to ensuring food safety procedures are met
  • Maintains productivity that meets/exceeds standards
  • Dedicated to creating a high quality product that consistently meets product specifications
  • Contributes to the team and the whole facility in a positive way
 

REQUIRED SKILLS, ABILITIES & EXPERIENCE:

  • Able to work in a fast-paced work environment with repetitive heavy lifting tasks
  • Able to perform heavy lifting, pushing tanks, lifting totes, shoveling
  • Able to stand and walk throughout the shift
  • Able to perform repetitive lifting and shoveling
  • Can work well in a team environment and support fellow team members
  • Good communication skills, able to speak and read English

Maple Leaf Foods is committed to ensuring the health and safety of all our employees.  As part of this commitment, we have adopted a number of COVID-19 safety measures, including a requirement for all employees to be fully vaccinated by March 31, 2022 and to show proof of vaccination.   In keeping with this policy, successful candidates will need to provide proof of vaccination by March 31, 2022 (or prior to their first day of work if the start date is after March 31, 2022).  We will of course consider accommodations for anyone unable to be vaccinated following human rights and other applicable laws.

We thank all applicants for their interest in exploring employment opportunities with Maple Leaf Foods however only those selected for an interview will be contacted. Applicants may be subject to a background check and must meet the security criteria designated for the position.

Maple Leaf Foods is committed to Employment Equity and maintaining a diverse workforce.  Job applicants with a disability who require reasonable accommodation for any part of the application or hiring process can contact our Talent Attraction Team at

accommodations@mapleleaf.com

.  Reasonable accommodations will be determined on a case-by-case basis and your request will be responded to as soon as possible.

title: General Labour (Burlington)
description:
JFE Shoji Power Canada Inc. is looking for Machine Operators in Burlington, ON!

Formerly Cogent Power Inc., JFE Shoji Power Canada Inc. is under new management.

While we appreciate all applicants, we will only be contacting those selected for an interview.

This position will be on rotating continental shifts (12-hour shifts) and overtime available as required, there will be a shift premium (80 cents) on all regular hours.

This position is located in Burlington, Ontario - 845 Laurentian Drive, L7N 3W7 (Conveniently located on bus route) 

Salary: $18-$23 an hour

Why you should join JFE: 

  • $500 signing bonus after your first 4 weeks 
  • 2 weeks of paid training! 
  • Travel Subsidy:
    • Starting April to September 2022 we will be providing a subsidy to all employees that incur the costs of travelling to work. These subsidies will be provided at the end of the month in the form of a gas card (i.e April subsidy will be provided by mid-May).
    • For those who take a city bus to work, we will be providing a transit pass.  
  • 100% Health & Benefit Plan 
  • RRSP RPP Pension Plan (Company matching!)
  • Perkopolis Account - get access to 5000 exclusive online discounts to stores & sports events (Hello Fresh, Apple, Indigo, Toronto Marlies, Toronto Raptors, etc.)
  • Boot & Prescription Safety Glasses Reimbursement
  • Employee & Family Assistance (free confidential counselling program)
  • Annual Canada's Wonderland event
  • & More

What youâ€™ll do as a Machine Operator:

  • Set up machine according to work order and operating procedures
  • Ensure product meets quality requirements as per work order, operating procedures and customersâ€™ specifications
  • Basic troubleshooting of machine and process flow 
  • Read work orders and understand all measurements
  • Follow priority schedule

About you, simply stated:

  • Strong measuring skills (tape measure & micrometre experience preferred) 
  • Exceptional communication skills
  • Strong attention to detail
  • Mechanically inclined
  • Organized
  • Manufacturing experience is a strong asset

About JFE Shoji Power Canada Inc:

On September 20th, 2019, JFE Shoji Trade Corporation acquired 100% of the shares of Cogent Power Inc, from Tata Steel Europe. Grouped together, the Cogent and JFE Shoji Steel America business make it possible for JFE Shoji to capture greater market share in the electrical steel market for both transformer and automotive products. The combination of Cogent and JFE Shoji has become one of the largest processors of electrical steel transformers in the world. JFE Shoji currently has many other production and processing facilities throughout Asia, as well as a facility in Tijuana, Mexico.

Globally, JFE Shoji enhanced the businessâ€™ competitiveness by sharing and integrating technical skills with deep business experience, which can be strongly applied to the global and North American markets. With this investment, JFE Shoji has one of the worldâ€™s leading processing and distribution functions for core design and manufacturing for transformers.

Based in Tokyo, JFE is one of the worldâ€™s largest steel producers with over 45,000 employees and operations globally.

If you would like to be considered, please apply in confidence. For more information about starting your career with JFE Shoji Power Canada, please visit https://www.jfeshojipower.com/

Job Type: Full time, benefits, vacation, RRSP and Pension offered!

#JFEHP

title: Skilled Labourer
description:
Our Skilled Labourers earn a competitive hourly wage based on experience. We offer an exceptional extended health plan including medical, dental, and vision. Our other benefits include an employee assistance program, educational assistance, professional development, internal growth opportunities, the opportunity for national career movement, and a healthy work/life balance. If this sounds like the opportunity for you, apply today!

Position Summary:

The Skilled Labourer is in good physical condition and provides construction work and support required to ensure timely project completion. The Skilled Labourer follows good work practices and procedures and sets a good example for new crew members and co-workers. The Skilled Labourer may: operate a variety of equipment and instruments, including hand and power tools of all types; clean and prepare sites; clean up rubble and debris; remove mold, asbestos lead and other hazardous materials.

Responsibilities:

  • Leads by example and follows all health and safety policies and procedures.
  • Strives to continually improve through specific development plans.
  • Accepts direction from the Lead Hand, Lead Water Technician and/or Lead Carpenter and more experienced co-workers.
  • Participates in good housekeeping discipline on the job to ensure a safe non-cluttered workplace and to minimize cross contamination.
  • Learns and practices correct procedures, especially when environmental work is required.
  • Adheres to company policy regarding acceptable standards to follow at a customer site i.e. smoking policy etc.
  • Displays good manners and attitude toward the property owner, occupants of the property, co-workers and sub-contractors.
  • Is willing and able to be on-call 24/7 for after hour's emergency work.
  • Directs customer questions or concerns to the most senior company person at the job site.
  • Looks out for and assists co-workers.

Qualifications:

  • Previous construction or cleaning work preferred.
  • Experience with hand tools & power tools preferred.
  • High School graduate or equivalent.

ARE YOU READY TO JOIN OUR TEAM?

If you feel that you would be right for this position, please fill out our initial 3-minute, mobile-friendly application so that we can review your information. We look forward to meeting you!

title: General Labourer
description:
Why work for Lafarge?:

 

 

 

 

 

As the global leader in innovative and sustainable building materials, weâ€™re committed to shaping a greener, smarter and healthier world. At Lafarge Canada Inc., safety comes first, collaboration matters and diversity is celebrated with people who share our desire to continually make our materials better.  

 

Do you have the drive, the skills, and the passion to join us?

 

 

Overview:

 

Lafarge is looking for a safe, reliable, motivated, and flexible individual to join our team to be a General Labourer at our Cawthra Depot in Mississauga. The General Labourer will execute the daily tasks of maintaining the Depot in accordance with Lafargeâ€™s Best Practices and Policies. Employee will be performing various tasks and given responsibilities that the employee can prioritize and execute based on the level of importance at the given time.  

 

Site

Cawthra Depot is our flagship Depot within our Lafarge network in the Greater Toronto Area. We accept, process, and resell clean concrete rubble for construction. We carry various materials from sand and gravel pits, as well as limestone products from quarries. During the winter season, we would sell road salt to landscapers and the general public for consumption.

 

Responsibilities:

 

Safety:

  • Promote safety culture through engagement with employees, JHSC, subcontractors and suppliers, implementation and maintenance of local and regional initiatives with an objective of â€œzeroâ€ safety incidents.
  • Administer and promote safety policies, processes and review procedures to ensure that site meets or exceeds all Lafarge and Regulatory guidelines.
  • Ensure that the site is kept safe, presentable, and functional.

Site Maintenance:

  • Any activity related to maintaining, enhancing, or improving the condition of the depot.
  • Some of the tasks involved include but is not limited to:
    • Painting
    • Maintaining signage
    • Sweeping/cleaning/organizing
    • Landscaping
    • Shovelling

Environmental Management:

  • Ensure that site meets or exceeds all Lafarge and Regulatory guidelines. This may include operating a water truck, and/or motorized sweeper to keep fugitive dust from leaving the property

Equipment

  • Operate a CAT 972/980, CAT 908, forklift to perform ad-hoc activities in the depot. Tasks involved include but is not limited to:
    • Loading customer vehicles
    • Managing the concrete rubble pile
    • Ad-hoc tasks with the internal crushing crew
  • Perform daily inspections as part of our preventative maintenance program to ensure machine is safe to operate and identify potential issues.

Other

  • Perform other duties as assigned to assist in the efficient operation of the site. This may include assisting the Portable Recycling Crushing crew on an as-needed basis.
  • Experience with operating heavy mobile equipment is preferred (Loading trucks with a loader, Excavators etc.)
  • Applicant must be comfortable on computers to be back up for scale master as needed to cover for vacations and/or sick days
  • Applicants will be exposed to manual labour that includes heavy lifting, bending, and twisting while being indoors and outdoors under various weather conditions.  
  • Applicants must have a valid G license in order to operate mobile equipment.
  • Employee will be asked to assist at other depots within the GTA as required. Travel mileage will be compensation. Hours may vary at different locations from home base.
  • Night and weekend work may be required for salt shifts over the winter season on a rotational basis.
  • Location: 2531 Cawthra Road, Mississauga. Ontario.

Relationships with Others Jobs

  • Reports to the Depot Supervisor
  • This position requires extensive liaison the Weigh Master, Depot Supervisor, and Depot Manager
Qualifications:

 

Education & Work Experience:

  • Canadian secondary school diploma or equivalent
  • Heavy equipment operation experience an asset

Knowledge & Skills:

  • Specific mobile equipment training
  • Mechanical aptitude
  • Forklift operation

Job-Specific Competency Profile (Lominger):

  • Action oriented
  • Timely decision making
  • Organizing
  • Listening
  • Priority setting
  • Problem solving
  • Time Management              
LafargeHolcim:

 

As we are reinventing the way the world builds, we need world-class talent to join our Lafarge Canada team: people who are passionate, driven by curiosity and keen to grow, learn, develop and thrive in our high-performance culture.

Whatever you do, you will make a difference here. Because we know that your passion and curiosity are the natural resources the world needs.  

 

We thank you for your interest.  Only candidates selected for an interview will be contacted.   Lafarge is committed to the principles of employment equity and encourages the applications from women, visible minorities, and persons with disabilities.

 

Lafarge Canada Inc. welcomes and encourages applications from people with disabilities.  In Ontario, our organization/business is committed to fulfilling our requirements under the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act.  Accommodations are available on request for  candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process.

 

Lafarge Canada is committed to providing a safe environment for employees, customers, contractors and vendors. As such, in keeping with the requirements of our industry associations, partners, and clients across Canada, Lafarge Canada has implemented a COVID-19 vaccination policy intended to reduce the spread of COVID-19. As of October 1st, 2021, all new employees joining Lafarge Canada, subject to any requirement to accommodate pursuant to applicable human rights legislation, must be fully vaccinated against COVID-19.

title: Skilled Construction Workers
description:
Our client is a custom RTM builder located 24 kms south of Delisle SK. Company is growing and we are looking for an individual experienced in residential construction with reliable transportation to join our team.

Organization is a family run company that values work life balance. They are able to attract and retain top talent to work with them, who also value the high quality craftsmanship that company has built their brand name around by creating a fun, supportive work environment

The following is mandatory to be considered for this position:
  • 1+ years general experience in residential construction in the last 5 years
  • Committed team player
  • Drug free subject to testing
The following is experience that is highly valued for this role:
  • Framing
  • ICF foundation and flatwork experience
  • Roofing experience
  • Exterior work experience
  • Able to be working on the road for the week (always home on the weekends)
Company has been in operation for 17 years and prides itself in having personnel who are team oriented and goal driven. Wage and benefit opportunities will be determined on successful candidates experience level.

Benefits:
  • Extended health care
  • Dental care
Please note that we are looking to hire a full time employee and not a sub trade. If you are looking to work as a sub trade this opportunity is not for you.

title: General Labourer
description:
Company Description

Founded in 1936 in Montreal, American Iron & Metal (AIM) is a family-owned company, recognized as a world leader in the metal recycling industry. Over the years, AIM has evolved into a multi-faceted company with successful lines of business including metals recycling, dry materials recycling, manufacturing of solder assembly, environmental services, retail auto parts, and highway transportation. With multiple facilities throughout Canada, the United States, Mexico, Europe, and Asia and over 2000 employees located throughout the world, AIM is uniquely positioned to provide best-in-class service and value to its customers. 

Job Description

  • Sorting, picking, and processing scrap metals 
  • Clean and inspect recycling yard by sweeping and raking materials and debris  
  • Assist with performing routine maintenance 
  • Perform other general labourer duties as assigned 
Qualifications

  • A Minimum of 1 year of experience is required in a general labourer role  
  • Experience in the metal scrap industry will be considered as an asset 
  • Experience in using machines like Lift Truck / Forklift, Skid steer will be considered as an asset 
  • Must be able to lift 50 lbs. and stand for extended periods of time 
  • Successful candidates must be highly motivated and work with little supervision 
  • Always strive for excellence and constant improvement 


Additional Information

WE OFFER 

  • Competitive salaries commensurate with experience and qualifications 
  • Group benefits like insurance and RRSP 
  • Additional training and uniform 
  • Great working environment 
  • Overtime opportunities 

HOURS OF WORK 

  • Permanent and full-time position 
  • 40 hours per week, able to work extended hours/weekends when deemed necessary 

HEALTH AND SAFETY 

  • Must work in compliance with the Occupational Health and Safety Regulation and follow in accordance with AIM’s Health and Safety policies and procedures 
  • Responsible for reporting all accidents, illnesses, or ‘near miss’ incidents to management 

ACCOMMODATION 

American Iron and Metal Inc. is proud to be an equal opportunity employer committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. We ensure that all individuals are treated equally, respectfully and with integrity. We welcome resume submissions from all qualified applicants and thank you for your interest in American Iron and Metal Inc. If accommodations are required, please attach a request with your resume. All information received will be addressed confidentially. We thank all applicants for their interest but only candidates selected for an interview will be contacted.

title: Labourer
description:
Brandt is currently seeking a Labourer for our Calgary location. The successful applicant for this position will be responsible for assisting in the dismantling of construction, forestry and mining based heavy equipment and components.

Duties & Responsibilities

  • Cleaning parts and components
  • Cleaning and organizing the yard
  • Some inventory maintenance.
  • Assisting the other shop personnel fulfill their duties and increase overall shop productivity
  • Demonstrate safe and efficient workplace practices
  • Highly motivated, with excellent communication and interpersonal skills
  • Able to carry out and understand verbal and written instructions
  • Strong attention to detail
  • Must be able to lift up to 50 pounds

  • Capable of meeting the physical demands of the heavy duty equipment environment (ie: lifting up to 75 pounds)
  • Must be capable of working under minimal supervision
  • Previous mechanical aptitude and willingness to learn required
  • Forklift experience and heavy duty parts handling considered an asset

title: Skilled Labourers
description:
Job Description:

Are you looking to join a collaborative team? Are you passionate about working as a labour  and looking for temporary work? If your answer is yes then look no more, we are your Clear Choice!  

 

ClearStream is looking for Entry Level to Skilled Laborers that can work independently, and are physically capable to perform oilfield, plant, and field tasks.  

 

Please note these are temporary roles until December 22, 2022. Candidates local to Peace River will be given preference at this time, as we have current and future working coming up ASAP. Not from Peace River? We encourage all applicants to apply, especially those willing to relocate!

title: Labourer - Bucks
description:
At EVRAZ, our strength starts with our people! As a team we collaborate to solve problems, contribute ideas and challenge each other to ensure growth and ultimately success for the business and our employees.

Processor (Bucks Auto Parts)

Winnipeg, Manitoba

Job Description and Responsibilities

Bucks Auto Parts is a self-serve auto parts and vehicle recycling facility. If you have an aptitude for automobiles and/or suitable experience, a solid work ethic, a record of success and great communication skills, we want to talk to you! We are currently seeking a vehicle Processor to work at the Bucks Auto Parts in Winnipeg, operated by EVRAZ North America. Reporting to the Operations Manager, the Processor will be responsible for vehicle processing and draining appropriate fluids from cars and removing non-ferrous material.

  • Drain appropriate automobile fluids (gasoline, antifreeze, etc.) to assist with the processing of vehicles

  • Remove the catalytic converter from vehicles as needed

  • Notifies appropriate personnel of any procedural abnormalities

  • Keeps work area clean

  • Observes and follows all safety rules and regulations

  • Remove tires and rims from vehicles

Requirements

  • No experience necessary but previous work experience in a manufacturing, production, or similar scrapyard/auto part environment will be considered an asset

  • Knowledge of automotive components is a definite asset

  • Able to meet the physical demands of the position including standing, walking, sitting, climbing, crawling, kneeling, bending, moderate to heavy lifting and pushing and pulling

  • Willing and able to work in variable weather conditions including hot, dry summer conditions and cold, harsh winter conditions

  • Organized and able to prioritize competing priorities

  • Strong communication skills – communicates clearly and concisely, both verbally and in writing, and over mobile radio devices

  • Polite and friendly with a customer service orientation

  • Strong work ethic, uses time efficiently

  • Able to work with minimal supervision/general oversight

  • Strong attention to detail with a keen knack for accuracy when inputting data

  • Must have reliable transportation to and from work (remote location, not accessible by bus)

Our total compensation package includes amazing benefits!

  • Competitive wages and bonus opportunities
  • Family medical, dental, and prescription coverage at minimal employee cost
  • Short and long term disability programs
  • Competitive retirement plans
  • Paid vacations and statutory holidays
  • Apprenticeship and career advancement within the company
  • Tuition reimbursement

All applicants must be eligible to work in Canada without sponsorship.

While we thank all those who apply, only those being actively considered for employment will be contacted.

Equal Opportunity Employer

EVRAZ North America is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability, or protected Veteran status.

 

EVRAZ North America is committed to working with and providing reasonable accommodation to individuals with physical and mental disabilities.

If you need special assistance or an accommodation while seeking employment, please e-mail

careers@evrazna.com

or call: (312) 533-3577. We will make a determination on your request for reasonable accommodation on a case-by-case basis.

Join a team that manufactures excellence, drives success and builds careers!

title: Summer Student - General Laborer - Inuvik
description:
Under the general supervision of the Manager Generation Support, you contribute to the safe and efficient operation of the NTPC Plant. Duties would include heavy lifting, weed whacking, painting, mopping, cleaning and assisting the Mechanics, Electrical Technicians, Electricians and Power Linepersons



Qualifications:

  • Are enrolling/enrolled to attend full time post-secondary studies at the start of the Fall 2021 semester.
  • Related experience in a labourer position an asset.

 How to Apply:

  • Submit your cover letter, and a current copy of your resume including two references from your most recent supervisor or instructors.
  • You will be required to provide proof of registration in a post-secondary institution.

This position pays $26.97 per hour plus 6% vacation pay.  No housing or relocation assistance provided.

 

This job opening is limited to student residents living in Inuvik.

 

Affirmative Action Employer - Candidates must clearly identify eligibility status via our online portal in order to receive priority consideration.

 

We thank all those who apply and advise that only those selected for further consideration will be contacted.

description:

Looking forward to hearing from you!

Randstad Canada is committed to fostering a workforce reflective of all peoples of Canada. As a result, we are committed to developing and implementing strategies to increase the equity, diversity and inclusion within the workplace by examining our internal policies, practices, and systems throughout the entire lifecycle of our workforce, including its recruitment, retention and advancement for all employees. In addition to our deep commitment to respecting human rights, we are dedicated to positive actions to affect change to ensure everyone has full participation in the workforce free from any barriers, systemic or otherwise, especially equity-seeking groups who are usually underrepresented in Canada's workforce, including those who identify as women or non-binary/gender non-conforming; Indigenous or Aboriginal Peoples; persons with disabilities (visible or invisible) and; members of visible minorities, racialized groups and the LGBTQ2+ community.

title: Labourer
description:
Company Description

 

We are Chandos

Inclusion. Collaboration. Ingenuity. Innovation.

These values speak to our desire to create places where all people belong, listening and learning from one another in a way that sparks ideas and leads to positive changes in our industry and community. They also demonstrate our commitment to a diverse, equitable, and inclusive culture. And, if they resonate with you too, we should talk!

We are 100 percent employee owned and proud to be the first and largest B Corp certified commercial builder in North America, meaning we put our values at the centre of everything we do. 

Continuous improvement is core to our success. Championing innovative and collaborative ways to build is just one example of that. Collaborative construction leads to more efficiency, cost savings, social value, and a much better working experience for everyone.

Every day, our teams are working to build places for people to live, work, learn, serve, and play. But above all, we’re building community. And, we’re looking for like-minded people to join us. Together, we can build a better world.

 

Job Description

The Labourer is required to perform tasks involving physical labour at commercial construction projects, and to operate a variety of hand and power tools.

Qualifications

  • Knowledge of safe operation of basic hand and power tools
  • Minimum of 1 year previous construction labour experience preferred
  • Knowledge of workplace safety, and safe lifting and handling procedures
  • Knowledge of First Aid and CPR preferred
  • Valid Drivers License and clean abstract preferred
  • Out of town work may be required. Work in all weather conditions.

 



Additional Information

Chandos is an equal opportunity employer and we are committed to a diverse, equitable, and inclusive culture and this includes our recruitment and hiring process. 

We recognize that our differences are our greatest strengths. We uncover talent. We nurture talent. And then we give people the tools they need to use their talent to create a positive impact.

  • We are 100% employee owned. Every person who works for Chandos can become an owner. There is only one class of units at Chandos, because we believe everyone should be treated equal. We talk about being an entrepreneurial-minded organization and you can be sure we mean it!
  • Competitive wages
  • Well rounded employer paid benefits program including health, dental, vision care and employee assistance program
  • RRSP matching program to aid and prepare employees for long-term financial security
  • Educational assistance for employees who wish to pursue job-performance enhancing education
  • Recognition and annual salary reviews program
  • Leadership conferences that allow employees to connect and collaborate
  • Regular company-wide engagement opportunities

title: Labourer - Alberta
description:
Forbes Bros is currently recruiting full-time Yard Laborer's for projects within Alberta.


Responsibilities:

The responsibilities of this position include, but are not limited to:

  • Digging and backfilling trenches
  • Pulling and placing underground and overhead cable
  • Carry and move materials as needed
  • Operating small equipment and hand tools
  • Spotting for vehicles and equipment
  • Site setup and cleanup, ensuring trash, debris and potential dangerous materials from the construction site are removed
  • Assisting craft/crew members with work
  • Development of skills on varied and challenging tasks
  • Perform additional labourer duties as assigned

Preferred Qualifications:

As the successful candidate, you will have:

  • Ability to work outdoors in all weather conditions
  • Must be in good physical condition and able to lift up to 23 kg (50 lbs)
  • Must have general knowledge of the principals involved in the operation of construction and maintenance methods and procedures
  • Able to work well with others as well as independently
  • Able to follow instruction and adhere to safe work practices
  • Attention to detail
  • Motivated
  • Punctual

Additional Details:

This position requires candidates to:

  • Have and maintain a valid driver's license and acceptable driver's abstract.
  • Successfully complete pre-employment drug and alcohol testing
  • Travel and work overtime as required

What We Offer:

Forbes Bros offers an attractive compensation package that includes a competitive salary, comprehensive benefit plan and a rewarding pension program. Forbes Bros has an open and team oriented culture that focuses on communication, innovation and respect in the workplace!

Forbes Bros Ltd. (FBL) is an equal opportunity employer committed to best practice recruiting and hiring, to promote gender equity and workplace diversity. We thank all applicants for their interest, however only those candidates who meet the requirements noted and who earn an invitation to interview will be contacted.

title: Construction Labourers
description:
Construction Labourers

At PME INC, we're constantly pushing the limits of what we've done in the past - propelling ourselves toward bigger and better opportunities, while exploring new market sectors and services. So it only seems natural that we'd hire people who have their own voice and aren't afraid to use it. These are people who are simultaneously critical, creative and captivated by construction. They make our business their business, and follow a path that with continuous learning and an innovative spirit leads them to be recognized as leaders in the industry. We hire these types of people knowing they are as diverse as we are, and they come on board because they share our core values.

In the position of an upcoming job for Construction Labourer, we would ask you to do the following: Handle and distribute construction materials (e.g., load and unload vehicles with supplies, equipment and construction materials; move tools, equipment and construction materials to and from work areas; remove rubble and other debris) Assemble and dismantle scaffolding, ramps, catwalks, shoring and barricades at construction sites Prepare and clean up construction sites, move materials and equipment, and perform demolition, excavation and compaction activities Work on a wide variety of buildings, structures and premises including municipal sewer and water mains, roads, dams and bridges, tunnels, railways and canals

Sounds challenging and exciting right? Here are a few of the attributes and experience you need to be successful in this position:

  • You have one to two years of industrial or civil construction experience and must have Construction Safety Training Systems (CSTS 09) Certificate or SCOT, WHMIS 2015, Standard First Aid considered an asset.
  • You have experience in using compactors, and trampers (jumping jack) You are able to lift up to 13.5 kg (30 lbs) 9-23 Kg You have a safety conscious attitude and able to work with others in a team
  • Valid driver's license - Driver's Abstract is required
  • Drug and Alcohol Screening required.

Go ahead and be yourself. We'll pay you for it! These positions will start in Spring 2022.

Please note, there is NO TRAVEL or LIVING ALLOWANCE for this project.

We are an equal opportunity employer. We welcome people of any age, culture, subculture, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, nationality, ethnicity, race, size, mental or physical status, veteran status, religion, language, political opinion, working-style preference, family status, education, and socio-economic status.

Here are a few of the attributes and experience you need to be successful in this position:', "Go ahead and be yourself. We'll pay you for it! These positions will start in Spring 2022."]

title: General Labour (Day & Afternoon Shifts Available)
description:
Considering a Career at Maple Leaf Foods?
Maple Leaf Foods is Canada’s leading consumer-packaged protein company, headquartered in Toronto, Ontario. We make high-quality, great tasting, nutritious and innovative food products under leading brands including Maple Leaf®, Maple Leaf Prime®, Maple Leaf Natural Selections®, Schneiders®, Schneiders Country Naturals® and Mina™. Our Company employs approximately 11,500 people in its operations across Canada and exports to more than 20 global markets including the U.S. and Asia.

Our people are passionate about the work they do and the products we make. As we move forward, we are determined to leverage their integrity and passion to continue to build a high-performing, values-based company enabled by high-performing, motivated and talented people.

Maple Leaf Foods Bradford Plant is Hiring!
  • Production positions include General Labourer, Semi-Skilled, and Skilled positions!
  • Full Time Roles are eligible for Benefits and Pension
  • A variety of shifts are available
  • fast paced learning environment
  • Competitive wages -Earn up to $17.85/hour + benefits + pension + $1500 bonus!
  • Annual wage review completed to ensure wages remain competitive across MLF and external companies
    • Pay progressions occur every 6 months
  • Full-time permanent employees are eligible for benefits (Healthcare/medical and Dental through SunLife) after 3 months of working
  • Pension with Manulife after 2 years of working
  • Career Advancement within company (we’ve had many employees move up to higher paying hourly positions (i.e. Lead Hands, Assistant Supervisors) and salary positions as well (i.e. Production Supervisors)
  • Employee Family Assistance Program (EFAP) through Morneau Shepell, paid by company
  • Inkblot online (CBT) cognitive behavioural therapy
  • Employee Events throughout the year
  • Employee sales for product throughout the year
  • Until further notice: Safe Covid19 protocols including face masks, face shields and physical barriers within Production

GENERAL LABOURER: The General Labourer position is responsible for performing packaging, clean-up and other elemental activities related to food processing.
Responsibilities:
  • Manually pack product into bags, trays and other packaging formats as per customer specification
  • Check products and packaging for basic quality defects.
  • Load product onto packaging line for processing
  • Ensure work area is clean and tidy
  • Follow all GMP and food safety principles

SEMI-SKILLED: The Semi-Skilled position is responsible for operating single-function machines to process and package meat products, perform equipment set-up and material handling





Responsibilities:
  • Set up and adjust single-function processing and packaging machines preparatory to operation.
  • Set up labels in retail labeller and end scales
  • Operate single function machines required to process or package food products.
  • Check products for defects and to ensure conformance to company standards and perform corrective machine adjustments as necessary.
  • Complete associated documents
  • Train new employees
  • Understand and comply with basic food safety principles.

SKILLED: The Skilled position is responsible for operating multi-function process control or single-function machines to process and package meat products.


Responsibilities:
  • Performing line set up approvals and verification
  • Complete required documentation associated to the production run
  • Ensure all products are set up and packaged as per specification
  • Oversee training of new employees
  • Maintain shift log of production and other data.
  • Participate in continuous improvement programs, meetings, etc.
  • Understand and comply with basic food safety principles.

Experience/Competencies:
  • Secondary Education
  • Good oral and written communication skills
  • Experience in a manufacturing environment is an asset

WHY Maple Leaf Foods,
• Training provided where needed
• Reputable company
• Competitive Wages
• Opportunities to participate in Benefits and Pension plans
• Great team environment
• Strong focus on internal advancement
• Employee Assistance Program

If interested, please send resume by email to:

Jessica.madia@mapleleaf.com

or apply to our job posting online

We thank all applicants for their interest in exploring employment opportunities with Maple Leaf Foods however only those selected for an interview will be contacted. Applicants may be subject to a background check and must meet the security criteria designated for the position.

Maple Leaf Foods is committed to ensuring the health and safety of all our employees. As part of this commitment, we have adopted a number of COVID-19 safety measures, including a requirement for all employees to be fully vaccinated by March 31, 2022 and to show proof of vaccination. In keeping with this policy, successful candidates will need to provide proof of vaccination by March 31, 2022 (or prior to their first day of work if the start date is after March 31, 2022). We will of course consider accommodations for anyone unable to be vaccinated following human rights and other applicable laws

Maple Leaf Foods is committed to Employment Equity and maintaining a diverse workforce. Job applicants with a disability who require reasonable accommodation for any part of the application or hiring process can contact our Talent Attraction Team at

accommodations@mapleleaf.com

. Reasonable accommodations will be determined on a case-by-case basis and your request will be responded to as soon as possible.

title: General Labour (Burlington)
description:
JFE Shoji Power Canada Inc. is looking for Machine Operators in Burlington, ON!

Formerly Cogent Power Inc., JFE Shoji Power Canada Inc. is under new management.

While we appreciate all applicants, we will only be contacting those selected for an interview.

This position will be on rotating continental shifts (12-hour shifts) and overtime available as required, there will be a shift premium (80 cents) on all regular hours.

This position is located in Burlington, Ontario - 845 Laurentian Drive, L7N 3W7 (Conveniently located on bus route) 

Salary: $18-$23 an hour

Why you should join JFE: 

  • $500 signing bonus after your first 4 weeks 
  • 2 weeks of paid training! 
  • Travel Subsidy:
    • Starting April to September 2022 we will be providing a subsidy to all employees that incur the costs of travelling to work. These subsidies will be provided at the end of the month in the form of a gas card (i.e April subsidy will be provided by mid-May).
    • For those who take a city bus to work, we will be providing a transit pass.  
  • 100% Health & Benefit Plan 
  • RRSP RPP Pension Plan (Company matching!)
  • Perkopolis Account - get access to 5000 exclusive online discounts to stores & sports events (Hello Fresh, Apple, Indigo, Toronto Marlies, Toronto Raptors, etc.)
  • Boot & Prescription Safety Glasses Reimbursement
  • Employee & Family Assistance (free confidential counselling program)
  • Annual Canada's Wonderland event
  • & More

What youâ€™ll do as a Machine Operator:

  • Set up machine according to work order and operating procedures
  • Ensure product meets quality requirements as per work order, operating procedures and customersâ€™ specifications
  • Basic troubleshooting of machine and process flow 
  • Read work orders and understand all measurements
  • Follow priority schedule

About you, simply stated:

  • Strong measuring skills (tape measure & micrometre experience preferred) 
  • Exceptional communication skills
  • Strong attention to detail
  • Mechanically inclined
  • Organized
  • Manufacturing experience is a strong asset

About JFE Shoji Power Canada Inc:

On September 20th, 2019, JFE Shoji Trade Corporation acquired 100% of the shares of Cogent Power Inc, from Tata Steel Europe. Grouped together, the Cogent and JFE Shoji Steel America business make it possible for JFE Shoji to capture greater market share in the electrical steel market for both transformer and automotive products. The combination of Cogent and JFE Shoji has become one of the largest processors of electrical steel transformers in the world. JFE Shoji currently has many other production and processing facilities throughout Asia, as well as a facility in Tijuana, Mexico.

Globally, JFE Shoji enhanced the businessâ€™ competitiveness by sharing and integrating technical skills with deep business experience, which can be strongly applied to the global and North American markets. With this investment, JFE Shoji has one of the worldâ€™s leading processing and distribution functions for core design and manufacturing for transformers.

Based in Tokyo, JFE is one of the worldâ€™s largest steel producers with over 45,000 employees and operations globally.

If you would like to be considered, please apply in confidence. For more information about starting your career with JFE Shoji Power Canada, please visit https://www.jfeshojipower.com/

Job Type: Full time, benefits, vacation, RRSP and Pension offered!

#JFEHP

title: General Labourer
description:
Our General Labourers earn a competitive hourly wage based on experience. We offer an exceptional extended health plan including medical, dental, and vision. Our other benefits include an employee assistance program, educational assistance, professional development, internal growth opportunities, the opportunity for national career movement, and a healthy work/life balance. If this sounds like the opportunity for you, apply today!


Position Summary:

The General Labourer is in good physical condition and provides construction work and support required to ensure timely project completion. The Labourer follows good work practices and procedures and sets a good example for new crew members and co-workers. The Labourer may: operate a variety of equipment and instruments, including hand and power tools of all types; clean and prepare sites; clean up rubble and debris; remove mold, asbestos lead, and other hazardous materials.

Responsibilities:

  • Leads by example and follows all health and safety policies and procedures.
  • Strives to continually improve through specific development plans.
  • Accepts direction from the Lead Hand, Lead Water Technician and/or Lead Carpenter and more experienced co-workers.
  • Participates in good housekeeping discipline on the job to ensure a safe non-cluttered workplace and to minimize cross-contamination.
  • Learns and practices correct procedures, especially when environmental work is required.
  • Adheres to company policy regarding acceptable standards to follow at a customer site i.e. smoking policy etc.
  • Displays good manners and attitude toward the property owner, occupants of the property, co-workers, and sub-contractors.
  • Is willing and able to be on-call 24/7 for after hour's emergency work.
  • Directs customer questions or concerns to the most senior company person at the job site.
  • Looks out for and assists co-workers.

Qualifications:

  • Previous construction or cleaning work preferred.
  • Experience with hand tools & power tools preferred.
  • High School graduate or equivalent.

ARE YOU READY TO JOIN OUR TEAM?

If you feel that you would be right for this position, please fill out our initial 3-minute, mobile-friendly application so that we can review your information. We look forward to meeting you!

title: General Labourer
description:
Why work for Lafarge?

 

 

 

 

 

As the global leader in innovative and sustainable building materials, we’re committed to shaping a greener, smarter and healthier world. At Lafarge Canada Inc., safety comes first, collaboration matters and diversity is celebrated with people who share our desire to continually make our materials better. 

 

Do you have the drive, the skills, and the passion to join us?

 

 

Overview

 

Lafarge is looking for a safe, reliable, motivated, and flexible individual to join our team to be a General Labourer at our Cawthra Depot in Mississauga. The General Labourer will execute the daily tasks of maintaining the Depot in accordance with Lafarge’s Best Practices and Policies. Employee will be performing various tasks and given responsibilities that the employee can prioritize and execute based on the level of importance at the given time.  

 

Site

Cawthra Depot is our flagship Depot within our Lafarge network in the Greater Toronto Area. We accept, process, and resell clean concrete rubble for construction. We carry various materials from sand and gravel pits, as well as limestone products from quarries. During the winter season, we would sell road salt to landscapers and the general public for consumption.

 

Responsibilities

 

Safety:

  • Promote safety culture through engagement with employees, JHSC, subcontractors and suppliers, implementation and maintenance of local and regional initiatives with an objective of “zero” safety incidents.
  • Administer and promote safety policies, processes and review procedures to ensure that site meets or exceeds all Lafarge and Regulatory guidelines.
  • Ensure that the site is kept safe, presentable, and functional.

Site Maintenance:

  • Any activity related to maintaining, enhancing, or improving the condition of the depot.
  • Some of the tasks involved include but is not limited to:
    • Painting
    • Maintaining signage
    • Sweeping/cleaning/organizing
    • Landscaping
    • Shovelling

Environmental Management:

  • Ensure that site meets or exceeds all Lafarge and Regulatory guidelines. This may include operating a water truck, and/or motorized sweeper to keep fugitive dust from leaving the property

Equipment

  • Operate a CAT 972/980, CAT 908, forklift to perform ad-hoc activities in the depot. Tasks involved include but is not limited to:
    • Loading customer vehicles
    • Managing the concrete rubble pile
    • Ad-hoc tasks with the internal crushing crew
  • Perform daily inspections as part of our preventative maintenance program to ensure machine is safe to operate and identify potential issues.

Other

  • Perform other duties as assigned to assist in the efficient operation of the site. This may include assisting the Portable Recycling Crushing crew on an as-needed basis.
  • Experience with operating heavy mobile equipment is preferred (Loading trucks with a loader, Excavators etc.)
  • Applicant must be comfortable on computers to be back up for scale master as needed to cover for vacations and/or sick days
  • Applicants will be exposed to manual labour that includes heavy lifting, bending, and twisting while being indoors and outdoors under various weather conditions.  
  • Applicants must have a valid G license in order to operate mobile equipment.
  • Employee will be asked to assist at other depots within the GTA as required. Travel mileage will be compensation. Hours may vary at different locations from home base.
  • Night and weekend work may be required for salt shifts over the winter season on a rotational basis.
  • Location: 2531 Cawthra Road, Mississauga. Ontario.

Relationships with Others Jobs

  • Reports to the Depot Supervisor
  • This position requires extensive liaison the Weigh Master, Depot Supervisor, and Depot Manager

Qualifications

 

Education & Work Experience:

  • Canadian secondary school diploma or equivalent
  • Heavy equipment operation experience an asset

Knowledge & Skills:

  • Specific mobile equipment training
  • Mechanical aptitude
  • Forklift operation

Job-Specific Competency Profile (Lominger):

  • Action oriented
  • Timely decision making
  • Organizing
  • Listening
  • Priority setting
  • Problem solving
  • Time Management             

LafargeHolcim

 

As we are reinventing the way the world builds, we need world-class talent to join our Lafarge Canada team: people who are passionate, driven by curiosity and keen to grow, learn, develop and thrive in our high-performance culture.

Whatever you do, you will make a difference here. Because we know that your passion and curiosity are the natural resources the world needs. 

 

We thank you for your interest. Only candidates selected for an interview will be contacted.  Lafarge is committed to the principles of employment equity and encourages the applications from women, visible minorities, and persons with disabilities.

 

Lafarge Canada Inc. welcomes and encourages applications from people with disabilities. In Ontario, our organization/business is committed to fulfilling our requirements under the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act. Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process.

 

Lafarge Canada is committed to providing a safe environment for employees, customers, contractors and vendors. As such, in keeping with the requirements of our industry associations, partners, and clients across Canada, Lafarge Canada has implemented a COVID-19 vaccination policy intended to reduce the spread of COVID-19. As of October 1st, 2021, all new employees joining Lafarge Canada, subject to any requirement to accommodate pursuant to applicable human rights legislation, must be fully vaccinated against COVID-19.

title: Skilled Construction Workers
description:
Our client is a custom RTM builder located 24 kms south of Delisle SK. Company is growing and we are looking for an individual experienced in residential construction with reliable transportation to join our team.

Organization is a family run company that values work life balance. They are able to attract and retain top talent to work with them, who also value the high quality craftsmanship that company has built their brand name around by creating a fun, supportive work environment

The following is mandatory to be considered for this position:
  • 1+ years general experience in residential construction in the last 5 years
  • Committed team player
  • Drug free subject to testing
The following is experience that is highly valued for this role:
  • Framing
  • ICF foundation and flatwork experience
  • Roofing experience
  • Exterior work experience
  • Able to be working on the road for the week (always home on the weekends)
Company has been in operation for 17 years and prides itself in having personnel who are team oriented and goal driven. Wage and benefit opportunities will be determined on successful candidates experience level.

Benefits:
  • Extended health care
  • Dental care
Please note that we are looking to hire a full time employee and not a sub trade. If you are looking to work as a sub trade this opportunity is not for you.

title: General Labourer - Sudbury North
description:
Company Description

Founded in 1936 in Montreal, American Iron & Metal (AIM) is a family-owned company, recognized as a world leader in the metal recycling industry. Over the years, AIM has evolved into a multi-faceted company with successful lines of business including metals recycling, dry materials recycling, manufacturing of solder assembly, environmental services, retail auto parts, and highway transportation. With multiple facilities throughout Canada, the United States, Mexico, Europe, and Asia and over 2000 employees located throughout the world, AIM is uniquely positioned to provide best-in-class service and value to its customers. 

Job Description

American Iron & Metal, a Hamilton based Metal Recycling Yard has an opening for an enthusiastic individual to fill a General Labour position at our AIM Recycling Sudbury Operation.

The successful candidate will be responsible for supporting and ensuring the smooth and safe day to day activities in our yard. There are many potential growth opportunities within our organization for a career minded candidate!

Duties Will Include

  • Working both inside the warehouse and outside in our yard
  • Sorting and processing metal pieces
  • Operating a tow motor and or forklift on occasion to tip or dump bins
  • Other manual labour duties will apply

 

Qualifications

  • Reading, writing and basic math skills are required
  • Computer literacy is considered an asset as the position evolves
  • Must be able to stand and walk for long periods of time
  • Must be able to lift up-to 50lbs
  • Must be able to work independently as well as in a team orientated environment
  • Ability to work in outside in all-weather conditions
  • Safety orientated
  • Tow motor or forklift license considered an asset however we will provide training to the right candidate

 



Additional Information

  • Competitive salaries commensurate with experience and qualifications 
  • Group benefits like insurance and RRSP 
  • Additional training and uniform 
  • Great working environment 
  • Overtime opportunities

 We workday-in and day-out to provide the best solutions for our customers. With a legacy of excellence and experience stretching back more than 50 years.    

 

Our people and processes are the pillars of our company. Safety is intertwined into our culture where everyone strives to achieve a zero-injury workforce and flawless execution on schedule and within budget.    

 

We are hiring labourers for a four-day shutdown located in Whitecourt, AB starting April 25, 2022. You will be responsible to assist in the installation, maintenance, and repair of industrial facilities during Shutdown.  

 

 

What youâ€™ll be doing:

  • Loading and unloading materials, tools, and equipment    
  • Assisting skilled trades in various tasks    
  • Supporting cross-functional trade as required

title: Labourer
description:
Brandt is currently seeking a Labourer for our Dryden location.

The successful applicant for this position will be responsible for assisting in the dismantling of construction, forestry and mining based heavy equipment and components.

Duties & Responsibilities

  • Cleaning parts and components
  • Cleaning and organizing the yard
  • Some inventory maintenance.
  • Assisting the other shop personnel fulfill their duties and increase overall shop productivity
  • Demonstrate safe and efficient workplace practices
  • Highly motivated, with excellent communication and interpersonal skills
  • Able to carry out and understand verbal and written instructions
  • Strong attention to detail
  • Must be able to lift up to 50 pounds
  • Capable of meeting the physical demands of the heavy duty equipment environment (ie: lifting up to 75 pounds)
  • Must be capable of working under minimal supervision
  • Previous mechanical aptitude and willingness to learn required
  • Forklift experience and heavy duty parts handling considered an asset

title: Labourer - Ferrous / Non Ferrous Downstream (GenAlta)
description:
At EVRAZ, our strength starts with our people! As a team we collaborate to solve problems, contribute ideas and challenge each other to ensure growth and ultimately success for the business and our employees.

Job Description and Responsibilities

GenAlta has an immediate opening for a labourer for the Ferrous / Non-Ferrous material streams at our Edmonton location. The laborer will report to the Assistant Operations Manager. Hours of operation will be 6:00-4:00 pm, Monday to Friday. Additional overtime including weekends can also be scheduled in.

  • Observe/Practice all company safety rules and policies

  • Ability to multi task in a progressive environment

  • Mechanically inclined.

  • Responsible for lubrication and general cleanup

  • Work closely with loader operator while loading containers

  • Work in the picker shack as well as the non-ferrous separation building

  • Monitor flow of product from a raw material state through to the finished product

  • Able to operate the Skid steer

Requirements

  • Previous work experience in a manufacturing, production, or similar scrap-yard/auto part environment will be considered an asset

  • Able to meet the physical demands of the position including standing, walking, sitting, climbing, crawling, kneeling, bending, moderate to heavy lifting and pushing and pulling up to 50 pounds throughout the day

  • Able to communicate clearly

  • Willing to assist / support with labor duties in other areas of the plant

  • Willing and able to work in variable weather conditions including hot, dry summer conditions and cold, harsh winter conditions

  • Willingness to learn and work responsibly following all safety procedures

  • A proven history of reliability

  • Mentally alert to surroundings

  • Good attention to detail and quality control

This is a unionized position with a 3 month probationary period.

The successful candidate will be asked to undergo a Fitness to Work & Alcohol/ Drug testing upon a conditional offer of employment being extended.

Our total compensation package includes amazing benefits!

  • Competitive wages and bonus opportunities
  • Family medical, dental, and prescription coverage at minimal employee cost
  • Short and long term disability programs
  • Competitive retirement plans
  • Paid vacations and statutory holidays
  • Apprenticeship and career advancement within the company
  • Tuition reimbursement

All applicants must be eligible to work in Canada without sponsorship.

While we thank all those who apply, only those being actively considered for employment will be contacted.

Equal Opportunity Employer

EVRAZ North America is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability, or protected Veteran status.

 

EVRAZ North America is committed to working with and providing reasonable accommodation to individuals with physical and mental disabilities.

If you need special assistance or an accommodation while seeking employment, please e-mail

careers@evrazna.com

or call: (312) 533-3577. We will make a determination on your request for reasonable accommodation on a case-by-case basis.

Join a team that manufactures excellence, drives success and builds careers!

title: Summer Student - General Laborer - Ulukhaktok
description:
Under the general supervision of the Manager Generation Support, you contribute to the safe and efficient operation of the NTPC Plant. Duties would include heavy lifting, weed whacking, painting, mopping, cleaning and assisting the Mechanics, Electrical Technicians, Electricians and Power Linepersons



Qualifications:

  • Are enrolling/enrolled to attend full time post-secondary studies at the start of the Fall 2021 semester.
  • Related experience in a labourer position an asset.

 How to Apply:

  • Submit your cover letter, and a current copy of your resume including two references from your most recent supervisor or instructors.
  • You will be required to provide proof of registration in a post-secondary institution.

This position pays $26.97 per hour plus 6% vacation pay.  No housing or relocation assistance provided.

 

This job opening is limited to student residents living in Uluhaktok.

 

Affirmative Action Employer - Candidates must clearly identify eligibility status via our online portal in order to receive priority consideration.

 

We thank all those who apply and advise that only those selected for further consideration will be contacted.

title: General Labour
description:
GENERAL LABOUR CAREER OPPORTUNITY - PERMANENT!

No shutdowns, busy in winter and summer, and great permanent benefits.

• Interview with a local company in Barrie - full-time permanent
• Monday to Friday 8 AM - 4:30 PM (with occasional weekend work)
• Lifting 50 lbs, putting in pipes, working with tools, some knowledge of tool experience
• Forklift license, an asset
• Paid travel time as well as meal reimbursements
• 50% work boots and clothes
• 10 paid sick days
• Must have a G License (due to driving in the role)
• DZ License an asset

Please apply online at www.randstad.ca and then call the branch at 705-735-1106 - keep in mind we have a referral bonus program for anyone we find a placement for both permanent and temporary.

Advantages
• Interview with a local company in Barrie - full-time permanent
• Benefits: Group benefits plan, when full time after 3 months
• Company pension plan after 2 years of employment (5% match by company)
• Safety training (working at heights, confined space)
• Potential to be sent to get weld tech license

Responsibilities
• Lifting 50 lbs, putting in pipes, working with tools, some knowledge of tool experience
• Some welding, using propane torches, stick welding
• Basic knowledge of working with motors

Qualifications
• Must have a G License (due to driving in the role)
• Must be able to lift 50 lbs
• Basic knowledge of working with motors
• Weld knowledge such as using propane torches and stick welding
• Forklift license an asset
• DZ License an asset

Summary
Do you have general labour experience, as well welding and mechanical knowledge? This is a career FOR YOU!

No shutdowns, busy in winter and summer, and great permanent benefits.

Randstad Canada is committed to fostering a workforce reflective of all peoples of Canada. As a result, we are committed to developing and implementing strategies to increase the equity, diversity and inclusion within the workplace by examining our internal policies, practices, and systems throughout the entire lifecycle of our workforce, including its recruitment, retention and advancement for all employees. In addition to our deep commitment to respecting human rights, we are dedicated to positive actions to affect change to ensure everyone has full participation in the workforce free from any barriers, systemic or otherwise, especially equity-seeking groups who are usually underrepresented in Canada's workforce, including those who identify as women or non-binary/gender non-conforming; Indigenous or Aboriginal Peoples; persons with disabilities (visible or invisible) and; members of visible minorities, racialized groups and the LGBTQ2+ community.

Randstad Canada is committed to creating and maintaining an inclusive and accessible workplace for all its candidates and employees by supporting their accessibility and accommodation needs throughout the employment lifecycle. We ask that all job applications please identify any accommodation requirements by sending an email to

accessibility@randstad.ca

to ensure their ability to fully participate in the interview process.

title: Labourer
description:
Forbes Bros is currently recruiting full-time Laborer's for projects within BC, Alberta and Monitoba.


Responsibilities:

The responsibilities of this position include, but are not limited to:

  • Digging and backfilling trenches
  • Pulling and placing underground and overhead cable
  • Carry and move materials as needed
  • Operating small equipment and hand tools
  • Spotting for vehicles and equipment
  • Site setup and cleanup, ensuring trash, debris and potential dangerous materials from the construction site are removed
  • Assisting craft/crew members with work
  • Development of skills on varied and challenging tasks
  • Perform additional labourer duties as assigned

Preferred Qualifications:

As the successful candidate, you will have:

  • Ability to work outdoors in all weather conditions
  • Must be in good physical condition and able to lift up to 23 kg (50 lbs)
  • Must have general knowledge of the principals involved in the operation of construction and maintenance methods and procedures
  • Able to work well with others as well as independently
  • Able to follow instruction and adhere to safe work practices
  • Attention to detail
  • Motivated
  • Punctual

Additional Details:

This position requires candidates to:

  • Have and maintain a valid driver's license and acceptable driver's abstract.
  • Successfully complete pre-employment drug and alcohol testing
  • Travel and work overtime as required

What We Offer:

Forbes Bros offers an attractive compensation package that includes a competitive salary, comprehensive benefit plan and a rewarding pension program. Forbes Bros has an open and team oriented culture that focuses on communication, innovation and respect in the workplace!

Forbes Bros Ltd. (FBL) is an equal opportunity employer committed to best practice recruiting and hiring, to promote gender equity and workplace diversity. We thank all applicants for their interest, however only those candidates who meet the requirements noted and who earn an invitation to interview will be contacted.

title: Construction Labourers
description:
Construction Labourers

At PME Inc, we're constantly pushing the limits of what we've done in the past - propelling ourselves toward bigger and better opportunities, while exploring new market sectors and services. So it only seems natural that we'd hire people who have their own voice and aren't afraid to use it. These are people who are simultaneously critical, creative and captivated by construction. They make our business their business, and follow a path that with continuous learning and an innovative spirit leads them to be recognized as leaders in the industry. We hire these types of people knowing they are as diverse as we are, and they come on board because they share our core values.

In the position of an upcoming job for Construction Labourer, we would ask you to do the following: Handle and distribute construction materials (e.g., load and unload vehicles with supplies, equipment and construction materials; move tools, equipment and construction materials to and from work areas; remove rubble and other debris) Assemble and dismantle scaffolding, ramps, catwalks, shoring and barricades at construction sites Prepare and clean up construction sites, move materials and equipment, and perform demolition, excavation and compaction activities Work on a wide variety of buildings, structures and premises including municipal sewer and water mains, roads, dams and bridges, tunnels, railways and canals

Sounds challenging and exciting right? Here are a few of the attributes and experience you need to be successful in this position:

  • You have one to two years of industrial or civil construction experience and must have Construction Safety Training Systems (CSTS 09) Certificate, WHMIS 2015, Standard First Aid considered an asset.
  • You have experience in using compactors, and trampers (jumping jack) You are able to lift up to 13.5 kg (30lbs) 9-23 Kg You have a safety conscious attitude and able to work with others in a team
  • Valid driver's license - Driver's Abstract is required
  • Drug and Alcohol Screening required.
  • These positions are located in Boyle, AB.

Go ahead and be yourself. We'll pay you for it!

Please note, there is NO TRAVEL or LIVING ALLOWANCE for this project.

We are an equal opportunity employer. We welcome people of any age, culture, subculture, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, nationality, ethnicity, race, size, mental or physical status, veteran status, religion, language, political opinion, working-style preference, family status, education, and socio-economic status.
