We'll pay you for it!"]

title: General Labour (Day & Afternoon Shifts Available)
description:
Considering a Career at Maple Leaf Foods?
Maple Leaf Foods is Canada’s leading consumer-packaged protein company, headquartered in Toronto, Ontario. We make high-quality, great tasting, nutritious and innovative food products under leading brands including Maple Leaf®, Maple Leaf Prime®, Maple Leaf Natural Selections®, Schneiders®, Schneiders Country Naturals® and Mina™. Our Company employs approximately 11,500 people in its operations across Canada and exports to more than 20 global markets including the U.S. and Asia.
 
Our people are passionate about the work they do and the products we make. As we move forward, we are determined to leverage their integrity and passion to continue to build a high-performing, values-based company enabled by high-performing, motivated and talented people.

Maple Leaf Foods Bradford Plant is Hiring!
  • Production positions include General Labourer, Semi-Skilled, and Skilled positions!
  • Full Time Roles are eligible for Benefits and Pension
  • A variety of shifts are available
  • fast paced learning environment
  • Competitive wages - Earn up to $17.85/hour + benefits + pension + $1500 bonus!
  • Annual wage review completed to ensure wages remain competitive across MLF and external companies
    • Pay progressions occur every 6 months
  • Full-time permanent employees are eligible for benefits (Healthcare/medical and Dental through SunLife) after 3 months of working
  • Pension with Manulife after 2 years of working
  • Career Advancement within company (we’ve had many employees move up to higher paying hourly positions (i.e. Lead Hands, Assistant Supervisors) and salary positions as well (i.e. Production Supervisors)
  • Employee Family Assistance Program (EFAP) through Morneau Shepell, paid by company
  • Inkblot online (CBT) cognitive behavioural therapy
  • Employee Events throughout the year
  • Employee sales for product throughout the year
  • Until further notice:  Safe Covid19 protocols including face masks, face shields and physical barriers within Production

GENERAL LABOURER: The General Labourer position is responsible for performing packaging, clean-up and other elemental activities related to food processing.
Responsibilities:
  • Manually pack product into bags, trays and other packaging formats as per customer specification
  • Check products and packaging for basic quality defects.
  • Load product onto packaging line for processing
  • Ensure work area is clean and tidy
  • Follow all GMP and food safety principles

SEMI-SKILLED: The Semi-Skilled position is responsible for operating single-function machines to process and package meat products, perform equipment set-up and material handling


 
 
 
Responsibilities:
  • Set up and adjust single-function processing and packaging machines preparatory to operation.
  • Set up labels in retail labeller and end scales
  • Operate single function machines required to process or package food products.
  • Check products for defects and to ensure conformance to company standards and perform corrective machine adjustments as necessary.
  • Complete associated documents
  • Train new employees
  • Understand and comply with basic food safety principles.

SKILLED: The Skilled position is responsible for operating multi-function process control or single-function machines to process and package meat products.


Responsibilities:
  • Performing line set up approvals and verification
  • Complete required documentation associated to the production run
  • Ensure all products are set up and packaged as per specification
  • Oversee training of new employees
  • Maintain shift log of production and other data.
  • Participate in continuous improvement programs, meetings, etc.
  • Understand and comply with basic food safety principles.
 
Experience/Competencies:
  • Secondary Education
  • Good oral and written communication skills
  • Experience in a manufacturing environment is an asset
 
WHY Maple Leaf Foods,
• Training provided where needed
• Reputable company
• Competitive Wages
• Opportunities to participate in Benefits and Pension plans
• Great team environment
• Strong focus on internal advancement
• Employee Assistance Program

If interested, please send resume by email to:

Jessica.madia@mapleleaf.com

or apply to our job posting online

We thank all applicants for their interest in exploring employment opportunities with Maple Leaf Foods however only those selected for an interview will be contacted. Applicants may be subject to a background check and must meet the security criteria designated for the position.
 
Maple Leaf Foods is committed to ensuring the health and safety of all our employees.  As part of this commitment, we have adopted a number of COVID-19 safety measures, including a requirement for all employees to be fully vaccinated by March 31, 2022 and to show proof of vaccination.   In keeping with this policy, successful candidates will need to provide proof of vaccination by March 31, 2022 (or prior to their first day of work if the start date is after March 31, 2022).  We will of course consider accommodations for anyone unable to be vaccinated following human rights and other applicable laws

Maple Leaf Foods is committed to Employment Equity and maintaining a diverse workforce.  Job applicants with a disability who require reasonable accommodation for any part of the application or hiring process can contact our Talent Attraction Team at 

accommodations@mapleleaf.com

.  Reasonable accommodations will be determined on a case-by-case basis and your request will be responded to as soon as possible.

title: Labourer
description:
Company Description

 

We are Chandos

Inclusion. Collaboration. Ingenuity. Innovation.

These values speak to our desire to create places where all people belong, listening and learning from one another in a way that sparks ideas and leads to positive changes in our industry and community. They also demonstrate our commitment to a diverse, equitable, and inclusive culture. And, if they resonate with you too, we should talk!

We are 100 percent employee owned and proud to be the first and largest B Corp certified commercial builder in North America, meaning we put our values at the centre of everything we do. 

Continuous improvement is core to our success. Championing innovative and collaborative ways to build is just one example of that. Collaborative construction leads to more efficiency, cost savings, social value, and a much better working experience for everyone.

Every day, our teams are working to build places for people to live, work, learn, serve, and play. But above all, we’re building community. And, we’re looking for like-minded people to join us. Together, we can build a better world.

 

Job Description

The Labourer is required to perform tasks involving physical labour at commercial construction projects, and to operate a variety of hand and power tools.

Qualifications

  • Knowledge of safe operation of basic hand and power tools
  • Minimum of 1 year previous construction labour experience preferred
  • Knowledge of workplace safety, and safe lifting and handling procedures
  • Knowledge of First Aid and CPR preferred
  • Valid Drivers License and clean abstract preferred
  • Out of town work may be required. Work in all weather conditions.

 



Additional Information

Chandos is an equal opportunity employer and we are committed to a diverse, equitable, and inclusive culture and this includes our recruitment and hiring process. 

We recognize that our differences are our greatest strengths. We uncover talent. We nurture talent. And then we give people the tools they need to use their talent to create a positive impact.

  • We are 100% employee owned. Every person who works for Chandos can become an owner. There is only one class of units at Chandos, because we believe everyone should be treated equal. We talk about being an entrepreneurial-minded organization and you can be sure we mean it!
  • Competitive wages
  • Well rounded employer paid benefits program including health, dental, vision care and employee assistance program
  • RRSP matching program to aid and prepare employees for long-term financial security
  • Educational assistance for employees who wish to pursue job-performance enhancing education
  • Recognition and annual salary reviews program
  • Leadership conferences that allow employees to connect and collaborate
  • Regular company-wide engagement opportunities

The health and safety of our employees, families, industry partners, clients, and communities remains of the utmost importance.  That’s why we’re taking several steps to reduce the spread of COVID-19.

As of November 15, 2021, Chandos Construction requires all employees across the country to be fully vaccinated for COVID-19. This is in line with our values and commitment to all stakeholders.

title: Labourer - Seasonal
description:
Why work for Lafarge?:

As the global leader in innovative and sustainable building materials, weâ€™re committed to shaping a greener, smarter and healthier world. At Lafarge Canada Inc., safety comes first, collaboration matters and diversity is celebrated with people who share our desire to continually make our materials better.  

 

Do you have the drive, the skills, and the passion to join us?

 

Overview:

Lafarge Canada Inc is a leading manufacturer and supplier of quality products for the construction industry and has an immediate opportunity at our Regina Cement Terminal for a Seasonal Labourer.

 

The Labourer operates and maintains terminal equipment  with a focus on  bulk truck loading and bulk rail car unloading with associated administration reporting functions; all while maintaining high safety and quality assurance standards. To be successful you will be comfortable with  outdoor working conditions with higher percentage of physicality to the role.Operation, equipment and safety training will be provided as required.

Responsibilities:
  • Actively participate in and operate within the terminal Safety Program in compliance with Lafarge Canada Incâ€™s safety and environmental policies
  • General labour related duties and cleanup
  • Unload bulk railcars and load bulk semi-trucks
  • Operation and daily maintenance of rail unloading and bulk truck loading equipment
  • Operate a forklift to load and unload packaged cement
  • Supervise and direct contractors on site, when required
  • Supervision and direction of truck/railway carriersâ€™ activities on site
  • Inventory control
  • Terminal Housekeeping
  • Other associated duties that the employee is trained for
  • Ability to work overtime and willing to work shift work if required.
Qualifications:

Education:  

  • High school graduate or G.E.D. equivalent

Experience and Skill Set:

  • High school diploma or equivalent
  • Comfortable and capable of working at heights
  • Demonstrates commitment to safety for oneself and others
  • Mechanical aptitude a positive attribute
  • Time and self-management skills as part of a team or independently
  • Physically fit to encompass labor requirements of role
  • Demonstrate strong skills in problem solving, decision making and multi-tasking
  • Good verbal and written communication skills
  • Computer literacy: including Excel, Word programs a benefit
  • Valid class 5 driverâ€™s license
  • Understanding of building materials industry, including cement product knowledge an asset

As part of our dedicated focus on the health and safety of all employees, a pre-employment medical, including drug and alcohol testing and a criminal record check, may be required.

LafargeHolcim:

As we are reinventing the way the world builds, we need world-class talent to join our Lafarge Canada team: people who are passionate, driven by curiosity and keen to grow, learn, develop and thrive in our high-performance culture.

 

Whatever you do, you will make a difference here. Because we know that your passion and curiosity are the natural resources the world needs.

 

Check out our YouTube channel to learn more about our operations and see all career opportunities at www.lafarge.ca/careers.

 

We thank you for your interest.  Only candidates selected for an interview will be contacted.   Lafarge is committed to the principles of employment equity and encourages the applications from women, visible minorities, and persons with disabilities.

title: Skilled Labourer
description:
Our Skilled Labourers earn a competitive hourly wage based on experience. We offer an exceptional extended health plan including medical, dental, and vision. Our other benefits include an employee assistance program, educational assistance, professional development, internal growth opportunities, the opportunity for national career movement, and a healthy work/life balance. If this sounds like the opportunity for you, apply today!

Position Summary:

The Skilled Labourer is in good physical condition and provides construction work and support required to ensure timely project completion. The Skilled Labourer follows good work practices and procedures and sets a good example for new crew members and co-workers. The Skilled Labourer may: operate a variety of equipment and instruments, including hand and power tools of all types; clean and prepare sites; clean up rubble and debris; remove mold, asbestos lead and other hazardous materials.

Responsibilities:

  • Leads by example and follows all health and safety policies and procedures.
  • Strives to continually improve through specific development plans.
  • Accepts direction from the Lead Hand, Lead Water Technician and/or Lead Carpenter and more experienced co-workers.
  • Participates in good housekeeping discipline on the job to ensure a safe non-cluttered workplace and to minimize cross contamination.
  • Learns and practices correct procedures, especially when environmental work is required.
  • Adheres to company policy regarding acceptable standards to follow at a customer site i.e. smoking policy etc.
  • Displays good manners and attitude toward the property owner, occupants of the property, co-workers and sub-contractors.
  • Is willing and able to be on-call 24/7 for after hour's emergency work.
  • Directs customer questions or concerns to the most senior company person at the job site.
  • Looks out for and assists co-workers.

Qualifications:

  • Previous construction or cleaning work preferred.
  • Experience with hand tools & power tools preferred.
  • High School graduate or equivalent.

ARE YOU READY TO JOIN OUR TEAM?

If you feel that you would be right for this position, please fill out our initial 3-minute, mobile-friendly application so that we can review your information. We look forward to meeting you!

title: General Labourer
description:
Company Description

Founded in 1936 in Montreal, American Iron & Metal (AIM) is a family-owned company, recognized as a world leader in the metal recycling industry. Over the years, AIM has evolved into a multi-faceted company with successful lines of business including metals recycling, dry materials recycling, manufacturing of solder assembly, environmental services, retail auto parts, and highway transportation. With multiple facilities throughout Canada, the United States, Mexico, Europe, and Asia and over 2000 employees located throughout the world, AIM is uniquely positioned to provide best-in-class service and value to its customers. 

Job Description

  • Sorting, picking, and processing scrap metals 
  • Clean and inspect recycling yard by sweeping and raking materials and debris  
  • Assist with performing routine maintenance 
  • Perform other general labourer duties as assigned 
Qualifications

  • A Minimum of 1 year of experience is required in a general labourer role  
  • Experience in the metal scrap industry will be considered as an asset 
  • Experience in using machines like Lift Truck / Forklift, Skid steer will be considered as an asset 
  • Must be able to lift 50 lbs. and stand for extended periods of time 
  • Successful candidates must be highly motivated and work with little supervision 
  • Always strive for excellence and constant improvement 


Additional Information

WE OFFER 

  • Competitive salaries commensurate with experience and qualifications 
  • Group benefits like insurance and RRSP 
  • Additional training and uniform 
  • Great working environment 
  • Overtime opportunities 

HOURS OF WORK 

  • Permanent and full-time position 
  • 44 hours per week, able to work extended hours/weekends when deemed necessary 

HEALTH AND SAFETY 

  • Must work in compliance with the Occupational Health and Safety Regulation and follow in accordance with AIM’s Health and Safety policies and procedures 
  • Responsible for reporting all accidents, illnesses, or ‘near miss’ incidents to management 

ACCOMMODATION 

American Iron and Metal Inc. is proud to be an equal opportunity employer committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. We ensure that all individuals are treated equally, respectfully and with integrity. We welcome resume submissions from all qualified applicants and thank you for your interest in American Iron and Metal Inc. If accommodations are required, please attach a request with your resume. All information received will be addressed confidentially. We thank all applicants for their interest but only candidates selected for an interview will be contacted.

title: Skilled Labourer
description:
Our client is a Canadian-owned, family-oriented workplace that is at the forefront of a quickly evolving business sector. Operating in Alberta for over 78 years, their business is composed of Construction, and Shepard development. Since 2002, They has been a proud member of Canada’s 50 Best Privately Managed Companies. They have maintained their Platinum membership status since 2008.

They are seeking self-motivated, reliable Skilled Labourers to join team in Calgary. Skilled Labourers are versatile individuals who have opportunities to work in various specializations of the Utilities Industry. They work with Traffic Control Systems, Street Lights, Natural Gas and Fibre Optics, as well as Overhead and Underground Powerline Construction.

Responsibilities:
Job duties vary by type of project and specifications of our Clients. Specific duties for Skilled Labourers include:
  • Assisting in locating buried utilities, trenches, excavating, sanding, backfilling and compacting/leveling earth to grade specifications, using picks, shovels, pneumatic tampers and rakes
  • Installations, setting and framing of poles and streetlights
  • Placing/pulling conduit and different types of cables
  • Installing shallow utilities for residential and commercial sites
  • Installing underground cables and conduit
  • Installing pre-cast concrete structures and underground fibre glass vaults
  • Overseeing crews and ensuring all safety policies and practices are being followed
  • Knowledge of OH&S obligations
  • Ability to direct crew members
  • Ability to confidently suggest and identify areas of improvement
  • Identify and relay crew concerns
  • Familiar with computers and their role in Construction
  • Site, equipment and tool maintenance
  • Material hauling, organizing and site clean up
  • Participate in and contribute to daily job site hazard assessments and weekly safety meetings
  • Assisting Foreman/ Qualified Tradesman including Gas Fusers and Powerline Technicians with various tasks and paperwork as required
  • Other duties as requested
Skills and Abilities:
  • Minimum two years of utilities experience (Powerline, Gas or Traffic) is considered an asset or four years of Construction Industry experience
  • Previous experience running crews is considered an asset
  • Equipment operating experience is an asset
  • Experience working in close proximity to active heavy machinery is an asset
  • Previous flagger experience is not required but considered an asset
  • Valid driver’s license
  • Class 3 or Class 1 is an asset
  • Clean driving abstract
  • CSTS
  • Ground Disturbance Level 2
  • Additional Safety Tickets and Certifications including First Aid and Fall Protection are assets
  • Willing and able to commute to various job sites
  • Reliable transportation is a must
  • Able to walk and stand for long periods in addition to performing physical activities and manual labour – such as climbing, lifting, balancing, walking, stooping and handling of materials
Working Conditions:
The nature of this position requires physically demanding motions and tasks. Candidates are required to successfully complete a Pre-Employment Assessment including drug and alcohol screening and fitness test requiring the ability to lift 50 lbs repeatedly. Company has projects all over Western Canada. Travel and shift work may be required with this position. Be prepared for the possibility of travel throughout Alberta. Company operates year-round and outdoors in all types of terrain and environments. All employees must have FR Personal Protective Equipment.

Proof of COVID-19 immunization records must be provided prior to your start date as a condition of employment.
  • Taking appropriate action when you see an unsafe act
  • Being reliable and fit for duty
  • Carrying out work in a safe and timely manner in accordance with requirements of the project and company policies.
Offer:
  • A commitment to safety in the workplace
  • A supportive and nurturing collaborative environment
  • An interactive culture focusing on employee engagement and wellbeing
  • Engaged in supporting initiatives within our community
  • A commitment to the development of our employees by providing opportunities for career development across job categories, and varied project types and locations across Alberta
Compensation and Benefits:
  • Company offers a well-rounded compensation package that includes:
  • Competitive salary commensurate with candidates experience and skill set
  • Comprehensive benefits package including dental, optical and medical
  • Company Retirement Savings Plan
  • Strong commitment to safety in the workplace
  • Commitment to training and providing opportunities for career development
  • Personal Protective Equipment Annual Allowance
  • Apprenticeship Financial Assistance

title: Labourer
description:
Brandt is currently seeking a Labourer for our Thunder Bay location.

The successful applicant for this position will be responsible for assisting in the dismantling of construction, forestry and mining based heavy equipment and components.

Duties & Responsibilities

  • Cleaning parts and components
  • Cleaning and organizing the yard
  • Some inventory maintenance.
  • Assisting the other shop personnel fulfill their duties and increase overall shop productivity
  • Demonstrate safe and efficient workplace practices
  • Highly motivated, with excellent communication and interpersonal skills
  • Able to carry out and understand verbal and written instructions
  • Strong attention to detail
  • Must be able to lift up to 50 pounds

  • Capable of meeting the physical demands of the heavy duty equipment environment (ie: lifting up to 75 pounds)
  • Must be capable of working under minimal supervision
  • Previous mechanical aptitude and willingness to learn required
  • Forklift experience and heavy duty parts handling considered an asset

title: Labourers
description:
Job Description:

 Are you passionate about your job? Are you an advocate for safety? If you answered yes, then we want you on our team!    

 

ClearStream is seeking Labourers, in the  Vancouver  area,  with industrial experience in oil and gas service.

 

â€¯Please note that this is an expression of interest posting to build our pool of candidates in the Vancouver area. These position's could be starting  fairly  immediately, and could run for several months.    

 

What  youâ€™ll  be doing:  

 

  • Demolition and site clean.  
  • Cleaning and maintenance of tools, and equipment.    
  • Transport materials,  tools,  and equipment.      
  • Load and unload materials,  tools,  and equipment.    
  • Assist skilled trades and Equipment Operators in various tasks.
  • Other  duties as  assigned.  

 

Weâ€™d  love to hear from you if you:  

 

  • Have 1 or more years experience on industrial sites.  
  • Valid and up to date safety tickets: H2S Alive  
  • Standard First Aid is an asset.  
  • Have a high regard for personal safety, safety of company assets and employees.  
  • Self-motivated, capable of performing tasks with minimal supervision.  
  • Able to prioritize and handle multiple tasks simultaneously.  
  • Ability to work well under pressure and handle strict deadline.  

 

What we offer:    

 

  • Competitive Pay based on the work you do here and not your  previous  salary.    
  • Working for a reputable and safety conscious company that values employees.  

 

Other details:  

 

This position has beenâ€¯identifiedâ€¯as a safety sensitive position and will require completion of a drug and alcohol testing.â€¯â€¯â€¯  

 

Why ClearStream  

We are  the  clear choice  for rewarding opportunities and challenging careers. Joining our team would mean you would contribute to the quality of work we do and to the success of ClearStream along with the values we share. If you are driven, dedicated and have a passion for helping our customers bring resources to our world, then ClearStream is the team to join.    

 

We  believe that diversity and inclusion among our teammates is critical to our success.  Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability, protected veteran status or any other legally protected factors.

title: Laborer - Non Ferrous Downstream (GenAlta)
description:
At EVRAZ, our strength starts with our people! As a team we collaborate to solve problems, contribute ideas and challenge each other to ensure growth and ultimately success for the business and our employees.

Job Description and Responsibilities

GenAlta has an immediate opening for a laborer for the MSS (Downstream Separation System) at our Edmonton location. The laborer will report to the Assistant Operations Manager. Hours of operation will be 6:00am to 4:00 pm, Monday to Friday. Additional overtime including weekends can also be scheduled in.

  • Observe/Practice all company safety rules and policies

  • Ability to multi task in a progressive environment

  • Mechanically inclined. Capable of troubleshooting light mechanical repairs

  • Responsible for maintenance/lubrication and minor repairs to equipment associated with the MSS plant including conveyors, shakers, compressors, Trommel and batch feeder.

  • Work closely with loader operator to ensure efficient product flow in the input and output of the plant

  • Responsible for maintaining a productive and consistent flow of material through the MSS, optimizing the balance between throughput and quality.

  • Monitor flow of product from a raw material state through to the finished product

  • Responsible for general clean up

  • Responsible for accurately documenting daily startup and any delays

  • Able to operate the Skid steer

Requirements

  • Previous work experience in a manufacturing, production, or similar scrap-yard/auto part environment will be considered an asset

  • Able to meet the physical demands of the position including standing, walking, sitting, climbing, crawling, kneeling, bending, moderate to heavy lifting and pushing and pulling up to 50 pounds throughout the day

  • Able to communicate clearly

  • Willing to assist / support with labor duties in other areas of the plant

  • Willing and able to work in variable weather conditions including hot, dry summer conditions and cold, harsh winter conditions

  • Willingness to learn and work responsibly following all safety procedures

  • A proven history of reliability

  • Mentally alert to surroundings

  • Good attention to detail and quality control

This is a unionized position with a 3 month probationary period.

The successful candidate will be asked to undergo a Fitness to Work & Alcohol & Drug test upon a conditional offer of employment being extended.

Our total compensation package includes amazing benefits!

  • Competitive wages and bonus opportunities
  • Family medical, dental, and prescription coverage at minimal employee cost
  • Short and long term disability programs
  • Competitive retirement plans
  • Paid vacations and statutory holidays
  • Apprenticeship and career advancement within the company
  • Tuition reimbursement

All applicants must be eligible to work in Canada without sponsorship.

While we thank all those who apply, only those being actively considered for employment will be contacted.

Equal Opportunity Employer

EVRAZ North America is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability, or protected Veteran status.

 

EVRAZ North America is committed to working with and providing reasonable accommodation to individuals with physical and mental disabilities.

If you need special assistance or an accommodation while seeking employment, please e-mail

careers@evrazna.com

or call: (312) 533-3577. We will make a determination on your request for reasonable accommodation on a case-by-case basis.

Join a team that manufactures excellence, drives success and builds careers!

title: Summer Student - General Laborer - Fort Liard
description:
Under the general supervision of the Manager Generation Support, you contribute to the safe and efficient operation of the NTPC Plant. Duties would include heavy lifting, weed whacking, painting, mopping, cleaning and assisting the Mechanics, Electrical Technicians, Electricians and Power Linepersons



Qualifications:

  • Are enrolling/enrolled to attend full time post-secondary studies at the start of the Fall 2021 semester.
  • Related experience in a labourer position an asset.

 How to Apply:

  • Submit your cover letter, and a current copy of your resume including two references from your most recent supervisor or instructors.
  • You will be required to provide proof of registration in a post-secondary institution.

This position pays $26.97 per hour plus 6% vacation pay.  No housing or relocation assistance provided.

 

This job opening is limited to student residents living in Fort Liard.

 

Affirmative Action Employer - Candidates must clearly identify eligibility status via our online portal in order to receive priority consideration.

 

We thank all those who apply and advise that only those selected for further consideration will be contacted.

title: General Labour - Day shift
description:
DAY SHIFT! - Full-Time!
Days: Monday to Friday 7:30AM to 4:00PM

Are you interested in learning new skills?
Do you like working with manual/semi-automatic hand tools? Do you like working in a fast-paced and fast-growing environment?
Do you have an interest in assembling and building things? Would you like to join one of the best manufacturing plants?
If the answer is Yes! We have an amazing opportunity for you. Join the Randstad team at the Manufacturing Plant at Concord!

Shifts Available:
Days: Monday to Thursday, 6:00 AM to 4:30 PM
Days: Monday to Friday 7:30AM to 4:00PM


Pay: $17/hr
Address: Applewood Cres, Concord, ON
(Intersection – Highway 400 & Langstaff Rd)




Advantages
What is in it for you as the General Labour at Manufacturing Plant in Concord:
- Weekly pay
- Competitive pay rate
- Weekend Bonus / Night Shift premium
- 4% Vacation Pay
- Schedule: three shifts to choose from
- Onsite support to help you succeed and learn new skills


Responsibilities
What will you do as General Labour at Manufacturing Plant in Concord:
- Assembly and packaging of windows and window components
- Basic reading skills
- Read a Tape Measure – Metric and Standard
- Cleaning of assembled frame
- Other general labour duties as required by the Manager / Supervisor / Lead Hand
(Training / Ongoing support provided for all responsibilities)


Qualifications
What will make you an IDEAL candidate for the General Labour role at Manufacturing Plant in Concord:
- Operate manual or semi-automatic hand tools
- Ability to use a tape measure
- Lifting up to 50 pounds (regularly)
- Experience working in a plant/manufacturing environment is an asset but not necessary.


Summary
Amazing opportunity for those who are looking to get a job instantly!
Get some General Labour experience! and learn some skills!
We are ready for you to join us!!
Start ASAP
Contact ‘Krithika’ today, email on ‘krithika.sridhar@randstad.ca’ and mention “Concord-General Labour” in the subject line.
Or Call/Text on 905-867-0297


Randstad Canada is committed to building a diverse workforce reflective of the diversity of Canada. As a result, we promote employment equity and encourage candidates, especially those who identify as a woman, an Aboriginal person, a person with a disability or a member of a visible minority group, and any others who may contribute to the diversification of our workforce, to apply.
Randstad Canada is also committed to developing an inclusive, barrier-free selection processes and work environments. If contacted in relation to a job opportunity, you should advise your Randstad Representative or your local Randstad branch in a timely fashion of the accommodation measures which must be taken to enable you to be assessed in a fair and equitable manner. Information received relating to accommodation measures will be addressed confidentially.


Randstad Canada is committed to fostering a workforce reflective of all peoples of Canada. As a result, we are committed to developing and implementing strategies to increase the equity, diversity and inclusion within the workplace by examining our internal policies, practices, and systems throughout the entire lifecycle of our workforce, including its recruitment, retention and advancement for all employees. In addition to our deep commitment to respecting human rights, we are dedicated to positive actions to affect change to ensure everyone has full participation in the workforce free from any barriers, systemic or otherwise, especially equity-seeking groups who are usually underrepresented in Canada's workforce, including those who identify as women or non-binary/gender non-conforming; Indigenous or Aboriginal Peoples; persons with disabilities (visible or invisible) and; members of visible minorities, racialized groups and the LGBTQ2+ community.

Randstad Canada is committed to creating and maintaining an inclusive and accessible workplace for all its candidates and employees by supporting their accessibility and accommodation needs throughout the employment lifecycle. We ask that all job applications please identify any accommodation requirements by sending an email to

accessibility@randstad.ca

to ensure their ability to fully participate in the interview process.

title: Labourer
description:
Are you looking for long term employment with a proven employer? As a member of the FBL team you will enjoy many career advancement opportunities such as development training, career growth, and promotional opportunities from within.

Forbes Brothers Ltd, OA FB Bullet is looking for qualified individuals to join our growing team. Specializing in underground utility construction FB Bullet offers a competitive compensation package, benefits and pension contribution. We are looking for applicants ranging from Crew Leaders, Lead Hands, Pipelayers, Operators and Labourers. Specializing in shallow utility construction FB Bullet staff all report to our main office in Surrey and travel to work sites with their designated crews in company vehicles. We offer full-time year-round work with a vast opportunity for overtime due to the nature and demand of our work.


Civil Labourer

The ideal candidate will either have previous experience as a Construction Labourer or seeks the opportunity to join our growing team and advance their knowledge and skill base. The role of Civil Labourer will be responsible to report to the Crew Leader and execute the day-to-day activities of their crew. As a valued member of our team, you will be able to support and take instructions from crew members with assigned duties to gain and improve efficiencies.

Responsibilities:

  • Receive duties, delegations from the Crew Leader, and assist crew members execute these tasks
  • Work closely with all crew members, and learn the construction industry standards
  • Complete installation of conduit and other utility infrastructure with crew members
  • Work on tight timeline power outage worksites
  • Assist in maintaining a clean and organized work site
  • Able to problem solve through coordination with Crew Leader
  • Ensure quality of work meets or exceeds expectations
  • Complete daily pre-trip inspections on company equipment/vehicles
  • Participate and engage in daily Tailboard meetings, identify hazards and assist in crew compliance to safety policies and regulations
  • Work with construction equipment such as compactors, shoring, core drills, various hand tools
  • Ensure all small tools assigned to crew are cleaned, stored and maintained properly
  • Work closely with Crew Leader/Lead Hand to install conduit per specifications to correct grades/elevations
  • Assist drivers and vehicles navigate through busy work sites via proper hand signals and guidance

Schedule:

  • Due to the demand of our workload, all crews are scheduled Monday-Friday with the opportunity for weekend work quite frequently. Nightshift work is also scheduled on a less frequent basis
  • All shifts are scheduled for 8-10 hours, and due to the type of work we perform can extend past that
  • Daily overtime/double time is offered in all FB positions

Candidate Requirements:

  • Valid Class 5 driver's licence, Class 1 or 3 preferred
  • Preferred experience in underground utility construction, hydro/telecommunications considered an asset
  • Physically fit and able to provide hands on assistance to crew members
  • Must be safety orientated
  • Ability to take and execute instructions and duties assigned to you
  • Lead by example attitude
  • Existing knowledge of WorkSafeBC standards and policies is an asset for this position

What We Offer:

Forbes Bros offers an attractive compensation package that includes a competitive salary, comprehensive benefit plan and a rewarding pension program. Forbes Bros has an open and team oriented culture that focuses on communication, innovation and respect in the workplace!

Forbes Bros Ltd. (FBL) is an equal opportunity employer committed to best practice recruiting and hiring, to promote gender equity and workplace diversity. We thank all applicants for their interest, however only those candidates who meet the requirements noted and who earn an invitation to interview will be contacted.

title: General Labour Workers
description:
General Labour Workers

Maple Leaf Foods Hamilton Plant is Hiring!

  • $16.50 to start with regular increases!
  • A variety of shifts are available 
  • Some shifts are not bus accessible, but we do have afternoon and night shift premiums available 
  • Opportunities to learn and grow
  • Trans Cab Service and Conventional Bus Service is provided through HSR 
    • Highly automated and fast paced learning environment

A Sustainable, Forward Thinking Protein Company

Maple Leaf Foods is a leading meat and plant-based protein company, employing over 11,500 people and publicly traded on the Toronto Stock Exchange. We are proud of our roots, which trace back well over 100 years, but our vision and purpose are decidedly forward looking. As we pursue our vision to become the most sustainable protein company on earth, we are committed to creating shared value – creative business value through addressing some of the world’s most critical social and environmental challenges. Our goal is to build a more sustainable food system, which provides nutritious affordable food, operates within planetary limits, cares for animals responsibly, and meaningfully engages with our communities to advance a more just society. We are advancing bold changes within Maple Leaf and more broadly within society to pursue our vision. We deeply believe this is the sustainable path to growth.

Our job is to make great food

Maple Leaf Foods embraces a strong values-based culture, where our people are deeply engaged in work that is purposeful, fast-paced and challenging.  We cultivate an open, non-bureaucratic and inclusive workplace that fosters safety and transparency, along with individual leadership and accountability. Each Maple Leaf team member has a voice and plays an active role in helping all of us achieve our goals with passion and discipline. We support one another to grow professionally, to learn new skills and to take on challenging experiences in the spirit of continuous improvement. 

Raise the Good in Food

We have united behind a shared purpose – to Raise the Good in Food. This spans a dramatic transformation of our flagship Maple Leaf brand, replacing anything artificial with simple, natural ingredients; investments and process changes to reduce our environmental footprint by 50% by 2025; building a diverse and inclusive culture where all talent thrives; becoming a leader in animal care; and advancing food security through our charitable foundation, the Maple Leaf Centre for Action on Food Security.

Our Leadership Values 

Eight core values guide us in everything that we do.
  • Do What’s Right
  • Shared Value
  • High Performance
  • Diverse and Inclusive Teams
  • Disciplined Decision Making
  • Our Accountability
  • Intense Curiosity
  • Transparency and Humility

The Opportunity

 The General Labour full-time position is responsible for performing packaging, clean-up and other elemental activities related to food processing. 

A snapshot of some of the exciting things you will lead and do: 

  • Feed cartons into machines.
  • Check and weigh materials and/or product.
  • Manually pack product into bags, cartons or other containers.
  • Remove finished goods cartons from conveyer and place on pallets.
  • Check products and packaging for basic quality defects.

What we have to offer you:

  • Be part of a company with an inspiring and unique vision, with a deep commitment to sustainability and expanding its leadership in sustainable protein across North America

COVID-19 Safety Measures:

  • Maple Leaf Foods is committed to ensuring the health andsafety of all our employees. As part of this commitment, wehave adopted a number of COVID-19 safety measures,including a requirement for all employees to be fullyvaccinated and to show proof ofvaccination. In keeping with this policy, successfulcandidates will need to provide proof of vaccination prior to the commencement of employment. We will of course consider accommodations for anyone unable to be vaccinated following human rights and other applicable laws.
 
 
We thank all applicants for their interest in exploring employment opportunities with Maple Leaf Foods however only those selected for an interview will be contacted. Applicants may be subject to a background check and must meet the security criteria designated for the position.  

Maple Leaf Foods is committed to Employment Equity and maintaining a diverse workforce.  Job applicants with a disability who require reasonable accommodation for any part of the application or hiring process can contact our Talent Attraction Team at 

accommodations@mapleleaf.com

.  Reasonable accommodations will be determined on a case-by-case basis and your request will be responded to as soon as possible.

title: Construction Labourers - Spring 2022 Projects
description:
Construction Labourers

At PME Inc, we're constantly pushing the limits of what we've done in the past - propelling ourselves toward bigger and better opportunities, while exploring new market sectors and services. So it only seems natural that we'd hire people who have their own voice and aren't afraid to use it. These are people who are simultaneously critical, creative and captivated by construction. They make our business their business, and follow a path that with continuous learning and an innovative spirit leads them to be recognized as leaders in the industry. We hire these types of people knowing they are as diverse as we are, and they come on board because they share our core values.

In the position of an upcoming job for Construction Labourer, we would ask you to do the following: Handle and distribute construction materials (e.g., load and unload vehicles with supplies, equipment and construction materials; move tools, equipment and construction materials to and from work areas; remove rubble and other debris) Assemble and dismantle scaffolding, ramps, catwalks, shoring and barricades at construction sites Prepare and clean up construction sites, move materials and equipment, and perform demolition, excavation and compaction activities Work on a wide variety of buildings, structures and premises including municipal sewer and water mains, roads, dams and bridges, tunnels, railways and canals

Sounds challenging and exciting right? Here are a few of the attributes and experience you need to be successful in this position:

  • You have one to two years of industrial or civil construction experience and must have Construction Safety Training Systems (CSTS 09) Certificate, WHMIS 2015, Standard First Aid considered an asset.
  • You have experience in using compactors, and trampers (jumping jack) You are able to lift up to 13.5 kg (30 lbs) 9-23 Kg You have a safety conscious attitude and able to work with others in a team
  • Valid driver's license - Driver's Abstract is required
  • Drug and Alcohol Screening required.

Go ahead and be yourself. We'll pay you for it! These positions will start in Spring 2022.

Please note, there is NO TRAVEL or LIVING ALLOWANCE for this project.

We are an equal opportunity employer. We welcome people of any age, culture, subculture, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, nationality, ethnicity, race, size, mental or physical status, veteran status, religion, language, political opinion, working-style preference, family status, education, and socio-economic status.

title: Labourer - Seasonal
description:
Why work for Lafarge?

As the global leader in innovative and sustainable building materials, we’re committed to shaping a greener, smarter and healthier world. At Lafarge Canada Inc., safety comes first, collaboration matters and diversity is celebrated with people who share our desire to continually make our materials better. 

 

Do you have the drive, the skills, and the passion to join us?

 

Overview

Lafarge Canada Inc is a leading manufacturer and supplier of quality products for the construction industry and has an immediate opportunity at our Regina Cement Terminal for a Seasonal Labourer.

 

The Labourer operates and maintains terminal equipment with a focus on bulk truck loading and bulk rail car unloading with associated administration reporting functions; all while maintaining high safety and quality assurance standards. To be successful you will be comfortable with outdoor working conditions with higher percentage of physicality to the role. Operation, equipment and safety training will be provided as required.

Responsibilities

  • Actively participate in and operate within the terminal Safety Program in compliance with Lafarge Canada Inc’s safety and environmental policies
  • General labour related duties and cleanup
  • Unload bulk railcars and load bulk semi-trucks
  • Operation and daily maintenance of rail unloading and bulk truck loading equipment
  • Operate a forklift to load and unload packaged cement
  • Supervise and direct contractors on site, when required
  • Supervision and direction of truck/railway carriers’ activities on site
  • Inventory control
  • Terminal Housekeeping
  • Other associated duties that the employee is trained for
  • Ability to work overtime and willing to work shift work if required.

Qualifications

Education: 

  • High school graduate or G.E.D. equivalent

Experience and Skill Set:

  • High school diploma or equivalent
  • Comfortable and capable of working at heights
  • Demonstrates commitment to safety for oneself and others
  • Mechanical aptitude a positive attribute
  • Time and self-management skills as part of a team or independently
  • Physically fit to encompass labor requirements of role
  • Demonstrate strong skills in problem solving, decision making and multi-tasking
  • Good verbal and written communication skills
  • Computer literacy: including Excel, Word programs a benefit
  • Valid class 5 driver’s license
  • Understanding of building materials industry, including cement product knowledge an asset

As part of our dedicated focus on the health and safety of all employees, a pre-employment medical, including drug and alcohol testing and a criminal record check, may be required.

LafargeHolcim

As we are reinventing the way the world builds, we need world-class talent to join our Lafarge Canada team: people who are passionate, driven by curiosity and keen to grow, learn, develop and thrive in our high-performance culture.

 

Whatever you do, you will make a difference here. Because we know that your passion and curiosity are the natural resources the world needs.

 

Check out our YouTube channel to learn more about our operations and see all career opportunities at www.lafarge.ca/careers.

 

We thank you for your interest. Only candidates selected for an interview will be contacted.  Lafarge is committed to the principles of employment equity and encourages the applications from women, visible minorities, and persons with disabilities.

title: General Labourer
description:
Our General Labourers earn a competitive hourly wage based on experience. We offer an exceptional extended health plan including medical, dental, and vision. Our other benefits include an employee assistance program, educational assistance, professional development, internal growth opportunities, the opportunity for national career movement, and a healthy work/life balance. If this sounds like the opportunity for you, apply today!


Position Summary:

The General Labourer is in good physical condition and provides construction work and support required to ensure timely project completion. The Labourer follows good work practices and procedures and sets a good example for new crew members and co-workers. The Labourer may: operate a variety of equipment and instruments, including hand and power tools of all types; clean and prepare sites; clean up rubble and debris; remove mold, asbestos lead, and other hazardous materials.

Responsibilities:

  • Leads by example and follows all health and safety policies and procedures.
  • Strives to continually improve through specific development plans.
  • Accepts direction from the Lead Hand, Lead Water Technician and/or Lead Carpenter and more experienced co-workers.
  • Participates in good housekeeping discipline on the job to ensure a safe non-cluttered workplace and to minimize cross-contamination.
  • Learns and practices correct procedures, especially when environmental work is required.
  • Adheres to company policy regarding acceptable standards to follow at a customer site i.e. smoking policy etc.
  • Displays good manners and attitude toward the property owner, occupants of the property, co-workers, and sub-contractors.
  • Is willing and able to be on-call 24/7 for after hour's emergency work.
  • Directs customer questions or concerns to the most senior company person at the job site.
  • Looks out for and assists co-workers.

Qualifications:

  • Previous construction or cleaning work preferred.
  • Experience with hand tools & power tools preferred.
  • High School graduate or equivalent.

ARE YOU READY TO JOIN OUR TEAM?

If you feel that you would be right for this position, please fill out our initial 3-minute, mobile-friendly application so that we can review your information. We look forward to meeting you!

title: General Labourer
description:
Company Description

Founded in 1936 in Montreal, American Iron & Metal (AIM) is a family-owned company, recognized as a world leader in the metal recycling industry. Over the years, AIM has evolved into a multi-faceted company with successful lines of business including metals recycling, dry materials recycling, manufacturing of solder assembly, environmental services, retail auto parts, and highway transportation. With multiple facilities throughout Canada, the United States, Mexico, Europe, and Asia and over 2000 employees located throughout the world, AIM is uniquely positioned to provide best-in-class service and value to its customers. 

Job Description

  • Sorting, picking, and processing scrap metals 
  • Clean and inspect recycling yard by sweeping and raking materials and debris  
  • Assist with performing routine maintenance 
  • Perform other general labourer duties as assigned 
Qualifications

  • A Minimum of 1 year of experience is required in a general labourer role  
  • Experience in the metal scrap industry will be considered as an asset 
  • Experience in using machines like Lift Truck / Forklift, Skid steer will be considered as an asset 
  • Must be able to lift 50 lbs. and stand for extended periods of time 
  • Successful candidates must be highly motivated and work with little supervision 
  • Always strive for excellence and constant improvement 


Additional Information

WE OFFER 

  • Competitive salaries commensurate with experience and qualifications 
  • Group benefits like insurance and RRSP 
  • Additional training and uniform 
  • Great working environment 
  • Overtime opportunities 

HOURS OF WORK 

  • Permanent and full-time position 
  • 40 hours per week, able to work extended hours/weekends when deemed necessary 

HEALTH AND SAFETY 

  • Must work in compliance with the Occupational Health and Safety Regulation and follow in accordance with AIM’s Health and Safety policies and procedures 
  • Responsible for reporting all accidents, illnesses, or ‘near miss’ incidents to management 

ACCOMMODATION 

American Iron and Metal Inc. is proud to be an equal opportunity employer committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. We ensure that all individuals are treated equally, respectfully and with integrity. We welcome resume submissions from all qualified applicants and thank you for your interest in American Iron and Metal Inc. If accommodations are required, please attach a request with your resume. All information received will be addressed confidentially. We thank all applicants for their interest but only candidates selected for an interview will be contacted.

title: Skilled Labourer
description:
Our client is a Canadian-owned, family-oriented workplace that is at the forefront of a quickly evolving business sector. Operating in Alberta for over 78 years, their business is composed of Construction, and Shepard development. Since 2002, They has been a proud member of Canada’s 50 Best Privately Managed Companies. They have maintained their Platinum membership status since 2008.

They are seeking self-motivated, reliable Skilled Labourers to join team in Calgary. Skilled Labourers are versatile individuals who have opportunities to work in various specializations of the Utilities Industry. They work with Traffic Control Systems, Street Lights, Natural Gas and Fibre Optics, as well as Overhead and Underground Powerline Construction.

Responsibilities:
Job duties vary by type of project and specifications of our Clients. Specific duties for Skilled Labourers include:
  • Assisting in locating buried utilities, trenches, excavating, sanding, backfilling and compacting/leveling earth to grade specifications, using picks, shovels, pneumatic tampers and rakes
  • Installations, setting and framing of poles and streetlights
  • Placing/pulling conduit and different types of cables
  • Installing shallow utilities for residential and commercial sites
  • Installing underground cables and conduit
  • Installing pre-cast concrete structures and underground fibre glass vaults
  • Overseeing crews and ensuring all safety policies and practices are being followed
  • Knowledge of OH&S obligations
  • Ability to direct crew members
  • Ability to confidently suggest and identify areas of improvement
  • Identify and relay crew concerns
  • Familiar with computers and their role in Construction
  • Site, equipment and tool maintenance
  • Material hauling, organizing and site clean up
  • Participate in and contribute to daily job site hazard assessments and weekly safety meetings
  • Assisting Foreman/ Qualified Tradesman including Gas Fusers and Powerline Technicians with various tasks and paperwork as required
  • Other duties as requested
Skills and Abilities:
  • Minimum two years of utilities experience (Powerline, Gas or Traffic) is considered an asset or four years of Construction Industry experience
  • Previous experience running crews is considered an asset
  • Equipment operating experience is an asset
  • Experience working in close proximity to active heavy machinery is an asset
  • Previous flagger experience is not required but considered an asset
  • Valid driver’s license
  • Class 3 or Class 1 is an asset
  • Clean driving abstract
  • CSTS
  • Ground Disturbance Level 2
  • Additional Safety Tickets and Certifications including First Aid and Fall Protection are assets
  • Willing and able to commute to various job sites
  • Reliable transportation is a must
  • Able to walk and stand for long periods in addition to performing physical activities and manual labour – such as climbing, lifting, balancing, walking, stooping and handling of materials
Working Conditions:
The nature of this position requires physically demanding motions and tasks. Candidates are required to successfully complete a Pre-Employment Assessment including drug and alcohol screening and fitness test requiring the ability to lift 50 lbs repeatedly. Company has projects all over Western Canada. Travel and shift work may be required with this position. Be prepared for the possibility of travel throughout Alberta. Company operates year-round and outdoors in all types of terrain and environments. All employees must have FR Personal Protective Equipment.

Proof of COVID-19 immunization records must be provided prior to your start date as a condition of employment.
  • Taking appropriate action when you see an unsafe act
  • Being reliable and fit for duty
  • Carrying out work in a safe and timely manner in accordance with requirements of the project and company policies.
Offer:
  • A commitment to safety in the workplace 
  • A supportive and nurturing collaborative environment
  • An interactive culture focusing on employee engagement and wellbeing
  • Engaged in supporting initiatives within our community
  • A commitment to the development of our employees by providing opportunities for career development across job categories, and varied project types and locations across Alberta 
Compensation and Benefits:
  • Company offers a well-rounded compensation package that includes:
  • Competitive salary commensurate with candidates experience and skill set
  • Comprehensive benefits package including dental, optical and medical
  • Company Retirement Savings Plan
  • Strong commitment to safety in the workplace
  • Commitment to training and providing opportunities for career development
  • Personal Protective Equipment Annual Allowance 
  • Apprenticeship Financial Assistance

title: Labourer
description:
Brandt is currently seeking a Labourer for ourSurrey location. The successful applicant for this position will be responsible for assisting in the dismantling of construction, forestry and mining based heavy equipment and components.

Duties & Responsibilities

  • Cleaning parts and components
  • Cleaning and organizing the yard
  • Some inventory maintenance.
  • Assisting the other shop personnel fulfill their duties and increase overall shop productivity
  • Demonstrate safe and efficient workplace practices
  • Highly motivated, with excellent communication and interpersonal skills
  • Able to carry out and understand verbal and written instructions
  • Strong attention to detail
  • Must be able to lift up to 50 pounds

  • Capable of meeting the physical demands of the heavy duty equipment environment (ie: lifting up to 75 pounds)
  • Must be capable of working under minimal supervision
  • Previous mechanical aptitude and willingness to learn required
  • Forklift experience and heavy duty parts handling considered an asset

title: Labourer
description:
At EVRAZ, our strength starts with our people! As a team we collaborate to solve problems, contribute ideas and challenge each other to ensure growth and ultimately success for the business and our employees.

Labourer

At EVRAZ, our strength starts with our people! As a team we collaborate to solve problems, contribute ideas and challenge each other to ensure growth and ultimately success for the business and our employees.

Job Description and Responsibilities

EVRAZ has multiple openings for Production Workers and General Labourers at our Red Deer facility.  This position is required to work 12 hour shifts with varied start times. This role performs physical labour throughout the shift, good physical stamina is required.

  • Comply with all safety rules and procedures
  • Operate equipment to manufacture steel pipe
  • Use various hand and power tools, gas torches, measuring devices
  • General labour duties
  • Visually inspect product produced at station
  • Cleaning of work area
  • Computer data entry
  • General labour duties

  • Requirements
  • No experience necessary but previous work experience in a manufacturing and/or production environment will be considered an asset
  • Ability to meet the physical demands of the position including standing, walking, sitting, climbing, crawling, kneeling, bending, moderate to heavy lifting and pushing and pulling up to 50 pounds throughout the shift
  • Mechanically inclined, ability to follow instructions
  • Communication and teamwork skills
  • Willing to work 12 hour shifts
  • Commitment to safety rules, wear full protective personal equipment
  • Reliable transportation, work location is outside of public transit

  • Compensation

  • 21.00 an hour

Our total compensation package includes amazing benefits!

  • Competitive wages and bonus opportunities
  • Family medical, dental, and prescription coverage at minimal employee cost
  • Short and long term disability programs
  • Competitive retirement plans
  • Paid vacations and statutory holidays
  • Apprenticeship and career advancement within the company
  • Tuition reimbursement

All applicants must be eligible to work in Canada without sponsorship.

While we thank all those who apply, only those being actively considered for employment will be contacted.

Equal Opportunity Employer

EVRAZ North America is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability, or protected Veteran status.

 

EVRAZ North America is committed to working with and providing reasonable accommodation to individuals with physical and mental disabilities.

If you need special assistance or an accommodation while seeking employment, please e-mail

careers@evrazna.com

or call: (312) 533-3577. We will make a determination on your request for reasonable accommodation on a case-by-case basis.

Join a team that manufactures excellence, drives success and builds careers!

title: Summer Student - General Laborer - Aklavik
description:
Under the general supervision of the Manager Generation Support, you contribute to the safe and efficient operation of the NTPC Plant. Duties would include heavy lifting, weed whacking, painting, mopping, cleaning and assisting the Mechanics, Electrical Technicians, Electricians and Power Linepersons



Qualifications:

  • Are enrolling/enrolled to attend full time post-secondary studies at the start of the Fall 2021 semester.
  • Related experience in a labourer position an asset.

 How to Apply:

  • Submit your cover letter, and a current copy of your resume including two references from your most recent supervisor or instructors.
  • You will be required to provide proof of registration in a post-secondary institution.

This position pays $26.97 per hour plus 6% vacation pay.  No housing or relocation assistance provided.

 

This job opening is limited to student residents living in Aklavik.

 

Affirmative Action Employer - Candidates must clearly identify eligibility status via our online portal in order to receive priority consideration.

 

We thank all those who apply and advise that only those selected for further consideration will be contacted.

title: General Labour
description:
Position: General Labourer
Wage: $18+

Do you have previous experience with working general labour? Are you looking for a daily workout by lifting up to 50 lbs.? Are you interested in expanding your general labour knowledge to include some technical warehouse knowledge? Are you a self starter? Do you have previous experience with hand or power tools?

If the answer is Yes! We have an exciting warehouse associate opportunity located in the south of Edmonton and some available in Nisku!

Advantages
This General Labour position offers:
*Competitive wages
*Paid weekly through Randstad
*Vacation paid out weekly
*Health & Wellness benefits available from day 1
*Referral bonuses available
*Transit accessible work

Responsibilities
In this general labour position you may be required to:
*Measure and cut items (ie. wood, steel, etc)
*Utilize hand & power tools
*Conduct quality control assessments

Qualifications
What do you need for this general labour position?
*Ability to lift 50 lbs. repetitively
*Attention to detail
*Ability to read a tape measure and utilize a computer
*Ability to follow direction well

Summary
If you are interested in applying for this general labour position, please apply today!

How to apply:
1) email your resume to nerizza.sadie@randstad.ca
2) call our branch number 780-420-1120 today and look for Sara
3) apply online today at randstad.ca today!

We are also accepting referrals and offer a bonus that will put extra cash into your pocket- ask us about it to learn more.

Randstad Canada is committed to fostering a workforce reflective of all peoples of Canada. As a result, we are committed to developing and implementing strategies to increase the equity, diversity and inclusion within the workplace by examining our internal policies, practices, and systems throughout the entire lifecycle of our workforce, including its recruitment, retention and advancement for all employees. In addition to our deep commitment to respecting human rights, we are dedicated to positive actions to affect change to ensure everyone has full participation in the workforce free from any barriers, systemic or otherwise, especially equity-seeking groups who are usually underrepresented in Canada's workforce, including those who identify as women or non-binary/gender non-conforming; Indigenous or Aboriginal Peoples; persons with disabilities (visible or invisible) and; members of visible minorities, racialized groups and the LGBTQ2+ community.

Randstad Canada is committed to creating and maintaining an inclusive and accessible workplace for all its candidates and employees by supporting their accessibility and accommodation needs throughout the employment lifecycle. We ask that all job applications please identify any accommodation requirements by sending an email to

accessibility@randstad.ca

to ensure their ability to fully participate in the interview process.

title: Labourer
description:
Are you looking for long term employment with a proven employer? As a member of the FBL team you will enjoy many career advancement opportunities such as development training, career growth, and promotional opportunities from within.

Forbes Brothers Ltd, OA FB Bullet is looking for qualified individuals to join our growing team. Specializing in underground utility construction FB Bullet offers a competitive compensation package, benefits and pension contribution. We are looking for applicants ranging from Crew Leaders, Lead Hands, Pipelayers, Operators and Labourers. Specializing in shallow utility construction FB Bullet staff all report to our main office in Surrey and travel to work sites with their designated crews in company vehicles. We offer full-time year-round work with a vast opportunity for overtime due to the nature and demand of our work.


Civil Labourer

The ideal candidate will either have previous experience as a Construction Labourer or seeks the opportunity to join our growing team and advance their knowledge and skill base. The role of Civil Labourer will be responsible to report to the Crew Leader and execute the day-to-day activities of their crew. As a valued member of our team, you will be able to support and take instructions from crew members with assigned duties to gain and improve efficiencies.

Responsibilities:

  • Receive duties, delegations from the Crew Leader, and assist crew members execute these tasks
  • Work closely with all crew members, and learn the construction industry standards
  • Complete installation of conduit and other utility infrastructure with crew members
  • Work on tight timeline power outage worksites
  • Assist in maintaining a clean and organized work site
  • Able to problem solve through coordination with Crew Leader
  • Ensure quality of work meets or exceeds expectations
  • Complete daily pre-trip inspections on company equipment/vehicles
  • Participate and engage in daily Tailboard meetings, identify hazards and assist in crew compliance to safety policies and regulations
  • Work with construction equipment such as compactors, shoring, core drills, various hand tools
  • Ensure all small tools assigned to crew are cleaned, stored and maintained properly
  • Work closely with Crew Leader/Lead Hand to install conduit per specifications to correct grades/elevations
  • Assist drivers and vehicles navigate through busy work sites via proper hand signals and guidance

Schedule:

  • Due to the demand of our workload, all crews are scheduled Monday-Friday with the opportunity for weekend work quite frequently. Nightshift work is also scheduled on a less frequent basis
  • All shifts are scheduled for 8-10 hours, and due to the type of work we perform can extend past that
  • Daily overtime/double time is offered in all FB positions

Candidate Requirements:

  • Valid Class 5 driver's licence, Class 1 or 3 preferred
  • Preferred experience in underground utility construction, hydro/telecommunications considered an asset
  • Physically fit and able to provide hands on assistance to crew members
  • Must be safety orientated
  • Ability to take and execute instructions and duties assigned to you
  • Lead by example attitude
  • Existing knowledge of WorkSafeBC standards and policies is an asset for this position

What We Offer:

Forbes Bros offers an attractive compensation package that includes a competitive salary, comprehensive benefit plan and a rewarding pension program. Forbes Bros has an open and team oriented culture that focuses on communication, innovation and respect in the workplace!

Forbes Bros Ltd. (FBL) is an equal opportunity employer committed to best practice recruiting and hiring, to promote gender equity and workplace diversity. We thank all applicants for their interest, however only those candidates who meet the requirements noted and who earn an invitation to interview will be contacted.

title: General Labour Workers
description:
General Labour Workers

What's in it for you?

  • $16.50 to start with regular increases!
  • Afternoon andnight shift premiums available
  • Day, afternoon, and overnight shifts available
  • Opportunity for overtime
  • Benefits available after completion of probationary period
  • Pension after 2 years of continuous service
  • Progression wage increases
  • Perks and discounts on entertainment, travel, attractions, shopping, sports and more
  • All PPE is provided to employees (hard hat, boots, jacket, etc.)
  • Shifts do notrotate
  • Support of a union
  • Highly automated and fast paced learning environment
  • Opportunities for growth and training development
  • Trans Cab Service and Conventional Bus Service is provided through HSR

A Sustainable, Forward Thinking Protein Company

Maple Leaf Foods is a leading meat and plant-based protein company, employing over 11,500 people and publicly traded on the Toronto Stock Exchange. We are proud of our roots, which trace back well over 100 years, but our vision and purpose are decidedly forward looking. As we pursue our vision to become the most sustainable protein company on earth, we are committed to creating shared value – creative business value through addressing some of the world’s most critical social and environmental challenges. Our goal is to build a more sustainable food system, which provides nutritious affordable food, operates within planetary limits, cares for animals responsibly, and meaningfully engages with our communities to advance a more just society. We are advancing bold changes within Maple Leaf and more broadly within society to pursue our vision. We deeply believe this is the sustainable path to growth.

Our job is to make great food

Maple Leaf Foods embraces a strong values-based culture, where our people are deeply engaged in work that is purposeful, fast-paced and challenging. We cultivate an open, non-bureaucratic and inclusive workplace that fosters safety and transparency, along with individual leadership and accountability. Each Maple Leaf team member has a voice and plays an active role in helping all of us achieve our goals with passion and discipline. We support one another to grow professionally, to learn new skills and to take on challenging experiences in the spirit of continuous improvement.

Raise the Good in Food

We have united behind a shared purpose – to Raise the Good in Food. This spans a dramatic transformation of our flagship Maple Leaf brand, replacing anything artificial with simple, natural ingredients; investments and process changes to reduce our environmental footprint by 50% by 2025; building a diverse and inclusive culture where all talent thrives; becoming a leader in animal care; and advancing food security through our charitable foundation, the Maple Leaf Centre for Action on Food Security.

Our Leadership Values

Eight core values guide us in everything that we do.
  • Do What’s Right
  • Shared Value
  • High Performance
  • Diverse and Inclusive Teams
  • Disciplined Decision Making
  • Our Accountability
  • Intense Curiosity
  • Transparency and Humility

The Opportunity

The General Labour full-time position is responsible for performing packaging, clean-up and other elemental activities related to food processing.

A snapshot of some of the exciting things you will lead and do:

  • Feed cartons into machines.
  • Check and weigh materials and/or product.
  • Manually pack product into bags, cartons or other containers.
  • Remove finished goods cartons from conveyer and place on pallets.
  • Check products and packaging for basic quality defects.

What we have to offer you:

  • Be part of a company with an inspiring and unique vision, with a deep commitment to sustainability and expanding its leadership in sustainable protein across North America

COVID-19 Safety Measures:

  • Maple Leaf Foods is committed to ensuring the health and
safety of all our employees. As part of this commitment, we
have adopted a number of COVID-19 safety measures,
including a requirement for all employees to be fully
vaccinated and to show proof of
vaccination. In keeping with this policy, successful
candidates will need to provide proof of vaccination prior to the commencement of employment. We will of course consider accommodations for anyone unable to be vaccinated following human rights and other applicable laws.

We thank all applicants for their interest in exploring employment opportunities with Maple Leaf Foods however only those selected for an interview will be contacted. Applicants may be subject to a background check and must meet the security criteria designated for the position.

Maple Leaf Foods is committed to Employment Equity and maintaining a diverse workforce. Job applicants with a disability who require reasonable accommodation for any part of the application or hiring process can contact our Talent Attraction Team at

accommodations@mapleleaf.com

. Reasonable accommodations will be determined on a case-by-case basis and your request will be responded to as soon as possible.
