title: Construction Labourers - Calgary AB
description:
Construction Labourers

At PME INC, we're constantly pushing the limits of what we've done in the past - propelling ourselves toward bigger and better opportunities, while exploring new market sectors and services. So it only seems natural that we'd hire people who have their own voice and aren't afraid to use it. These are people who are simultaneously critical, creative and captivated by construction. They make our business their business, and follow a path that with continuous learning and an innovative spirit leads them to be recognized as leaders in the industry. We hire these types of people knowing they are as diverse as we are, and they come on board because they share our core values.

In the position of an upcoming job for Construction Labourer, we would ask you to do the following: Handle and distribute construction materials (e.g., load and unload vehicles with supplies, equipment and construction materials; move tools, equipment and construction materials to and from work areas; remove rubble and other debris) Assemble and dismantle scaffolding, ramps, catwalks, shoring and barricades at construction sites Prepare and clean up construction sites, move materials and equipment, and perform demolition, excavation and compaction activities Work on a wide variety of buildings, structures and premises including municipal sewer and water mains, roads, dams and bridges, tunnels, railways and canals

Sounds challenging and exciting right? Here are a few of the attributes and experience you need to be successful in this position:

  • You have one to two years of industrial or civil construction experience and must have Construction Safety Training Systems (CSTS 09) Certificate or SCOT, WHMIS 2015, flagging, Standard First Aid considered an asset.
  • You have experience in using compactors, and trampers (jumping jack) You are able to lift up to 13.5 kg (30 lbs) 9-23 Kg You have a safety conscious attitude and able to work with others in a team
  • Valid driver's license - Driver's Abstract is required
  • Drug and Alcohol Screening required.

Go ahead and be yourself. We'll pay you for it! These positions will start in Spring 2022.

Please note, there is NO TRAVEL or LIVING ALLOWANCE for this project.

We are an equal opportunity employer. We welcome people of any age, culture, subculture, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, nationality, ethnicity, race, size, mental or physical status, veteran status, religion, language, political opinion, working-style preference, family status, education, and socio-economic status.

title: Labourer - Ferrous Receiver
description:
Company Description

Founded in 1936 in Montreal, American Iron & Metal (AIM) is a family-owned company, recognized as a world leader in the metal recycling industry. Over the years, AIM has evolved into a multi-faceted company with successful lines of business including metals recycling, dry materials recycling, manufacturing of solder assembly, environmental services, retail auto parts, and highway transportation. With multiple facilities throughout Canada, the United States, Mexico, Europe, and Asia and over 2000 employees located throughout the world, AIM is uniquely positioned to provide best-in-class service and value to its customers. 

Job Description

We are currently recruiting for a Receiver Ferrous with experience for our London location. Under the supervision of the Yard Manager, the incumbent will be responsible for the general maintenance of the premises. 

  • Receive, sort and organize different types of ferrous metals
  • Properly weigh and track the material
  • Do general maintenance of the premises
  • Ensure the equipment in good condition
  • Data entry into the RECY system
  • Provide excellent customer service to clients on site
  • Help with torch cutting if necessary
  • Operate the crane as required
  • Work with a safety oriented mindset
Qualifications

  • Experience using a crane will be considered as an asset
  • Experience in metal recycling will be an asset
  • Ability to work indoors/outdoors in all weather conditions
  • Good physical fitness
  • Ability to work as a team
  • Excellent attendance and safety record.


Additional Information

WE OFFER 

  • Competitive salaries commensurate with experience and qualifications 
  • Group benefits like insurance and RRSP 
  • Additional training and uniform 
  • Great working environment 
  • Overtime opportunities 

HEALTH AND SAFETY 

  • Must work in compliance with the Occupational Health and Safety Regulation and follow in accordance with AIM’s Health and Safety policies and procedures 
  • Responsible for reporting all accidents, illnesses, or ‘near miss’ incidents to management 

HOURS OF WORK 

  • Permanent and full-time position 
  • 40 hours per week, able to work extended hours/weekends when deemed necessary 

ACCOMMODATION 

American Iron and Metal Inc. is proud to be an equal opportunity employer committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. We ensure that all individuals are treated equally, respectfully and with integrity. We welcome resume submissions from all qualified applicants and thank you for your interest in American Iron and Metal Inc. If accommodations are required, please attach your rrequest with the resume. All information received will be addressed confidentially. We thank all applicants for their interest but only candidates selected for an interview will be contacted.

title: Labourer - Ready Mix
description:
Why work for Lafarge?:

As the global leader in innovative and sustainable building materials, weâ€™re committed to shaping a greener, smarter and healthier world. At Lafarge Canada Inc., safety comes first, collaboration matters and diversity is celebrated with people who share our desire to continually make our materials better.  

 

Do you have the drive, the skills, and the passion to join us?

 

Overview:

Lafarge has an immediate opening for an experienced Labourer to join our Ready Mix team in Edmonton.

Responsibilities:

Responsibilities and not limited to:

  • Perform general construction labor to include jobsite clean-up and moving of materials by hand.
  • Operating motorized equipment including power tools, grinders, saws, hammers, etc.  
  • Work requires alert individuals with good balance and physical strength.
  • Assist in pouring and placing concrete.
  • Mostly interior work but could be exposed to cold and heat, noise and dust from construction operations depending upon project site.
Qualifications:

Minimum Qualifications:

  • High school diploma
  • Frequently lifting, carrying, pushing and pulling up to 50 pounds of material  and up to 90 pounds of material with assistance, if requested.
  • Frequently walking, stooping, kneeling, reaching and climbing.
  • Frequent use of hand tools such as power tools, circular saws, hammers, nails, and bolts.
  • Valid driverâ€™s license

Preferred Experience:

  • Preference given to candidates with concrete construction labor work experience at meets or exceeds performance expectations.
  • Preference also given to those willing to learn and work in a team environment.

Competencies:

  • Safety oriented
  • Able to lift 50 lbs.
  • Able to work in a fast paced, high production environment
  • Willing to work overtime and shifts when needed including Saturdays

title: Construction Labourer
description:
Our client is a reputable custom home builder with multiple residential projects throughout the Okanagan. They are seeking a Construction Labourer to join the team.
  • Knowledge and experience in the following areas are not essential but would be considered an asset.
  • General knowledge and ability to use power tools
  • Ability to follow direction with limited supervision
  • Slab preparation
  • Concrete forming for driveways
Typical duties would include:
  • Prep construction sites by cleaning or removing debris, obstacles and hazards
  • Perform daily site clean-up
  • Loading and unloading of materials
  • Remove, fill and compact earth
  • Physical labour and other strenuous physical tasks
  • Assist craft workers and other skilled labour when necessary
This position offers both mentorship and infinite potential for growth within the company. If you have a positive attitude and a willingness to learn this could be the opportunity you have been looking for!
  • Motivated
  • Ambitious
  • Punctual
  • Reliable
  • Ability to work in all weather
  • Must be local to the Lake Country, Kelowna or Vernon
Job Types: Full-time, Permanent
Schedule: 8 hour shift (Mon to Fri)

title: Labourer
description:
At EVRAZ, our strength starts with our people! As a team we collaborate to solve problems, contribute ideas and challenge each other to ensure growth and ultimately success for the business and our employees.

Job Description and Responsibilities

  • Loading baler and process material for shipping.

  • Load processed material out for shipping to material purchasers.

  • Palletizing material

  • Inspecting and sorting material

  • Clean productions areas

Requirements

  • Must have High school diploma or GED

  • 1-2 years of experience working in recycling preferred but not necessary.

  • Able to meet the physical demands of the position including standing, walking, sitting, climbing, crawling, kneeling, bending, moderate to heavy lifting and pushing and pulling up to 70 pounds throughout the day

  • Willing and able to work in variable weather conditions including hot, dry summer conditions and cold, harsh winter conditions

  • Basic math skills

  • Strong communication skills; ability to interact productively with supervisors, peers, and subordinates

  • Ability to multitask, react to changing conditions and function well under the pressure of deadlines

  • Excellent customer service, committed to making sure that all purchases are handled professionally and expeditiously

Our total compensation package includes amazing benefits!

  • Competitive wages and bonus opportunities
  • Family medical, dental, and prescription coverage at minimal employee cost
  • Short and long term disability programs
  • Competitive retirement plans
  • Paid vacations and statutory holidays
  • Apprenticeship and career advancement within the company
  • Tuition reimbursement

All applicants must be eligible to work in Canada without sponsorship.

While we thank all those who apply, only those being actively considered for employment will be contacted.

Equal Opportunity Employer

EVRAZ North America is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability, or protected Veteran status.

 

EVRAZ North America is committed to working with and providing reasonable accommodation to individuals with physical and mental disabilities.

If you need special assistance or an accommodation while seeking employment, please e-mail

careers@evrazna.com

or call: (312) 533-3577. We will make a determination on your request for reasonable accommodation on a case-by-case basis.

Join a team that manufactures excellence, drives success and builds careers!

title: Summer Student - General Laborer - Colville Lake
description:
Under the general supervision of the Manager Generation Support, you contribute to the safe and efficient operation of the NTPC Plant. Duties would include heavy lifting, weed whacking, painting, mopping, cleaning and assisting the Mechanics, Electrical Technicians, Electricians and Power Linepersons



Qualifications:

  • Are enrolling/enrolled to attend full time post-secondary studies at the start of the Fall 2021 semester.
  • Related experience in a labourer position an asset.

 How to Apply:

  • Submit your cover letter, and a current copy of your resume including two references from your most recent supervisor or instructors.
  • You will be required to provide proof of registration in a post-secondary institution.

This position pays $26.97 per hour plus 6% vacation pay.  No housing or relocation assistance provided.

 

This job opening is limited to student residents living in Colville Lake.

 

Affirmative Action Employer - Candidates must clearly identify eligibility status via our online portal in order to receive priority consideration.

 

We thank all those who apply and advise that only those selected for further consideration will be contacted.

title: General Labourer
description:
This position is responsible for assisting the general assembly, material processing, painting and material handling departments to increase our overall shop productivity within our Saskatoon Manufacturing Facility. The right candidate will have the opportunity to be trained in-house, which can include assembling machinery and equipment, industrial painting, CNC cutting machines, brake press machining, laser and plasma machining and other related maintenance and equipment through an intensive training program, working alongside our highly specialized team.

We are looking for ambitious, hardworking individuals that want to build their career with a company that will provide advancement and security for them for the long haul while gaining all the experience needed to become a highly specialized professional in the industry.

We are an industry leader that employs the very latest technologies and equipment to build the best products out there and pride ourselves on delivering a safe, clean work environment for all of our employees.

DUTIES & RESPONSIBILITIES:

  • Demonstrate safe and efficient workplace practices
  • Highly motivated individual who possesses excellent communication and interpersonal skills
  • Able to understand and carry out written and verbal instructions
  • Possess mechanical aptitude and strong willingness to learn and be trained
  • Capable of meeting the physical demands of the heavy duty equipment environment
  • Capable of working under minimum amount of supervision ‘
  • Other duties as assigned

  • Able to create alternative solutions to problems.
  • Strong attention to detail.
  • Physical ability to lift up to 50lbs.
  • Ability to work both indoors and outdoors.
  • Excellent time management skills.
  • Ability to work independently in a busy environment

title: General Labour
description:
Looking to grow and develop new skills?
Like to work Hands -on?
Looking for a career opportunity in Barrie?
We are hiring for Assembly workers - new shift straight days who want to work locally!

DAYS ONLY
$17.50/hr
Monday to Friday

Details:

• Mon- Thursday 6:30-4:00 Fridays 7:30-4:00 hours 44 hours after 3 months you will receive a bonus $500 and start immediate benefits
• immediate openings, immediate interviews - opportunity to be trained in all positions - • $17.50/Hour working for a local company
• Background using hand tools cutting material, drills, nail guns
• Worked in a fabrication type role, drilling templates, cutting templates, fitting plates, grinding
• Working with steel, measuring tapes, cutting materials, sanding, polishing, and grinding
• Need to be comfortable lifting upwards of 40 lbs

Please apply online at www.randstad.ca and then call the branch at 705-735-1106.



Advantages
• after 3 months full benefits and $500 bonus
• $17.50/Hour working for a local company
• Work Monday - Friday Day Shift
• Company focuses on a great working culture

Responsibilities
• Strong English communication skills (written and oral)
• Strong interpersonal skills
• Capable of following oral instructions
• Ability to work quickly, calmly, while adhering to our high quality and safety standards
• Able to stand, bend or lift for extended periods of time
• Must be able to discern colours and shades
• Must have the flexibility to work extra hours, on short notice, in order to meet internal/external customer requirements (scheduled and nonscheduled overtime shifts

Qualifications
• Equivalent experience in assembly and/or warehouse experience
• Prior experience in a production environment (fast-paced manufacturing environment preferred)

Summary
Please apply online at www.randstad.ca and then call the branch at 705-735-1106.
work straight days

Looking forward to hearing from you!

Randstad Canada is committed to fostering a workforce reflective of all peoples of Canada. As a result, we are committed to developing and implementing strategies to increase the equity, diversity and inclusion within the workplace by examining our internal policies, practices, and systems throughout the entire lifecycle of our workforce, including its recruitment, retention and advancement for all employees. In addition to our deep commitment to respecting human rights, we are dedicated to positive actions to affect change to ensure everyone has full participation in the workforce free from any barriers, systemic or otherwise, especially equity-seeking groups who are usually underrepresented in Canada's workforce, including those who identify as women or non-binary/gender non-conforming; Indigenous or Aboriginal Peoples; persons with disabilities (visible or invisible) and; members of visible minorities, racialized groups and the LGBTQ2+ community.

Randstad Canada is committed to creating and maintaining an inclusive and accessible workplace for all its candidates and employees by supporting their accessibility and accommodation needs throughout the employment lifecycle. We ask that all job applications please identify any accommodation requirements by sending an email to

accessibility@randstad.ca

to ensure their ability to fully participate in the interview process.

title: Labourer
description:
Are you looking for long term employment with a proven employer? As a member of the FBL team you will enjoy many career advancement opportunities such as development training, career growth, and promotional opportunities from within.

Forbes Brothers Ltd, OA FB Bullet is looking for qualified individuals to join our growing team. Specializing in underground utility construction FB Bullet offers a competitive compensation package, benefits and pension contribution. We are looking for applicants ranging from Crew Leaders, Lead Hands, Pipelayers, Operators and Labourers. Specializing in shallow utility construction FB Bullet staff all report to our main office in Surrey and travel to work sites with their designated crews in company vehicles. We offer full-time year-round work with a vast opportunity for overtime due to the nature and demand of our work.


Civil Labourer

The ideal candidate will either have previous experience as a Construction Labourer or seeks the opportunity to join our growing team and advance their knowledge and skill base. The role of Civil Labourer will be responsible to report to the Crew Leader and execute the day-to-day activities of their crew. As a valued member of our team, you will be able to support and take instructions from crew members with assigned duties to gain and improve efficiencies.

Responsibilities:

  • Receive duties, delegations from the Crew Leader, and assist crew members execute these tasks
  • Work closely with all crew members, and learn the construction industry standards
  • Complete installation of conduit and other utility infrastructure with crew members
  • Work on tight timeline power outage worksites
  • Assist in maintaining a clean and organized work site
  • Able to problem solve through coordination with Crew Leader
  • Ensure quality of work meets or exceeds expectations
  • Complete daily pre-trip inspections on company equipment/vehicles
  • Participate and engage in daily Tailboard meetings, identify hazards and assist in crew compliance to safety policies and regulations
  • Work with construction equipment such as compactors, shoring, core drills, various hand tools
  • Ensure all small tools assigned to crew are cleaned, stored and maintained properly
  • Work closely with Crew Leader/Lead Hand to install conduit per specifications to correct grades/elevations
  • Assist drivers and vehicles navigate through busy work sites via proper hand signals and guidance

Schedule:

  • Due to the demand of our workload, all crews are scheduled Monday-Friday with the opportunity for weekend work quite frequently. Nightshift work is also scheduled on a less frequent basis
  • All shifts are scheduled for 8-10 hours, and due to the type of work we perform can extend past that
  • Daily overtime/double time is offered in all FB positions

Candidate Requirements:

  • Valid Class 5 driver's licence, Class 1 or 3 preferred
  • Preferred experience in underground utility construction, hydro/telecommunications considered an asset
  • Physically fit and able to provide hands on assistance to crew members
  • Must be safety orientated
  • Ability to take and execute instructions and duties assigned to you
  • Lead by example attitude
  • Existing knowledge of WorkSafeBC standards and policies is an asset for this position

What We Offer:

Forbes Bros offers an attractive compensation package that includes a competitive salary, comprehensive benefit plan and a rewarding pension program. Forbes Bros has an open and team oriented culture that focuses on communication, innovation and respect in the workplace!

Forbes Bros Ltd. (FBL) is an equal opportunity employer committed to best practice recruiting and hiring, to promote gender equity and workplace diversity. We thank all applicants for their interest, however only those candidates who meet the requirements noted and who earn an invitation to interview will be contacted.

title: General Labour (Heavy Lifter) - 3:15PM - 11:45PM
description:
This position pays a $0.55 shift premium in addition to the hourly rate.

JOB RESPONSIBILITIES:
  • Contributes to a healthy work environment, while maintaining high food safety standards
  • Lifts boxes/totes from skids and pushes loaded boxes/totes onto conveyor
  • Manually moves caps around when necessary
  • Lifts partially and/or full totes and dumps into combo boxes
  • Working on production lines, handling raw poultry products
  • Takes action to correct any issues and to make improvements
  • Other responsibilities as required

WHAT DOING A GOOD JOB LOOKS LIKE:
  • Directly helps to meet targets and goals while maintaining a safe & healthy work environment
  • Maintains productivity that meets/exceeds standards
  • Dedicated to creating a high-quality product that consistently meets product specifications
  • Contributes to the team and the whole facility in a positive way

REQUIRED SKILLS, ABILITY & EXPERIENCE:
  • Able to work in a fast-paced work environment with repetitive tasks on a moving line
  • Able to stand and walk throughout the shift
  • Able to rotate through all positions in the department as required
  • Must be able to lift totes/boxes up to 55lbs
  • Good communication skills, able to speak and read English
Maple Leaf Foods is committed to ensuring the health and safety of all our employees. As part of this commitment, we have adopted a number of COVID-19 safety measures, including a requirement for all employees to be fully vaccinated by March 31, 2022 and to show proof of vaccination. In keeping with this policy, successful candidates will need to provide proof of vaccination by March 31, 2022 (or prior to their first day of work if the start date is after March 31, 2022). We will of course consider accommodations for anyone unable to be vaccinated following human rights and other applicable laws.

title: Labourer - Ready Mix
description:
Why work for Lafarge?

As the global leader in innovative and sustainable building materials, we’re committed to shaping a greener, smarter and healthier world. At Lafarge Canada Inc., safety comes first, collaboration matters and diversity is celebrated with people who share our desire to continually make our materials better. 

 

Do you have the drive, the skills, and the passion to join us?

 

Overview

Lafarge has an immediate opening for an experienced Labourer to join our Ready Mix team in Edmonton.

Responsibilities

Responsibilities and not limited to:

  • Perform general construction labor to include jobsite clean-up and moving of materials by hand.
  • Operating motorized equipment including power tools, grinders, saws, hammers, etc. 
  • Work requires alert individuals with good balance and physical strength.
  • Assist in pouring and placing concrete.
  • Mostly interior work but could be exposed to cold and heat, noise and dust from construction operations depending upon project site.

Qualifications

Minimum Qualifications:

  • High school diploma
  • Frequently lifting, carrying, pushing and pulling up to 50 pounds of material and up to 90 pounds of material with assistance, if requested.
  • Frequently walking, stooping, kneeling, reaching and climbing.
  • Frequent use of hand tools such as power tools, circular saws, hammers, nails, and bolts.
  • Valid driver’s license

Preferred Experience:

  • Preference given to candidates with concrete construction labor work experience at meets or exceeds performance expectations.
  • Preference also given to those willing to learn and work in a team environment.

Competencies:

  • Safety oriented
  • Able to lift 50 lbs.
  • Able to work in a fast paced, high production environment
  • Willing to work overtime and shifts when needed including Saturdays
  • Able to work unsupervised
  • Able to work well with others
  • Good communication skills

As part of our dedicated focus on the health and safety of all employees, a pre-employment medical, including drug and alcohol testing and a criminal record check, may be required.

LafargeHolcim

As we are reinventing the way the world builds, we need world-class talent to join our Lafarge Canada team: people who are passionate, driven by curiosity and keen to grow, learn, develop and thrive in our high-performance culture.

 

Whatever you do, you will make a difference here. Because we know that your passion and curiosity are the natural resources the world needs.

 

Check out our YouTube channel to learn more about our operations and see all career opportunities at www.lafarge.ca/careers.

 

We thank you for your interest. Only candidates selected for an interview will be contacted.  Lafarge is committed to the principles of employment equity and encourages the applications from women, visible minorities, and persons with disabilities.

title: General Labour
description:
Position: General Labourer
Wage: $18+

Do you have previous experience with general labour? Are you interested in working with a great team? Do you have previous experience with hand or power tools?

If the answer is Yes! We have an exciting warehouse associate opportunity located in Nisku and the south of Edmonton

Advantages
*Competitive wages
*Paid weekly through Randstad
*Vacation paid out weekly at a rate of 4%
*Health & Wellness benefits available from start date
*Referral bonuses available


Responsibilities
In this general labour position you may be required to:
*Measure and cut items (ie. wood, steel, etc)
*Utilize hand & power tools
*Conduct quality control assessments

Qualifications
What do you need for this general labour position?
*Ability to lift 50 lbs repetitively
*Strong attention to detail
*Ability to read a tape measure and utilize a computer
*Able to work with minimal supervision
*someone with background in the industry would be considered an asset

Summary
If you are interested in applying for this general labour position, please apply today!

How to apply:
1) email your resume to kristina.peters@randstad.ca

title: Labourer
description:
Are you looking for long term employment with a proven employer? As a member of the FBL team you will enjoy many career advancement opportunities such as development training, career growth, and promotional opportunities from within.

Forbes Brothers Ltd, OA FB Bullet is looking for qualified individuals to join our growing team. Specializing in underground utility construction FB Bullet offers a competitive compensation package, benefits and pension contribution. We are looking for applicants ranging from Crew Leaders, Lead Hands, Pipelayers, Operators and Labourers. Specializing in shallow utility construction FB Bullet staff all report to our main office in Surrey and travel to work sites with their designated crews in company vehicles. We offer full-time year-round work with a vast opportunity for overtime due to the nature and demand of our work.


Civil Labourer

The ideal candidate will either have previous experience as a Construction Labourer or seeks the opportunity to join our growing team and advance their knowledge and skill base. The role of Civil Labourer will be responsible to report to the Crew Leader and execute the day-to-day activities of their crew. As a valued member of our team, you will be able to support and take instructions from crew members with assigned duties to gain and improve efficiencies.

Responsibilities:

  • Receive duties, delegations from the Crew Leader, and assist crew members execute these tasks
  • Work closely with all crew members, and learn the construction industry standards
  • Complete installation of conduit and other utility infrastructure with crew members
  • Work on tight timeline power outage worksites
  • Assist in maintaining a clean and organized work site
  • Able to problem solve through coordination with Crew Leader
  • Ensure quality of work meets or exceeds expectations
  • Complete daily pre-trip inspections on company equipment/vehicles
  • Participate and engage in daily Tailboard meetings, identify hazards and assist in crew compliance to safety policies and regulations
  • Work with construction equipment such as compactors, shoring, core drills, various hand tools
  • Ensure all small tools assigned to crew are cleaned, stored and maintained properly
  • Work closely with Crew Leader/Lead Hand to install conduit per specifications to correct grades/elevations
  • Assist drivers and vehicles navigate through busy work sites via proper hand signals and guidance

Schedule:

  • Due to the demand of our workload, all crews are scheduled Monday-Friday with the opportunity for weekend work quite frequently. Nightshift work is also scheduled on a less frequent basis
  • All shifts are scheduled for 8-10 hours, and due to the type of work we perform can extend past that
  • Daily overtime/double time is offered in all FB positions

Candidate Requirements:

  • Valid Class 5 driver's licence, Class 1 or 3 preferred
  • Preferred experience in underground utility construction, hydro/telecommunications considered an asset
  • Physically fit and able to provide hands on assistance to crew members
  • Must be safety orientated
  • Ability to take and execute instructions and duties assigned to you
  • Lead by example attitude
  • Existing knowledge of WorkSafeBC standards and policies is an asset for this position

What We Offer:

Forbes Bros offers an attractive compensation package that includes a competitive salary, comprehensive benefit plan and a rewarding pension program. Forbes Bros has an open and team oriented culture that focuses on communication, innovation and respect in the workplace!

Forbes Bros Ltd. (FBL) is an equal opportunity employer committed to best practice recruiting and hiring, to promote gender equity and workplace diversity. We thank all applicants for their interest, however only those candidates who meet the requirements noted and who earn an invitation to interview will be contacted.

title: General Labour (3:15PM - 11:45PM)
description:
This position pays a $0.55 shift premium in addition to the hourly rate.

JOB RESPONSIBILITIES:
  • Contributes to a healthy work environment, while maintaining high food safety standards
  • Works on the line directly handling raw poultry products
  • Takes action to correct any issues and to make improvements
  • Other responsibilities as required
WHAT DOING A GOOD JOB LOOKS LIKE:
  • Directly helps to meet targets and goals while maintaining a safe & healthy work environment
  • Maintains productivity that meets/exceeds standards
  • Dedicated to creating a high quality product that consistently meets product specifications
  • Contributes to the team and the whole facility in a positive way

REQUIRED SKILLS, ABILITY & EXPERIENCE:
  • Able to work in a fast-paced work environment with repetitive tasks on a moving line
  • Able to stand and walk throughout the shift
  • Able to rotate through all positions in the department as required
  • Must be comfortable with handling raw poultry products
  • Good communication skills, able to speak and read English


Maple Leaf Foods is committed to ensuring the health and safety of all our employees. As part of this commitment, we have adopted a number of COVID-19 safety measures, including a requirement for all employees to be fully vaccinated by March 31, 2022 and to show proof of vaccination. In keeping with this policy, successful candidates will need to provide proof of vaccination by March 31, 2022 (or prior to their first day of work if the start date is after March 31, 2022). We will of course consider accommodations for anyone unable to be vaccinated following human rights and other applicable laws.

title: Labourer
description:
At EVRAZ, our strength starts with our people! As a team we collaborate to solve problems, contribute ideas and challenge each other to ensure growth and ultimately success for the business and our employees.

Job Description and Responsibilities

Our General Scrap facility in Winnipeg has multiple openings for Labourers for immediate hire. This is a physically demanding role that is performed in all weather conditions.

  • Working in conveyor picking stations removing unwanted material from product stream
  • Cleaning production areas, including shoveling, scraping and sweeping
  • Assist with shop and yard cleanliness by removing debris and picking-up metal from various places throughout the facility
  • Clearing snow as required.
  • Loading and unloading material and equipment
  • Assisting operators with maintenance and repairs of equipment
  • Pressure washing yard equipment
  • Assist in organizing and cleaning warehousing and part storage areas

Requirements

  • No experience necessary but previous work experience in a manufacturing, production, or similar scrapyard/auto part environment will be considered an asset
  • Able to meet the physical demands of the position including standing, walking, sitting, climbing, crawling, kneeling, bending, moderate to heavy lifting and pushing and pulling up to 50 pounds throughout the day
  • Willing and able to work in variable weather conditions including hot, dry summer conditions and cold, harsh winter conditions
  • Knowledge and understanding of metallic materials purchased, ferrous and non-ferrous classifications, an asset
  • Able to work with minimal supervision/general oversight
  • Able to communicate clearly as including using a handheld radio
  • Able to work evenings and weekends

Our total compensation package includes amazing benefits!

  • Competitive wages and bonus opportunities
  • Family medical, dental, vision and prescription coverage at minimal employee cost
  • Short and long term disability programs
  • Competitive retirement plans
  • Paid vacations and statutory holidays
  • Apprenticeship and career advancement within the company
  • Tuition reimbursement

All applicants must be eligible to work in Canada without sponsorship.

While we thank all those who apply, only those being actively considered for employment will be contacted.

Equal Opportunity Employer

EVRAZ North America is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability, or protected Veteran status.

 

EVRAZ North America is committed to working with and providing reasonable accommodation to individuals with physical and mental disabilities.

If you need special assistance or an accommodation while seeking employment, please e-mail

careers@evrazna.com

or call: (312) 533-3577. We will make a determination on your request for reasonable accommodation on a case-by-case basis.

Join a team that manufactures excellence, drives success and builds careers!

title: Summer Student - General Labour
description:
General Labour Workers - Summer Student

Maple Leaf Foods Hamilton Plant is Hiring!

Summer Student Incentive

  • Returning students will receive a $250 signing bonus after exceeding 160 hours
  • All students will accrue $1/hr for each hour worked payable at the end of summer to assist with tuition (program guidelines and restrictions do apply)
General Information
  • Must be 18 years of age or older to work in a production environment
  • $16.50 to start with regular increases!
  • A variety of shifts are available
  • Some shifts are not busaccessible, but we do have afternoon andnightshift premiumsavailable
  • Opportunities to learn and grow
  • Trans Cab Service and Conventional Bus Service is provided through HSR
    • Highly automated and fast paced learning environment

A Sustainable, Forward Thinking Protein Company

Maple Leaf Foods is a leading meat and plant-based protein company, employing over 11,500 people and publicly traded on the Toronto Stock Exchange. We are proud of our roots, which trace back well over 100 years, but our vision and purpose are decidedly forward looking. As we pursue our vision to become the most sustainable protein company on earth, we are committed to creating shared value – creative business value through addressing some of the world’s most critical social and environmental challenges. Our goal is to build a more sustainable food system, which provides nutritious affordable food, operates within planetary limits, cares for animals responsibly, and meaningfully engages with our communities to advance a more just society. We are advancing bold changes within Maple Leaf and more broadly within society to pursue our vision. We deeply believe this is the sustainable path to growth.

Our job is to make great food

Maple Leaf Foods embraces a strong values-based culture, where our people are deeply engaged in work that is purposeful, fast-paced and challenging. We cultivate an open, non-bureaucratic and inclusive workplace that fosters safety and transparency, along with individual leadership and accountability. Each Maple Leaf team member has a voice and plays an active role in helping all of us achieve our goals with passion and discipline. We support one another to grow professionally, to learn new skills and to take on challenging experiences in the spirit of continuous improvement.

Raise the Good in Food

We have united behind a shared purpose – to Raise the Good in Food. This spans a dramatic transformation of our flagship Maple Leaf brand, replacing anything artificial with simple, natural ingredients; investments and process changes to reduce our environmental footprint by 50% by 2025; building a diverse and inclusive culture where all talent thrives; becoming a leader in animal care; and advancing food security through our charitable foundation, the Maple Leaf Centre for Action on Food Security.

Our Leadership Values

Eight core values guide us in everything that we do.
  • Do What’s Right
  • Shared Value
  • High Performance
  • Diverse and Inclusive Teams
  • Disciplined Decision Making
  • Our Accountability
  • Intense Curiosity
  • Transparency and Humility

The Opportunity

The General Labour full-time position is responsible for performing packaging, clean-up and other elemental activities related to food processing.

A snapshot of some of the exciting things you will lead and do:

  • Feed cartons into machines.
  • Check and weigh materials and/or product.
  • Manually pack product into bags, cartons or other containers.
  • Remove finished goods cartons from conveyer and place on pallets.
  • Check products and packaging for basic quality defects.

What we have to offer you:

  • Be part of a company with an inspiring and unique vision, with a deep commitment to sustainability and expanding its leadership in sustainable protein across North America

COVID-19 Safety Measures:

  • Maple Leaf Foods is committed to ensuring the health and
safety of all our employees. As part of this commitment, we
have adopted a number of COVID-19 safety measures,
including a requirement for all employees to be fully
vaccinated and to show proof of
vaccination. In keeping with this policy, successful
candidates will need to provide proof of vaccination prior to the commencement of employment. We will of course consider accommodations for anyone unable to be vaccinated following human rights and other applicable laws.

We thank all applicants for their interest in exploring employment opportunities with Maple Leaf Foods however only those selected for an interview will be contacted. Applicants may be subject to a background check and must meet the security criteria designated for the position.

Maple Leaf Foods is committed to Employment Equity and maintaining a diverse workforce. Job applicants with a disability who require reasonable accommodation for any part of the application or hiring process can contact our Talent Attraction Team at

accommodations@mapleleaf.com

. Reasonable accommodations will be determined on a case-by-case basis and your request will be responded to as soon as possible.

title: Summer Student - General Labour
description:
General Labour Workers - Summer Student

Maple Leaf Foods Hamilton Plant is Hiring!

Summer Student Incentive

  • Returning students will receive a $250 signing bonus after exceeding 160 hours
  • All students will accrue $1/hr for each hour worked payable at the end of summer to assist with tuition (program guidelines and restrictions do apply)
General Information
  • Must be 18 years of age or older to work in a production environment
  • $16.50 to start with regular increases!
  • A variety of shifts are available 
  • Some shifts are not bus accessible, but we do have afternoon and night shift premiums available 
  • Opportunities to learn and grow
  • Trans Cab Service and Conventional Bus Service is provided through HSR 
    • Highly automated and fast paced learning environment

A Sustainable, Forward Thinking Protein Company

Maple Leaf Foods is a leading meat and plant-based protein company, employing over 11,500 people and publicly traded on the Toronto Stock Exchange. We are proud of our roots, which trace back well over 100 years, but our vision and purpose are decidedly forward looking. As we pursue our vision to become the most sustainable protein company on earth, we are committed to creating shared value – creative business value through addressing some of the world’s most critical social and environmental challenges. Our goal is to build a more sustainable food system, which provides nutritious affordable food, operates within planetary limits, cares for animals responsibly, and meaningfully engages with our communities to advance a more just society. We are advancing bold changes within Maple Leaf and more broadly within society to pursue our vision. We deeply believe this is the sustainable path to growth.

Our job is to make great food

Maple Leaf Foods embraces a strong values-based culture, where our people are deeply engaged in work that is purposeful, fast-paced and challenging.  We cultivate an open, non-bureaucratic and inclusive workplace that fosters safety and transparency, along with individual leadership and accountability. Each Maple Leaf team member has a voice and plays an active role in helping all of us achieve our goals with passion and discipline. We support one another to grow professionally, to learn new skills and to take on challenging experiences in the spirit of continuous improvement. 

Raise the Good in Food

We have united behind a shared purpose – to Raise the Good in Food. This spans a dramatic transformation of our flagship Maple Leaf brand, replacing anything artificial with simple, natural ingredients; investments and process changes to reduce our environmental footprint by 50% by 2025; building a diverse and inclusive culture where all talent thrives; becoming a leader in animal care; and advancing food security through our charitable foundation, the Maple Leaf Centre for Action on Food Security.

Our Leadership Values 

Eight core values guide us in everything that we do.
  • Do What’s Right
  • Shared Value
  • High Performance
  • Diverse and Inclusive Teams
  • Disciplined Decision Making
  • Our Accountability
  • Intense Curiosity
  • Transparency and Humility

The Opportunity

 The General Labour full-time position is responsible for performing packaging, clean-up and other elemental activities related to food processing. 

A snapshot of some of the exciting things you will lead and do: 

  • Feed cartons into machines.
  • Check and weigh materials and/or product.
  • Manually pack product into bags, cartons or other containers.
  • Remove finished goods cartons from conveyer and place on pallets.
  • Check products and packaging for basic quality defects.

What we have to offer you:

  • Be part of a company with an inspiring and unique vision, with a deep commitment to sustainability and expanding its leadership in sustainable protein across North America

COVID-19 Safety Measures:

  • Maple Leaf Foods is committed to ensuring the health andsafety of all our employees. As part of this commitment, wehave adopted a number of COVID-19 safety measures,including a requirement for all employees to be fullyvaccinated and to show proof ofvaccination. In keeping with this policy, successfulcandidates will need to provide proof of vaccination prior to the commencement of employment. We will of course consider accommodations for anyone unable to be vaccinated following human rights and other applicable laws.
 
 
We thank all applicants for their interest in exploring employment opportunities with Maple Leaf Foods however only those selected for an interview will be contacted. Applicants may be subject to a background check and must meet the security criteria designated for the position.  

Maple Leaf Foods is committed to Employment Equity and maintaining a diverse workforce.  Job applicants with a disability who require reasonable accommodation for any part of the application or hiring process can contact our Talent Attraction Team at 

accommodations@mapleleaf.com

.  Reasonable accommodations will be determined on a case-by-case basis and your request will be responded to as soon as possible.

title: Labourer - Mill Helper
description:
Why work for Lafarge?:

 

 

 

 

 

As the global leader in innovative and sustainable building materials, weâ€™re committed to shaping a greener, smarter and healthier world. At Lafarge Canada Inc., safety comes first, collaboration matters and diversity is celebrated with people who share our desire to continually make our materials better.  

 

Do you have the drive, the skills, and the passion to join us?

 

 

Overview:

 

As a member of the Stouffville site team, the Mill Assistant will execute the daily tasks of cleaning, monitoring and maintaining the Sand and Gravel Wash Plant in accordance with Lafargeâ€™s Best Practices and Policies as well as perform all administration related to the equipment maintenance.

Responsibilities:

 

Safety:

  • Promote safety culture through engagement with employees, JHSC, subcontractors and suppliers, implementation and maintenance of local and regional initiatives with an objective of â€œzeroâ€ safety incidents.
  • Administer and promote safety policies, processes and review procedures to ensure that site meets or exceeds all Lafarge and Regulatory guidelines.
  • Ensure that plant and surrounding site is kept safe, presentable, and functional.

Environmental Management:

  • Ensure that site meets or exceeds all Lafarge and Regulatory guidelines.
  • Supports Environmental Department to develop, implement and manage operational standards to manage activities and mitigate our environmental impact.

Equipment

  • Ensure assigned equipment is operated and maintained to original equipment manufacturer specifications and industry best practices.

Maintenance:

  • Perform daily inspections as part of our preventative maintenance program to ensure maintenance is scheduled and completed as required.
  • Wash plant and equipment to remove material buildup resulting from spillages.

Community Relations:

  • Support effective relationships within the community by participating in local activities/events and through partnerships with local associations and the business community.

Other

  • Perform other duties as assigned to assist in the efficient operation of the plant and site.

 

Relationships with Others Jobs

  • Reports to the Plant Foreman
  • This position requires extensive liaison the Mill Operator and other Mill Assistants.

 

Specific Accountabilities:

  • Safety: Near Miss and HI process, MVAâ€™s, FAâ€™s, MIâ€™s, LTIâ€™s, Daily Safety Huddles, Risk Assessments, Confined Space and WAH permits
  • Maintenance: daily, weekly, monthly, and annual inspection process, Prioritize deficiencies as they occur,
Qualifications:

 

Education & Work Experience:

  • Canadian secondary school diploma or equivalent
  • Industrial plant operation and maintenance experience an asset
  • Heavy equipment operation experience an asset

 

 

Knowledge & Skills:

  • Specific mobile equipment training
  • Mechanical aptitude
  • Forklift and Skidsteer operation
  • Computer literacy an asset

 

Safety Profile:

  • First Aid
  • Surface Miner
  • Confined Space
  • Working at Heights
  • LOTOTO

 

Job-Specific Competency Profile (Lominger):

 

  • Action oriented
  • Delegation                                                                                      
  • Organizing
  • Listening
  • Priority setting
  • Problem solving                                                                    
  • Process Management
  • Time Management                                                                                        
  • Written Communications

title: Curb & Gutter Crews
description:
Why work for Lafarge?

As the global leader in innovative and sustainable building materials, we’re committed to shaping a greener, smarter and healthier world. At Lafarge Canada Inc., safety comes first, collaboration matters and diversity is celebrated with people who share our desire to continually make our materials better. 

 

Do you have the drive, the skills, and the passion to join us?

 

Overview

Island Slipform is a division of Lafarge Canada Inc., operating all over Vancouver Island.  We place concrete curb, gutter & sidewalks municipalities and developers. 

 

Why join Island Slipform?

  • Earn up to $35/hour on Vancouver Island
  • Unionized environment
  • Good OT potential
  • Training opportunities
  • Help build your community

Responsibilities

What you’ll do:

  • Follow all health and safety regulations when operating equipment. Safely operate a variety of tools & equipment upon competency.
  • Ability to do physical labor and other strenuous physical tasks.
  • Must have a positive attitude and work ethic. Able to work independently or as an active member of a team, good interpersonal skills and communication with all levels of management.
  • Complete all assigned tasks in a timely and efficient manner.

Qualifications

Who we’re looking for:

  • Must have a valid driver license.
  • Workers must be punctual and reliable
  • Ability to work in all weather
  • Willingness to learn

As part of our dedicated focus on the health and safety of all employees, a pre-employment medical, including drug and alcohol testing and a criminal record check, may be required.

LafargeHolcim

As we are reinventing the way the world builds, we need world-class talent to join our Lafarge Canada team: people who are passionate, driven by curiosity and keen to grow, learn, develop and thrive in our high-performance culture.

 

Whatever you do, you will make a difference here. Because we know that your passion and curiosity are the natural resources the world needs.

 

See more opportunities at www.lafarge.ca/careers.

 

We thank you for your interest. Only candidates selected for an interview will be contacted.  Lafarge is committed to the principles of employment equity and encourages the applications from women, visible minorities, and persons with disabilities.

There is opportunity for advancement to those employees that demonstrate good work ethics and commitment to team work.

title: Labourer - Mill Helper
description:
Why work for Lafarge?

 

 

 

 

 

As the global leader in innovative and sustainable building materials, we’re committed to shaping a greener, smarter and healthier world. At Lafarge Canada Inc., safety comes first, collaboration matters and diversity is celebrated with people who share our desire to continually make our materials better. 

 

Do you have the drive, the skills, and the passion to join us?

 

 

Overview

 

As a member of the Stouffville site team, the Mill Assistant will execute the daily tasks of cleaning, monitoring and maintaining the Sand and Gravel Wash Plant in accordance with Lafarge’s Best Practices and Policies as well as perform all administration related to the equipment maintenance.

Responsibilities

 

Safety:

  • Promote safety culture through engagement with employees, JHSC, subcontractors and suppliers, implementation and maintenance of local and regional initiatives with an objective of “zero” safety incidents.
  • Administer and promote safety policies, processes and review procedures to ensure that site meets or exceeds all Lafarge and Regulatory guidelines.
  • Ensure that plant and surrounding site is kept safe, presentable, and functional.

Environmental Management:

  • Ensure that site meets or exceeds all Lafarge and Regulatory guidelines.
  • Supports Environmental Department to develop, implement and manage operational standards to manage activities and mitigate our environmental impact.

Equipment

  • Ensure assigned equipment is operated and maintained to original equipment manufacturer specifications and industry best practices.

Maintenance:

  • Perform daily inspections as part of our preventative maintenance program to ensure maintenance is scheduled and completed as required.
  • Wash plant and equipment to remove material buildup resulting from spillages.

Community Relations:

  • Support effective relationships within the community by participating in local activities/events and through partnerships with local associations and the business community.

Other

  • Perform other duties as assigned to assist in the efficient operation of the plant and site.

 

Relationships with Others Jobs

  • Reports to the Plant Foreman
  • This position requires extensive liaison the Mill Operator and other Mill Assistants.

 

Specific Accountabilities:

  • Safety: Near Miss and HI process, MVA’s, FA’s, MI’s, LTI’s, Daily Safety Huddles, Risk Assessments, Confined Space and WAH permits
  • Maintenance: daily, weekly, monthly, and annual inspection process, Prioritize deficiencies as they occur,

Qualifications

 

Education & Work Experience:

  • Canadian secondary school diploma or equivalent
  • Industrial plant operation and maintenance experience an asset
  • Heavy equipment operation experience an asset

 

 

Knowledge & Skills:

  • Specific mobile equipment training
  • Mechanical aptitude
  • Forklift and Skidsteer operation
  • Computer literacy an asset

 

Safety Profile:

  • First Aid
  • Surface Miner
  • Confined Space
  • Working at Heights
  • LOTOTO

 

Job-Specific Competency Profile (Lominger):

 

  • Action oriented
  • Delegation                                           
  • Organizing
  • Listening
  • Priority setting
  • Problem solving                                  
  • Process Management
  • Time Management                                             
  • Written Communications

LafargeHolcim

 

As we are reinventing the way the world builds, we need world-class talent to join our Lafarge Canada team: people who are passionate, driven by curiosity and keen to grow, learn, develop and thrive in our high-performance culture.

Whatever you do, you will make a difference here. Because we know that your passion and curiosity are the natural resources the world needs. 

 

We thank you for your interest. Only candidates selected for an interview will be contacted.  Lafarge is committed to the principles of employment equity and encourages the applications from women, visible minorities, and persons with disabilities.

 

Lafarge Canada Inc. welcomes and encourages applications from people with disabilities. In Ontario, our organization/business is committed to fulfilling our requirements under the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act. Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process.

 

Lafarge Canada is committed to providing a safe environment for employees, customers, contractors and vendors. As such, in keeping with the requirements of our industry associations, partners, and clients across Canada, Lafarge Canada has implemented a COVID-19 vaccination policy intended to reduce the spread of COVID-19. As of October 1st, 2021, all new employees joining Lafarge Canada, subject to any requirement to accommodate pursuant to applicable human rights legislation, must be fully vaccinated against COVID-19.

title: Skilled Labourer
description:
Our client is involved in all aspects of heavy civil construction including structural, marine construction, and environmental and navigational dredging. They are committed to providing every project with a highly skilled work force, a highly respected management team, highly developed quality control and safety programs and a commitment to growth, stability, quality and performance to get the job done right. They provide a safe and healthy workplace with safety as a primary consideration in all we do.

Responsibilities:
  • The primary goal of this position is to achieve excellence in all facets of the essential functions, while providing the highest quality construction services and products safely, effectively and efficiently to ensure companies principle of “Building to Last” endures for future generations.
  • Responsible for carrying out all work functions at construction sites in a safe and effective manner in order to minimize the risk of injury, property damage or loss of life.
  • Perform tasks involving physical labour on construction sites in accordance with JJM policies and procedures.
  • Tasks include but are not limited to: manual labour, cleaning, preparing sites, digging trenches, setting braces to support the sides of excavations, erecting scaffolding, cleaning up rubble and debris, remove waste materials, load and unload construction materials, assisting heavy equipment operators to secure attachments to equipment, operate hand tools as directed, tend to/feed equipment such as mixers, compressors and pumps.
  • Communicate effectively with co-workers via hand signals and radio communications while guiding/directing moving equipment.
  • Clean, maintain and secure all equipment and property as directed by companies policies and procedures.
  • Perform other site duties or functions, consistent with status or vocational ability as may be required from time to time.
  • Ensure a safe work environment for our people, clients, subcontractors, and the public.
  • Represent company to the public in a manner that is consistent with corporate values and goals.
Qualifications:
  • Company is committed to providing a safe and healthy workplace with safety as a primary consideration in all we do.
  • Minimum of three (3) years’ experience on a construction site.
  • Demonstrated mechanical ability.
  • Physically fit, with excellent stamina and the ability to perform hard manual labour.
  • CSTS-90 certificate (CSTS-2020 preferred).
  • Valid driver’s license and clean driver’s abstract (per company insurance requirements).
  • H2S Alive, Confined Space Entry & Rescue, Standard First Aid (OFA Level 1) and WHMIS are an asset.
Health and Safety:
  • Strictly adhere to the JJM Construction OHS Manual.
  • Follow companies safe work practices and safe job procedures.
  • Follow the BC Occupational Health and Safety Regulations, specifically, Part 16.
  • Ensure a safe work environment for our people, clients, subcontractors, and the public.
Please forward your resumé along with a cover letter stating how your experience and qualifications are a match for this opportunity as well as your salary expectations.

$17.50/HR

$18.50/HR

- Ability to stand/bend/walk/lift for long periods

- Problem solving skills
- Attention to detail
- Team player and great work ethic

description:
Maple Leaf Foods Inc. is a Canadian consumer packaged meats company. At our facilities, our employees work with various types of meat including chicken and pork.
 
As this is a FULL-TIME permanent opportunity, we require availability of 40 hours/week on a permanent basis.  
*********************************************************************************************************************************************
Please email resumes to hrwalker@mapleleaf.com 

Do you love taking on new challenges?  Are you detail-oriented with the ability to problem solve under tight deadlines? Do you love working in a fast-paced environment? If this sounds like you, Maple Leaf Foods has the role for YOU!
 
We are looking for upbeat general labourers who thrive working in a team-based challenging environment!
 
Snapshot of your role:
 
The successful candidate will place appropriate quantities of components into the trays.
 
What you’ll learn:
  • Organization and how to effectively meet or exceed productivity goals while maintaining high quality standards
  • Communicating effectively in a team-based environment
  • General troubleshooting and problem-solving in a fast paced-work environment
  • Time management by learning how to effectively manage workloads based on business needs
 Required Skills, Ability & Experience:
  • Ability to read, write and communicate in English
  • Positive interaction and information sharing with Associates and Salaried Team
  • Active participation in Work Group meetings
  • Ability to obtain pertinent information, evaluate information objectively and explore alternative solutions to problems
  • Actively finding new and improved ways of completing tasks
  • Willing to try new things and assume additional responsibilities
  • Cross-shift communication
  • Interact and share information with employees at all levels (Team members, Lead Hands, Supervisors, Others).  Actively participates in their work group.
  • Actively finds new and improved ways of completing tasks.  Is willing to try new things and assume additional responsibilities (assists with changeovers, keeps up with line speed requirements)
  • Employees may be required to complete aptitude testing
  • For training purposes, you must be available to work the day shift
  • Must be able to handle all food products and work in a cold environment
 
Role Responsibilities:
 
  • Take an active role in changeover procedures and achieve line speed efficiencies
  • Visual quality checks of product against customer and internal specifications (Including foreign materials and weight checks)
  • Ability to maintain cleanliness of areas of responsibility
  • Adhere to individual Product Standard Operating Procedures for components and packaging materials
  • Must wear proper PPE and comply with Health and Safety requirements including ensuring power is shut down on equipment prior to specified tasks
  • Frequent reaching and standing are required
  • Other tasks as assigned
 
Quality & Food Safety Skills:
  • Thorough, accurate, and neat completion of forms for HACCP & Quality Assurance (including brining product to the lab for testing)
  • Product quality checks against customer and internal specifications
  • Ability to maintain cleanliness of areas of responsibility
 
Health and Safety:
  • Demonstrated ability to wear proper PPE and comply with safety requirements
  • Pushing, pulling and overhead reaching, bending and reaching
  • Lifting, bending, pushing and pulling
  • Reaching, gripping with both hands
  • Ability to lift up to 50lbs
  • Prolonged standing and climbing (ladder to the hopper)
Considering a Career at Maple Leaf Foods?

Maple Leaf Foods is Canada’s leading consumer-packaged protein company, headquartered in
Toronto, Ontario. We make high-quality, great tasting, nutritious and innovative food products under leading brands including Maple Leaf®, Maple Leaf Prime®, Maple Leaf Natural Selections®, Schneiders®, Schneiders Country Naturals® and Mina™. Our Company employs approximately 11,500 people in its operations across Canada and exports to more than 20 global markets including the U.S. and Asia.

Our people are passionate about the work they do and the products we make. As we move forward, we are determined to leverage their integrity and passion to continue to build a high-performing, values-based company enabled by high-performing, motivated and talented people.
 
We thank all applicants for their interest in exploring employment opportunities with Maple Leaf Foods however only those selected for an interview will be contacted. Applicants may be subject to a background check and must meet the security criteria designated for the position.  

Maple Leaf Foods is committed to Employment Equity and maintaining a diverse workforce.  Job applicants with a disability who require reasonable accommodation for any part of the application or hiring process can contact our Talent Attraction Team at 

accommodations@mapleleaf.com

 or 905-285-5862.  Reasonable accommodations will be determined on a case-by-case basis and your request will be responded to as soon as possible.

title: Labourer - Aggregates
description:
Why work for Lafarge?

As the global leader in innovative and sustainable building materials, we’re committed to shaping a greener, smarter and healthier world. At Lafarge Canada Inc., safety comes first, collaboration matters and diversity is celebrated with people who share our desire to continually make our materials better. 

 

Do you have the drive, the skills, and the passion to join us?

 

Overview

Our Lafarge Aggregates operations in Central Alberta are looking for Labourers to join our team to carry out scheduled ground maintenance work and operate a skid steer, ideally.

 

These opportunities are for our Central Alberta Aggregates operations.

 

To apply, send your resume to: angela.ryan@lafargeholcim.com . Please reference the Job Title you are applying for in your e-mail.

Responsibilities

  • Ensure the safety of company personnel, the community, and environment
  • Seek out and implement Best Practices
  • Create an atmosphere of teamwork and ensure the development of personnel and arbitrate to resolve conflicts
  • Identify and communicate product problems and information
  • Perform several types of manual work
  • Handle materials, tools, and equipment
  • Operate automotive vehicles when required
  • Shovel spillage around conveyors

SPECIFIC ACCOUNTABILITIES

  • Ensure safety goals are achieved
  • Comply with all company safety rules

Qualifications

  • Skid steer experience is an asset
  • Semi-skilled, enthusiastic, has the ability to work on their own initiative
  • Knowledge in general maintenance work
  • Capable of working in an outdoor environment year round

As part of our dedicated focus on the health and safety of all employees, a pre-employment medical, including drug and alcohol testing and a criminal record check, may be required.

LafargeHolcim

As we are reinventing the way the world builds, we need world-class talent to join our Lafarge Canada team: people who are passionate, driven by curiosity and keen to grow, learn, develop and thrive in our high-performance culture.

 

Whatever you do, you will make a difference here. Because we know that your passion and curiosity are the natural resources the world needs.

 

Check out our YouTube channel to learn more about our operations and see all career opportunities at www.lafarge.ca/careers.

 

We thank you for your interest. Only candidates selected for an interview will be contacted.  Lafarge is committed to the principles of employment equity and encourages the applications from women, visible minorities, and persons with disabilities.

title: Skilled Labourer
description:
Our client is involved in all aspects of heavy civil construction including structural, marine construction, and environmental and navigational dredging. They are committed to providing every project with a highly skilled work force, a highly respected management team, highly developed quality control and safety programs and a commitment to growth, stability, quality and performance to get the job done right. They provide a safe and healthy workplace with safety as a primary consideration in all we do.

Responsibilities:
  • The primary goal of this position is to achieve excellence in all facets of the essential functions, while providing the highest quality construction services and products safely, effectively and efficiently to ensure companies principle of “Building to Last” endures for future generations.
  • Responsible for carrying out all work functions at construction sites in a safe and effective manner in order to minimize the risk of injury, property damage or loss of life.
  • Perform tasks involving physical labour on construction sites in accordance with JJM policies and procedures.
  • Tasks include but are not limited to: manual labour, cleaning, preparing sites, digging trenches, setting braces to support the sides of excavations, erecting scaffolding, cleaning up rubble and debris, remove waste materials, load and unload construction materials, assisting heavy equipment operators to secure attachments to equipment, operate hand tools as directed, tend to/feed equipment such as mixers, compressors and pumps.
  • Communicate effectively with co-workers via hand signals and radio communications while guiding/directing moving equipment.
  • Clean, maintain and secure all equipment and property as directed by companies policies and procedures.
  • Perform other site duties or functions, consistent with status or vocational ability as may be required from time to time.
  • Ensure a safe work environment for our people, clients, subcontractors, and the public.
  • Represent company to the public in a manner that is consistent with corporate values and goals.
Qualifications:
  • Company is committed to providing a safe and healthy workplace with safety as a primary consideration in all we do.
  • Minimum of three (3) years’ experience on a construction site.
  • Demonstrated mechanical ability.
  • Physically fit, with excellent stamina and the ability to perform hard manual labour.
  • CSTS-90 certificate (CSTS-2020 preferred).
  • Valid driver’s license and clean driver’s abstract (per company insurance requirements).
  • H2S Alive, Confined Space Entry & Rescue, Standard First Aid (OFA Level 1) and WHMIS are an asset.
Health and Safety:
  • Strictly adhere to the JJM Construction OHS Manual.
  • Follow companies safe work practices and safe job procedures.
  • Follow the BC Occupational Health and Safety Regulations, specifically, Part 16.
  • Ensure a safe work environment for our people, clients, subcontractors, and the public.
Please forward your resumé along with a cover letter stating how your experience and qualifications are a match for this opportunity as well as your salary expectations.

title: General Labour - Afternoon shift
description:
Are you a machine operator or general labourer? Are you looking for a position in Manufacturing? Would you like to learn how to operate a spot welding machine?

We are hiring mechanically inclined candidates who have a great attitude, great aptitude, and a willingness to learn.

You will be responsible for working in a manufacturing warehouse where you will take metal components, hold them in place and load them in the machine, step on the peddle to start the spot weld, along with other general labour duties (packaging, prepping materials etc). You will then inspect each part for quality and accuracy.





Advantages
- Straight afternoons Monday to Friday from 4 pm to 12:30 am
- $16.75 /hr to start with room for growth
- Work for a brand name product manufacturer
- Be hired on permanently once you've proven your work ethic, attendance, and reliability

Responsibilities
Your duties will include but are not limited to:
-stripping plastic
-packaging
-sorting, loading
-lifting up to 25lbs
-Light general labour

Qualifications
- 6 months experience working in a manufacturing environment
- Ability to wear steel-toed boots, safety glasses, gloves, and hearing protection
- Strong attention to detail
- Strong focus on attendance and work ethic

title: Skilled Labourer
description:
The successful candidate will be a skilled labourer with a proactive attitude, strong work ethic, common sense, along with the necessary general skill set for this role. Our ideal candidate would be looking for a place to grow their knowledge base and exposure within the residential design-build industry.

Responsibilities include a wide variety of tasks onsite, including but not limited to: demolition by hand & tool, forming, framing, insulation, drywall, waterproofing, interior and exterior finishing, painting, clean up and deficiencies.
  • Experience with framing or carpentry is an asset.
  • All work to be done under the direction of a Site Supervisor.

Requirements:
  • 2-5 years related experience minimum – open to all levels of experience into senior levels
  • Construction labour abilities – whether from a specific trade perspective or a generalist perspective
  • Basic safety wear and weather-appropriate gear including steel toe boots, hard hat, gloves, rain suit; basic hand tools
  • A strong understanding of residential construction
  • A strong work ethic with attention to detail
  • Ability to take direction with English oral communication skills
  • Ideal Applicant will also have:
  • Specific experience with residential construction in BC / City of Vancouver
  • Experience with framing, carpentry and finishing
Remuneration:
  • Competitive based on experience and, for full-time staff, a shared benefits package after the probationary period.

title: General Labour (Cartwright)
description:
Maple Leaf Foods – Cappola
                                           JOB DESCRIPTION

Title & Grade:       General Labour (Cappola Cartwright)

Reports To:           Department Supervisor

DEPARTMENT:         Packaging/Production

SHIFT TIME:              Day Shift, 6:00am- 2:30pm

HOURLY RATE:             $16.15/hour
 
 

JOB Summary: 
The General Labourer works in the Production department. They work in a fast-paced food manufacturing environment, responsible for packaging, trimming, clean-up and other food processing activities. This person has direct impact on the efficiency of our operation and contributes daily to quality of our products.
        
JOB Responsibilities:
  • Contributes to a healthy work environment, while maintaining high food safety and health and safety standards
  • Works on the production line to process pork products
  • Checks and weighs materials and/or product
  • Transfer, seal, manually labels and pack product into bags, cartons or other containers
  • Removes finished goods packages from conveyer and place on pallets
  • Checks products and packaging for basic quality defects
  • Trims and removes quality defects from product
  • Moves and lifts skids, tanks and combos
  • Follows curing process of Salting & Desalting hams
  • Able to apply leaf lard to product safely using appropriate tools and personal protective equipment
  • Performs daily GMP monitoring tasks checking room temperatures, condensation and boot wash concentration
  • Performs daily preoperational inspections accurately and completely
  • Takes action to correct any issues and to make improvements, troubleshoots equipment if necessary
  • Directly helps the department to meet targets and goals while maintaining a healthy and safe work environment
  • Maintains productivity that meets/exceeds standards
  • Dedicated to creating a high quality product that consistently meets product specifications
  • Contributes to the team and the whole facility in a positive way
  • Other responsibilities as required

REQUIRED SKILLS, ABILITY & EXPERIENCE:
  • Able to work in a fast-paced work environment with repetitive tasks
  • Able to stand and walk throughout the shift
  • Able to perform repetitive lifting
  • Able to lift approximately 30-40 lbs repetitively
  • Can work well in a team environment and support fellow team members
  • Good communication skills, able to speak and read English
  • Punctual, reliable and responsible

title: General Labour
description:
Have you heard wondering where your soap was packaged? Do you have an eye for detail? Are you interested in working as a general labourer in Brantford? This job is for you!

We have immediate openings with a very busy manufacturing facility in Brantford. This is a great opportunity to join an ever-growing company that is expanding year over year. Come and be part of a welcoming team of general labourers in Brantford to help and assist with packaging hand sanitizer on a fast-paced production line. You will have the opportunity to learn new skills in the manufacturing industry and have opportunities to advance in your career.

Job Title: General Labour
Location: Brantford, Ontario
Shift: 7 am to 5 pm - Monday to Thursday
Pay Rate: $17.25/hour


Advantages
Why make the job change?
-Working straight day shifts
-Get paid weekly
-4% vacation pay paid out weekly
-Health and dental benefits
-Opportunity for advancement
-Full-time hours
-Team-oriented environment
-Clean environment
-Well-lit work conditions
-Working with a small team
-Welcoming environment for new employees
-Positive work culture

Responsibilities
Job Responsibilities:
-Packaging soap products
-Quality checking for accurate shipments
-Maintain a clean work area


Qualifications
Who are we looking for?

-Experience in a manufacturing environment
-Any transferable skills from a labour role

Summary
Apply Today!

How to apply:
To apply for this position email your resume to katie.carmichael@randstad.ca
Or call the office 519.758.1511 and ask to speak to either Zana or Katie
Or come by our Randstad office at 10 Stanley St in Brantford
Or apply online at randstad.ca

We are text-friendly. Feel free to text us at 519.717.3982

If this job is not for you, but you’re interested in a career change, please call the phone number above and let us know what you’re looking for. We would love to help find you your dream job!

Make sure you download our new app called 'myrandstad' in the Google Play Store or the App Store and give us a call so we can set you up with a pin. This is the new way to get all the latest job notifications! If you need help setting up the app just stop by our office or give us a call and we'll be happy to help!
