title: Skilled Labourer
description:
Our client is currently seeking Skilled Labourers to join team at the IOL Kearl site near Fort Mackay, Alberta. Skilled Labourers assist skilled trades people and perform a wide range of tasks at construction sites. Skilled Labourers will be expected to do but are not limited to the following tasks:
  • Cleaning of company vehicles and/or equipment
  • Loading, unloading, identifying, and distributing materials and equipment
  • Cleaning and preparation of construction components (Modules, Process equipment etc.)
  • Execute assigned tasks in a safe and efficient manner
  • Ask required questions and take the required direction to ensure that work is accomplished safely
  • Understand and follow safety management system and core values
  • Maintain all company tools and equipment to the required standards
  • Foster a cooperative and positive work atmosphere
Minimum Requirements:
  • Minimum 3 years of related experience.
  • Previous construction experience
  • Physical strength and stamina
  • Manual dexterity
  • Safety conscious attitude
  • Construction Safety Training Systems (CSTS-09 or 2020) Certification
  • First Aid – Standard Level Certification
  • Fit Test
Preferred Qualifications:
  • Ability to work with others in a team
  • Ability to work at heights
  • A valid Driver’s License
  • Confined Space Entry Level 1 & 2
  • Working around heavy mining equipment and mine driving experience an asset but not mandatory

title: General Labourer
description:
We are looking for a reliable general labourer to work with an established family owned business in Waterloo. If you love to keep busy and work hard this position is for you! You will be assisting in sorting and flipping matts as well as taking the items to be cleaned throughout the warehouse. There is quite a bit of lifting involved in this role so you better be in good shape, you can get a good work out in this warehouse. The environment can be warm so ensure to wear layers just in case. This is a very team friendly environment! The shift will start at 7am and generally goes until 4:30pm or until the matts are completed.

Advantages
-straight day shift 7-4:30pm Monday to Friday every second Monday off
-$16/hr
-potential for long term employment
-benefits available through randstad
-great team environment
-available on a bus route in Waterloo
-overtime available

Responsibilities
- sorting and flipping matts
- ability to lift up to 50 pounds repetitively

Qualifications
-ability to lift up to 50 pounds consistently
-attention to detail
-reliable and punctual
-ability to stand for long periods
-able to work in warm environments

Summary
How to apply:
1) Respond directly to this job posting
2) Apply at www.randstad.ca and follow up with a phone call an hour afterward to 519.772.0181 X1 and ask for Lashauna or Jackie

You can also email lashauna.mcbean@randstad.ca or jackie.kurtz@randstad.ca

Our services will never be at a cost to you. Registration with Randstad offers you the benefit of our industry knowledge and client database which spans across many industries.

Randstad Waterloo is committed to helping you tackle the challenges and take advantage of promising career opportunities. Connect with us today to learn more about the many positions we have to offer at Waterloo Randstad.

Ask us about our new MyRandstad app, which sends automatic alerts about new shifts that you can accept or decline depending on your availability.

Lashauna
Jackie

title: Skilled Labourer
description:
Our client is currently seeking Skilled Labourers to join team at the IOL Kearl site near Fort Mackay, Alberta. Skilled Labourers assist skilled trades people and perform a wide range of tasks at construction sites. Skilled Labourers will be expected to do but are not limited to the following tasks:
  • Cleaning of company vehicles and/or equipment
  • Loading, unloading, identifying, and distributing materials and equipment
  • Cleaning and preparation of construction components (Modules, Process equipment etc.)
  • Execute assigned tasks in a safe and efficient manner
  • Ask required questions and take the required direction to ensure that work is accomplished safely
  • Understand and follow safety management system and core values
  • Maintain all company tools and equipment to the required standards
  • Foster a cooperative and positive work atmosphere
Minimum Requirements:
  • Minimum 3 years of related experience.
  • Previous construction experience
  • Physical strength and stamina
  • Manual dexterity
  • Safety conscious attitude
  • Construction Safety Training Systems (CSTS-09 or 2020) Certification
  • First Aid – Standard Level Certification
  • Fit Test
Preferred Qualifications:
  • Ability to work with others in a team
  • Ability to work at heights
  • A valid Driver’s License
  • Confined Space Entry Level 1 & 2
  • Working around heavy mining equipment and mine driving experience an asset but not mandatory

title: Road Construction Workers
description:
Why work for Lafarge?:

As the global leader in innovative and sustainable building materials, weâ€™re committed to shaping a greener, smarter and healthier world. At Lafarge Canada Inc., safety comes first, collaboration matters and diversity is celebrated with people who share our desire to continually make our materials better.  

 

Do you have the drive, the skills, and the passion to join us?

Overview:

Lafarge Canada Inc (Construction) is looking for skilled Road Construction Workers to join our team in Vancouver, BC. Scope of work will be in our concrete, base, and asphalt road construction divisions. Experience will be considered an asset. Successful candidates should be hard working, adaptable, and enthusiastic team players, willing and ready to learn and work in all conditions.

 

To apply, please email your resume to Mike at

mike.darby@lafargeholcim.com

and include 'Road Construction Workers' in your subject line.

Responsibilities:

We are currently hiring the following positions for our Road Construction division:

  • Civil Foremen/women
  • Skid Steer Operator
  • Heavy Duty Mechanic
  • Concrete Workers
  • Paving
  • Milling
  • Grading
  • Curb and Gutter
  • Equipment Operators
Qualifications:
  • Experience as a Skid Steer Operator or as a Heavy Duty Mechanic will be considered an asset. If you have experience with paving, milling, grading, curb and gutter, that is great as well.

  • Ideal candidates have a minimum of 3 years' knowledge of paving in highway, commercial, municipal or residential work

  • Mandatory drug and alcohol pre screening is needed before starting work

As part of our dedicated focus on the health and safety of all employees, a pre-employment medical, including drug and alcohol testing and a criminal record check, may be required.

JOB DESCRIPTION

JOB Summary:
The General Labourer works in the Production department. They work in a fast-paced food manufacturing environment, responsible for packaging, trimming, clean-up and other food processing activities. title: General labour
description:
Are you looking for a heavy general labour position? Are you interested in a long-term job opportunity in Brantford? Do you enjoy team environments? This job is for you!

Come and be part of a team of general labours in a very busy warehouse here in Brantford, Ontario. This is an amazing opportunity to get in with a relatively new company in town. There is career growth potential working at this site. In this role, you will gain experience in many different areas within the warehouse. Your main position will be cutting open bags of product and pouring them into a hopper. You may be asked to unload shipping containers by hand involving heavy repetitive lifting. The environment you will be working in is dusty and mouldy and it has a team-oriented atmosphere.

Job Title: General labour
Location: Brantford, Ontario
Shift: Days, Monday to Friday
Hours: 6:45 am to 3:30 pm
Pay: $18/hour
Bus accessible in Brantford

Advantages
Why make the job change?
-Straight Day shift (6:45 am to 3:30 pm)
-Full-time hours
-On a bus route
-$18/hr starting rate
-Growing company
-Great management
-Room for growth
-Long-term job opportunity
-Welcoming environment for new employees

Responsibilities
Job responsibilities include:
-cutting bags by hand
-dumping product in bags into a hopper
-other general labour duties as assigned


Qualifications
Who are we looking for?
-Experience working in an industrial/warehouse environment
-Someone who is comfortable working in a dusty environment


Summary

To apply for this position email your resume to katie.carmichael@randstad.ca
Or call the office 519.758.1511 and ask to speak to Katie or Matt
Or text us at 519.717.3982
Or apply online at randstad.ca

Are you interested in making your next career move, but this one doesn’t sound right? Please give us a call – we have an extensive list of open positions in the Brantford area. We look forward to speaking with you!

title: Skilled Labourer
description:
The successful candidate will be a skilled labourer with a proactive attitude, strong work ethic, common sense, along with the necessary general skill set for this role. Our ideal candidate would be looking for a place to grow their knowledge base and exposure within the residential design-build industry.

Responsibilities include a wide variety of tasks onsite, including but not limited to: demolition by hand & tool, forming, framing, insulation, drywall, waterproofing, interior and exterior finishing, painting, clean up and deficiencies.
  • Experience with framing or carpentry is an asset.
  • All work to be done under the direction of a Site Supervisor.

Requirements:
  • 2-5 years related experience minimum – open to all levels of experience into senior levels
  • Construction labour abilities – whether from a specific trade perspective or a generalist perspective
  • Basic safety wear and weather-appropriate gear including steel toe boots, hard hat, gloves, rain suit; basic hand tools
  • A strong understanding of residential construction
  • A strong work ethic with attention to detail
  • Ability to take direction with English oral communication skills
  • Ideal Applicant will also have:
  • Specific experience with residential construction in BC / City of Vancouver
  • Experience with framing, carpentry and finishing
Remuneration:
  • Competitive based on experience and, for full-time staff, a shared benefits package after the probationary period.

title: Labourer
description:
Why work for Lafarge?:

 

 

 

 

 

As the global leader in innovative and sustainable building materials, weâ€™re committed to shaping a greener, smarter and healthier world. At Lafarge Canada Inc., safety comes first, collaboration matters and diversity is celebrated with people who share our desire to continually make our materials better.  

 

Do you have the drive, the skills, and the passion to join us?

 

 

Overview:

 

Provide housekeeping and cleanup support to the Woodstock Terminal.   Be part of a team that maintains a safe, clean working environment.  

Responsibilities:

 

  • Obey and apply all Company health and safety rules in daily duties.
  • Conduct field level risk assessment before starting any task.
  • Ensure all equipment is properly and adequately locked out before starting any task.
  • Clean up spills, leaks etc as directed by the Plant Supervisor or designate.
  • Follow instructions as per weekly housekeeping schedule.
  • Operate mobile housekeeping equipment such as vacuum truck, skid steer, walk behind bobcat, water truck and sweeper.
  • Carry out confined space attendant duties.
  • Communicate effectively with Plant Supervisor or designate to identify and address chronic housekeeping concerns.
  • Report all safety and environmental incidents in a timely manner.
  • Inspect all equipment and tools prior to use and initiate work requests to resolve deficiencies.
  • Carry out adjustments and minor repairs to equipment as needed.
  • Manual labor, use of jack hammer & shovels
  • Report all safety and environmental incidents in a timely manner.
  • Inspect all equipment and tools prior to use and initiate work requests to resolve deficiencies.
  • Perform other duties as required.
Qualifications:

 

Qualifications for New Hire:

  • Successful completion of High School certificate.
  • Previous experience working in a heavy industrial environment.
  • Basic mechanical skills desirable.
  • Trained and holding current tickets for operating mobile equipment desirable.

 

Language Skills: Ability to read and comprehend simple instructions, short correspondence and memos. Ability to write simple correspondence.  Ability to effectively present information in one-on-one and small group situations to other employees of the organization.

 

Mathematical Skills: Ability to add, subtract, multiply and divide in all units of measure, using whole numbers, common fractions and decimals.

 

Reasoning Ability: Ability to apply common sense understanding to carry out detailed but uninvolved written or oral instructions. Ability to deal with problems involving a few concrete variables in standardized situations.

 

Physical Demands: the physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job.

 

Physical Ability:   While performing the duties of this job, the employee is frequently required to stand and walk, stoop, kneel, crouch, or crawl, and touch or hear. The employee must frequently lift and/or move up moderate to heavy objects. Specific vision abilities required by this job include close vision, colour vision, depth perception and ability to adjust focus.

 

Work Environment: The work environment characteristics described here are representative of those an employee encounters while performing the essential functions of this job.

While performing the duties of this job, the employee is frequently exposed to moving mechanical parts, and high precarious places. The employee is occasionally exposed to wet and/or humid conditions, fumes or airborne particles, outside weather conditions, extreme heat and vibration. The noise level in the work environment is usually moderate.

LafargeHolcim:

 

As we are reinventing the way the world builds, we need world-class talent to join our Lafarge Canada team: people who are passionate, driven by curiosity and keen to grow, learn, develop and thrive in our high-performance culture.

Whatever you do, you will make a difference here. Because we know that your passion and curiosity are the natural resources the world needs.  

 

We thank you for your interest.  Only candidates selected for an interview will be contacted.   Lafarge is committed to the principles of employment equity and encourages the applications from women, visible minorities, and persons with disabilities.

 

Lafarge Canada Inc. welcomes and encourages applications from people with disabilities.  In Ontario, our organization/business is committed to fulfilling our requirements under the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act.  Accommodations are available on request for  candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process.

 

Lafarge Canada is committed to providing a safe environment for employees, customers, contractors and vendors. As such, in keeping with the requirements of our industry associations, partners, and clients across Canada, Lafarge Canada has implemented a COVID-19 vaccination policy intended to reduce the spread of COVID-19. As of October 1st, 2021, all new employees joining Lafarge Canada, subject to any requirement to accommodate pursuant to applicable human rights legislation, must be fully vaccinated against COVID-19.

title: Skilled Laborer
description:
Our client is a leading construction workforce supplier. B.C. owned and operated since 1993, focusing on large multi-residential projects spanning across the Lower Mainland. As they continue to rapidly grow, strive to treat everyone like family and that is reflected in the remarkable tenure of some of their team, serving their entire careers with them.

Offer:

  • Benefits (extended health & dental)
  • Steady, year-round employment
  • Paid training/certifications/apprenticeship
  • Paid vacation, overtime
  • Room for advancement
  • On going support from our team
Currently seeking an experienced Skilled Labourer at one of our large multi-residential projects in Surrey. The right candidate should be comfortable working indoors and outdoors, is physically fit and capable of performing various general labour tasks around the site.

Key Duties may include:
  • Prepping construction sites by cleaning obstacles and hazards
  • Operating and caring for the construction equipment and power tools

title: Road Construction Workers
description:
Why work for Lafarge?

As the global leader in innovative and sustainable building materials, we’re committed to shaping a greener, smarter and healthier world. At Lafarge Canada Inc., safety comes first, collaboration matters and diversity is celebrated with people who share our desire to continually make our materials better. 

 

Do you have the drive, the skills, and the passion to join us?

Overview

Lafarge Canada Inc (Construction) is looking for skilled Road Construction Workers to join our team in Vancouver, BC. Scope of work will be in our concrete, base, and asphalt road construction divisions. Experience will be considered an asset. Successful candidates should be hard working, adaptable, and enthusiastic team players, willing and ready to learn and work in all conditions.

 

To apply, please email your resume to Mike at mike.darby@lafargeholcim.com and include 'Road Construction Workers' in your subject line.

Responsibilities

We are currently hiring the following positions for our Road Construction division:

  • Civil Foremen/women
  • Skid Steer Operator
  • Heavy Duty Mechanic
  • Concrete Workers
  • Paving
  • Milling
  • Grading
  • Curb and Gutter
  • Equipment Operators

Qualifications

  • Experience as a Skid Steer Operator or as a Heavy Duty Mechanic will be considered an asset. If you have experience with paving, milling, grading, curb and gutter, that is great as well.
  • Successful candidates should be hard working, adaptable, and enthusiastic team players, willing and ready to learn and work in all conditions
  • Ideal candidates have a minimum of 3 years' knowledge of paving in highway, commercial, municipal or residential work
  • Class 5 license and own means of transportation is required as not all sites will have public transit access
  • Mandatory drug and alcohol pre screening is needed before starting work
  • Must be able to follow company safety policy

As part of our dedicated focus on the health and safety of all employees, a pre-employment medical, including drug and alcohol testing and a criminal record check, may be required.

LafargeHolcim

As we are reinventing the way the world builds, we need world-class talent to join our Lafarge Canada team: people who are passionate, driven by curiosity and keen to grow, learn, develop and thrive in our high-performance culture.

 

Whatever you do, you will make a difference here. Because we know that your passion and curiosity are the natural resources the world needs.

 

See more opportunities at www.lafarge.ca/careers.

 

We thank you for your interest. Only candidates selected for an interview will be contacted.  Lafarge is committed to the principles of employment equity and encourages the applications from women, visible minorities, and persons with disabilities.

title: General Labour (3:15PM - 11:45PM)
description:
This position pays a $0.55 shift premium in addition to the hourly rate.

JOB RESPONSIBILITIES:
  • Contributes to a healthy work environment, while maintaining high food safety standards
  • Works on the line directly handling raw poultry products
  • Takes action to correct any issues and to make improvements
  • Other responsibilities as required
WHAT DOING A GOOD JOB LOOKS LIKE:
  • Directly helps to meet targets and goals while maintaining a safe & healthy work environment
  • Maintains productivity that meets/exceeds standards
  • Dedicated to creating a high quality product that consistently meets product specifications
  • Contributes to the team and the whole facility in a positive way
 
REQUIRED SKILLS, ABILITY & EXPERIENCE:
  • Able to work in a fast-paced work environment with repetitive tasks on a moving line
  • Able to stand and walk throughout the shift
  • Able to rotate through all positions in the department as required
  • Must be comfortable with handling raw poultry products 
  • Good communication skills, able to speak and read English


Maple Leaf Foods is committed to ensuring the health and safety of all our employees.  As part of this commitment, we have adopted a number of COVID-19 safety measures, including a requirement for all employees to be fully vaccinated by March 31, 2022 and to show proof of vaccination.   In keeping with this policy, successful candidates will need to provide proof of vaccination by March 31, 2022 (or prior to their first day of work if the start date is after March 31, 2022).  We will of course consider accommodations for anyone unable to be vaccinated following human rights and other applicable laws.

title: General Labourer
description:
Are you looking to join a growing warehouse team in Brantford, Ontario with a permanent opportunity? Do you like working in cooler temperatures in a general labour role? Do you thrive in team environments? This job is for you!

You have the chance to work in a dynamic and fast-paced environment with the opportunity to advance across multiple departments. Come and be part of a company that invests in its employees' development and where you help to create a positive work culture. Training will be provided for you, you will have on-the-job training. You will be responsible for helping to load and unload trucks of cold-stored packages and packaging frozen bread into boxes and trays.

Job Title: General Labourer
Location: Brantford, near the airport
Shift: Days, Monday to Friday
Hours: 7:00 am to 3:30 pm
Pay Rate: $16.75/hour

Advantages
Why make the job change?
-Long-term opportunity
-Working straight shifts
-Full-time hours
-Opportunity for career growth
-Get paid weekly
-Health and dental benefits
-Team-oriented environment
-Cooler work environment

Responsibilities
Job Duties include:
-Unloading trucks
-Packaging food product
-Stacking trays of packaged food
-Preparing finished orders for shipment

Qualifications
Who are we looking for?
-Experience working in a warehouse or manufacturing environment
-Transferable general labour skills

Summary
How to apply?
-Call the Brantford office at 519-758-1511 and speak with Katie or Amanda
-Email your resume to katie.carmichael@randstad.ca
-Apply online at randstad.ca
-We are text-friendly. Feel free to text us at 519.717.3982.

Don't forget to inquire about our special referral bonus.

title: Labourer
description:
Why work for Lafarge?

 

 

 

 

 

As the global leader in innovative and sustainable building materials, we’re committed to shaping a greener, smarter and healthier world. At Lafarge Canada Inc., safety comes first, collaboration matters and diversity is celebrated with people who share our desire to continually make our materials better. 

 

Do you have the drive, the skills, and the passion to join us?

 

 

Overview

 

Provide housekeeping and cleanup support to the Woodstock Terminal.  Be part of a team that maintains a safe, clean working environment. 

Responsibilities

 

  • Obey and apply all Company health and safety rules in daily duties.
  • Conduct field level risk assessment before starting any task.
  • Ensure all equipment is properly and adequately locked out before starting any task.
  • Clean up spills, leaks etc as directed by the Plant Supervisor or designate.
  • Follow instructions as per weekly housekeeping schedule.
  • Operate mobile housekeeping equipment such as vacuum truck, skid steer, walk behind bobcat, water truck and sweeper.
  • Carry out confined space attendant duties.
  • Communicate effectively with Plant Supervisor or designate to identify and address chronic housekeeping concerns.
  • Report all safety and environmental incidents in a timely manner.
  • Inspect all equipment and tools prior to use and initiate work requests to resolve deficiencies.
  • Carry out adjustments and minor repairs to equipment as needed.
  • Manual labor, use of jack hammer & shovels
  • Report all safety and environmental incidents in a timely manner.
  • Inspect all equipment and tools prior to use and initiate work requests to resolve deficiencies.
  • Perform other duties as required.

Qualifications

 

Qualifications for New Hire:

  • Successful completion of High School certificate.
  • Previous experience working in a heavy industrial environment.
  • Basic mechanical skills desirable.
  • Trained and holding current tickets for operating mobile equipment desirable.

 

Language Skills: Ability to read and comprehend simple instructions, short correspondence and memos. Ability to write simple correspondence.  Ability to effectively present information in one-on-one and small group situations to other employees of the organization.

 

Mathematical Skills: Ability to add, subtract, multiply and divide in all units of measure, using whole numbers, common fractions and decimals.

 

Reasoning Ability: Ability to apply common sense understanding to carry out detailed but uninvolved written or oral instructions. Ability to deal with problems involving a few concrete variables in standardized situations.

 

Physical Demands: the physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job.

 

Physical Ability:  While performing the duties of this job, the employee is frequently required to stand and walk, stoop, kneel, crouch, or crawl, and touch or hear. The employee must frequently lift and/or move up moderate to heavy objects. Specific vision abilities required by this job include close vision, colour vision, depth perception and ability to adjust focus.

 

Work Environment: The work environment characteristics described here are representative of those an employee encounters while performing the essential functions of this job.

While performing the duties of this job, the employee is frequently exposed to moving mechanical parts, and high precarious places. The employee is occasionally exposed to wet and/or humid conditions, fumes or airborne particles, outside weather conditions, extreme heat and vibration. The noise level in the work environment is usually moderate.

LafargeHolcim

 

As we are reinventing the way the world builds, we need world-class talent to join our Lafarge Canada team: people who are passionate, driven by curiosity and keen to grow, learn, develop and thrive in our high-performance culture.

Whatever you do, you will make a difference here. Because we know that your passion and curiosity are the natural resources the world needs. 

 

We thank you for your interest. Only candidates selected for an interview will be contacted.  Lafarge is committed to the principles of employment equity and encourages the applications from women, visible minorities, and persons with disabilities.

 

Lafarge Canada Inc. welcomes and encourages applications from people with disabilities. In Ontario, our organization/business is committed to fulfilling our requirements under the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act. Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process.

 

Lafarge Canada is committed to providing a safe environment for employees, customers, contractors and vendors. As such, in keeping with the requirements of our industry associations, partners, and clients across Canada, Lafarge Canada has implemented a COVID-19 vaccination policy intended to reduce the spread of COVID-19. As of October 1st, 2021, all new employees joining Lafarge Canada, subject to any requirement to accommodate pursuant to applicable human rights legislation, must be fully vaccinated against COVID-19.

title: General labour
description:
Do you want to work for a well-known company in Princeton, Ontario? Do you like working in a team environment as a Skilled General Labourer? Are you looking for opportunities for advancement? This job will develop junior hand and power tool skills and prepare you for a career in skilled trades. If you like the sound of this, This job is for you!

At a manufacturing plant in Princeton, Ontario, you will be joining a team of production employees to work in both the steel wall panel production plant and the steel deck and steel joist plant. Employees need to be able to work in small teams in a fast-paced environment. The positions entail the fabrication of light steel wall panels during the various stages of fabrication - framing - sheathing and screwing as well as the fabrication and handling of steel joists and deck.

Job Title: General Labourer/Construction labourer
Location: Princeton, Ontario
Shift: Days
Hours: 7 am to 4:30 pm, Monday to Thursday
Starting pay rate: $20/hour


Advantages
Why make the job change?
• Straight shifts, scheduled full-time hours
• Paid weekly
• Overtime is available
• Excellent management
• Opportunity to work in a growing industry
• Permanent opportunity
• Room for career advancement
• Health and dental benefits
• Referral bonus eligibility
• Welcoming environment for new employees

Why else?
Do you want to be apart of a rewarding team?
Do you want an opportunity for advancement?
Do you want to work for a company that offers competitive rates with annual increases?
Do you have skills that can be developed OR skills that can add true value to a company?
Do you want to work in an upbeat workplace with a team that has great morale?
Annual perks- ask me for more info!

Responsibilities
What will you be doing?
-Working in the shop manufacturing joists and frames for buildings
-Hand and power tools, MIG, spot welding
-Putting up wall panels and spreading joists


Qualifications
Who are we looking for?
• Previous experience working in a general labour role
• Previous construction and production experience is an asset but not necessary as training will be provided for all aspects of production.

Summary
How to apply:
To apply for this position email your resume to katie.carmichael@randstad.ca
Or call the office 519.758.1511 and ask to speak to Zana or Katie
Or apply online at randstad.ca
Or text us 519.717.3982

title: Skilled Labour
description:
This is a full-time position, with an hourly rate which is based on ability and experience. A company vehicle (for travel from office to jobsite), all tools and equipment will be provided. We offer benefit options after a waiting period.

Our client encompasses over 50 years of combined experience in the construction, renovation and retail facilities sectors. We are dedicated to providing excellent workmanship, commitment to design concepts and meticulous management of our projects. We utilize our strengths and experience to ensure timely and on-budget delivery of our projects.

Duties and Responsibilities:
  • Provide assistance to the Project Manager, Site Supervisor and sub trades on the job site when required.
  • Complete general construction work including but not limited to: demolition, minor concrete work, framing, drywall, insulation,
  • painting, flooring and other specialized construction processes as required.
  • Manual handling of supplies, equipment, and construction materials.
  • Read and interpret instructions, specifications and CAD drawings.
  • Operate and maintain, equipment, hand and power tools safely and accurately.
  • Follow proper safety policies to maintain a safe working environment.
  • Maintain a clean, safe and organized work site.
  • Maintain daily communication and records of daily construction activity.
  • Assist with communication between sub trades, skilled trades, labourers and GC.
  • Travel to job sites throughout Ontario.

Skills / Experience:
  • Three (3) years or more of renovation and construction experience.
  • Strong carpentry skills, general trades and interior finishing experience.
  • Must be able to lift 50lbs repetitively.
  • Excellent organizational and time management skills.
  • Strong verbal and listening communications skills.
  • Ability to work in a fast-paced environment.
  • Ability to work as a team or unaccompanied on various tasks.
  • Valid G driver’s licence with a clean driving record.
  • Ability to work nights.

Personal Attributes:
  • Fast thinking and good judgement (common sense).
  • Hardworking, detail oriented and thorough.
  • Honest, trustworthy and flexible.
  • Respectful and conscientious of the people and environment around them.
  • Demonstrates sound work ethics and self-motivation to work with minimal supervision.
  • Interacts with supervisors, coworkers and clients in a positive, courteous and respectful manner.

title: General Labour
description:
GENERAL LABOR PRODUCTION WORKERS 

Maple Leaf Foods in North York is accepting applications for entry-level General Labor positions within our Prepared Meats facility located at 25 LePage Court, North York, ON, M3J 2A2, which require availability for up to 40 hours a week. We currently have numerous vacancies - come join our team!

A Sustainable, Forward Thinking Protein Company
Maple Leaf Foods is a leading meat and plant-based protein company, employing over 11,500 people and publicly traded on the Toronto Stock Exchange. We are proud of our roots, which trace back well over 100 years, but our vision and purpose are decidedly forward looking. As we pursue our vision to become the most sustainable protein company on earth, we are committed to creating shared value – creative business value through addressing some of the world’s most critical social and environmental challenges. Our goal is to build a more sustainable food system, which provides nutritious affordable food, operates within planetary limits, cares for animals responsibly, and meaningfully engages with our communities to advance a more just society. We are advancing bold changes within Maple Leaf and more broadly within society to pursue our vision. We deeply believe this is the sustainable path to growth.
 
Our job is to make great food
Maple Leaf Foods embraces a strong values-based culture, where our people are deeply engaged in work that is purposeful, fast-paced and challenging.  We cultivate an open, non-bureaucratic and inclusive workplace that fosters safety and transparency, along with individual leadership and accountability. Each Maple Leaf team member has a voice and plays an active role in helping all of us achieve our goals with passion and discipline. We support one another to grow professionally, to learn new skills and to take on challenging experiences in the spirit of continuous improvement.
 
Raise the Good in Food
We have united behind a shared purpose – to Raise the Good in Food. This spans a dramatic transformation of our flagship Maple Leaf brand, replacing anything artificial with simple, natural ingredients; investments and process changes to reduce our environmental footprint by 50% by 2025; building a diverse and inclusive culture where all talent thrives; becoming a leader in animal care; and advancing food security through our charitable foundation, the Maple Leaf Centre for Action on Food Security.

Our Leadership Values 
Eight core values guide us in everything that we do.
  • Do What's Right
  • High Performance
  • Disciplined Decision Making 
  • Intense Curiosity 
  • Shared Value
  • Diverse and Inclusive Teams
  • Our Accountability 
  • Transparency and Humility 
Hourly Rate: $14.25 per hour

Shift: 6:45 am - 3:15 pm; Monday to Friday (as per the business needs)

JOB Responsibilities:
  • Contributes to a healthy work environment, while maintaining high food safety and health and safety standards
  • Works on the production line to process pork products
  • Checks and weighs materials and/or product
  • Transfer, seal, manually labels and pack product into bags, cartons or other containers
  • Removes finished goods packages from conveyer and place on pallets
  • Checks products and packaging for basic quality defects
  • Removes quality defects from product
  • Moves and lifts skids, tanks and combos
  • Takes action to correct any issues and to make improvements, troubleshoots equipment if necessary
  • Directly helps the department to meet targets and goals while maintaining a healthy and safe work environment
  • Maintains productivity that meets/exceeds standards
  • Dedicated to creating a high-quality product that consistently meets product specifications
  • Contributes to the team and the whole facility in a positive way
  • Other responsibilities as required

REQUIRED SKILLS, ABILITY & EXPERIENCE:
  • Able to work in a fast-paced work environment with repetitive tasks
  • Able to stand and walk throughout the shift
  • Able to perform repetitive lifting
  • Able to lift up to 25kgs, lifting required
  • Participates and successfully passes formal BT Training
  • Can work well in a team environment and support fellow team members
  • Good communication skills, able to speak and read English
  • Punctual, reliable and responsible
Please apply online or in-person today! 

All applicants must provide documentation to prove eligibility to work in Canada

title: General labour
description:
Are you at the beginning stage of your career in manufacturing? Are you looking for a job opportunity like no other? Does a permanent job sound more like what you are looking for? This job is for you!

Apply for this long-term job opportunity today. Use new skills and gain new ones to assist in cutting metal using cutting-edge laser technology. Come and be part of a dedicated team of laser operators in a newly refurbished shop in Paris, Ontario with hands-on supervisors who will guide you and train you. Your early days will consist of labour tasks such as grinding and buffering until you are fully trained to operate the machines. You will be joining the day shift crew and your training will be on the day shift. Advancement opportunities should be available to you once more experience is gained and with a willingness to learn attitude.

Job Title: General labour/Machine operator entry-level
Location: Paris, Ontario
Pay rate: $20/hour
Shift: Afternoons, Monday to Thursday
Hours: 3:30 pm to 1:30 am

Advantages
Why make the job change?
-Permanent job opportunity
-Long-term job opportunity
-Full-time hours
-Straight shifts
-Benefits after 3 months
-2 weeks paid vacation first year
-Overtime available
-Training involved
-Open-concept production floor
-Welcoming environment to new employees
-Strong team-oriented company

Responsibilities
Job responsibilities include:
-loading and unloading machined parts
-cleaning and inspecting parts
-using grinders and buffers to clean parts

Qualifications
Who are we looking for?
-someone with general labour experience
-basic mechanical knowledge of machines is an asset

Summary
How to apply:
To apply for this position email your resume to katie.carmichael@randstad.ca
Or call the office 519.758.1511 and ask for Oksana or Katie
Or apply online at randstad.ca

We are text-friendly. Feel free to text us at 519.717.3982

If this job is not for you, but you’re interested in a career change, please call the phone number above and let us know what you’re looking for. We would love to help find you your dream job!

Make sure you download our new app called 'myrandstad' in the Google Play Store or the App Store and give us a call so we can set you up with a pin. title: General labourer
description:
Are you interested in working in the automotive industry? Are you looking for a permanent job opportunity in Brantford? Do you have what it takes to be part of an innovative team? Then this job is for you!

This relatively newly established automotive facility in Brantford is looking to grow its production team. This is a great chance to join an established company worldwide that has come to Brantford. There are many opportunities for growth within this company.

In this permanent position, you will be working on the production loading and unloading parts and performing routine quality inspections. Training will be provided. You will have the opportunity to work alongside highly automated systems with high degrees of technology. There is so much potential with this position, it's hard to list all the advancements that can take place.

Location: Brantford, Ontario

title: Part-time General Labour
description:
Considering a Career at Maple Leaf Foods?
Maple Leaf Foods is Canada’s leading consumer-packaged protein company, headquartered in Toronto, Ontario. We make high-quality, great tasting, nutritious and innovative food products under leading brands including Maple Leaf®, Maple Leaf Prime®, Maple Leaf Natural Selections®, Schneiders®, Schneiders Country Naturals® and Mina™. Our Company employs approximately 11,500 people in its operations across Canada and exports to more than 20 global markets including the U.S. and Asia.
 
Our people are passionate about the work they do and the products we make. As we move forward, we are determined to leverage their integrity and passion to continue to build a high-performing, values-based company enabled by high-performing, motivated and talented people.

Maple Leaf Foods Bradford Plant is Hiring for multiple General Labour positions within our Production team!
The General Labour position is responsible for performing packaging, clean-up and other general activities related to food processing.
We are offering part-time work opportunities for people who are interested in working afternoon shift, 2-3 days per week.  

Job Title:            General Labour
Department:       Production
Reports To:        Production Supervisor

We have numerous positions available for the following shifts:
  • Tray Pack Department:  Monday - Friday, 5:30 pm - 1:30 am (or end of shift)
  • Cut-Up Department:       Monday - Friday, 6:30 pm - 3:00 am (or end of shift)
Details regarding wages and shift premium will be discussed when contacted.

Responsibilities:
  • Manually pack product into bags, trays and other packaging formats as per customer specification
  • Check products and packaging for basic quality defects
  • Cut-up product and hang poultry
  • Operate single-function machines
  • Load product onto packaging line for processing
  • Ensure work area is clean and tidy
  • Follow all GMP and food safety principles
Experience:
  • Able to work in a fast-paced work environment
  • Able to stand and walk throughout the shift
  • Able to perform repetitive lifting
  • Can work well in a team environment and support fellow team members
  • Good communication skills

Why Maple Leaf Foods?

  • Training provided where needed, specifically in Human Resources, Health & Safety, Food Safety and on-the-job training
  • Reputable company and well-known brands
  • Competitive Wages
  • Opportunities to participate in Benefits and Pension plans
  • Great team environment
  • Strong focus on internal advancement and promotion
  • Employee Assistance Program and Mental Health support


If interested, please send resume by email to: 

Jessica.madia@mapleleaf.com

 or apply to our job posting online with an updated resume and phone number at Careers and Jobs – Maple Leaf Foods, or through our other job boards.  

These positions will remain open until filled.


We thank all applicants for their interest in exploring employment opportunities with Maple Leaf Foods however only those selected for an interview will be contacted. Applicants may be subject to a background check and must meet the security criteria designated for the position.
 
Maple Leaf Foods is committed to Employment Equity and maintaining a diverse workforce. We ensure that our recruitment practices are supportive of this commitment.

title: General Laborer
description:
Looking for General Laborers to join in our team in Coquitlam, BC!

We are currently looking for to hire General Laborer wanting to gain some experience in the industry and have a chance to work with a quickly growing team! In this role you would be supporting various departments by shipping receiving, order picking, and material handling. Hands-on training will be provided along with forklift certification. This position requires some heavy lifting, and some but not much experience, and is a really rewarding job. With training provided this is the perfect step towards your career, and a great opportunity to help you reach your goals! This role is long-term and full-time and offers stability, and a competitive pay rate and flexible shifts!
Are you looking for an easy way to your path to success? Then send us your resume or refer a friend today!

Shift: Monday-Friday
Time: 8:00am-4:30pm OR 4:00pm-11:30pm
Wage: $19-$21 an hour
Area: Coquitlam, BC
Looking for candidates who can start immediately
Full-Time/ Permanent position
Transit Accessible
*Can start right away*

If interested in the General Laborer role in Coquitlam, BC - please send us your resume and we will take care of the rest!

Advantages
- Starting wage is $20+ an Hour
- Shift is Monday to Friday (Days)
- Job Security
- Fantastic Benefits Packages
- Opportunities for growth.
- A dynamic work environment with a strong team.
- Transit accessible location

Responsibilities
- Assembling pallets of products for inventory requests including wrapping orders and preparing them for shipping
- Ensuring items are accurately picked and identified to avoid discrepancies
- Adhering to all safety and equipment regulations, and maintaining a clean work environment
- Utilizing an electric pallet jack to maneuver through the warehouse
- Ability to take direction from a voice-automated system to pick and organize orders
- Gathering orders, packing, wrapping and strapping
- Pallet-Jack use/ Sit down counterbalance- not required but would be an asset

Qualifications
- Previous experience in a warehouse or working with inventory is a bonus but not required
- We prefer that you have your own steel toe boots and a safety vest.
- Must be able to lift up to 35+ lbs
- Reliable, responsible & willing to get the job done
- Good attention to detail
- Forklift experience an asset
- You are currently located in the Coquitlam, BC area!

Summary
If this sounds like the perfect job opportunity for you, look no further!
We are also accepting referrals and offer a bonus that will put extra cash into your pocket- ask us about it to learn more.

Just send your resume along to our team here at Randstad!
Lipika @ lipikaluthra.pahuja@randstad.ca
Nicole @ nicole.demers@randstad.ca

title: SUMMER STUDENT - General Labour
description:
SUMMER STUDENT - GENERAL LABOUR

We are a food processing facility in St. Mary's, Ontario that is currently hiring SUMMER STUDENTS for our busy summer season.

Please note that we are NOT on a bus route, so applicants must have their own reliable transportation to and from work.
  • must be able to work any shift: days, afternoons, nights

title: General labourer
description:
Are you at the beginning stage of your career in manufacturing? Are you looking for a job opportunity like no other? Does a permanent job sound more like what you are looking for? This job is for you!

Apply for this long-term job opportunity today. Use new skills and gain new ones to assist in cutting metal using cutting-edge laser technology. Come and be part of a dedicated team of laser operators in a newly refurbished shop in Paris, Ontario with hands-on supervisors who will guide you and train you. Your early days will consist of labour tasks such as grinding and buffering until you are fully trained to operate the machines. You will be joining the day shift crew and your training will be on the day shift. Advancement opportunities should be available to you once more experience is gained and with a willingness to learn attitude.

Location: Paris, Ontario
Pay rate: $20/hour
Shift: Days, Monday to Friday
Hours: 7 am to 3:30 pm

-Straight shifts

-2 weeks paid vacation first year
-Overtime available
-Training involved
-Open-concept production floor
-Welcoming environment to new employees
-Strong team-oriented company

Responsibilities
Job responsibilities include:
-loading and unloading machined parts
-cleaning and inspecting parts
-using grinders and buffers to clean parts

-someone with general labour experience
-basic mechanical knowledge of machines is an asset

title: GENERAL LABOUR
description:
Do you love taking on new challenges? Are you detail-oriented with the ability to problem solve under tight deadlines? Do you love working in a fast-paced environment? If this sounds like you, Maple Leaf Foods has the role for YOU!

We are looking for upbeat general labourers who thrive working in a team-based challenging environment!

Snapshot of your role:

The successful candidate will place appropriate quantities of components into the trays.

What you’ll learn:
  • Organization and how to effectively meet or exceed productivity goals while maintaining high quality standards
  • Communicating effectively in a team-based environment
  • General troubleshooting and problem-solving in a fast paced-work environment
  • Time management by learning how to effectively manage workloads based on business needs

Role Responsibilities:
  • Take an active role in changeover procedures and achieve line speed efficiencies
  • Visual quality checks of product against customer and internal specifications (Including foreign materials and weight checks)
  • Ability to maintain cleanliness of areas of responsibility
  • Adhere to individual Product Standard Operating Procedures for components and packaging materials
  • Must wear proper PPE and comply with Health and Safety requirements including ensuring power is shut down on equipment prior to specified tasks
  • Frequent reaching and standing are required
  • Other tasks as assigned

Required Skills, Ability & Experience:
  • Ability to read, write and communicate in English.
  • Interact and share information with employees at all levels (Team members, Lead Hands, Supervisors, Others). Actively participates in their work group.
  • Actively finds new and improved ways of completing tasks. Is willing to try new things and assume additional responsibilities (assists with changeovers, keeps up with line speed requirements)
  • Employees may be required to complete aptitude testing
  • For training purposes, you must be available to work the day shift
  • Must be able to handle all food products and work in a cold environment

description:

Considering a Career at Maple Leaf Foods?

Maple Leaf Foods is Canada’s leading consumer-packaged protein company, headquartered in Mississauga, Ontario. We make high-quality, great tasting, nutritious and innovative food products under leading brands including Maple Leaf®, Maple Leaf Prime®, Maple Leaf Natural Selections®, Schneiders®, Schneiders Country Naturals® and Mina™. title: General labourer
description:
Do you want to work for a well-known company in Princeton, Ontario? Do you like working in a team environment as a Skilled General Labourer? Are you looking for opportunities for advancement? This job will develop junior hand and power tool skills and prepare you for a career in skilled trades. If you like the sound of this, This job is for you!

At a manufacturing plant in Princeton, Ontario, you will be joining a team of production employees to work in both the steel wall panel production plant and the steel deck and steel joist plant. Employees need to be able to work in small teams in a fast-paced environment. The positions entail the fabrication of light steel wall panels during the various stages of fabrication - framing - sheathing and screwing as well as the fabrication and handling of steel joists and deck.

Job Title: General Labourer/Construction labourer
Location: Princeton, Ontario
Shift: Afternoons
Hours: 4:30 pm to 2:30 am, Monday to Thursday
Starting pay rate: $20/hour


Advantages
Why make the job change?
• Straight shifts, scheduled full-time hours
• Paid weekly
• Overtime is available
• Excellent management
• Opportunity to work in a growing industry
• Permanent opportunity
• Room for career advancement
• Health and dental benefits
• Referral bonus eligibility
• Welcoming environment for new employees

Why else?
Do you want to be apart of a rewarding team?
Do you want an opportunity for advancement?
Do you want to work for a company that offers competitive rates with annual increases?
Do you have skills that can be developed OR skills that can add true value to a company?
Do you want to work in an upbeat workplace with a team that has great morale?
Annual perks- ask me for more info!

Responsibilities
What will you be doing?
-Working in the shop manufacturing joists and frames for buildings
-Hand and power tools, MIG, spot welding
-Putting up wall panels and spreading joists


Qualifications
Who are we looking for?
• Previous experience working in a general labour role
• Previous construction and production experience is an asset but not necessary as training will be provided for all aspects of production.

Randstad Canada is committed to fostering a workforce reflective of all peoples of Canada. As a result, we are committed to developing and implementing strategies to increase the equity, diversity and inclusion within the workplace by examining our internal policies, practices, and systems throughout the entire lifecycle of our workforce, including its recruitment, retention and advancement for all employees. In addition to our deep commitment to respecting human rights, we are dedicated to positive actions to affect change to ensure everyone has full participation in the workforce free from any barriers, systemic or otherwise, especially equity-seeking groups who are usually underrepresented in Canada's workforce, including those who identify as women or non-binary/gender non-conforming; Indigenous or Aboriginal Peoples; persons with disabilities (visible or invisible) and; members of visible minorities, racialized groups and the LGBTQ2+ community.
